story:
About The Show

  • Anisa and Dalton met at College of DuPage back in 2016. They have been working on school and independent projects since then. During the global pandemic, with little work out there, Anisa and Dalton decided to write something funny to help bring joy during hard times. After months of long nights and discord meet-ups thus The Mis-Scripts was born.
  • The Mis-Scripts is a comedy Web Series in the same vein as It's Always Sunny in Philidephia and Community. So what do you get when you have a motley crew of film students and an overbearing and obnoxious principal who will do anything to stop them? Well, you get a bunch of Mis-Scripts who get called to action and try to stop him in his tracks first!
  • We want to give special thanks to our families, friends, and the community for taking the time to help us thrive and succeed during our production. With the amount of support we received, we can’t thank them enough. Hopefully, with your help, we can return the favor to these amazing individuals.

What We Need & What You Get

  • Share & Follow on Instagram
  • Donate/Fund
  • Perks/Rewards

The Impact

  • As stated above, the sole purpose of this production was to bring joy and laughter during a rough year. We wanted to make sure that was our number one priority on and off the set. We hope you will be able to see that as we bring more behind the scenes for you to look at.
  • This production was a first for most people on set so it was super fun for them to experience this art form and we hope you can see the impact they left on us.
  • This whole production brought many people together and was a great learning experience for everyone on set. This was the first time we wanted to try something on our own and tackle all the challenges that came with it.

Risks & Challenges

  • First Time Challenges such as rewrites or location changes have happened on production days
  • We lost a few actors/characters in the process
  • General Fees and Payments
  • While we were hit with some challenges in this process, in the end, we all got through them with smiles on our faces and learned so much from them.
  • For your help, contributing in any way possible would be amazing. This will help us fund for film festivals in the future and help us give back to the amazing people who helped this production continue while the trials and tribulations of filmmaking hit us.
  • How Can You Help? There are many ways you can show your support! Simply following and sharing our social media helps tremendously. Also, helping us financially will help get our name out there and help us to get recognized in the field we dream to work in. Any contribution or way of helping would be amazing. Make sure to check out our perks as well so you can be more of a part of our production.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Make sure to give us a follow on Instagram @themis_scripts and share us on your Instagram/Facebook stories!
  • Share the IndieGoGo link on social media to help spread the word! 

Thank you for taking the time out of your day to read up on our page!

Meet the Cast & Crew

Dalton Lass (Producer/Actor/Writer/Director/Editor):

From the “Good-Ol” suburbs of Chicago, Dalton has always had an affinity to film. He finally got to achieve those dreams by getting a film degree at College of DuPage back in 2018. With that education, Dalton really found his passions of screenwriting, directing, and cinematography and was able to fine-tune them to his strengths. After a brief hiatus, Dalton decided it was time to get out the old gear and start filming again. Since 2020 was such a rough year for everyone, Dalton and Anisa decided they wanted to bring some joy to people while showcasing the woes and lows of film school, which soon birthed the creation of The Mis-Scripts.

 

Anisa Selenica (Producer/Writer/Director/Editor and Actress): 

Anisa studied at College of DuPage and Columbia College Chicago, graduating with a Bachelor’s degree in Television Writing and Producing. Born and raised in the Chicagoland suburbs, Anisa is a writer, producer, director, cinematographer, and actor. She has always had a knack for filmmaking ever since her parents purchased her a Canon camcorder as a child, the rest was history. Anisa is a two-time Emmy nominee for the Chicago/Midwest Emmys. She has been involved in television news and talk shows and has won five Illinois Broadcasters Association (IBA) awards. In addition to winning second place for “Outstanding Videography” in the 2018 SINBA Awards. With a number of short films and series under her belt, The Mis-Scripts is the first mini/web series written and produced by Anisa.

 

Abbas Tayebali (Actor/Co-director/Audio):

Abbas has been involved in the arts and filmmaking industry in Chicago IL for 5 years. Most of his notable works are from his student-led projects for his sound production. The proudest roles he's played are Sonny from Grease the Musical and Starred in his own student film as himself in Unconcious. Abbas has been nominated for an Emmy in the Chicago/Midwest Emmys. The thing that Abbas loves about his work is the story behind what he tells with his filmmaking, making people laugh or cry.

 

Paris Selenica (Actress):

Paris is an actress from Riverside, Illinois, and has played in multiple theater productions. Paris first started acting at the age of 11 and hasn’t stopped since. Paris also worked with her local Speech Team and some improv. Paris’s favorite productions she’s been in include playing a hungry girl named Ted in Peter And The Star Catchers, and a nervous curious man called Mr. Green in Clue. This was Paris’s first-time film acting and she loved being a part of this series.

 

Taylor Topczewski (Actress):

Taylor is a singer and actress based in Illinois. She has been in plays and musicals for the last 9 years. Taylor is so thrilled to be a part of The Mis-Scripts since it is her first time being in a web series! She loves the bond that she made with her cast and cannot wait for The Mis-Scripts to come to life!

 

Abril Garza (Actress):

Abril is an actress based in Chicago. She enjoys playing the cello in her free time. Abril's first role was in the web series The Mis-Scripts, and she has played smaller roles in theatre productions when she was younger.

 

Gabriel Garza Tinoco (Actor/PA):

Gabriel was born in Mexico but raised in Chicago. He is an actor and director. He had his debut in the show "The Mis-Scripts" in which he portrayed Tyler Kent. Gabriel can speak fluent English and Spanish. Gabriel also has some theater experience and can do improv/adlib. He is grateful to be in a fun production and more to come.

 

Alice Sylvie (Actress):

Alice is very excited to be a part of this production and to make the leap from theatre to film. Her previous performances include the role of Sophie in RBHS’s Mamma Mia, Anabella/Pamela/Margaret in LATTE Theater’s The 39 Steps, JoJo in St. Louise Players’s Seussical The Musical,  and many more. In her spare time, Alice enjoys singing and playing piano, saxophone, and guitar. She will be beginning her senior year of high school this year and cannot wait to participate in future productions.

 

Tommy Briolat (Actor):

 

Neal E. Fischer (Actor):

Neal is an award-winning filmmaker, writer, and pop culture fanatic who cut his teeth as a musician and performer on stage before ultimately transitioning behind the scenes. Neal's credits include the award-winning documentary 10 Mountains 10 Years, narrated by Anne Hathaway, #WhoKilledHeather, an innovative branded web series, and many short films and features that screened at festivals around the world. Neal also directs commercials for brands such as Dunkin’ Donuts, Wisconsin Lottery, TD Ameritrade, and Cars.com, the latter of which was shortlisted for awards at Cannes Lions. When he's not developing projects for various platforms you can hear Neal's bad impressions and obscure movie references each week on Triviality, a pub-trivia-style podcast available everywhere. Neal had a blast working with this group of passionate young filmmakers and attributes his manic performance as Principal Barnes to the fact that he couldn't properly shave or gel his hair like normal.

 

Manny Jeff Lopez (Actor):


Manny is an American actor, producer, writer, and director. Born in Chicago, Illinois, and raised in Downers Grove. He is known best as a co-creator, executive producer, and half of the duo Manny & MEAT. He is the recipient of many accolades, including a SINBA Award for best videography, in addition to five nominations from the National Academy of Television Arts & Sciences-Chicago/Midwest Chapter.

 

Rob Logan (Producer/Photographer):

Rob is a filmmaker and collaborator. His main interest is art film and abstract animation, but he'll also work on conventional narrative film stories if you ask nicely.

 

Anthony Burton Darrus (Audio Mixer/Composer):

Anthony is a singer, songwriter, and producer, living in the suburbs of Chicago. Born in the 90's and raised on pop culture and video games. Anthony blends vintage sensibility with modern technology and production techniques to create experimental originals and brings his unique perspectives to covers of famous songs.

 

Brian Grebner (Graphic and Visual Designer)

Brian is based in the Chicagoland area. He studied graphic design at the College of DuPage and has been working professionally for 6 years. His most recent motions graphics projects have been working for community news stations and on commercial productions. Lately, his work has taken a focus on animation and he's excited to dive into this medium for the Mis-Scripts.
story_txt:
About The Show

Anisa and Dalton met at College of DuPage back in 2016. They have been working on school and independent projects since then. During the global pandemic, with little work out there, Anisa and Dalton decided to write something funny to help bring joy during hard times. After months of long nights and discord meet-ups thus The Mis-Scripts was born.
The Mis-Scripts is a comedy Web Series in the same vein as It's Always Sunny in Philidephia and Community. So what do you get when you have a motley crew of film students and an overbearing and obnoxious principal who will do anything to stop them? Well, you get a bunch of Mis-Scripts who get called to action and try to stop him in his tracks first!
We want to give special thanks to our families, friends, and the community for taking the time to help us thrive and succeed during our production. With the amount of support we received, we can’t thank them enough. Hopefully, with your help, we can return the favor to these amazing individuals.


What We Need & What You Get

Share & Follow on Instagram
Donate/Fund
Perks/Rewards


The Impact

As stated above, the sole purpose of this production was to bring joy and laughter during a rough year. We wanted to make sure that was our number one priority on and off the set. We hope you will be able to see that as we bring more behind the scenes for you to look at.
This production was a first for most people on set so it was super fun for them to experience this art form and we hope you can see the impact they left on us.
This whole production brought many people together and was a great learning experience for everyone on set. This was the first time we wanted to try something on our own and tackle all the challenges that came with it.


Risks & Challenges

First Time Challenges such as rewrites or location changes have happened on production days
We lost a few actors/characters in the process
General Fees and Payments
While we were hit with some challenges in this process, in the end, we all got through them with smiles on our faces and learned so much from them.
For your help, contributing in any way possible would be amazing. This will help us fund for film festivals in the future and help us give back to the amazing people who helped this production continue while the trials and tribulations of filmmaking hit us.
How Can You Help? There are many ways you can show your support! Simply following and sharing our social media helps tremendously. Also, helping us financially will help get our name out there and help us to get recognized in the field we dream to work in. Any contribution or way of helping would be amazing. Make sure to check out our perks as well so you can be more of a part of our production.


Other Ways You Can Help

Make sure to give us a follow on Instagram @themis_scripts and share us on your Instagram/Facebook stories!
Share the IndieGoGo link on social media to help spread the word! 

Thank you for taking the time out of your day to read up on our page!

story:
BoHo Sherpa Studio 2.0

The Art Sherpa was born out of the love for teaching art with a mission to bring free art education to anyone around the world. You are our art tribe. Because of the support and loyalty of you our community, we have been able to teach hundreds of thousands of people to paint worldwide in over 250+ countries. Together, we have learned so much over the last three years and we are ready to take that experience, and with your help, create the next generation of the Sherpa Studio to carry that mission into 2018.

We are blessed with an amazing community of viewers who follow us on YouTube. Our community support, along with patrons, and strategic partners has allowed The Art Sherpa family to thrive. But, the day-to-day expenses of studio operations does not leave much in the budget for anything else. We need your help to take the next step.

Together, we would like to build a new studio set and upgrade our production. We have big dreams to create new, interactive experiences and art adventures like you have never seen before. You have watched us push the boundaries of teaching art online. We’ve set the standard of How-To Acrylic on YouTube and now we plan to raise that bar. 

To thank you for contributing to our Studio Fund, we have created some compelling Perks below. Please take a look at our plan, and if you like what we have in mind, we would love your support.

 

Sherpazoids Unite!

The Plan

We have broken down our studio development strategy into 5 primary goals and 2 secondary goals. The first 5 Phazes are the core goals to accomplish and reach the next level. Our secondary Phazes represent overfund goals and what we will do with those funds if we are so lucky! While we know some details may change slightly, this is our plan and we are ready to start building!

**Sherpa Note: We know we it’s spelled phase, we just liked it with a “z”. :-)

Phaze 1: Set Walls and Decor $3200

This is the core of all the work moving forward. New stage flat walls, a door, basic electricity, a new easel, interactive touch screen and some new decoration. The new set will allow Cinnamon to finally capture her vision of an art sanctum and share it with you. The new wall flats will be built to meet live stage event standards and greatly improve the safety and reliability of our set day to day. We will add a dedicated 220V-30amp service to the studio to provide the necessary power for lighting and servers. Inside the studio, we will have new electrical break out panels, stingers, and on set power distribution.

We are designing a new pallet table, 'hands' work space, and easel to help capture better camera angles. These custom build sets will allow us better use of the space we have, while making it more enjoyable for the viewer and much more comfortable for Cinnamon to teach.

An interactive touch screen is one of the best parts of this Phaze. This amazing tool allows Cinnamon to draw directly on the screen to assist in painting and drawing lessons during live shows. 

**Sherpa Note: Cinnamon believes that this will actually help her definitely teach clouds, or at least explain what those things are doing up in the sky. And probably some branches and flowers too. (maybe lighting, and oh what about underwater...)

Phaze 2: Lighting and DMX $500

Long time viewers of the show know that we have worked hard to keep color accuracy as true as possible and lighting is the biggest part of that. In our new studio, we will incorporate full spectrum, dimmable LED panels replacing our existing fluorescent lighting fixtures. The new lights are not only brighter so we need less of them, but they are much cooler as well. This translates to a consistent color balance between our camera shots, overall better lighting, and better painting conditions in the studio.

While we are rewiring all the lights, we will also upgrade to DMX512 lighting controls. That means, we will be able to change lighting focus or mood at the touch of a button, control the bubble machine, and incorporate more great stage effects like smoke and lasers! Not only will it make the set more fun, but it also makes our studio much safer. All of the electrical wires, switches, and plugs can be pulled up and away from our studio space with no need to manually adjust the lights. All of this will be accomplished from the control desk from now on.

Phaze 3: Rigging and Security - $500

Theaters used to use rope, pulleys, and counterweights to raise an lower the curtain just like a ship raises and lowers it’s sail. So ever since some creative Thespians purchased their stage equipment from the sailors (or pirates), its has been called Rigging… Just like on a ship. Now that we are getting our studio ship shape, we need some rigging too. Over the last couple hundred years theater tech has evolved, so we are going to need more than a few standard ropes and pulleys.

First thing, we will create strong anchor points for all the lights and electrical cables necessary. Runners and rails will be installed so we can drop green screens and swap out lights without much difficult. And most importantly, we will add redundant security cable points at every light fixture in case a clamp fails, the cable prevents the light from falling.

**Sherpa note: Please don't let my lights fall on me John!!!**

While we are securing things, we will be upgrading our existing alarm system. Well, we won’t go into too much detail about this, for security reasons… ;)

Phaze 4: Video Server - $2000

Improving the reliability of our streams is a big priority for us, and the stability of our computer systems is that foundation. (Who shall be named KEVIN THE KRACKEN!!!!) We have selected a factory refurbished HP Workstation to serve as that next building block. By selecting high quality refurbished components, we can stretch our server budget enough to get a serious graphics machine to handle all the new streaming features. This new server will provide three primary functions. First, provide storage space for our video clips, music, and visual effects for live shows. Second, it will manage the capture and storage of our final videos, and finally, it will allow for expanding and higher quality graphics, to be added to our live stream events. 

Phaze 5: Robocam 2.0 - $3800

Robocam set the standard in close up painting shots, and now we know how to make ‘him’ even better. Bigger lens, faster servos and one heck of a quiet iris, Robocam 2 is a huge improvement in video fidelity. Not only can we zoom in even closer (EXTREME CLOSE UP GARTH!) but we have more accurate control of gain and color correction from the studio control booth.

With the upgrade of Robocam 2, we also have a new control board that can handle even more Robocams and allow for smoother pan, tilt and zoom operations. Robocam 1 will stay in service and offer additional zoom angle shots.

Phaze 6: Interactive Sherpa Graphics (Overfund Goal 1)

Now that we have all this cool new tech, we need to build some graphics to experiment with it!  While we can't afford a real snow machine, virtual snow would be fun! (And less damaging to the artwork) We would like to develop a new set of broadcast graphics for the 2018 season that utilizes the new amazing power of our new graphics server. This will include a new intro, lower thirds (name plate) transition animation, and experimental interactive elements. This new system is capable of some really astounding interactive integration for our live stream events and we look forward to pushing these broadcast boundaries on YouTube in 2018.

Phaze 7: Robocam Invasion (Overfund Goal 2)

Like Tribbels, you can’t have just one… and who only wants one anyway! Klingons not withstanding. Bring on the ROBOT INVASION!

We want Robocam 2 on both the left and right zoom angle shots. This way, we will never miss a close up and the color will perfectly match as well. Robcam 1 will be moved to the overhead allowing all our camera angles to be adjusted remotely.

Community Responsibility

When we started planning this project, our first objective was to be transparent in our goals and what we plan to do with the donations you provide us. And we are committed to continuing that transparency if we see success beyond our initial goals.

With additional budget, we could choose a faster server, get a few more lights, and improve some of the choices we are making in the studio. We need a lot of basic things upgraded in the studio and a little extra capitol would go a long way to make that happen. Ranging from a new laser printer to both Cinnamon and John needing a good chair, we will keep everyone posted on how we use the funds to build our new community space. 

What about the SherpaMobile? We realized that before we could invest in our mobile broadcasting, we needed to get some of the basics in the main studio first. Once we get our studio secure, we will give her our full attention!

CAN WE DO IT? YES WE CAN!

It takes a Tribe.

This project has been largely made possible because of our community members, patrons, and friends of The Sherpa who have stepped forward to help us. In order to build our new set, we need access to a complete wood and electrical workshop, along with the expertise needed to run it all. But as luck would have it, John's good friend Mike (a master carpenter) offered to build all the new sets in his workshop, come install it and rewire our studio, we just needed to get the materials! WOW!!! With an offer like that, we had to explore our options. After a talking to a few more friends, more offers of help and great deals on lights, cameras and servers to improve the studio started to emerge. We have done extensive research on each stage of our plan to make sure we can successfully execute each Phaze as we achieve that funding level. With this confluence of events, we realize now is the time to accept the loving offers of help, and take the Sherpa studio to the next level.

Other Ways You Can Help

Many hands make for light work, and if you can’t contribute financially, THAT'S OK!  You can still help JUST by sharing this fundraiser on your social pages to get the word out in support of free art for everyone! Add a wish to your canvas that we fund!!

Leave a COMMENT! We love to hear from you… :)

Help find ways to reduce our studio cost! Everyday we get suggestions from our community on low cost resources for everything from servers to drywall and we need all the help we can get. If you have ideas, please send them to help@theartsherpa.com

*International Shipping and Perks*

Hey all, we did a lot of research on shipping costs for the Perk rewards and came to the conclusion: International shipping is WAY TOO EXPENSIVE!

As soon as the package is larger than a letter, the cost goes through the roof. So we created the INTERNATIONAL LOVE perk level. This includes free shipping worldwide for this exact reason. If you are International, expect an additional US$100-300 in shipping cost. For this reason, we are not offering International Shipping at the time of purchase. If you are comfortable with the ADDITIONAL SHIPPING COSTS, we will ship worldwide. Your exact shipping costs will be calculated at the end of the campaign, no refunds for unshipped items. We appreciate your understanding. 

The Perks: Claim your loot!

$5 : Sherpazoid Supporter

Your name will go on a special thank you page on our website AND Cinnamon will design and teach a special painting tutorial that will only be available to those that donate to THIS fundraiser. Access to Download an exclusive wall paper, and a special Gif -(digital animated image) **SHERPA NOTE: it’s a giiiifffffttttt LOL

$25 : Studio Supporter

Your name goes on our new studio wall! We have a special place picked out in the new studio for a Patron Wall, and we are excited to put your name first! PLUS -- we you will get access to exclusive videos and live events during our studio build! You also get the your name on Thank you wall on theartsherpa.com, Access to the Supporter only art tutorial, Digital wallpaper and Gif download.

$50 : Brave Beta Tester

ACCESS to Beta Development Pages, and tester feedback forums....which also means you get to beta test all the new Sherpa Software currently in development. Of course, we give you everything above as well: Name on Thank you wall on the sherpa website, Digital Wallpaper,Gif, supporter only tutorial,- Interactivity with social media and internet is necessary to participate.

$120 : Benevolent Benefactor 

Exclusive signed 11x14 museum quality print. Cinnamon, The Art Sherpa, will design and paint this image, then have quality prints made, and she will hand sign them all !!! This exclusive image will never be available again. All Signed Prints will come with a certificate of authenticity. Everything in Brave Beta Tester is also included.

$200 : International Love

An original Artist Trading Card by The Art Sherpa. ATC's are 2.5" x 3.5" trading card sized original works of art that make it affordable to share original artwork all over the world. So to make it possible to ship a perk with FREE WORLD WIDE SHIPPING, it had to be small. :) Also includes Brave Beta Tester.

$250 : Art Angel 

Sherpa’s own hand EMBELLISHED 11x14 print. This will be the same image as the signed print and will have hand painted embellishments and of course the Sherpa will sign it. All Embellished Prints will come with a certificate of authenticity. Everything in Brave Beta Tester is also included.

$500 : Creative Champion 

You get to choose one of The Art Sherpa's original studies from a tutorial show. First come First Serve. There are 40 pre-selected paintings to choose from below. They are broken down by size and canvas board or paper. As you all know John is a Dragon and this is part of his horde, thank you John for sharing. Studies will come with a certificate of authenticity. You will also receive everything in Benevolent Benefactor

We will send out emails requesting your selections after the close of the Indiegogo event. Perk winners will be processed on a first purchase, first pick priority. 

$1000 : The OG Sherpette

You get a one of a kind Sherpa Girl painting by Cinnamon Cooney, The Art Sherpa. Cinnamon will paint one of her "Party Girls" just for you! You will have Limited Customization (Hair, skin tone, eye color, body type, dress style and colors.) No Revisions. You will be contacted via email. Originals will come with a certificate of authenticity. You will also receive everything in Benevolent Benefactor. **Sherpa Note: I am totally down for designing a guy if you really want a party guy, and OG stands for Original Girl... :P

<----- Example show here 

$1500 : E-Coffee with The Art Sherpa

One on One, Coffee, Skype, and art chatting with The Art Sherpa for one hour! Cinnamon will grab a coffee and call you on Skype, for a one hour, Art-In where you will talk about YOUR Art Journey. You will have a chance to email with Cinnamon before to call to outline some Family Friendly topics to cover. We also include everything in the Creative Champion Perks. Sherpa Note: I’m kinda really excited to SEE you and your art and talk to you about it. I never get to SEE you!!! This will be sooo much fun!!**

$2500 : Patron of The Sherpa

You dear Patron, have the super special and rare opportunity to reserve a place in the Sherpadom; Help us meet our financial obligations! Your gracious donation to The Art Sherpa will provide much needed funds to carry out her mission. As a Patron, we reserve a special place of thanks to you on our Community Wall, Patron screens and of course, YOU will be one of the first people we call when we need help! You also have a special place on our Christmas Card List! Enjoy an old school medieval patronage!

$5000 : Sherpazoid Grand Bubble Blower

Access and control over the Bubble Machine*.  Online badge, community recognition (No professional or business requests pleases), a Custom Bubble Wand will be presented. You, Sherpazoid Grand Bubble Blower or SGBB, will be given priority access to all Bubble Blowing controls whenever possible, at any event or party YOU attend! That's right, you can call fourth Texas Snowflakes whenever you feel the Sherpa needs to get down! As the SGBB, if you choose to remain anonymous, we will make appropriate accommodation! Sherpa-unobtanium!

story_txt: BoHo Sherpa Studio 2.0The Art Sherpa was born out of the love for teaching art with a mission to bring free art education to anyone around the world. You are our art tribe. Because of the support and loyalty of you our community, we have been able to teach hundreds of thousands of people to paint worldwide in over 250+ countries. Together, we have learned so much over the last three years and we are ready to take that experience, and with your help, create the next generation of the Sherpa Studio to carry that mission into 2018.We are blessed with an amazing community of viewers who follow us on YouTube. Our community support, along with patrons, and strategic partners has allowed The Art Sherpa family to thrive. But, the day-to-day expenses of studio operations does not leave much in the budget for anything else. We need your help to take the next step.Together, we would like to build a new studio set and upgrade our production. We have big dreams to create new, interactive experiences and art adventures like you have never seen before. You have watched us push the boundaries of teaching art online. We’ve set the standard of How-To Acrylic on YouTube and now we plan to raise that bar. To thank you for contributing to our Studio Fund, we have created some compelling Perks below. Please take a look at our plan, and if you like what we have in mind, we would love your support. Sherpazoids Unite!The PlanWe have broken down our studio development strategy into 5 primary goals and 2 secondary goals. The first 5 Phazes are the core goals to accomplish and reach the next level. Our secondary Phazes represent overfund goals and what we will do with those funds if we are so lucky! While we know some details may change slightly, this is our plan and we are ready to start building!**Sherpa Note: We know we it’s spelled phase, we just liked it with a “z”. :-)Phaze 1: Set Walls and Decor $3200This is the core of all the work moving forward. New stage flat walls, a door, basic electricity, a new easel, interactive touch screen and some new decoration. The new set will allow Cinnamon to finally capture her vision of an art sanctum and share it with you. The new wall flats will be built to meet live stage event standards and greatly improve the safety and reliability of our set day to day. We will add a dedicated 220V-30amp service to the studio to provide the necessary power for lighting and servers. Inside the studio, we will have new electrical break out panels, stingers, and on set power distribution.We are designing a new pallet table, 'hands' work space, and easel to help capture better camera angles. These custom build sets will allow us better use of the space we have, while making it more enjoyable for the viewer and much more comfortable for Cinnamon to teach.An interactive touch screen is one of the best parts of this Phaze. This amazing tool allows Cinnamon to draw directly on the screen to assist in painting and drawing lessons during live shows. **Sherpa Note: Cinnamon believes that this will actually help her definitely teach clouds, or at least explain what those things are doing up in the sky. And probably some branches and flowers too. (maybe lighting, and oh what about underwater...)Phaze 2: Lighting and DMX $500Long time viewers of the show know that we have worked hard to keep color accuracy as true as possible and lighting is the biggest part of that. In our new studio, we will incorporate full spectrum, dimmable LED panels replacing our existing fluorescent lighting fixtures. The new lights are not only brighter so we need less of them, but they are much cooler as well. This translates to a consistent color balance between our camera shots, overall better lighting, and better painting conditions in the studio.While we are rewiring all the lights, we will also upgrade to DMX512 lighting controls. That means, we will be able to change lighting focus or mood at the touch of a button, control the bubble machine, and incorporate more great stage effects like smoke and lasers! Not only will it make the set more fun, but it also makes our studio much safer. All of the electrical wires, switches, and plugs can be pulled up and away from our studio space with no need to manually adjust the lights. All of this will be accomplished from the control desk from now on.Phaze 3: Rigging and Security - $500Theaters used to use rope, pulleys, and counterweights to raise an lower the curtain just like a ship raises and lowers it’s sail. So ever since some creative Thespians purchased their stage equipment from the sailors (or pirates), its has been called Rigging… Just like on a ship. Now that we are getting our studio ship shape, we need some rigging too. Over the last couple hundred years theater tech has evolved, so we are going to need more than a few standard ropes and pulleys.First thing, we will create strong anchor points for all the lights and electrical cables necessary. Runners and rails will be installed so we can drop green screens and swap out lights without much difficult. And most importantly, we will add redundant security cable points at every light fixture in case a clamp fails, the cable prevents the light from falling.**Sherpa note: Please don't let my lights fall on me John!!!**While we are securing things, we will be upgrading our existing alarm system. Well, we won’t go into too much detail about this, for security reasons… ;)Phaze 4: Video Server - $2000Improving the reliability of our streams is a big priority for us, and the stability of our computer systems is that foundation. (Who shall be named KEVIN THE KRACKEN!!!!) We have selected a factory refurbished HP Workstation to serve as that next building block. By selecting high quality refurbished components, we can stretch our server budget enough to get a serious graphics machine to handle all the new streaming features. This new server will provide three primary functions. First, provide storage space for our video clips, music, and visual effects for live shows. Second, it will manage the capture and storage of our final videos, and finally, it will allow for expanding and higher quality graphics, to be added to our live stream events. Phaze 5: Robocam 2.0 - $3800Robocam set the standard in close up painting shots, and now we know how to make ‘him’ even better. Bigger lens, faster servos and one heck of a quiet iris, Robocam 2 is a huge improvement in video fidelity. Not only can we zoom in even closer (EXTREME CLOSE UP GARTH!) but we have more accurate control of gain and color correction from the studio control booth.With the upgrade of Robocam 2, we also have a new control board that can handle even more Robocams and allow for smoother pan, tilt and zoom operations. Robocam 1 will stay in service and offer additional zoom angle shots.Phaze 6: Interactive Sherpa Graphics (Overfund Goal 1)Now that we have all this cool new tech, we need to build some graphics to experiment with it!  While we can't afford a real snow machine, virtual snow would be fun! (And less damaging to the artwork) We would like to develop a new set of broadcast graphics for the 2018 season that utilizes the new amazing power of our new graphics server. This will include a new intro, lower thirds (name plate) transition animation, and experimental interactive elements. This new system is capable of some really astounding interactive integration for our live stream events and we look forward to pushing these broadcast boundaries on YouTube in 2018.Phaze 7: Robocam Invasion (Overfund Goal 2)Like Tribbels, you can’t have just one… and who only wants one anyway! Klingons not withstanding. Bring on the ROBOT INVASION!We want Robocam 2 on both the left and right zoom angle shots. This way, we will never miss a close up and the color will perfectly match as well. Robcam 1 will be moved to the overhead allowing all our camera angles to be adjusted remotely.Community ResponsibilityWhen we started planning this project, our first objective was to be transparent in our goals and what we plan to do with the donations you provide us. And we are committed to continuing that transparency if we see success beyond our initial goals.With additional budget, we could choose a faster server, get a few more lights, and improve some of the choices we are making in the studio. We need a lot of basic things upgraded in the studio and a little extra capitol would go a long way to make that happen. Ranging from a new laser printer to both Cinnamon and John needing a good chair, we will keep everyone posted on how we use the funds to build our new community space. What about the SherpaMobile? We realized that before we could invest in our mobile broadcasting, we needed to get some of the basics in the main studio first. Once we get our studio secure, we will give her our full attention!CAN WE DO IT? YES WE CAN!It takes a Tribe.This project has been largely made possible because of our community members, patrons, and friends of The Sherpa who have stepped forward to help us. In order to build our new set, we need access to a complete wood and electrical workshop, along with the expertise needed to run it all. But as luck would have it, John's good friend Mike (a master carpenter) offered to build all the new sets in his workshop, come install it and rewire our studio, we just needed to get the materials! WOW!!! With an offer like that, we had to explore our options. After a talking to a few more friends, more offers of help and great deals on lights, cameras and servers to improve the studio started to emerge. We have done extensive research on each stage of our plan to make sure we can successfully execute each Phaze as we achieve that funding level. With this confluence of events, we realize now is the time to accept the loving offers of help, and take the Sherpa studio to the next level.Other Ways You Can HelpMany hands make for light work, and if you can’t contribute financially, THAT'S OK!  You can still help JUST by sharing this fundraiser on your social pages to get the word out in support of free art for everyone! Add a wish to your canvas that we fund!!Leave a COMMENT! We love to hear from you… :)Help find ways to reduce our studio cost! Everyday we get suggestions from our community on low cost resources for everything from servers to drywall and we need all the help we can get. If you have ideas, please send them to help@theartsherpa.com*International Shipping and Perks*Hey all, we did a lot of research on shipping costs for the Perk rewards and came to the conclusion: International shipping is WAY TOO EXPENSIVE!As soon as the package is larger than a letter, the cost goes through the roof. So we created the INTERNATIONAL LOVE perk level. This includes free shipping worldwide for this exact reason. If you are International, expect an additional US$100-300 in shipping cost. For this reason, we are not offering International Shipping at the time of purchase. If you are comfortable with the ADDITIONAL SHIPPING COSTS, we will ship worldwide. Your exact shipping costs will be calculated at the end of the campaign, no refunds for unshipped items. We appreciate your understanding. The Perks: Claim your loot!$5 : Sherpazoid SupporterYour name will go on a special thank you page on our website AND Cinnamon will design and teach a special painting tutorial that will only be available to those that donate to THIS fundraiser. Access to Download an exclusive wall paper, and a special Gif -(digital animated image) **SHERPA NOTE: it’s a giiiifffffttttt LOL$25 : Studio SupporterYour name goes on our new studio wall! We have a special place picked out in the new studio for a Patron Wall, and we are excited to put your name first! PLUS -- we you will get access to exclusive videos and live events during our studio build! You also get the your name on Thank you wall on theartsherpa.com, Access to the Supporter only art tutorial, Digital wallpaper and Gif download.$50 : Brave Beta TesterACCESS to Beta Development Pages, and tester feedback forums....which also means you get to beta test all the new Sherpa Software currently in development. Of course, we give you everything above as well: Name on Thank you wall on the sherpa website, Digital Wallpaper,Gif, supporter only tutorial,- Interactivity with social media and internet is necessary to participate.$120 : Benevolent Benefactor Exclusive signed 11x14 museum quality print. Cinnamon, The Art Sherpa, will design and paint this image, then have quality prints made, and she will hand sign them all !!! This exclusive image will never be available again. All Signed Prints will come with a certificate of authenticity. Everything in Brave Beta Tester is also included.$200 : International LoveAn original Artist Trading Card by The Art Sherpa. ATC's are 2.5" x 3.5" trading card sized original works of art that make it affordable to share original artwork all over the world. So to make it possible to ship a perk with FREE WORLD WIDE SHIPPING, it had to be small. :) Also includes Brave Beta Tester.$250 : Art Angel Sherpa’s own hand EMBELLISHED 11x14 print. This will be the same image as the signed print and will have hand painted embellishments and of course the Sherpa will sign it. All Embellished Prints will come with a certificate of authenticity. Everything in Brave Beta Tester is also included.$500 : Creative Champion You get to choose one of The Art Sherpa's original studies from a tutorial show. First come First Serve. There are 40 pre-selected paintings to choose from below. They are broken down by size and canvas board or paper. As you all know John is a Dragon and this is part of his horde, thank you John for sharing. Studies will come with a certificate of authenticity. You will also receive everything in Benevolent BenefactorWe will send out emails requesting your selections after the close of the Indiegogo event. Perk winners will be processed on a first purchase, first pick priority. $1000 : The OG SherpetteYou get a one of a kind Sherpa Girl painting by Cinnamon Cooney, The Art Sherpa. Cinnamon will paint one of her "Party Girls" just for you! You will have Limited Customization (Hair, skin tone, eye color, body type, dress style and colors.) No Revisions. You will be contacted via email. Originals will come with a certificate of authenticity. You will also receive everything in Benevolent Benefactor. **Sherpa Note: I am totally down for designing a guy if you really want a party guy, and OG stands for Original Girl... :P<----- Example show here $1500 : E-Coffee with The Art SherpaOne on One, Coffee, Skype, and art chatting with The Art Sherpa for one hour! Cinnamon will grab a coffee and call you on Skype, for a one hour, Art-In where you will talk about YOUR Art Journey. You will have a chance to email with Cinnamon before to call to outline some Family Friendly topics to cover. We also include everything in the Creative Champion Perks. Sherpa Note: I’m kinda really excited to SEE you and your art and talk to you about it. I never get to SEE you!!! This will be sooo much fun!!**$2500 : Patron of The SherpaYou dear Patron, have the super special and rare opportunity to reserve a place in the Sherpadom; Help us meet our financial obligations! Your gracious donation to The Art Sherpa will provide much needed funds to carry out her mission. As a Patron, we reserve a special place of thanks to you on our Community Wall, Patron screens and of course, YOU will be one of the first people we call when we need help! You also have a special place on our Christmas Card List! Enjoy an old school medieval patronage!$5000 : Sherpazoid Grand Bubble BlowerAccess and control over the Bubble Machine*.  Online badge, community recognition (No professional or business requests pleases), a Custom Bubble Wand will be presented. You, Sherpazoid Grand Bubble Blower or SGBB, will be given priority access to all Bubble Blowing controls whenever possible, at any event or party YOU attend! That's right, you can call fourth Texas Snowflakes whenever you feel the Sherpa needs to get down! As the SGBB, if you choose to remain anonymous, we will make appropriate accommodation! Sherpa-unobtanium!*whenever production allows, additional technology for online play coming 'soon' Show Study Gallery(Full size images available HERE)8x10 Canvas Board          9x11 Canvas Board       11x14 Canvas Board            8x10 Paper9x10 Paper

story:
How We Got Our Idea About Having No Idea

When you finally know what you want to do with your life but have no idea how to do it... When you figure out how you want to do it but the pandemic hits... When you say “screw it” and write a TV series over Zoom with your friends and it’s.. good... When you realize that shooting an entire season requires more capital than your scrappy indie productions are used to... When you know you’re going to make it happen, but HOW you will make it happen… you have no idea.

What the Show's About

Three queer roommates, all former 9-5er's in their early 30's have finally decided they want to pursue acting. But what does this mean? THEY HAVE NO IDEA.

Gray, Melissa, and Lane have just landed in Atlanta to pursue their passion? Dream? Purpose? as actors and feel like they are starting over. This series is about the highs and lows of a creative career and not having any idea what you're doing in your 30's (aka when you're supposed to have it "all figured out".) The series consists of hijinks, struggles, fears, and working through lifelong conditioning to become the people they want to be, alongside new friends, and figuring it out on the way.

Our Backstory 

"I Have No Idea” (IHNI) is a digital comedy series created by Shay Dominguez, Allyson Kloster, and Leslie Martinez, three actor-producers from Los Angeles who live in Atlanta. When we lost our jobs over the pandemic, we met weekly over Zoom to write season one (eight episodes). The writing sessions gave us hope, confidence, and a YOLO mentality, and our goal is to infuse the show with that spirit. 

We've produced and financed over 30 comedic short films through Leslie and Ally's production company Supervāse Video. But shooting an entire eight-episode season of a series requires more production costs and resources than we personally have access to. So we need your help! 

We truly believe that no one has any idea what they’re doing, and that’s okay! It’s just about following your heart, listening to your inner voice, and despite the conditions of the world around you, continuing to chart your own path. Through this process, this is how things are created and how magic is made.

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal of our campaign is to finance the production and post-production of our first season. The first season consists of 8 fully written episodes. Production expenses include our principal location (house) and key cast & crew. Post-production expenses will go to hiring a quality editor. 

The $25,000 we hope to raise will go directly to filming our first season (the S1 budget is over twice as much).

A significant chunk of our money will go to the location fee of our principal location: the Queer House. Gray (Shay Dominguez), Lane (Allyson Kloster), and Melissa (Leslie Martinez), meet and become friends as new roommates in the Queer House. The house is not only a physical home base of the story, but an emotional home base for the characters as they live life together.

The Perks

We have a lot of great perks in store for you! We have perks ranging from $1 to $10,000! The reason for this is because we want people on the whole financial spectrum to be able to identify and be a part of our story in anyway, shape or form they can be (that means YOU, Mr. Moneybags!)

These are some of the perks we are most excited about: 

  • SWAG BAG! Which includes a t-shirt, a mug, a sticker, a magnet, a pin, and a tote bag! 
  • Tarot Readings with Bandit The Oracle who has 15+ years of experience 
  • A personalized postcard from Atlanta (where we are!)
  • New Moon Ritual for manifesting and intention setting with Leslie!
  • Personalized Painting of your favorite Pet or Human! 
  • And last but not least, access to an exclusive Cast+Crew Zoom Watch Party (+ Swag Bag) where you can watch the first two episodes with the cast and crew before IHNI is even released! Q&A w/ the creators before or after.

 

If we don’t reach our entire goal, we will reallocate funds to produce our first season on a micro-micro-micro-budget and skeleton crew (literally, just the three of us and a camera person, probably no food (DON’T LET US STARVE!)). While not ideal, we have done it before and we are determined to shoot this series no matter what.

The Impact

We want to see and create a world in which being queer is just a part of the story and not what the whole story is about. We are in 2021 and queer shows are still not mainstream, and if they are, many of these stories are not being told by queer people. Frankly, being queer is still a “taboo” subject in many parts of the country. We want to normalize being queer and queer voices. We want to see queer people living their happy lives and being their best selves. We want to see queer people living happy lives and not be killed off at the end of a season. 

With your contribution, we will be able to film an entire first season of our newly created series and properly compensate people for their time. We will hire local Atlanta talent with a strong emphasis on BIPOC/AAPI and queer people, since these people are often overlooked in front of and behind the camera in the entertainment industry. 

Being POC and/or queer ourselves, we see it as our duty to provide opportunities for people like us, as we know how challenging it is to get through the door. We want to continue raising up diverse voices and telling these stories while compensating appropriately. 

WE NEED MORE QUEER STORIES TOLD. 

The Creators

Shay, Ally and Leslie met in the L.A. indie improv scene, after Leslie introduced herself to the 6-foot tall lesbian in a blue track jacket who just got off the stage. Together with her girlfriend Ally, Leslie asked Shay if she wanted to start an all-women queer improv team, Historically Straight. 

Shay Dominguez has produced and starred in her own music videos, created interesting twin sibling characters Gary & Mary on TikTok, amongst other sketch videos.

Allyson Kloster is a DIY filmmaker who started making sketch comedy videos (through Supervāse comedy, co-founded with Leslie) because didn’t see any other way of creating her own projects without literally creating her own projects. That meant teaching herself how to direct, DP, produce, and edit, and buy some mean crafty. Because she added those tools to her belt, she created a space for her to live out her true passion: acting. 

Leslie Martinez is an actor/writer/director/producer. She co-founded Supervāse Video with Ally. Together, they learned how to produce videos on a micro-budget from the ground up. Leslie learned how to run a set, DP, do Sound, Direct, and much more! Leslie has worn multiple hats within entertainment from being PA on set to a Social Media Manager at major studios. 

Now, the three of them are coming together to launch a web series! 

Risks & Challenges

We are new to Atlanta so meeting local talent will be a challenge but we plan on meeting people through FB groups and networking events, going to local comedy shows, and word of mouth. 

Producing something is difficult and stressful. Thankfully we all have experience producing our own videos, so we know what to look for in hiring, we know how to run a show, and we have realistic expectations for post-production and releasing the project.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share! Share! Share! Help us spread the word of our show! Most shows (especially queer shows) become popular by sharing, people telling their friends about it, and word of mouth. 

Tell every queer person on the street about this project, and all your STRAIGHT FRIENDS TOO! We love straight people! We love queer people! We love people! 

At the end of the day, we all have no idea what we’re doing, so let’s do it together.

Tell every queer person on the street about this project, and all your STRAIGHT FRIENDS TOO! We love straight people! We love queer people! We love people! 
At the end of the day, we all have no idea what we’re doing, so let’s do it together.

story:
My name is Craig Staggs and I am the Creative Director and co-founder of Minnow Mountain. We are an award-winning animation studio best known for our work on the documentary feature Tower. I served as Animation Directer and Co-Producer of Tower along with my partner, Steph Swope. We've also created an independent animated digital series called Earp. We are very excited to introduce our latest project: Murder Lake.

Murder Lake is a bloody memory. A dark and lush nightmare with environments steeped in atmosphere. Elaborate and striking painted backgrounds are adorned with dazzling effects of light, dust, weather, and wind. We’ll build an authentic horror story universe that stands in contrast to the hijinks and eccentricities of the characters inhabiting it.

This campaign is specifically to fund the creation and outreach of our series pitch package.  Every great show has to start somewhere and we are currently in production on an exceptional project bible and killer trailer that serves as proof of value and concept for Murder Lake. Animation at this level is difficult, but your contribution, coupled with our talented and experienced team, allows us to build and share a strong series pitch package that is integral to selling the show.

I've pulled together a small but growing team to make Murder Lake a reality. As the team expands and strengthens, so does the project. This is an exciting part of the process and drives the success and personality of our series.

CASTING UPDATE:

We are thrilled to announce the addition of Lee Eddy to the Murder Lake cast. Lee is an award winning actor and producer and it's an honor to work with her. She'll play the voice of Radio- Letty's ever present, all knowing, disembodied sidekick.

We're proud to announce the addition of Josephine Christiane McAdam to the Murder Lake Cast. Josephine's character will be featured in the pilot episode and the series trailer. More details soon.

Please consider joining the team with a contribution today!

 

Your contribution helps us reach our next InDemand Goal of $13,666 to add a Series Treatment that covers all the episodes of Murder Lake to our pre-production pitch package. Strengthening the collection of assets that is the foundation for production of our pilot episode.

Here is a breakdown of the funding levels and the phases of production they unlock:

"The Caretaker" Limited Edition Poster

As the creators and producers of Murder Lake, it's our job to breathe life into this dysfunctional love letter to occult mystery series like True Detective and X-Files. Here are just a handful of the projects that have inspired us and to which we aspire.

 

YOUR CONTRIBUTION WILL MAKE A DIFFERENCE FAR BEYOND THIS CAMPAIGN:

You can stick it to The Man.

Murder Lake is a hilariously seditious take on the mystery genre featuring a tough, capable, and independent female lead fighting a bloviating, style-over-substance, in-over-his-head bad guy. Kinda like America.

You can be the start of something big.

Tower, the animated documentary we co-produced, raised over $50,000 through Indiegogo. The film went on to theatrical distribution, national broadcast on PBS, and is now available on Amazon, Netflix, and iTunes.

We've also had the honor of working with ArtTV, a wildly imaginative web series inspiring kids to GO MAKE ART! This digital series raised over $53,000 here on Indiegogo and has a growing fan base.

You can help build a community.

Tower expanded on a rotoscope animation style pioneered by Richard Linklater with his features Waking Life and A Scanner Darkly. Murder Lake would be produced in Austin, building upon this strong foundation in the independent animation community.

Animation production employs actors, artists, videographers, sound designers, musicians, and many more hard working creative professionals.

The Minnow Mountain Sizzle Reel:

The Minnow Mountain About Video:

Let’s get serious.

Our approach is ambitous and experimental. With this approach there are big rewards but substancial risks. We anticipate these risks when possible but strive to be flexible and efficient enough to respond to the obstacles we couldn’t predict.

This veteran team is organized and capable.

Making a digital series can get complicated. We've run large teams in competitive environments and pride ourselves on an efficient approach to film production.

We are aware of the pitfalls of production and have lived through many of them. 

One step at a time. Our plan is to develop Murder Lake in stages, allowing us time to anticipate and solve possible production obstacles.

We have a plan B. And C. And D.

Don't Panic. Our elastic and aggressive production workflow is designed by experienced low-budget and independent filmmakers. We value momentum and we respond quickly to challenges.

Each stage of production results in a deliverable that allows us to gain feedback, recalibrate and strengthen our pitch and project before moving on to the next step. Adjustments to the production workflow and the creative content are organic and constant.

Craig could get hit by a bus.

Wait. What? Really. But all the planning, passion, and efficiency can't account for every eventuality. There is a chance that Murder Lake will fail or never get made. That's the straight dope. And also explains why Craig wears a helmet if he leaves the house.

A little short right now? That doesn't mean you can't help. Follow us on social media and come back later for updates and new perks!

FACEBOOK     INSTAGRAM     TWITTER

Please use this short link when you share: igg.me/at/murderlake

Make some noise about MURDER LAKE!  Use our hashtags and sample text to help us get the word out about this amazing new show.

I contributed to this killer project: Murder Lake on @Indiegogo. igg.me/at/murderlake #animation #adventure #darkcomedy #monsters #murderlake

Please share with us why you donated to the campaign! We are humbled by your generosity and want to brag about it to everybody. Send us a photo and a quote explaining why you donated!

Delivery dates are estimates. We'll let you know if there are any delays in delivery of your perks.

Thanks for reading all the way to the bottom. And thank you in advance for your donation, social share, and positive vibes!

story:
Short Summary

  • Hi! I'm Viveza Anthony and I'm Will D'Epagnier and we're the producers of "Dorm Dayz," an independent webseries that paints four separate portraits of individuals in their college experience. We're currently studying film at Emerson College, and this project isn't for a class or organization--it's just a story we really want to tell.
  • We already have built a small family with a wonderful, passionate cast and crew, but we still need a little bit more support to get the ball rolling.
  • We will begin filming March 31st and post our content in mid-late April
  • Please support us and join  the Dorm Dayz fam!

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are looking for donations of all shapes and sizes! We are hoping to raise up to $500 for location costs, props, costumes, and festival submission fees.
  • We have some wonderful perks, including digital copies of our project and Dorm Dayz posters.

The Impact 

  • We think this project is important because we want to capture real stories of college students!  So often we don't see accurate representation of what it means to be in college and we really want to bring a more authentic light to college living.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spread the word! Subscribe to our Youtube channel and follow us on social media.

story:
• What is the show about?


Joey is a Tai Chi instructor at a local public park when recently a group of LARPers (Live Action Role Players) have invaded his peaceful sanctuary. When their fantasy fighting scares off students and potential business, Joey has to take matters into his own hands.

He must join their make believe world, defeat the kingdom's greatest warriors, kill the king, and banish the LARPers from the Kingdom.
 

  • What's LARPing or whatever you call it...?


I thought for a while on how to solve the problem of keeping a light-hearted martial arts series while maintaining tense, action-packed, plot driven fight scenes.

My answer: LARPing or Live Action Role Playing

Basically, it's real life Dungeons and Dragons where you dress and act out the adventures of your characters. To a lot of people that have never tried either LARPing or D&D, this might sound incredibly lame and geeky; and maybe some of you have seen a particular video of a kid throwing marshmallows yelling, "Thunderbolt!," or that 8-bit sprite re-enacted skit of a group of guys playing D&D on Youtube, which doesn't help the image of the scene.

So, what if, these LARPers were actual AMAZING fighters that had to fight for their imaginary lives?

Doesn't sound too lame now, right?

 

  • Why we need your help

 

As a Youtube group, a project this size would be hard for us to tackle alone. So, we reached out for help and our cast and crew rose up to the challenge. Alongside them is Epic Armoury Unlimited, who graciously donated their amazing weapons for us to use; but we still found ourselves a bit short.

That's why we're here today to ask you all for your help.

To get straight to the point, we really need this money to get us over that last push to finishing the series. As you can see, we've been hard at work for this year to put together our biggest project yet, but even with all the help from family, friends, and our cast and crew; we still ran into unforeseen circumstances that lead us to the idea of crowdfunding our project.
 

  • So who's in the project?


This project wouldn't have gotten off the ground without the participation of these amazing talents:


DL MacDonald - I've known this guy for a damn long while and still don't know what DL stands for but his performance in anything he does speaks for itself. A professional Canadian stuntman of the Eclipse Stunts, he also help train knights in Medieval Times in Toronto. Who else to be the King of the Kingdom if not him?


Please take a look at his reel as well, and ladies, don't fall too hard:

 


Brian Kuttel - So, to give you guys an idea of how long I've know this awesome dude...we met on Myspace. Not in a catfish way, but in a, "HEY, YOU DO KUNG FU TOO!," kind of way, and we've become friends since. Brian, or should I say, Sifu Kuttel works out of San Francisco, training and teaching at the Doc-Fai Wong Martial Arts Center. He has a Youtube channel with videos that are designed to help students add depth to their training with supplementary exercises as well as forms and demonstration to show Choy Li Fut Kung Fu and Yang Style Tai Chi Chuan.


Check out his channel here!

 



Vincent Lyn - Can you believe I got this guy in my web series?! I grew up watching this guy! For those of you that might not know this legend, he has had a healthy career being on the big screen overseas! One of my most memorable childhood action movies is Operation Condor, where Vincent Lyn squared off with Jackie Chan himself! If we're going for a Hong Kong style martial arts action in this web series, might as well get someone who was a big and authentic part of that action genre!

Watch a snippet of the amazing work done by Vincent Lyn!


And of course, Joey Min (Me) and Stephanie Pham of Art School Dropouts!


Well, if you guys want to know more about Steph and I, check out our Youtube channel!

 

  • The Final Pitch

I hope that you guys can see how much passion and effort that is going into this project. Everything from its conception, story, the people in front of the camera and behind it, I took careful consideration with. I promise that if this project gets funded, I will give you, dear backers, the product that I know you would enjoy because it's something that I have enjoyed as a kid.

Martial art movies are an amazing and underestimated genre.
It transcends language barriers and is enjoyed around the world because no matter what language you speak, a punch is a punch, a kick is a kick; but what I miss is the way that martial arts were presented back then. The trend is that the bloodier and grittier a fight scene goes, the more "realistic" it is.

I, for one, am not a badass, nor do I look like one. I can't pull off looking like Jason Bourne or movies like the Raid. I started filming with comedy and feel good movies, with martial arts as a good blend of action and visual comedy. Along the way, in my career and my path of being a filmmaker, I felt like I strayed away from what I really loved to do.

So now, I'm returning back to what I really love, with the people I love, for the people that love what we do.

This webseries is not only a tribute to my childhood heroes, but to my friends, and my love for making films. I want to share those smiles by making other people smile in the only way that I can.

So please, I hope you guys can open your hearts and your wallets and help me make an awesome action webseries with great characters, funny story, and a feel-good happy message.

Thanks for your time.

www.youtube.com/artschooldropouts

story:
* YOU CAN CONTRIBUTE AS MUCH AS YOU LIKE. It doesn't have to be in perk increments. Everyone who contributes, regardless of sum, will get a thank you on the Talking Teal episode they've helped make happen.

 

Wentworth is back for season 6, and so is Talking Teal. Personal podcast and vlog perks are already for sale on igg.me/at/ladypartstv , but fans are asking for full episodes, replete with fan emails and all the good ole' fun. SO, here's what we can do. The premiere and the finale are on us, but the 10 episodes in the middle are up to you. Every full episode is $250. Every time this campaign reaches $250 increments, we'll do a full Talking Teal episode. Get to $2500 and you have a full season! This will allow you all to band together as fans and make each episode happen for all of you! We are here and ready to party!

story:
My name is Anni and I am 21 years old, born and (still) living in Berlin. New queer but hella proud. 

Queermune is my little baby that I've been carrying around with me for a while.

But a few weeks ago I started to get more specific about it and started to search for a crew and wrote some stuff, like character breakdowns and a complete pilot.You will help me to raise money, so that I can really search for a crew and some more actors/ actresses. Also we have to pay locations, development stuff and of course my crew and the talents. Basically: You make my dream come true.

 

We will need around 1000€, so that we can pay the crew, the talents, the locations, equipment and all the important stuff. We think about to found the rest (if there will be something left) for a good cause. 

We will have a non-binary MALE character and lots of nationalities. I'll try to work with as much women as possible for the crew. I am queer myself and wrote the whole script, so far. That means representation from a queer person.

The rest of the money will goto a good cause, like mental health organizations. As I support them with an own website, trying to get more awareness for mental health issues.

 

With Queermune I'll try to show that a whole show can be based around a full queer ensemble. What does it mean to be queer, what are the challenges to come out to YOURSELF at first hand and so much more. Especially the male non-binary character is very important for me.

My biggest role model ist the webseries Carmella on KindaTV. It would be a dream come true, if Queermune get's only half of the recognition that Carmella gets. But I think they've work so hard to make it possible, so I'll do the same.

I promise there will be a lot of queer stuff. You'll see diverse people and REAL people, they won't be perfect, because nobody is. And their lives won't be perfect, but they handle their lives with humor, love, friendship, empathy and by just being human. Like you and me.

 

Yeah, this project and idea seems heavy, because it is. It's my first try, but I am ready to take all the challenges to create an amazing show, that a lot of people can relate to. One challenge could be to don't get a crew, well I've a camera and if everything goes wrong I'll do it myself with the help and support of friends. What if there isn't enough money? Well I was never afraid to work more and more for my dreams, but then it'll take much longer. I am ready to face those challenges and I am ready to solve them, with you guys by my side :)

 

How can you help? RAISE YOUR VOICE. Spread the idea of this webseries, talk t your moms, your friends, your colleagues and even your dog. YOU are the important ones. YOU can make it happen.

Just a little share can help a lot. Share it on Twitter, Instagram, Facebook, WhatsApp, YouTube and much more. We appreciate every single one.

Or just use the Indiegogo sharing tools, right here ;)

But enough now. 

Thank you for reading and thanks for taking your time.

We'd love to see you while watching QUEERMUNE.

 

Love Anni

Writer and Creator of Queermune

Well I was never afraid to work more and more for my dreams, but then it'll take much longer. I am ready to face those challenges and I am ready to solve them, with you guys by my side :)

 
How can you help? RAISE YOUR VOICE. Spread the idea of this webseries, talk t your moms, your friends, your colleagues and even your dog. YOU are the important ones. YOU can make it happen.
Just a little share can help a lot. Share it on Twitter, Instagram, Facebook, WhatsApp, YouTube and much more. We appreciate every single one.
Or just use the Indiegogo sharing tools, right here ;)
But enough now. 
Thank you for reading and thanks for taking your time.
We'd love to see you while watching QUEERMUNE.
 
Love Anni
Writer and Creator of Queermune

story:
Awoken TV: The Video Subscription Platform for Spiritual Media!

I'm Brad Johnson: creator of Awoken.TV.

For 10 years, I've been involved in the field of spirituality, consciousness, the psychic field, channeling and metaphysical research. I've worked with many thousands of clients from all over the world since 2008, and my greatest passion is to create a powerful video subscription platform that helps to both educate and entertain us through spiritual-themed shows, films, documentaries and courses!

We are going through intense changes upon the planet, and what I've discovered that people require most is spiritual support and community that's there for them. This is the life blood behind Awoken.TV. Not only will we have incredible spiritual content, but we're going to build a community where we can all help each other and learn about ourselves through the content we create.

I would like to invite you to become an early subscriber for the Awoken.TV platform and help us to get started as we work to bring this new project to a worldwide audience promoting spirituality, consciousness and truth!

The Start-up Plan

  • Our goal is to raise $5000 to fulfill our start up cost to creating our integrated app so that Awoken.TV can be available on Roku, Amazon FireTV, iOS, Android, Apple TV and other common platforms. This will bring us a global audience as our teachers present their original content to a worldwide stage.
  • Once our startup goal is met, everything else is taken care of as our video on demand partner platform, Intelivideo will be working with us to create a powerful video subscription website. Our team is beginning to grow and we will have an available staff to work in bring promotion, marketing and media management to Awoken TV. We estimate that Awoken.TV will be able to launch early spring of 2019.
  • Our perks offered include discount subscriptions where you can be a part of Awoken.TV as a subscriber for 1 month, 3 months, 6 months, 1 year, 2 years and a lifetime subscriber! Our supporters will also have their names upon our website's supporter wall page. We also have the highest tier offer where one contributor can obtain 1% of Awoken.TV's net sales per month and will earn the title of Awoken TV Producer through their contribution!
  • Our campaign is a flexible funding campaign and from what we earn here will help to reach our $5000 goal.

Our Teachers!

Not only can you become a supporting subscriber for Awoken.TV, but if you have the experience, insight and expertise in the field of spirituality, consciousness and truth, we offer you to become one of our teachers. After the completion of our startup campaign, we will be rolling out our Awoken TV Teacher Training website where you can learn how to create original content for Awoken TV and get paid for it! Our training follows how to create professional media and also allows you to submit ideas for the series, documentary, film, online course or livestream show that you would like to create. All of our submissions are screened and if they pass the requirements for professional quality, your content will be available to our members from all over the world!

Best of all is the payout system for our teachers. Not only do our teachers have a discount rate to access Awoken.TV, but 50% of our monthly net profit goes towards our teachers through a revenue-per-minute payout system. In other words, the more watch time your content receives on Awoken.TV, the large your monthly payout. This is an incentive that we are pleased to offer our teachers who are passionate in creating premium content for our platform!

Development Window Timeline

DECEMBER 2018: Begin Startup campaign to complete development for our Awoken.TV app integration. Assemble the full team to begin development of the Awoken TV platform and media management.

JANUARY 2019: Complete Awoken TV teacher training website and recruit teachers to create original video content and/or submit produced documentaries/films to be aired on Awoken TV.

FEBRUARY 2019: Massive social media promotion for Awoken TV as we promote our original programming from our teachers preparing our subscribers for the official launch.

MARCH 2019: Completion of video on demand platform. Official Launch month for Awoken.TV.  Public release.

Unity in the Community!

Not only will you be able to enjoy original video content on Awoken.TV, but you'll be able to interact with a large community of fellow subscribers from all over the world. Awoken.TV is people powered and we listen to our subscribers. Our subscribers are our family and we want your voice to be heard. This is why you have the power to suggest what type of content you would like our teachers to create for you. What's important to you? What would you like to know more about? What exciting new shows covering specific topics would you like to see in the field of spirituality, consciousness and truth? Our goal is to be your genie and provide you with the wishes you command. This is what stands Awoken.TV apart from any other video on demand platform. We are subscriber powered!

The Topics We Cover

Awoken.TV's goal is to become the most informative and topic-diverse video on demand platform online. Every topic that exists within spirituality, consciousness, self-awareness, metaphysics, truth-seeking, enlightenment and inner development will be a goal set to be covered by our teachers. And of course, we work with the feedback from our subscriber community to continue to stretch the coverage of topics we intend to cover.

Device Friendly

Whether you want to watch Awoken.TV on your phone, tablet, computer or TV, we got you covered. Awoken.TV will be a fully functional integrated web app and will work pretty much anywhere.

Live Events

Awoken.TV will include live-streaming shows and classrooms. We will also be working to host in-person events between late 2019 to early 2020. We'll be keeping all of our subscribers updated on venues as we host events with our teachers so we can meet our Awoken TV family in-person!

Why Crowdfund the Startup Campaign?

This is to show that Awoken.TV is supported by our subscribers. By helping us to achieve the startup cost, we  are making our platform a community-based website with passionate supporters who want to see Awoken.TV goes as far as it's own team wants it to. With your help, this will help us to get off the ground quicker and begin creating a video on demand platform like no other.

Risks and Challenges

Yes, creating a platform such as this takes a great deal of effort and a lot of time and money. Fortunately, we have an excellent partner platform behind the scenes that will help us with a great deal of behind the scenes work and full subscriber support. So a great deal of the behind the scenes management will be taken care of. And our growing team will be handling a great deal of the submitted media as we work to bring as much content to Awoken.TV upon our public launch in the spring. 

How Else Can You Help?

Spread the word about Awoken.TV by visiting our Facebook page: facebook.com/AwokenTV as well as sharing our Indiegogo campaign page far and wide. The more subscribers that can come aboard Awoken.TV, the further we can reach out across a global stage to provide spiritual-themed content for everyone!

Don't forget about the Indiegogo share tools, and stay informed by following our updates on our campaign page.
