story:
THE SERIES

Gabe (played by Brett) is training his best friend, Dillon (Lucas), to become an NFL quarterback. However, Dillon is 36, severely out of shape, and unbeknownst to either of them, has zero chance at becoming an NFL quarterback. But with Gabe's unorthodox sports management and training regiment, the help of their loyal and paying-all-the-rent friend and roommate Bo...and also their hookups through Gabe's dog-walking business, these guys are about to beat the odds. 

WHAT ARE WE DOING WITH YOUR MONEY???:

All proceeds will be going directly towards...

-shooting locations

-director 

-sound person 

-editor

-breakfast and lunch for our crew and amazing actors who are working for free because they are amazing

-props and additional costuming 

Now again, those of you that know us, know that Lucas is still drinking the tall boy Steel Reserves he drank in college and I'm still rockin' Celeste pizzas in my freezer so yeah we broke! (raise the roof emoji) While we were able to save up some money to get us off the ground and running, any amount you're willing to give financially in this pre-tax season (horrible timing we know we know) would be greatly appreciated and help us not have to worry about finding other jobs. (praying hands emoji) 

THANK YOU THANK YOU THANK YOU to all of you who are reading this. You have no doubt, at one time or another, supported our artistic endeavors be it coming to a show, watching one of our videos, listening to a podcast, or just being nice to us and letting us use your Netflix login (thanks Chris!) We honestly don't deserve you and thank you dearly for your amazing support and love.

Sincerely your favorite jerks, 

Brett Maline and Lucas Hill

ps. Please, no crypto-currency, we don't know what it really even is or how it works, or how to even make it into money...is it REALLY money?

story:
The N&N Files: “DELTA & DAISY”

 

Grab your “Go Cups,” and hit the streets with the next generation of Nikki & Nora -- 

 

DELTA & DAISY

This digital series follows New Orleans locals and married couple, Delta Delaney (Mandahla Rose) and Daisy Peltier (Nicole Pacent). Delta and Daisy juggle work and play in America’s ultimate party town. Oh, and they solve crimes… Aside from legally being able to take your cocktails “to go,” New Orleans also has the 4th largest crime rate in America. But fortunately for the citizens of the Crescent City, Delta and Daisy are on the job as private detectives for Vieux Carre Investigations: “Because, life in New Orleans ain’t always a parade…”

Season One: “Behind the Curtain” After a suspicious death, Delta and Daisy find themselves advocating for the young women and men who are entertainers at burlesque clubs in the French Quarter.

Starring: Mandahla Rose, Nicole Pacent, Tess Harper, Armin Shimerman, Kitty Swink, Shannan Leigh Reeve, Haviland Stillwell, and Tim Dougherty. (Stay tuned for more cast announcements)

Created & Written by: Nancylee Myatt

Directed by: Mary Lou Belli

MyHardt Productions in association with Purpledolphin Productions  

 

The Origin Story:

“Nikki & Nora” was a network television pilot, starring Liz Vassey & Christina Cox, shot on location in New Orleans in 2004. It focused on two NOPD detectives who were partners on the force and in life. Had the “Nikki & Nora” pilot been picked up to series, it would have been the first show that focused on a lesbian couple on network TV. When the promotional DVDs of the pilot were leaked onto the internet, the lesbian fanfic community claimed it as their own and kept the story of Nikki & Nora alive. Ten years after the pilot, and funded by the fans, creator Nancylee Myatt and stars Liz Vassey and Christina Cox returned to New Orleans to give this groundbreaking couple another chapter to their story with the webseries “The N&N Files.”

In this season of “The N&N Files” we meet Nora’s niece, Delta, and her wife Daisy. D&D are now the primary partners at Vieux Carre Investigations, keeping the streets of New Orleans safe and gay fabulous.

story:
THE CAMPAIGN VIDEO

Instead of filming a video where we tell you what style of web series we want to create, we decided to just show you. In order to secure a slot as a Resident Assistant, candidates must interview for the job. This video is a sneak peak at what to expect from this web series.

 

THIS PROJECT

When living in on-campus housing, there is a fine line between order and chaos. The dedicated students who protect this fine line are members of an elite squad known as Resident Assistants. These are their stories. A new web series about RAs: written, produced, and starring real life RAs. Join the absurd and satirical life of being an RA, through the eyes of RAs who are surprised they've made it out alive. 

 

OUR MISSION

Comedy is the best source of medicine. Whether you're stressing out about how you're going to pay rent, juggling being a full-time student and a part-time worker, while still trying to keep your creative juices flowing. It can be a lot to handle. No one knows this more than RAs. Instead of dwelling on the stresses of life and confining our creativity, we want to create a story that takes a satirical and comedic look at the life of RAs. Some of us are nearing the end of our college and RA careers, so we want to go off with a bang. Please support, share, and donate to help us to create something we can be proud of.

 

THE CHALLENGES- How can you help?

The goal is to produce 8 episodes for this web series throughout the next few months. Our story requires that we have proper equipment, scenic elements, production resources, etc. Listed below is where your money will go!

  • We need to rent camera equipment and lighting equipment.
  • We must provide reimbursement for transportation, parking, and gas of equipment and crew.
  • We are providing 1 meal a day for the student-based crew, dietary restrictions are taken into account. 
  • We’re going green! We want the set to have as little waste as possible and that means purchasing recyclable materials and organizing, recycling, and reusing efforts. 
  • Copyright and WGA registration fees. 
  • The hope is to make to our goal of $2,000 to effectively produce this project.

 

MEET THE TEAM

Anthony Fuentes, Director/Producer

Anthony Fuentes is a Junior at Columbia College Chicago studying Cinema and Television arts, mainly focusing on directing and producing. In the last 6 months, he has gotten the chance to produce 4 independent short films, one of which he also directed. Anthony was thrilled about the idea of tackling a web series regarding the absurd lifestyle of resident assistants. He is even more thrilled to have the opportunity to get to work with a group of such talented and young individuals.

 

Andrew Morris, Head Writer

Andrew (he/him) is a senior Photography and Comedy Writing & Performing major at Columbia College Chicago. As a 3rd year RA he’s truly seen it all. Since moving to Chicago from Albuquerque, NM (yes, like High School Musical) he has not shut up about writing a web series about this job. He’s so glad to be working with an incredible team of writers and actors to create this show. When not in the writers room, Andrew is out photographing the city. 

 

Maddi Banno, Line Producer

Maddi Banno (she/her), the Line Producer for the series, is finishing up her senior year as a filmmaking major with concentrations in producing and location sound as well as a minor in voiceover. In her free time, Maddi enjoys rock climbing, listening to podcasts, and keeping it real. Maddi has a passion for organization and an affinity for chaos, something she's learned to embrace through being an RA. She's honored to be working on such an amazing project with the incredibly talented and hardworking people whom she gets to call her coworkers, her friends, and most importantly, her family.
 

Bethany Schmieder, Writer

Bethany (she/her) is a senior at Columbia College Chicago studying comedy writing/performance and stage management. Bethany has wanted to create a series based around the lives of resident assistants since she started the job and is extremely grateful that this dream is finally becoming a reality. She credits her dearest friends, best memories, and mediation skills to her three years as an RA.

 

Kevin Garrett, Writer

Kevin Garrett is a Chicago based improviser, writer, and voice actor. They have performed at The Second City, Laugh Out Loud Chicago, iO, and other comedy theaters around the city. They could not be more thrilled to bring to life the story of RA's and the hijinks they get into. Kevin was an RA for two years while in college and getting to portray one again is all the therapy they need.

 

Raiza Newberry-Quiroz, Writer

Raiza Newberry-Quiroz (She, Her, Her's) is a senior Television Writing and Producing major at Columbia College Chicago. Raiza in the future hopes to be a Children's television writer but in the mean time loves to write everything in between comedy sketches to horror.  She is making the most out of her first year being an RA and picking up stories to exaggerate along the way.  Previously working with a few of the RAs in the cast, she knew that this web series was going to be something wonderful she would never forget. 

 

Kady McElhattan, Writer

Kady (she/her) is a senior Television Writing and Producing major at Columbia College Chicago. She has hopes to write comedy and be a showrunner in the future. She spends most of her time writing and producing independent projects for classes, but she's excited to now get the chance to write about her current side gig as a poster hanger upper (or "Resident Assistant").

 

Helen Grimes, Writer

Helen Grimes (she/her) is a sophomore at Columbia College Chicago who is pursuing a degree in Computer Animation with a minor in Television Writing. In the future, Helen wants to work with the production and writing of animated television. Currently, she is very excited and appreciative of this opportunity to write for such an interesting and fun web series. 

 

    THANK YOU

    If you can't donate money it doesn't mean you can't help us. Here are a few ways to support our project: 

    Share our campaign page via social media; facebook, instagram, and twitter.  Tell everyone you know to donate to our campaign and share our page.

    Come to our Fundraising show, this upcoming Saturday, February 22nd. More information on our instagram page.

    Follow us on instagram for the full inside scoop and updates about our production. INSTAGRAM: @rawebseries

    ---------

    We greatly appreciate your support!

Maddi has a passion for organization and an affinity for chaos, something she's learned to embrace through being an RA. She's honored to be working on such an amazing project with the incredibly talented and hardworking people whom she gets to call her coworkers, her friends, and most importantly, her family. 

Bethany Schmieder, Writer
Bethany (she/her) is a senior at Columbia College Chicago studying comedy writing/performance and stage management. Bethany has wanted to create a series based around the lives of resident assistants since she started the job and is extremely grateful that this dream is finally becoming a reality. She credits her dearest friends, best memories, and mediation skills to her three years as an RA.
 

Kevin Garrett, Writer
Kevin Garrett is a Chicago based improviser, writer, and voice actor. They have performed at The Second City, Laugh Out Loud Chicago, iO, and other comedy theaters around the city. They could not be more thrilled to bring to life the story of RA's and the hijinks they get into. Kevin was an RA for two years while in college and getting to portray one again is all the therapy they need.
 

Raiza Newberry-Quiroz, Writer
Raiza Newberry-Quiroz (She, Her, Her's) is a senior Television Writing and Producing major at Columbia College Chicago. Raiza in the future hopes to be a Children's television writer but in the mean time loves to write everything in between comedy sketches to horror.  She is making the most out of her first year being an RA and picking up stories to exaggerate along the way.  Previously working with a few of the RAs in the cast, she knew that this web series was going to be something wonderful she would never forget. 
 

Kady McElhattan, Writer
Kady (she/her) is a senior Television Writing and Producing major at Columbia College Chicago. She has hopes to write comedy and be a showrunner in the future. She spends most of her time writing and producing independent projects for classes, but she's excited to now get the chance to write about her current side gig as a poster hanger upper (or "Resident Assistant").
 

Helen Grimes, Writer
Helen Grimes (she/her) is a sophomore at Columbia College Chicago who is pursuing a degree in Computer Animation with a minor in Television Writing. In the future, Helen wants to work with the production and writing of animated television. Currently, she is very excited and appreciative of this opportunity to write for such an interesting and fun web series. 
 

THANK YOU
If you can't donate money it doesn't mean you can't help us. Here are a few ways to support our project: 
Share our campaign page via social media; facebook, instagram, and twitter.  Tell everyone you know to donate to our campaign and share our page.
Come to our Fundraising show, this upcoming Saturday, February 22nd. More information on our instagram page.
Follow us on instagram for the full inside scoop and updates about our production. INSTAGRAM: @rawebseries
---------
We greatly appreciate your support!

story:
DATE ME

Date Me tells the stories of Kristin's crazy family; the unique and often lousy ways people interact with her because of her disability; and her attempts, often failed or funny, at dating in a wheelchair with a strained, but ongoing determination not to give up. The opportunity to create a series inspired by Date Me will create inspired family-friendly entertainment and allow us to share in moments based on Kristin's dating experiment— 32 dates in 75 days.

Kristin Beale: I'm young, single, and in a wheelchair due to a jet ski accident in the ninth grade. In most people's minds, my wheelchair seems to define me; people are either scared of it or think it's a bigger deal than it is. But I'm just a normal girl. I'm a young, single woman who happens to be sitting down.

David Leehy: I'm an actor, director and scriptwriter. I've done everything from professional wrestling production to acting in Spielburg's Lincoln. I'm a proud grandfather and RV enthusiast who wants to bring Kristin's Date Me concept to the screen.

Tyler Darden: I'm a cinematographer and commercial photographer, dad and wakeboarder. I love to work with cameras, lenses and lighting to help make each story beautiful, compelling and unique.

Cast

 

Funding Goals

To cover costs of producing this pilot, $4000:

  • We are working with experienced actors and are keeping our production within guidelines outlined by the Screen Actors Guild.
  • We need more resources to keep the crew and actors safeguarded against Covid-19.
  • We have to pay fees for permits and permission to film at two of our four locations.
  • Our talented and hardworking crew will be paid to make this story shine on screen
  • We are using this pilot to pitch different outlets for additional funding to produce up to six episodes for season one.

Perks! Partnering with us you can choose one or more of these:

  • A signed copy of one of Kristin's books, Date Me, Greater Things or A Million Suns.
  • A Date Me t-shirt!
  • An invitation to an early screening of the pilot and provide input on the final edit.
  • An opportunity to visit the set as a guest producer and have lunch with the cast and crew.
  • An opportunity to come on set and be an extra in the pilot.
  • We hope to reach stretch goals and have an animated introduction using Kristin's drawings, bring in additional resources for wardrobe and set decorating. Additionally we would love to be able to have more crew for editing, coloring and sound in post-production.
  • we have a flexible goal, so even if we fall short of our stated goal, all funds will go toward the production and add to money already committed.

Our Impact

Your contribution will make a difference:

  • Help us bring Kristin's story, humor and poignancy to screens everywhere
  • Be a part of our mission to help many to see the challenges of being in a wheelchair and living life to its fullest.
  • We have over 60 years combined experience as writers, actors and filmmakers.
  • David Leehy has worked in large and small productions all around the mid-Atlantic.
  • Tyler Darden owns SaltFire Studio, a film and photo production company in Richmond, Va.
  • This is our third production together. We finished filming Everything But You in March (to premiere in November 2020) and premiered There's An App for That in May,
 

Risks & Challenges

While we hope we don't see setbacks, we must address as many as possible in preparation

  • Covid-19 restrictions could shut down production. If so, we will reschedule for a later date.
  • We will have a plan in place to keep the set clean with minimal interactions between departments.
  • We are committed to our crew and actors. If someone becomes sick, we will reschedule production of their part or work with them to find an amicable solution.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand if you may not be able to contribute monetarily at this time, but please forward this campaign to someone who may be able to help or have interest in bringing this project to life! Make some noise for us! And please use Indiegogo share tools when you can! Thanks so much for all of your consideration.

story:
WELCOME TO INNER SPACE

For centuries, people have sought out the wisdom of psychics to solve their problems. From Miss Cleo, to John Edwards and Sylvia Brown, psychics often reach fame of extraordinary heights due to humanity’s fascination with the parapsychological. But what do Claire and Ruby, a couple of jaded and broke millennial women, do when they have a problem? They become psychics.

CLAIREvoyant is a mystical comedy of errors starring a classic odd-couple duo. In this episodic digital series, co-creators and co-stars Annie Briggs (Ruby) and Natasha Negovanlis (Claire) play two sincere and relatable leads that are body positive, sex positive, and unafraid to be themselves. It is a feminist comedy/fantasy series for those that love the colourful kinetics of Chewing Gum, the bare-souled honesty of Fleabag, and the queer-positivity of Please Like Me. The tone of our storytelling is a fusion of grounded and genuine scenes about reluctant and painful personal growth, with absurdist humour. 

This is what it’s all about…



Aimless and hung-over, Claire and Ruby wake up under an overpass after partying away their last 50 bucks on Claire’s 25th birthday, and find out they are evicted. Instead of doing the responsible thing, the free-spirited Ruby cooks up a wild get-rich-quick scheme: scam people by becoming online psychics. The skeptical Claire is reluctant, but agrees to participate in a desperate bid to appease her restless wild-child best friend, Ruby, and oh yeah, avoid homelessness. Enter “THE SEER SISTERS”! Cosmonauts of INNER space!

Claire and Ruby’s fraud as the delightfully tacky “Seer Sisters” seems innocent at the start: “It’s for entertainment purposes ONLY!” But there’s a catch: Claire discovers she is actually psychic. This catalyzes the events of the first season, as Claire’s real extra-sensory abilities explode the Seer Sisters’ popularity while simultaneously attracting the ire of a secret cabal of malevolent psychics! Known as “The Seeing Eye” the cabal is hell-bent on harnessing Claire’s power for world domination. This propels Claire and Ruby on a journey of self-discovery, where they will have to learn to love themselves, trust each other, and kick some psychic ass!

But wait…

For those who followed our recent success with our Independent Production Fund application, you're probably wondering... what the fook?! Aren't you already rolling in dough?! 
Well, the IPF is an amazing professional development program which provides grants for Canadian creators who enhance the quality and availability of Canadian web series, and part of their mentorship initiative is to provide 75% of budgets for carefully selected productions if they are able to secure the remaining funds. That's where we're hoping you'll come in!

Because we believe…

Why else should you contribute to our campaign?

It’s a show about friendship.
It’s a show about growing up.
It’s a show about love.

But, this isn’t another show about apathetic millennials. It’s a show about learning to take action and finding a place in this world - even if it means having to destroy an evil psychic cabal while in the process! It’s about expanding horizons, evolving ideals, and about understanding that not everything is black and white - there’s always room for a little magic.

With two lead characters that experience very different romantic journeys, CLAIREvoyant shows us that there is no right or wrong way to be in a relationship, or to be a feminist. 

Out lesbians, pro-choicers, polyamorous adventurers, and academic brains!

Each female character on CLAIREvoyant is unabashedly strong in her own unique way. Plus, with the guidance of an openly queer co-creator, CLAIREvoyant will provide positive on-screen representation for the LGBTQIA+ community, and promises to demonstrate that queer relationships can be free from angst.

Although, it’s true that the digital media industry can be a…

So where will your money go? 

Aside from an extensive collection of leopard print pants and an on set lion? 
Just kidding! Well, maybe not about the pants...

Our budget goes directly to costs like: fair salaries for our crew, props and wardrobe, licensing and legal fees, production insurance, and union dues (ACTRA + WGC - The Writers' Guild of Canada) that protect our performers and creatives.

See our gallery above for an illustrated breakdown of where our modest budget will go.

But how do we know this show will be a success? 

We are fortunate that CLAIREvoyant already has a built-in audience of over 200K Subscribers on its host channel KindaTV, over 140K Views on the teaser trailer, as well as a generous cross-over with other fandoms. Since starring in the award winning digital series Carmilla, our creators have also collectively amassed a huge, loyal following because both women resonate with, and appreciate, their audience. They understand the importance of generating positive online engagement and our team will create unique, additional content with specific calls to action because we want YOU to be a part of our community.

We also have a pretty stellar creative team lined up, and it's only going to get better! 

Here's who is on board so far:

Annie Briggs: Co-Creator, Co-Writer, Co-Producer

Originally hailing from Halifax, Annie (Ruby Renaud) is a graduate of the American Academy of Dramatic Arts in NYC. Her recent appearances include the Murdoch Mysteries digital spinoff Beyond Time, on the Netflix series Dark Matter, and in repertory at the Wintergarden Theatre in Toronto with the Classical Theatre Project, in productions of Macbeth (Lady Macbeth), and Twelfth Night (Viola). She has also worked with such Canadian theatre companies as: Neptune Theatre, Single Thread Theatre Company, Food for Thought, Festival Players of Prince Edward County, Chester Playhouse and Shakespeare by the Sea, to name a few. Annie is most recognized for her work on four seasons of the 2016 Canadian Screen Award winning web series Carmilla, for which she has amassed a devoted fan-following. She has also appeared on Murdoch Mysteries, and starred in the indie-feature Roundabout. She is very pleased to have made her directorial debut with her short film Luvvie, which she also wrote and starred in. The film premiered at the Toronto International Short Film Festival this past autumn. 

Natasha Negovanlis: Co-Creator, Co-Writer, Co-Producer

Natasha (Claire Ganski) is a multi-disciplined artist who gained notoriety in 2014 for playing the titular character in the Canadian Screen Award winning digital series Carmilla. Formally trained in music, Natasha studied voice performance at McGill University before pursuing a professional career in acting. Now at it full time, Natasha also works as a content creator for Shaftesbury/Smokebomb, where she is the host of KindaTV, their flagship YouTube channel. Her accolades include: winning a 2017 Canadian Screen award for Fan's Choice with over two million votes, as well as receiving nominations for a 2016 Canadian Screen Award, 2015 VH1 Streamy Award, and a 2015 Shorty Award for her work as an actress. Her recent appearances include: guest roles in television shows such as Murdoch Mysteries and Slasher, as well as feature films like Darken and the iTunes best-seller Almost Adults, now available on Netflix.

Dillon Taylor: Supervising Producer, Editor, Trailer Director

A graduate of the Writing and Producing For Television program at Humber College, Dillon began his career in television in 2013 as a production assistant on the first season of Big Brother Canada, and landed a job as a producer/editor for Smokebomb Entertainment shortly after. Since then, he has edited several of their award-winning digital series including Carmilla, MsLabelled, and V Morgan is Dead. He has also written, produced, directed, and edited several short films including Flying Game & The Sixx which both won the Audience Choice and Jury awards at the T24 Toronto Youth Short Film Festival.

Jason Packer: Co-Writer, Co-Producer

Jason is a comedy producer/writer/story editor and member of the Writers Guild of Canada. Having worked alongside some of the most respected show runners in North America, Jason is lucky to have parlayed his twisted sense of humour into a career that’s actually, sometimes, considered a career. His credits include: The Next Step, Undercover High, Spun Out, Mr. D and most recently, People of Earth. You can always find him on social media at @denimsocks and on the beach... with his shirt on.

Simone Stock: Director 

Award winning writer-director Simone Stock’s first jobs were on Hollywood movies shot in her hometown of Toronto. Learning from industry greats like Ann Bancroft and Kathryn Bigelow, Simone developed a rich, cinematic sensibility and a fearless, hands-on approach with actors. Simone was nominated for Best Short in 2012 by TIFF for comedy Motown Morning made at AFI. Sci-fi short IRIS has screened festivals worldwide including Cannes and continues to win awards. Second Unit work has taken Simone to the Arctic filming a baby polar bear (The Journey Home), throughout Rwanda (Shake Hands With The Devil) across China (The Children of Haung Shi) and London for the film adaptation of bestseller A Street Cat Named Bob released last December. Recently short-listed for Women in View’s 5 To Watch, Simone will direct comedy feature Jesus Puts Everyone in RM 105 early next year. Her sci-fi feature script Polaris is currently part of Whistler Film Festival's prestigious Praxis Screenwriting Program.

Smokebomb Entertainment: Production Company 

Smokebomb Entertainment is an Emmy award-winning digital media production company, and the digital arm of production and distribution company Shaftesbury, based in Toronto. They create groundbreaking original transmedia projects and engaging convergent extensions for television by combining world-class story-telling, integrated second screen experiences, and innovative social campaigns. Smokebomb builds compelling story worlds for Tweens and the 16-34 demographic. 

So if you’re not going to do it for us, at least do it...

We not only aim to generate engagement from our pre-existing audience, but to also grow interest in people who are fed up with seeing unrealistic representations of their struggles in media, and frustrated by women having to compete for social space. 

Each perk has also been created to help YOU become a part of our creation and community. But if you’re unable to provide a monetary contribution to our project, you can also help us create the show of our dreams by following us on Twitter and Instagram (@clairevoyantsho) and by liking, commenting, and sharing this campaign, our teaser trailer, and social posts.

We are endlessly grateful for your interest and support of CLAIREvoyant!

*PLEASE NOTE that some perks will not be delivered until the series has premiered. However, all perks WILL be delivered and this series WILL get made! For questions, comments, and concerns you can contact: clairevoyantsho@gmail.com and we’ll SEE you in inner space!

story:
Short Summary

  • This Web Series is directed by Nate Allen and Produced by Corey O'Connell
  • We are trying to raise money to buy equipment and make this as professional as we can
  • Contributors will help us succeed in making this film

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are trying to raise $1000 dollars to buy equipment and be able to fund the film
  • The funds will go to equipment even if the goal is not reached

The Impact

  • We are young filmmakers trying to entertain people with our projects
  • We have previously created the cyber debate and this is our next project

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Feel free to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign
  • You can use the indiegogo share features to share the campaign

Short Summary

This Web Series is directed by Nate Allen and Produced by Corey O'Connell
We are trying to raise money to buy equipment and make this as professional as we can
Contributors will help us succeed in making this film


What We Need & What You Get

We are trying to raise $1000 dollars to buy equipment and be able to fund the film
The funds will go to equipment even if the goal is not reached


The Impact

We are young filmmakers trying to entertain people with our projects
We have previously created the cyber debate and this is our next project


Other Ways You Can Help

Feel free to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign
You can use the indiegogo share features to share the campaign

story:
BRAINDEAD

Hi, WELCOME to our IndieGoGo donation page for our original Web Series, BRAINDEAD.

We are a group of young actors and media artists who are excited and passionate about creating work for ourselves, and creating the type of content that we are interested in watching. 

Last year we shot a short film with a budget of 0 dollars, and while we are very proud of the product we hope to accomplish something a bit grander with our next project BRAINDEAD.

 

Our Proposal

We are partnering our next project with the Screen Actor Guild and working with dozens of young, talented, passionate artists. Because we are committed to keeping our work to a level we can be proud to show you, we need help funding our project. All of the money you donate will go directly into the project either through paying the actors and artists for their work or through buying equipment, materials, and the various physical elements that make a film set run. 

  • For a 5$ donation we will take down your name and thank you in the credits of a BRAINDEAD episode
  • For a donation of 10$ or more we will personally send you the soundtrack to our first project After Party, featuring
    • Sara Schwab 
      • https://geo.itunes.apple.com/us/album/sara-schw...
    • Joanna Podias
    • Dan Rice
    • Hasan
    • Liam Hall

The Impact

Your donation will directly benefit dozens of young artists trying to get their careers in the performing arts started.

Other Ways You Can Help

We absolutely understand that some people won't be able to contribute, and we appreciate that! We do ask that if you can't contribute monetarily please considering helping us out by simply sharing this IndieGoGo page allowing other people in your life to see our story and our project.

 

THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR YOUR TIME AND SUPPORT

story:
A Message from the Author Debra Magpie Earling of Perma Red

“The time is now for the gathering of those stories to rise up, and for us to change this narrative. . . to open the door for Native people to telling their own stories.”
-Debra Magpie Earling
 

Our Stories, Our Land, Our Time

The television adaptation for this highly acclaimed literary work is rooted in the history of Séliš (Salish) storytelling. 14,000 years ago, when the Séliš began to inhabit the
ancestral homeland, now known as the Bitterroot Valley and Flathead Reservation,
Salish languages, songs, and narratives were heard across the land before the sea of
colonization threatened to drown Salish voices and traditions. We hope Perma Red will
ignite a new generation of Selis and Native storytelling.

Perma Red-Television Series

Perma Red, based on the award-winning novel by Séliš author Debra Magpie Earling, brings to life the story of a young Séliš woman, Louise White Elk.  Smart, strong, and beautiful, Louise plays pranks, challenges boys and men to race her, breaks horses, dives in the dangerous waters of the Flathead River, saves her sisters from BIA officials, and lives as a free spirit in a world that denies Indians freedom.  

A 2011 Statistics Canada report estimates that Indigenous women are seven times more likely than other women to be victims of a homicide. Murdered and missing Indigenous women is a story as old as Lewis and Clark and now that terrible story is epidemic.

In reclaiming our stories, Natives are able to give a voice to those that have for too long been voiceless in the mainstream. Call it the decolonization of the arts, because through art and film we have the ability to change lives and influence society, but change can only occur through authenticity and respect.

We are almost to our goal but we need your help to fund the Pilot Episode! We are grateful to our donors and the Montana Film Office. This final push will get us to reach our budget goal to shoot the 45-minute Pilot Episode!

Who are we? Cast/Crew

We are a group of filmmakers, historians, writers, singers, actors, artists and advocates.  We believe in the power of media to change lives and to influence society. But we believe that change can only occur through authenticity and respect.  Perma Red  has the capability of refocusing the perception of Native Americans and changing America.

                                                        

Frank John "Johnny" Arlee

Salish Language and Cultural Advisor/Technical Advisor, Actor

                                   

 

Read full bios at our website: http://www.permaredfilm.com/cast-crew/

 

 

Storytelling Ignites the Fire

Native stories, language, tradition, and knowledge have been extracted and exploited
like all of our resources. This is the unfortunate legacy of colonization.

But storytelling decolonizes.

When we tell our own stories; we reclaim our stories.
We change lives through art and film.
We give voice to the voiceless.
Decolonization of the Arts begins with the original people.

Bridging Communities Ignites Hope

Storytelling ignites the fire colonization wanted to extinguish.

Perma Red is building an infrastructure to promote Native Storytelling for years to come. With issues like Murdered and Missing Indigenous Women and suicide reaching epidemic proportions in Indian Country, Natives across the United States need to come together to find solutions. 

Perma Red as a limited television series will be more than entertainment, it will be a viable job resource for the Mission Valley and Flathead Indian Reservation and will have ⅔ crew ratio of Native to White to honor Indigenous filmmaking. The script will include Salish dialogue, and there’s a need for crew, dancers, singers, cast, and consultants to ensure cultural sensitivity and accuracy. With the success of the series, more film projects would create financially viable jobs on and off the reservations honoring and encouraging the voice of culture through storytelling.

In an area wrought with high suicide rates, seeing an entire community unite behind the series will instill a sense of local and tribal pride and hope that cannot be understated. Their humanity, their struggles, and their hardships finally matter to a seemingly indifferent world. Elders and little kids alike proud they are part of a movie about where they live who they are, because through art, through literature, through film, they mattered.

Mentorship

We are also working with Salish Kootenai College to incorporate mentor programs for Native American youth to learn about working on a set as a director, producer, writer and personal assistant. In that, Perma Red is comprised of a crew of a highly accomplished women and men of their respective fields encompassing above-the-line roles from directing to producing—50% of whom are Native women. These statistics—unheard of on a production set—create an environment of passionate, collaborative, and progressive filmmaking. Not only does this provide an avenue and safe space to exercise the female gaze, it also creates a process of female-led mentorship and shared vision sorely needed in the cinematic world of today with the reality of #MeToo plaguing the industry. We can simultaneously lift women up in film and stimulate the creation of long term professional jobs in Montana and on the reservation for them.  

Finally, by addressing the serious and relevant issue of missing and murdered indigenous women through the true story it’s based upon, we will give national platform to the #MMIW movement. We are working closely with Debra Magpie Earling and an elder cultural counsel to tell this story with integrity and respect. We intend to bring awareness by honoring Séliš, Ql̓ispé  people while giving a voice to missing and murdered Native women whose voices we must always listen to and never forget.

We believe this series will further heal relationships internationally through the arts via the transcendent and universal language of literature and film, and will do so from the beautiful canvas called Western Montana, ntxʷetkʷ.

Ensuring Authenticity

We honor the significance of cultural authenticity in all of its facets and strive to ensure
sensitivity and protection. Séliš dialogue is a necessary element of the production and
we wish to bring awareness to the Sélis language which is now critically endangered.

Staying True to Tribal Sovereignty

The series will be shot on location on the visually stunning Flathead Indian Reservation
in Montana, a site that is deeply connected to Séliš culture.

Donations

The donations help us make this Pilot episode a success! Your money will go to: 

  • Secure professional cinematographer/gaffer 
  • Deposit for A-list actors to be attached to project
  • Secure 8K camera and equipment need for polish product and professional crew
  • Correct Clothing for the 1940s and for the Salish Culture
  • Working with the Salish Tribe on language, dialogue, locations and music
  • Salish Language lessons for lead actor, Veyanna Webster
  • Organizing an authentic Powwow event with Salish Community
  • Organizing mentors for Native American youth to be on set

Donation Raffle Items

When you donate, your name will be entered in a raffle to win one of the following items:

  •  First edition copy of Perma Red signed by the author Debra Magpie Earling.
  • A scarf by the amazing fashion designer B. Yellowtail.
  • And a VIP invite to our set and events.  

We will announce winners on this site and our social media sites.

The Impact

Perma Red brings hope to Indian Country.  

Social justice goals:

  • Perma Red confronts the serious epidemic of missing and murdered Native women in the Americas.
  • All women above-the-line on the crew and 50%+ Native American.
  • The series mentors Native American youth in the film industry to continue telling their stories through the medium of film as a career.
  • Protagonist is a Native American Woman and there a numerous supporting characters that are Native women.  
  • Accurate portrayal of  content Séliš, Ql̓ispé, history and culture.  Rarely are Native women depicted in leading roles or hired as directors in film production.
  • Low overall shooting budget and filmed in Montana, with internationally acclaimed crew and Native filmmakers, including casting director Rene Haynes (The Revenant and Twilight films).
  • The film will contain Séliš, Ql̓ispé dialogue.  As of 2018 the Séliš,Ql̓ispé language has reached the  “critically endangered” status among Indigenous languages in the US.
  • Perma Red is targeted to reach audiences in the United States, Canada, Mexico, South and Central America and Europe. The international market is calling for this type of female lead and the accurate portrayal of indigenous women in the Americas addressing social justice issues.

-Campaign written by Adrian Jawort with Contributions from Suzanne Shope, Maya Dittloff and Ivan MacDonald

Other Ways You Can Help

We value any help we can get! Sharing this campaign online, talking about it to friends and family, reaching out to us if your would like to be an extra or donate clothing, and supporting us with comments means so much to us! If you are interested in investing please contact us through our website: http://www.permaredfilm.com/contact/ 

 

 

Special thanks to Investors/Donors/Partners who have already supported the campaign: 

Montana Film Office: Big Sky Film Grant

From the Heart Productions (Fiscal Sponsor)

Salish Kootenai College

Polson Library

The Payne Family Native American Center

Wasabi Sushi Bar and Ginger Grill

MAPS Media Institute

Suzie Reahard

Robert Peccia

Susan and Tim Arneson

B. Yellowtail

Felicia Paul

Precious David

Bryan and Kassandra Murphy Brazill

Nacheyla, Sequoya, Sierra Dempsey and Terri Petersen

Sunni LaPlant, Sharmay Ewing and June Cree Medicine

Ronda Old Chief and Curtell Old Chief

Kieara Whitehawk, Mariah Maxwell-Hawley

Laurel and Bud Cheff

Marc and Kristy Carstens

Guthrie Weston Quist

Cecelia Coon and Lisa Coon

Paula Greenstein

Lindsey Jane Gardner

Heather Beeman Crombie

Myrna Chamberlain and John Feldt

Maura and Edwin Fields

Terri Peterson

Peter Koch

Martha Crites

Steve and Gail Johnson

Paul and Janice McCann

Dr. Janice Givler

Laura Snyder

Dori Gilels

Aimee McQuilkin

Elke Govertsen

Michelle Fields

Terry Stekly

Casey Stekly

Lane Brown

Nina Alviar 

Taylor White

Plonk, Missoula

Caelan Fisher

story:
Without your support, a second season does not happen. If we reach our goal, you'll get the best possible webseries we can create. We'll also send you some pretty awesome perks as thanks, so check those out along the side! And keep reading to find out more of our season two plans!

Want to contribute but no credit card? There's a PayPal for that! Click on the button below and make your donation. If you want a perk, enter the corresponding amount and let us know which perk you want.

                             

       

In Season One we followed Dorothy on her quest for love, friends & the sorority of her dreams. However, brash Dorothy quickly found herself mixed up with a corrupt student government that threatened to tear her new life apart.

Season Two picks up in Dorothy's second semester at Dumas College. Having achieved everything she set out to, Dorothy is now looking to leave her mark. With the sorority president election splitting her friends into opposing sides, the group must compete while keeping their friendships intact.

       

The cast you know and love is back for more!

Dorothy ­- Gwenlyn Cumyn                        Alex - AJ Simmons
Ariana - Xavier Lopez                                   Portia - Claire Gagnon-­King
Miller -­ Dan Mousseau                                Connie ­- Linnea Currie-­Roberts
Treville ­- Denise Yuen                                 Rochefort ­- Damien Doepping

  
           

Season 2 will also have three new on-screen characters!! Who are they? Well that's a mystery~

       

Lauren Evans (Producer) - It is said that Lauren is good at many things... unfortunately writing a witty bio about herself is not one of those things. When she's not stressing over what to say about herself on the internet she is helping to bring amazing stories to life with a spectacular group of friends and colleagues.  She can't wait to put her non-bio writing skills to good use making the second season of A4O the best one yet!

Sarah Shelson (Writer, Producer) - Sarah loves having many hats both actual and metaphorically. Her other roles on All For One have included Official Button Pusher, Official Inseparables Cue-er & Official Mom-Van Driver. Her hats include a Gryffindor toque, a Jayne knit hat and an uber-comfortable Cherrydale snapback.

Wil Noack (Editor) - Wil's favourite pastimes are editing, gaming, and working with Team Cherrydale on making a second season of All For One come to life. (Oh, and editing those glitches in season one, making everyone think it was their internet taking intermittent nose-dives. #sorrynotsorry).

RJ Lackie (Writer) - RJ is... very tired. In the past two years, he's done some combination of creating, writing and/or producing on web series like Inhuman Condition, All For One, Couple-ish, The Soliloquies of Santiago, and IRL: The Series, as well as his first produced feature film, Darken. His next great adventures are psychological thriller web series Riding Hood and - hopefully!! - All For One season two. What? We said the guy was tired! RJ is online at Twitter (@rjlackie).

Shannon Litt (Director) - Shannon’s passion for directing started at a tender young age when she wrangled the kids in her townhouse complex to perform an original (somewhat disastrous) rendition of 'The Velveteen Rabbit'. Her storytelling skills have slightly improved since then and she’s proud to revive her role as director for an epic Season 2 of A4O! (She's  spent the past 2 years obsessing over A4O tumblr posts and trying to convince writers Sarah & RJ to revive Portiana <3)

And over 20 other hardworking crew members at all stages of production!

       

We want to give you everything we have planned for season two because it's super awesome stuff! But all that awesomeness needs to be paid for. Here's where all of your generously donated money towards a second season will go:

Crew: Team work makes the dream work! We're lucky to be working with such incredible people who have already devoted so much of their time and hard work to A4O. To make the second season of All For One just as great (and then some) as the first, we'll need our team back to pull it off.

Cast: All For One just isn't All For One without the characters we've come to know and love. Our wonderful cast has given it their all to make the characters everything they are today, and we'd love for them to come back and continue bringing them to life. On top of that, we're introducing three brand-new on-screen characters who will also need to be compensated for their awesome acting efforts!

Production:  Lights, camera... and so much more! To make All For One look and sound as good as it does, we need to rent out a LOT of equipment, and as a result, buy a LOT of insurance. On top of that, production costs include wardrobe, props and locations. Oh, and we can't forget food and coffee - the life force behind any production (seriously, go ask any production).

Did we mention a Live Episode? 'Cause should funding go through, that's definitely going to happen.

Marketing: Where would All For One be if no one knew about it? Making the world aware of A4O takes a lot of research, time and effort, and for season two, we intend to make our reach larger than ever. This also includes costs that go towards award applications, to have our little show recognized by the big film & television community... which will hopefully lead to creating more shows for you in the future! 

Just In Case: We'll be completely up-front with you. Managing a production budget may not be rocket-science, but it's an incredible amount of work, and almost 100% of the time, unforeseen costs come up. Contingency is vital to every project, and ends up going towards making the show the best it can be at the end of the day.

Crowdfund: Yes, this campaign alone costs money to run! Additionally, IndieGoGo takes a total of 8-10% in processing fees to help themselves run, which is totally understandable.

The Bottom Line: From the bottom of our hearts, we appreciate any contribution you are able to make towards bringing a second season of All For One to life. Take it from us - we want to make it just as much as you want to see it. So any and all contributions are appreciated by the entire crew here at Cherrydale Productions. As far as we're concerned, you're just as much a part of the team.

      

Wow, you made it to the end, have an internet cookie on us! There's one last (but definitely not least) thing we'd like to mention - and that's how much we appreciate each and every one of our fans, audience members and supporters. It's because of you that we have another chance at making a second season of All For One happen, and we are not going to throw away our shot.

That said, we listen to everything you all have to say, and wanted to take a moment to share some of the awesome things our fans have taken the time to say about A4O!

"A big yes for bisexual visibility in media!"

          - grounder-alpaca (via Tumblr)

“...nerf gun fights, a 22-minute live episode, lady kisses and so much more. You'll laugh, you'll cry, you'll cry from laughing and so much more as this web series delivers everything you never thought you needed.”

          - netTVnow

“The episodes are crafted in ways that, once you put the video in full screen, really do feel like you're livestreaming with your friends… There's also a chat room that pops up, prompting characters to directly address the camera, adding to the genuine feel.”

          - Kristina Atienza, PopWrapped

“The Inseparables, who act as her trusted advisors and also a Greek chorus of sorts, makes All For One feels wonderfully, well, hip.”

          - Dana Piccoli, AfterEllen

"Do you like webseries with tons of queer characters and characters of color, featuring prominent and amazing relationships (platonic, romantic, etc) between women, and a whirlwind plot based on classic literature?

then you probably watch, or would like to watch, @a4oseries!!!!"

          - biextroverts (via Twitter)

            

PERK DISCLAIMER:
Please be aware that some perks may not be delivered until the entire season has aired, however we will keep you updated and informed of any and all delivery times. For on-site perks, you will be responsible for your own transportation and accommodation. Additional paperwork may be required to fulfill some rewards. On-set visits will require signed legal agreements to protect both parties. Inseparable and Minion perks will require legal agreements. If you are under the age of 18 and wish to attend the table read, or visit the set, you must be accompanied by a parent or guardian.

Table Read Perk: Table read date TBD. Table read will take place in Toronto, ON, Canada. Must be 18+, or accompanied by a parent/guardian.

Set Visit Perk: Filming dates TBD. Shoot will take place in Toronto, ON, Canada. Must be 18+, or accompanied by a parent/guardian.

Live Episode Perk: Filming date TBD. Shoot will take place in Toronto, ON, Canada. Must be 18+, or accompanied by a parent/guardian.

Inseparable Line Writing Perk: Written Inseparable line will be subject to approval by the producers.

Inseparable Character Creation Perk: Inseparable character creation will be subject to approval by the producers.
story_txt:
Without your support, a second season does not happen. If we reach our goal, you'll get the best possible webseries we can create. We'll also send you some pretty awesome perks as thanks, so check those out along the side! And keep reading to find out more of our season two plans!
Want to contribute but no credit card? There's a PayPal for that! Click on the button below and make your donation. If you want a perk, enter the corresponding amount and let us know which perk you want.
                             
       

In Season One we followed Dorothy on her quest for love, friends & the sorority of her dreams. However, brash Dorothy quickly found herself mixed up with a corrupt student government that threatened to tear her new life apart.
Season Two picks up in Dorothy's second semester at Dumas College. Having achieved everything she set out to, Dorothy is now looking to leave her mark. With the sorority president election splitting her friends into opposing sides, the group must compete while keeping their friendships intact.

       

The cast you know and love is back for more!
Dorothy ­- Gwenlyn Cumyn                        Alex - AJ SimmonsAriana - Xavier Lopez                                   Portia - Claire Gagnon-­KingMiller -­ Dan Mousseau                                Connie ­- Linnea Currie-­RobertsTreville ­- Denise Yuen                                 Rochefort ­- Damien Doepping
              
Season 2 will also have three new on-screen characters!! Who are they? Well that's a mystery~
       

Lauren Evans (Producer) - It is said that Lauren is good at many things... unfortunately writing a witty bio about herself is not one of those things. When she's not stressing over what to say about herself on the internet she is helping to bring amazing stories to life with a spectacular group of friends and colleagues.  She can't wait to put her non-bio writing skills to good use making the second season of A4O the best one yet!
Sarah Shelson (Writer, Producer) - Sarah loves having many hats both actual and metaphorically. Her other roles on All For One have included Official Button Pusher, Official Inseparables Cue-er & Official Mom-Van Driver. Her hats include a Gryffindor toque, a Jayne knit hat and an uber-comfortable Cherrydale snapback.
Wil Noack (Editor) - Wil's favourite pastimes are editing, gaming, and working with Team Cherrydale on making a second season of All For One come to life. (Oh, and editing those glitches in season one, making everyone think it was their internet taking intermittent nose-dives. #sorrynotsorry).
RJ Lackie (Writer) - RJ is... very tired. In the past two years, he's done some combination of creating, writing and/or producing on web series like Inhuman Condition, All For One, Couple-ish, The Soliloquies of Santiago, and IRL: The Series, as well as his first produced feature film, Darken. His next great adventures are psychological thriller web series Riding Hood and - hopefully!! - All For One season two. What? We said the guy was tired! RJ is online at Twitter (@rjlackie).
Shannon Litt (Director) - Shannon’s passion for directing started at a tender young age when she wrangled the kids in her townhouse complex to perform an original (somewhat disastrous) rendition of 'The Velveteen Rabbit'. Her storytelling skills have slightly improved since then and she’s proud to revive her role as director for an epic Season 2 of A4O! (She's  spent the past 2 years obsessing over A4O tumblr posts and trying to convince writers Sarah & RJ to revive Portiana <3)
And over 20 other hardworking crew members at all stages of production!

       


We want to give you everything we have planned for season two because it's super awesome stuff! But all that awesomeness needs to be paid for. Here's where all of your generously donated money towards a second season will go:
Crew: Team work makes the dream work! We're lucky to be working with such incredible people who have already devoted so much of their time and hard work to A4O. To make the second season of All For One just as great (and then some) as the first, we'll need our team back to pull it off.
Cast: All For One just isn't All For One without the characters we've come to know and love. Our wonderful cast has given it their all to make the characters everything they are today, and we'd love for them to come back and continue bringing them to life. On top of that, we're introducing three brand-new on-screen characters who will also need to be compensated for their awesome acting efforts!
Production:  Lights, camera... and so much more! To make All For One look and sound as good as it does, we need to rent out a LOT of equipment, and as a result, buy a LOT of insurance. On top of that, production costs include wardrobe, props and locations. Oh, and we can't forget food and coffee - the life force behind any production (seriously, go ask any production).
Did we mention a Live Episode? 'Cause should funding go through, that's definitely going to happen.
Marketing: Where would All For One be if no one knew about it? Making the world aware of A4O takes a lot of research, time and effort, and for season two, we intend to make our reach larger than ever. This also includes costs that go towards award applications, to have our little show recognized by the big film & television community... which will hopefully lead to creating more shows for you in the future! 
Just In Case: We'll be completely up-front with you. Managing a production budget may not be rocket-science, but it's an incredible amount of work, and almost 100% of the time, unforeseen costs come up. Contingency is vital to every project, and ends up going towards making the show the best it can be at the end of the day.
Crowdfund: Yes, this campaign alone costs money to run! Additionally, IndieGoGo takes a total of 8-10% in processing fees to help themselves run, which is totally understandable.
The Bottom Line: From the bottom of our hearts, we appreciate any contribution you are able to make towards bringing a second season of All For One to life. Take it from us - we want to make it just as much as you want to see it. So any and all contributions are appreciated by the entire crew here at Cherrydale Productions. As far as we're concerned, you're just as much a part of the team.

      

Wow, you made it to the end, have an internet cookie on us! There's one last (but definitely not least) thing we'd like to mention - and that's how much we appreciate each and every one of our fans, audience members and supporters. It's because of you that we have another chance at making a second season of All For One happen, and we are not going to throw away our shot.
That said, we listen to everything you all have to say, and wanted to take a moment to share some of the awesome things our fans have taken the time to say about A4O!
"A big yes for bisexual visibility in media!"
          - grounder-alpaca (via Tumblr)
“...nerf gun fights, a 22-minute live episode, lady kisses and so much more. You'll laugh, you'll cry, you'll cry from laughing and so much more as this web series delivers everything you never thought you needed.”
          - netTVnow
“The episodes are crafted in ways that, once you put the video in full screen, really do feel like you're livestreaming with your friends… There's also a chat room that pops up, prompting characters to directly address the camera, adding to the genuine feel.”
          - Kristina Atienza, PopWrapped
“The Inseparables, who act as her trusted advisors and also a Greek chorus of sorts, makes All For One feels wonderfully, well, hip.”
          - Dana Piccoli, AfterEllen
"Do you like webseries with tons of queer characters and characters of color, featuring prominent and amazing relationships (platonic, romantic, etc) between women, and a whirlwind plot based on classic literature?
then you probably watch, or would like to watch, @a4oseries!!!!"
          - biextroverts (via Twitter)

On-set visits will require signed legal agreements to protect both parties. Inseparable and Minion perks will require legal agreements. If you are under the age of 18 and wish to attend the table read, or visit the set, you must be accompanied by a parent or guardian.
Table Read Perk: Table read date TBD. Table read will take place in Toronto, ON, Canada. Must be 18+, or accompanied by a parent/guardian.
Set Visit Perk: Filming dates TBD. Shoot will take place in Toronto, ON, Canada. Must be 18+, or accompanied by a parent/guardian.
Live Episode Perk: Filming date TBD. Shoot will take place in Toronto, ON, Canada. Must be 18+, or accompanied by a parent/guardian.

story:
The Story

Contenders of the Last Will is a mystery drama series about a group of friends who find the Last Will of the Old Town Library owner and they figure out that they can contend for the inheritance. Everyone will have different motives, whether it's curiosity, wanting truth to prevail, or wanting it all for themselves. The friends will learn that there is a darker side of their town and that everyone is somehow connected to the Will. What will they dig up and who will become the heir?

Meet the Production Team:

Our monetary goal is $7000:

$3000 - Cast & Crew

$1500 - Camera/Lenses

$2500 - Editing, Music Licensing, Locations, Props, Wardrobe, etc.

We are so excited to share this project with you but we need your help! Even if you can't donate, we really appreciate your support in sharing this page with your friends!

Thank you!

story:
Who the ruddy hell are we?

  • Jordan Gray (Writer/Co-Star) is a stand-up comedian and former recording artist (Tall Dark Friend) best known for being the first transgender contestant on The Voice UK and for the 2018 ITV1 documentary Transformation Street.

  • Stephen Trumble (Co-Star) is a stand-up comedian, the Amused Moose Peoples’ Champion 2018 and Comedy Virgin Max Turner Prize Winner 2018.

  • Laura McMahon (Director) is a writer and director of short films and very much a regular in the TV&Film Production biz. She has been nominated for the following awards:

    BAFTA X Crew 2018 Writer/ Director

    BAFTA qualifying London Short Film Festival,  2018 Official Selection

    Top 20 Finalist at Funny Women  Awards 2018 Official Selection

    UK WebFest 2018 Official Selection. Best Female Director Finalist.

    Audience Awards Comedy Finalist 2018 Official Selection

    High Peak Film Festival 2018 Official Selection

    Comedy World Network Festival 2018 Official Selection

  • Olivia Phipps (Producer) is a freelance production manager, writer and producer. She has worked in scripted comedy production for over 5 years on shows such as Detectorists and Inside No. 9. She also writes for the British Comedy Guide, Succubus Magazine & the F Word, and is a podblin for the Comedian's Comedian Podcast.

 

What are we doing?

We are making 6 short episodes of a webseries, called 'Tall Dark Friend' written by Jordan Gray. This is a crowdfunder for episode 1 only.

Two hilarious but flawed up-and-coming comedians (one extroverted trans woman, one self-doubting man) navigate the London scene, with a pseudo-psychedelic twist.

Jordan seeks to become the biggest star in the comedy scene sky, and will do anything she can to get there (except headline Barry Gimp's transgender comedy night, obvs). Steve longs for 'a thing' to be known for on the comedy circuit, and pretends to be Jordan's agent to get her a top headliner slot...

Think Fleabag meets a “female Russell Brand”, with a good dollop of Mighty Boosh.

 

Why?

The miniseries will act as a proof-of-concept of a much longer sitcom script (already written!) The idea is to put them online, get feedback from viewers and pitch it to indies from there. We are doing this based on feedback we've had from development meetings so far.

This is for episode 1 only so that we can make sure the tone and style is perfect before making the other 5 episodes. The initial expense for episode 1 will be more than the other 5 because of this.

 

How?

  • We have a crew ready to go (headed up by 3 awesome women) and all are wonderful, talented and extremely generous humans from the world of telly.
  • The location (the beautiful Museum of Comedy) is booked in for a November shoot day, with a recce the week beforehand.
  • Shooting script all done and dusted.

We are all READY TO GO!

 

So why do we need YOU?

Unfortunately all of the above costs money. We've pulled favours everywhere we can and that has helped the budget ENORMOUSLY, but we still need to cover location, art/prop/costume materials, equipment and editing costs, plus a small token payment for each of our hardworking crew.

 

Why the ruddy hell should I part with my hard earned cash to make this?

  • The script is hilarious.
  • Jordan and Stephen are hilarious.
  • The writer, director and producer are female, independent filmmakers at the beginning of their careers. 
  • There aren't enough trans women in film, especially comedy. 
  • Why the ruddy hell not?

 

Other ways to help

  • We kindly ask if people could please get the word out and make some noise about this crowdfunder online and in real life with actual humans and that. It would really help so much.

 

To the bottom of our little tootsies, we thank you. X
