story:
(english at the end of spanish information)

¡NOS PRESENTAMOS!

¡Hola a todos! Nosotros somos Alba Téllez y Luigi Rodríguez. Nos encontramos aquí para mostrarles un nuevo proyecto que tenemos entre manos. Esta historia comenzó a escribirse a principios del 2014, y ahora que la tenemos finalizada, queremos sacarla a la luz.

Cuenta la historia de dos amigas, Rosa y Ana, que llevan vidas muy diferentes pero unidas por los problemas que han ido superando en su día a día. Pero cuando parece que consiguen medio estabilizarse, aparecen personas que les alteran sus vidas y las ponen en alerta las 24 horas.

Nuestra historia:

Rosa es una chica de clase social media-baja que vive sola en un pequeño apartamento. Su padre, Luis, es un borracho que ha estado en la cárcel por haber matado a su madre, Amalia, una noche de borrachera y que sigue molestando a su hija tras salir con la condicional. Rosa se gana la vida escribiendo guiones de historias que les envían otros escritores, así como corregirlas, en una empresa llamada “HISTORY”.

Minho es un surcoreano militar que tuvo que huir de Corea del Sur porque un día descubrió a su superior hablando con un jefe militar de Corea del Norte, planeando una redada contra Corea del Sur y traicionando así a su país. Minho le amenazó con decirlo todo, así que cuando fue a su casa, vio a sus padres y a su hermana menor muertos de manos de militares y de su superior. Así que huyó a España sin saber hablar el idioma español, sin trabajo y sin hogar. Allí, planea su venganza.

En España, Minho y Rosa se conocen de una forma muy peculiar, provocando que, a pesar de los “choques” entre ambos, acaben viviendo bajo el mismo techo. Rosa le enseña a hablar y escribir español, y Minho le enseña cosas de su cultura, lo que lleva a enamorarse el uno de otro.

Pero las cosas comienzan a complicarse cuando Clara, la peor enemiga de Rosa, intenta cautivar a Minho, haciendo todo lo posible para separarlos, además de la aparición repentina de Carlos, un ex novio de Rosa, quien quiere volver con ella haciendo cualquier cosa sin importarle las consecuencias.

Por otro lado tenemos a Ana, la mejor amiga de Rosa. Es dueña de una cafetería, una soltera treintañera. Ana esconde un triste pasado que comienza a revelarse cuando aparece Andrés, el mejor amigo de Ana que desapareció un día y que aparece 23 años después, pero Ana no lo reconoce…

Andrés, adoptado por una familia rica cuando tenía 8 años. Dueño de una marca de vinos con gran influencia internacional. Era muy amigo de Ana desde los 2 años, ya que vivían juntos en un orfanato. A los 8 años se fue a EEUU con sus padres adoptivos, lo que hizo que Andrés perdiera todo contacto con sus amigos españoles. Vuelve silenciosamente a España años más tarde para recuperar lo que perdió de niño.

LA IMPORTANCIA DE NUESTRA CAMPAÑA

ALBA: 

La idea de crear esta historia ha surgido a partir de mis experiencias vividas en Corea del Sur y del trato que tengo a diario con personas que viven en el país. He vivido en Corea del sur, he aprendido el idioma y he trabajo allí, por lo que conozco la situación actual del país y el conflicto que existe entre el Sur y el Norte debido a la dictadura del general Kim Jong Un y de las continuas amenazas de guerra y bombas que mantienen en alerta a los ciudadanos sur coreanos y al ejército, estando en continuo entrenamiento y obligando a los hombres, a partir de cierta edad, 2 años de milicia, además de cada cierto tiempo ir al ejército 3 días para un entrenamiento de “recordatorio”.

¿Y por qué el personaje coreano decide venir a España? A la gente de Corea le encanta nuestro país; continuamente vemos coreanos que vienen de vacaciones, canciones con palabras en nuestro idioma, incluso hay series y películas coreanas cuyas producciones las han traído a España para grabar algunas escenas. Hablamos de series muy famosas en el país como: The K2 (grabaron en Barcelona) o Leyenda del mar azul (en Galicia), entre otras, además de programas de TV y documentales.

Tras esta situación, y debido a que estamos en España, quise plasmar en mi historia una mezcla de culturas que provocan situaciones de comedia y de drama entre sus protagonistas, con el objetivo de divertir al espectador, a la vez que se enganche a la historia de sus personajes, pudiendo llegar a verse reflejados, en cierto modo, en ellos.

Antes de lanzarme a publicar mi historia, decidí enseñársela a varias personas, tanto relacionadas con el mundo del cine como no; sus opiniones positivas y sus frases tipo “Me he enamorado de tal personaje”, “¿Tienes más capítulos? Me has enganchado”, “¡Vaya! No sabía que la cultura coreana era así. ¡Me encanta la historia!” o “Enhorabuena Alba, me encantaría que sacaras el proyecto adelante. No me esperaba que la historia fuese así” son las que me dieron el empujón a querer llevar esta historia a la pantalla y que todo el mundo pudiera disfrutar de ella y, paralelamente, aprender una cultura nueva.

CON VUESTRA AYUDA, TODO ES POSIBLE

Como sabréis, el mundo del artista es muy duro. Conseguir un trabajo o sacar un proyecto adelante está sólo a manos de unos pocos privilegiados, ya sea por su status social, sus conexiones o su lugar de residencia. Pero gracias a las campañas crowdfunding, hay mucha gente que puede dar a luz grandes ideas que no deben quedarse en un cajón.

Financiar un proyecto no es fácil, por eso, la mínima ayuda que cada uno aporte supone un empujón muy grande para todos nosotros.

Queremos mostrar al país una nueva forma de contar historias, queremos llevar a la pantalla algo diferente a lo que solemos ver; algo que nos haga reír, que nos ponga en tensión, que nos transmita nostalgia... Queremos una historia que nos ponga todos nuestros sentimientos a flor de piel, que podamos llegar a sentirnos identificados con algunos de los personajes y, al mismo tiempo, aprendamos cosas nuevas de una cultura tan excepcional y diferente como es la coreana.

FINANCIACIÓN Y RECOMPENSAS

Como hemos comentado, llevar un proyecto a la pantalla no es fácil, ¡y mucho menos económico! Hay que cubrir gastos de todo tipo: catering, vestuario y atrezzo, material audiovisual, transporte, estancia, alquiler de localizaciones, seguros, posibles gastos médicos (recemos por que no sean necesarios nunca, pero ha de haber una parte reservada para ello), y un sin fín de cosas más necesarias para llevar a cabo el rodaje.

Realmente, es necesario una gran cantidad de dinero, pero hemos reducido a lo mínimo que necesitamos, llegando a la cantidad de 5.500 €. Ese dinero irá destinado a todo lo comentado en el párrafo anterior, así como a poder distribuir el capítulo piloto (capítulo 1), que será el que rodaremos. Para ello, contamos con la ayuda de todos vosotros.

Pero la ayuda no queda sólo en ayuda. ¡Os recompensaremos por ello! Tenemos un montón de sorpresas y regalos que os esperan.

 

¡CONÓCENOS MÁS A FONDO!

ALBA: Actualmente, tengo el guión de un largometraje de acción-thriller-suspense que está moviendo un director proveniente del norte de España y que espero que salga a la luz lo antes posible. También, hace poco, he realizado el proyecto de un cortometraje de acción-drama ("Apariencias") cuya trama principal es la violencia de género. Ese cortometraje ya ha sido rodado y estamos a la espera de su edición para proyectarlo en cines y festivales, pues ha tenido mucha aceptación.

LUIGI: Dispongo de una productora independiente llama "Nohappyendings films", en la cual tengo un pequeño grupo humano como técnicos de rodajes y material audiovisual que uso en mis proyectos personales. He sacado a la luz muchos proyectos, siendo la mayoría de ellos cortometrajes, pero uno de mis mayores tesoros fue la webserie "Draw My Life", la cual podéis verla al completo en youtube.

  • TRANSPARENCIA:

Ambos somos personas con las ideas muy claras. Sabemos lo que necesitamos, sabemos hasta dónde queremos llegar, pero siempre con los pies sobre la tierra, conociendo las posibilidades que nuestro país nos puede ofrecer e intentar sacar el máximo provecho para que todos salgamos beneficiados de esta idea.

Queremos hacer algo nuevo, diferente, un estilo que no se haya visto anteriormente en España. Queremos que, en un mismo capítulo, el espectador pueda vivenciar muchos sentimientos diferentes y que pueda verse reflejado en alguno de los personajes en ciertos momentos, o bien reflejados en historias.

Queremos que el espectador ría, llore, se ponga en tensión o de un suspiro de alivio, que se adentre en la historia y en los personajes, 

En España nunca hemos visto el estilo de nuestro proyecto. Es algo innovador, diferente, que engancha. La mezcla de culturas y la forma en que nuestros personajes la viven harán única a nuestra historia.

Además, el target al que va destinada nuestra ficción es amplio, tanto femenino como masculino, en una franja de edades que van desde jóvenes hasta adultos por la diversidad de personajes, tanto principales como secundarios, que expone la historia, así como la diversidad de géneros (acción, comedia, romance, drama, suspense...).

 

PODÉIS AYUDARNOS DE MUCHAS FORMAS

Somos conscientes de que la situación económica actual no es de las mejores, si no, no estaríamos nosotros realizando esta campaña :) . Pero si te gusta el proyecto y quieres colaborar, cualquier ayuda es bienvenida, aunque no sea económica, como por ejemplo:

- Cedernos localizaciones para rodar las escenas.

- Prepararnos el catering de los días de rodaje.

- Dejarnos vestuario y atrezzo para los actores.

- Material audiovisual para rodaje.

- Y cualquier cosa que pueda ser de ayuda para que el proyecto funcione.

¡Os estaremos eternamente agradecidos, os ayudaremos a promocionaros (en caso de que queráis) y colaboraremos en un futuro con vosotros si os hace falta nuestra ayuda!

Y como hemos comentado, cualquier ayuda, por mínima que sea, es bienvenida, ya sea 1€ que podáis invertir en el proyecto. Cada persona tiene diferentes posibilidades económicas, lo sabemos, por eso toda aportación es agradecida. 

Al igual que si nos ayudáis a difundir y compartir esta campaña para que más personas la conozcan y puedan colaborar, sería otra gran ayuda.

Compartir por redes sociales, whatsapp, en persona hablar del proyecto a la gente que os rodea... ¡Y no olvidéis usar las herramientas para compartir de Indiegogo!

¡Muchísimas gracias por vuestra colaboración!

Alba y Luigi.

NUESTROS ACTORES Y ACTRICES

 

ENGLISH:

"Crusader Destinations" is a serie of romantic-comedy fiction with melodramatic retreats and endless references to various genres, including action, suspense or sitcom. Start from a different premise and at the same time functional because of the mixture of cultures; in our case, the idea is fresh and innovative in the panorama of national fiction since the clash occurs between Spanish and Korean culture. This diversity will occur with the two main protagonists of the story, who in their day to day will have to resolve daily conflicts that will affect their decisions throughout the serie, making them evolve.

In order to make real the project, we need the help of everyone, because it is very difficult to finance a film project, also a tv series.

Any contribution is a huge help for the project, and we would be very grateful if you help us with the campaign, and don't forget to share!

Here's the synopsis:

Rosa is a middle-low class girl living alone in a small apartment. His father, Luis, is a drunk man who has been in jail for killing his mother, Amalia, a night of drunkenness and who continues to molest his daughter after leaving on parole. Rosa works writing scripts of stories sent to her by other writers, as well as correcting them, in a company called "HISTORY".

Minho is a South Korean military man who had to flee South Korea because one day he discovered his superior talking to a North Korean military chief, planning a raid on South Korea and thus betraying his country. Minho threatened to say everything, so when he went to his house, he saw his parents and his younger sister killed by the military and his superior. So he fled to Spain without knowing how to speak the Spanish language, without work and homeless. There, he plan the revenge.

In Spain, Minho and Rosa are known in a very peculiar way, causing that, despite the "clashes" between both, end up living under the same roof. Rosa teaches him to speak and write Spanish, and Minho teaches her the korean culture, which leads to falling in love with each other.

But things begin to get complicated when Clara, Rosa's worst enemy, tries to captivate Minho, doing everything possible to separate them, in addition to the sudden appearance of Carlos, an ex-boyfriend of Rosa who wants to date her again, doing anything without mind the consequences.

On the other hand we have Ana, Rosa's best friend. She owns a coffee shop, a single thirties. Ana hides a sad past that begins to reveal itself when Andrés appears, Ana's best friend who disappeared one day and appears 23 years later, but Ana does not recognize him...

Andrés, adopted by a wealthy family when he was 8 years old. Owner of a brand of wines with great international influence. He had been close friends with Ana since the age of two, since they lived together in an orphanage. At age 8 he went to the United States with his adoptive parents, which caused Andrés to lose all contact with his Spanish friends. He returns silently to Spain years later to recover what he lost when he was a child.
story_txt:
(english at the end of spanish information)
¡NOS PRESENTAMOS!
¡Hola a todos! Nosotros somos Alba Téllez y Luigi Rodríguez. Nos encontramos aquí para mostrarles un nuevo proyecto que tenemos entre manos. Esta historia comenzó a escribirse a principios del 2014, y ahora que la tenemos finalizada, queremos sacarla a la luz.
Cuenta la historia de dos amigas, Rosa y Ana, que llevan vidas muy diferentes pero unidas por los problemas que han ido superando en su día a día. Pero cuando parece que consiguen medio estabilizarse, aparecen personas que les alteran sus vidas y las ponen en alerta las 24 horas.
Nuestra historia:

Rosa es una chica de clase social media-baja que vive sola en un pequeño apartamento. Su padre, Luis, es un borracho que ha estado en la cárcel por haber matado a su madre, Amalia, una noche de borrachera y que sigue molestando a su hija tras salir con la condicional. Rosa se gana la vida escribiendo guiones de historias que les envían otros escritores, así como corregirlas, en una empresa llamada “HISTORY”.
Minho es un surcoreano militar que tuvo que huir de Corea del Sur porque un día descubrió a su superior hablando con un jefe militar de Corea del Norte, planeando una redada contra Corea del Sur y traicionando así a su país. Minho le amenazó con decirlo todo, así que cuando fue a su casa, vio a sus padres y a su hermana menor muertos de manos de militares y de su superior. Así que huyó a España sin saber hablar el idioma español, sin trabajo y sin hogar. Allí, planea su venganza.
En España, Minho y Rosa se conocen de una forma muy peculiar, provocando que, a pesar de los “choques” entre ambos, acaben viviendo bajo el mismo techo. Rosa le enseña a hablar y escribir español, y Minho le enseña cosas de su cultura, lo que lleva a enamorarse el uno de otro.
Pero las cosas comienzan a complicarse cuando Clara, la peor enemiga de Rosa, intenta cautivar a Minho, haciendo todo lo posible para separarlos, además de la aparición repentina de Carlos, un ex novio de Rosa, quien quiere volver con ella haciendo cualquier cosa sin importarle las consecuencias.
Por otro lado tenemos a Ana, la mejor amiga de Rosa. Es dueña de una cafetería, una soltera treintañera. Ana esconde un triste pasado que comienza a revelarse cuando aparece Andrés, el mejor amigo de Ana que desapareció un día y que aparece 23 años después, pero Ana no lo reconoce…
Andrés, adoptado por una familia rica cuando tenía 8 años. Dueño de una marca de vinos con gran influencia internacional. Era muy amigo de Ana desde los 2 años, ya que vivían juntos en un orfanato. A los 8 años se fue a EEUU con sus padres adoptivos, lo que hizo que Andrés perdiera todo contacto con sus amigos españoles. Vuelve silenciosamente a España años más tarde para recuperar lo que perdió de niño.

LA IMPORTANCIA DE NUESTRA CAMPAÑA
ALBA: 
La idea de crear esta historia ha surgido a partir de mis experiencias vividas en Corea del Sur y del trato que tengo a diario con personas que viven en el país. He vivido en Corea del sur, he aprendido el idioma y he trabajo allí, por lo que conozco la situación actual del país y el conflicto que existe entre el Sur y el Norte debido a la dictadura del general Kim Jong Un y de las continuas amenazas de guerra y bombas que mantienen en alerta a los ciudadanos sur coreanos y al ejército, estando en continuo entrenamiento y obligando a los hombres, a partir de cierta edad, 2 años de milicia, además de cada cierto tiempo ir al ejército 3 días para un entrenamiento de “recordatorio”.
¿Y por qué el personaje coreano decide venir a España? A la gente de Corea le encanta nuestro país; continuamente vemos coreanos que vienen de vacaciones, canciones con palabras en nuestro idioma, incluso hay series y películas coreanas cuyas producciones las han traído a España para grabar algunas escenas. Hablamos de series muy famosas en el país como: The K2 (grabaron en Barcelona) o Leyenda del mar azul (en Galicia), entre otras, además de programas de TV y documentales.
Tras esta situación, y debido a que estamos en España, quise plasmar en mi historia una mezcla de culturas que provocan situaciones de comedia y de drama entre sus protagonistas, con el objetivo de divertir al espectador, a la vez que se enganche a la historia de sus personajes, pudiendo llegar a verse reflejados, en cierto modo, en ellos.
Antes de lanzarme a publicar mi historia, decidí enseñársela a varias personas, tanto relacionadas con el mundo del cine como no; sus opiniones positivas y sus frases tipo “Me he enamorado de tal personaje”, “¿Tienes más capítulos? Me has enganchado”, “¡Vaya! No sabía que la cultura coreana era así. ¡Me encanta la historia!” o “Enhorabuena Alba, me encantaría que sacaras el proyecto adelante. No me esperaba que la historia fuese así” son las que me dieron el empujón a querer llevar esta historia a la pantalla y que todo el mundo pudiera disfrutar de ella y, paralelamente, aprender una cultura nueva.
CON VUESTRA AYUDA, TODO ES POSIBLE
Como sabréis, el mundo del artista es muy duro. Conseguir un trabajo o sacar un proyecto adelante está sólo a manos de unos pocos privilegiados, ya sea por su status social, sus conexiones o su lugar de residencia. Pero gracias a las campañas crowdfunding, hay mucha gente que puede dar a luz grandes ideas que no deben quedarse en un cajón.
Financiar un proyecto no es fácil, por eso, la mínima ayuda que cada uno aporte supone un empujón muy grande para todos nosotros.
Queremos mostrar al país una nueva forma de contar historias, queremos llevar a la pantalla algo diferente a lo que solemos ver; algo que nos haga reír, que nos ponga en tensión, que nos transmita nostalgia... Queremos una historia que nos ponga todos nuestros sentimientos a flor de piel, que podamos llegar a sentirnos identificados con algunos de los personajes y, al mismo tiempo, aprendamos cosas nuevas de una cultura tan excepcional y diferente como es la coreana.
FINANCIACIÓN Y RECOMPENSAS

Como hemos comentado, llevar un proyecto a la pantalla no es fácil, ¡y mucho menos económico! Hay que cubrir gastos de todo tipo: catering, vestuario y atrezzo, material audiovisual, transporte, estancia, alquiler de localizaciones, seguros, posibles gastos médicos (recemos por que no sean necesarios nunca, pero ha de haber una parte reservada para ello), y un sin fín de cosas más necesarias para llevar a cabo el rodaje.
Realmente, es necesario una gran cantidad de dinero, pero hemos reducido a lo mínimo que necesitamos, llegando a la cantidad de 5.500 €. Ese dinero irá destinado a todo lo comentado en el párrafo anterior, así como a poder distribuir el capítulo piloto (capítulo 1), que será el que rodaremos. Para ello, contamos con la ayuda de todos vosotros.
Pero la ayuda no queda sólo en ayuda. ¡Os recompensaremos por ello! Tenemos un montón de sorpresas y regalos que os esperan.
 ¡CONÓCENOS MÁS A FONDO!
ALBA: Actualmente, tengo el guión de un largometraje de acción-thriller-suspense que está moviendo un director proveniente del norte de España y que espero que salga a la luz lo antes posible. También, hace poco, he realizado el proyecto de un cortometraje de acción-drama ("Apariencias") cuya trama principal es la violencia de género. Ese cortometraje ya ha sido rodado y estamos a la espera de su edición para proyectarlo en cines y festivales, pues ha tenido mucha aceptación.
LUIGI: Dispongo de una productora independiente llama "Nohappyendings films", en la cual tengo un pequeño grupo humano como técnicos de rodajes y material audiovisual que uso en mis proyectos personales. He sacado a la luz muchos proyectos, siendo la mayoría de ellos cortometrajes, pero uno de mis mayores tesoros fue la webserie "Draw My Life", la cual podéis verla al completo en youtube.
TRANSPARENCIA:
Ambos somos personas con las ideas muy claras. Sabemos lo que necesitamos, sabemos hasta dónde queremos llegar, pero siempre con los pies sobre la tierra, conociendo las posibilidades que nuestro país nos puede ofrecer e intentar sacar el máximo provecho para que todos salgamos beneficiados de esta idea.
Queremos hacer algo nuevo, diferente, un estilo que no se haya visto anteriormente en España. Queremos que, en un mismo capítulo, el espectador pueda vivenciar muchos sentimientos diferentes y que pueda verse reflejado en alguno de los personajes en ciertos momentos, o bien reflejados en historias.
Queremos que el espectador ría, llore, se ponga en tensión o de un suspiro de alivio, que se adentre en la historia y en los personajes, 
En España nunca hemos visto el estilo de nuestro proyecto. Es algo innovador, diferente, que engancha. La mezcla de culturas y la forma en que nuestros personajes la viven harán única a nuestra historia.
Además, el target al que va destinada nuestra ficción es amplio, tanto femenino como masculino, en una franja de edades que van desde jóvenes hasta adultos por la diversidad de personajes, tanto principales como secundarios, que expone la historia, así como la diversidad de géneros (acción, comedia, romance, drama, suspense...).
 
PODÉIS AYUDARNOS DE MUCHAS FORMAS
Somos conscientes de que la situación económica actual no es de las mejores, si no, no estaríamos nosotros realizando esta campaña :) . Pero si te gusta el proyecto y quieres colaborar, cualquier ayuda es bienvenida, aunque no sea económica, como por ejemplo:
- Cedernos localizaciones para rodar las escenas.
- Prepararnos el catering de los días de rodaje.
- Dejarnos vestuario y atrezzo para los actores.
- Material audiovisual para rodaje.
- Y cualquier cosa que pueda ser de ayuda para que el proyecto funcione.
¡Os estaremos eternamente agradecidos, os ayudaremos a promocionaros (en caso de que queráis) y colaboraremos en un futuro con vosotros si os hace falta nuestra ayuda!
Y como hemos comentado, cualquier ayuda, por mínima que sea, es bienvenida, ya sea 1€ que podáis invertir en el proyecto. Cada persona tiene diferentes posibilidades económicas, lo sabemos, por eso toda aportación es agradecida. 
Al igual que si nos ayudáis a difundir y compartir esta campaña para que más personas la conozcan y puedan colaborar, sería otra gran ayuda.
Compartir por redes sociales, whatsapp, en persona hablar del proyecto a la gente que os rodea... ¡Y no olvidéis usar las herramientas para compartir de Indiegogo!
¡Muchísimas gracias por vuestra colaboración!
Alba y Luigi.

story:
Short Summary

I wrote a web series! My name is Lily Bowen, and I am a thirteen year old actor. I have acted in a few films and many musical theatre productions. I audition regularly for film and TV projects, so I read a lot of scripts. I finally decided to write my own! In The Cooler Crew,  my character, Melanie is a middle school straight A student wrongly convicted of a crime and sentenced to long-term afterschool detention. Watch as she gets to know the other "delinquents" while attempting to clear her name and find out the real culprit. Episodes currently in pre-production! Subscribe to the YouTube channel for casting updates, behind the scenes footage, interviews, and of course, the episodes!

What We Need & What You Get

To produce this project, there are many costs involved: location rental, feeding the cast and crew on shoot days, props, equipment and if possible, paying our cast and crew for their work. The cast and crew will receive a credit, experience and footage for their demo reels, but ideally we would like to pay them too! 

Any amount will help make this project a reality! A donation of $50 or more will grant you a Special Thanks by name in the credits of each episode. 

The Impact

Lily continues to audition and work on other projects, but this is a great opportunity for her to gain exposure and experience. It will also provide the same for the rest of the cast and crew.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, please help us promote the show! Subscribe to the YouTube channel and share with your network. If you have any advice or tips for first-time filmmakers like us, we welcome them! :)

story:
Welcome to Uncanny Valley...

The sky is a pale orange, grocery shopping is illegal, and an iPhone is a rare find.

Imagine living in a society trapped in the year 2007, isolated in a perfectly circular, 400 mile-wide resort built in the heart of Death Valley. You're constantly on the verge of heat stroke, the tainted water has you seeing things, and the recently established corporate government still wants you to buy Britney Spears' Blackout album, or else.

Not to mention, urban legends of crimes committed by bloodthirsty living dolls have you looking over your shoulder...

We've been developing the world and characters of Psykobreak! for some years, and it's about time we go public with it. "Blue Dream Tuesday" is already written and cast, and the music video/web series mashup can begin!

Where exactly is this money going?

We've put a lot of consideration into props, costumes and equipment in order to sell this rich world, and these things have proven to be the most expensive. We can pay for the bare minimum out of pocket and still get something cool, but financial support would make this video really shine.

Meet the Team:

Riley Buffington is the creator of Psykobreak! and the director of this video. He’s an audio engineer, music producer, and all-around artist. He still hasn't learned how to drive a car.

Maya Benepe is a camera nerd who helps film and organize Psykobreak! videos. She’s a film student with a passion for indie filmmaking. She is the proud creator of approximately 3 million folders of pre-production documents.

Ryan Kahn is a producer, writer, audio engineer and repeatedly used actor in Psykobreak! He has had a part in every Klopfgeist production, providing assistance and creativity where needed. He maintains an appropriate distance from snails due to an incident in his childhood.

Eliza Costello is a writer, singer, and sounding board for Psykobreak! content.  She is an aspiring filmmaker and musician with an interest in alternative content.  If you hear a Psykobreak! demo, it’s probably her voice.

Gabriel Hyon is an aspiring music artist and audio engineer. He hasn't come up with a good "stage name" yet. He's here to improve himself and to help his friends as much as he can.

Gabi Montes de Oca is the make up and hair artist as well as an actor. She's currently getting a cosmetology degree at Graham Webb Academy. Those freckles you see on the doll girls, they aren't natural (that's her).

Austin Ray Costello is a musician, audio engineer, and self-made insomniac. With 12 years experience he is a versatile gigging and session drummer able to engineer his own material and the work of others. He'll also be acting in this Psykobreak! video.

Brooke Edwards is the proud actress playing the role of Beauty Queen in this upcoming video. She studied acting at Goucher College and has worked with several acting coaches. She can be found laced up on the ice rink or in front of the camera.

What are the Perks?

For every $10 donated, you get an Uncanny Valley Sticker, originally designed by us!

story:
About Black Girl in a Big Dress

Thank you so much for taking the time to learn about this project!! We had an incredible first season and we really hope you'll be a part of this next chapter.

Like a lot of creators, I developed a show because I was longing for more content that I could relate to. It's been so exciting to watch Hollywood's interest for diverse content and diverse creators grow, and I was inspired to create something that continued to showcase the diversity within diversity. I knew that my friends and I loved bingewatching anything period (often in costume!), I knew that my friends and I had grand ideas about what romance should be like, and I knew that my friends and I happily embraced our geekdom, but I hadn't seen anyone quite like us on TV. So I decided to create something myself. 

We released the first season last fall, and it's been a wonderful ride!! Black Girl in a Big Dress racked up more than 2 million views and was nominated for a Webby Award! But even more exciting than those things are the amazing conversations and camaraderie we've experienced connecting with people who like the show. It's been so wonderful to find so many people who are excited about this world and about sharing their passion with others. 

Through this campaign, we plan to bring you a second season of Black Girl in a Big Dress that builds on the amazing start our fans have given us. We're planning more episodes, longer episodes, higher production value, and the ability to reach even more new fans. Your donations will help ensure that people are fed, paid, and well taken care of while producing this project they are so passionate about.  
 

Why We Need Indiegogo & How You Can Help

Black Girl in a Big Dress was originally intended to be a quick, short, personal project. But by popular demand from the community that has grown up around this show, we decided to make more episodes. The response has been amazingly, overwhelmingly excited and we can't wait to keep it going and you can help us reach that goal. 

Here's what your contributions will help us cover:

  • Crew costs
  • Camera rental
  • Lights rental
  • Sound Equipment
  • Costumes
  • Location Rental
  • Food
  • Production Insurance
  • Music Licensing
  • Editing and Post-Production costs
  • Publicity/Marketing Costs

Your support will help us pay for production and distribution costs. This includes everything from cameras and lights to food to insurance to costumes and location rentals. It will also help cover distribution and ensure that everyone's hard work, and this fantastic story, will be seen by as many people as possible. We hope to encourage everyone who wants to to put on their version of a big dress and be their wonderful, unique selves! 

Any amount is more than appreciated, nothing is too small. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If donating doesn't work for you right now, no worries! You can absolutely still support Black Girl in a Big Dress. A like, comment, retweet, or post can really help us get the word out; and we welcome those additions to Team BGBD!

Thank you so much for joining us on this adventure! Please let us know if we can answer any questions.
story_txt:
About Black Girl in a Big Dress
Thank you so much for taking the time to learn about this project!! We had an incredible first season and we really hope you'll be a part of this next chapter.
Like a lot of creators, I developed a show because I was longing for more content that I could relate to. It's been so exciting to watch Hollywood's interest for diverse content and diverse creators grow, and I was inspired to create something that continued to showcase the diversity within diversity. I knew that my friends and I loved bingewatching anything period (often in costume!), I knew that my friends and I had grand ideas about what romance should be like, and I knew that my friends and I happily embraced our geekdom, but I hadn't seen anyone quite like us on TV. So I decided to create something myself. 

We released the first season last fall, and it's been a wonderful ride!! Black Girl in a Big Dress racked up more than 2 million views and was nominated for a Webby Award! But even more exciting than those things are the amazing conversations and camaraderie we've experienced connecting with people who like the show. It's been so wonderful to find so many people who are excited about this world and about sharing their passion with others. 
Through this campaign, we plan to bring you a second season of Black Girl in a Big Dress that builds on the amazing start our fans have given us. We're planning more episodes, longer episodes, higher production value, and the ability to reach even more new fans. Your donations will help ensure that people are fed, paid, and well taken care of while producing this project they are so passionate about.   
Why We Need Indiegogo & How You Can Help
Black Girl in a Big Dress was originally intended to be a quick, short, personal project. But by popular demand from the community that has grown up around this show, we decided to make more episodes. The response has been amazingly, overwhelmingly excited and we can't wait to keep it going and you can help us reach that goal. 
Here's what your contributions will help us cover:

Crew costs
Camera rental
Lights rental
Sound Equipment
Costumes
Location Rental
Food
Production Insurance
Music Licensing
Editing and Post-Production costs
Publicity/Marketing Costs



Your support will help us pay for production and distribution costs. This includes everything from cameras and lights to food to insurance to costumes and location rentals. It will also help cover distribution and ensure that everyone's hard work, and this fantastic story, will be seen by as many people as possible. We hope to encourage everyone who wants to to put on their version of a big dress and be their wonderful, unique selves! 
Any amount is more than appreciated, nothing is too small. 

Other Ways You Can Help
If donating doesn't work for you right now, no worries! You can absolutely still support Black Girl in a Big Dress. A like, comment, retweet, or post can really help us get the word out; and we welcome those additions to Team BGBD!
Thank you so much for joining us on this adventure! Please let us know if we can answer any questions.

story:
About Us

Hi. We’re Frank and James. We're actors who met doing a play together in 2014. The play was 3 hours long and we were onstage for 20ish minutes, so we had lots of time to get to know each other.

Despite the fact that Frank is super gay and James is married to a lady, we discovered that we have very similar tastes in reality TV. People say we’re living in a golden age of television, and with shows like Iyanla: Fix My Life and RuPaul’s Drag Race on the air, we’re inclined to agree.

The holy grail, of course, is America’s Next Top Model.

The Origins of Catwalk Kings

On August 13, 2015 Tyra Banks was asked in the New York Times Magazine if America's Next Top Model would ever consider a plus-size male model as a contestant. Her response? “I’ve never seen that in real life.”

No really, that’s what she actually said. We’ve included a screenshot of it in the gallery above.

This stuck with Frank for a long time. Tyra’s brand is celebrating every individual’s unique beauty, but even she drew the line at a plus-size male model on her show.

In 2016 James’s wife Jess casually mentioned that there should be a reality show about plus-size male models. We’re happy to report that we’ve created the scripted spoof version of that reality show and it’s called Catwalk Kings.

Why It’s Important

The film and TV industries are engaged in a dialogue about diversity in front of and behind the camera like never before. It's about time.

We’ve found, however, that these discussions center around gender and race, with disability or LGBT issues sometimes thrown in for good measure. They almost never include body size. Being plus-size has an enormous set of challenges that you only know about if you’ve lived through them like we have.

As actors, one of our biggest challenges is that unless being overweight is specifically part of the character, chances are we’ll never even be considered for the role. We can't play "normal" characters because "normal" people aren't overweight.

We love our bodies. We love who we are as people. We want to use everything we've got and make people laugh in the hopes that by being visible we can inspire others.

Where the Money’s Going

This project is a leap of faith for both of us. We are co-creators, co-producers, and co-stars. Frank wrote the scripts and James is directing them. Beyond that we're assembling an amazing team of artists to make this happen.

We’ve already set shoot dates for January 2018 to film a sizzle reel and a pilot episode. Right now we need an additional $2000 to cover equipment, location, and wardrobe costs.

Any additional funds we raise will go toward shooting the first season later in 2018.

Please share this campaign with:

- Your richest friend.

- Your friend who loves reality TV.

- Your friend who can't buy their clothes at a regular department store because their body size is just too fabulous.

 

THANK YOU SO MUCH EVERYONE FOR ALL OF YOUR SUPPORT!

story:
IMPORTANT INFORMATION

The Gemini Show is currently in discussions with production companies. So depending on the result of meetings, pitches, etc, funds would either

A. Primarily go towards the quality of the pilot and the episodes made before joining said production company or...

B. Will be used for the whole length of the project

 

Short Summary

The Gemini Show is a web series created by 18 y/o Donovan Wade whose goal is to mix different medias from Music, Fashion, Acting, Art, Writing, etc from all types of people into a story that's interesting and relatable to young adults. We promote young adult's passions while exploring the challenges that many face in this transitional period in their lives. In this series, we see an anxious teenager named Gemini Daye stress over not knowing what he whats to do in the future, but after a psychedelic trip explores the world around him gaining knowledge and confidence while getting help from a mentor that only exists in his mind.  Here are some quotes from the people working on it and supporters who aren't.

Grady McDonnell (19) "This show is the most unique project I have worked on, doing something that I haven't seen before."

Jerry Jacover (76) "If you (Donovan Wade) actually do it, you'll be essentially creating a new genre."

Jackson Zimmerman (22) "This feels like the most unique and exciting thing I’ve ever had the chance to work on."

Giovanni Mwesigwa (25) “The concept delivers a unique look on the present identity of the current youth. Not only will this project bring a fresh direction to the current culture of filmmaking, but it also is a brilliant and real representation of the lives that exist within Chicago”

  The money donated will help the out-of-pocket cost of this project and the things needed for it. 

What We Need & What You Get

Funds will be used for:

  • Renting sound equipment for shooting
  • Food for the crew after 7-12 hour workdays
  • Video Quality enhancement 

The Impact

If done right The Gemini Show can be something that hasn't been done before. We have around 50 people from ages 17-25 working on this project from all over north Chicago. Our Production team is made up of college seniors and older whose profession is chromatography, sound, etc and have worked on TV shows as well. In these 8 episodes, we plan on having music videos, fashion shows, and other forms of Art embedded into our show. Many of the people working on this are a part of this because of these reasons...

  1. To have an extremely strong item to put on a creative resume
  2. To promote their music, fashion, writing, brand, etc
  3. To explore their creative side or to strengthen their skillset

We have been planning this for months already in detail and truly believe that when enough support, funds, and marketing this could be something that can gain a large amount of traction in the media but also for individual's careers. Many of us are underclassmen in college trying to find our way, and this could help us big time.

Risks & Challenges

Some risks are

  • Production taking longer than expected because of the wide range of experience in the group and other responsibilities

We try to avoid that by communicating within our group how to be the most efficient with time and money. Things and setbacks will always happen, but we try to plan in detail ahead of time so when they do we can adjust.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Support us by reposting on social media and reaching out to people who may want to support or help us!

story:
So, What's This All About? 

Conscripted follows the everyday lives of an ensemble of characters, all between the ages of 18 and 30, as their lives are turned upside down when a war breaks out on American soil, initiating the first draft since Vietnam.  Due to the ever growing New Realm Coalition, a domestic terrorist group whose tactics are technologically advanced and unpredictable, the country slowly becomes divided, until states and certain cities (Los Angeles being one) become sanctioned and the country is divided by East and West.  Our story follows four main characters: Sabina, John, Lyla, and Piper.  As we start out following them individually, their paths become intertwined as the story goes on. 

Conscripted is being shot in conjunction with Loyola Marymount University and Film Independent's Incubator Lab. Sara has spent the past year in the lab working with industry professionals to further hone the script to it's fullest potential for production. 

 

Why This Story? Why Now?

It's no secret that our country is more politically divided now than it ever has been. We're quick to point fingers and blame fault elsewhere instead of taking responsibility for the society we've become.  In recent years, Sara has gravitated toward writing about what scares her; exploring what she doesn't understand:

"War has always been an enigma to me. I’ve never understood how someone could support violence. The more I’ve explored writing and rewriting this piece over the past couple of years, the more I’ve understood another perspective; one of protection, pride, and promise. Only now do I understand that the word “freedom” has multiple meanings to different people. Though my stance on war has remained the same, I find myself understanding another’s stance. That said, my main outcome for this story is to help others (and myself) explore the possibility that a country (and world) divided is not the right answer, and will never lead to freedom, regardless of one’s definition of it."

 

Damage? About That...

We're looking to raise a minimum of $7,500 to get us through production and post production. $7,500 is a lot of money! Who knew! (Kidding). However, if you'd like to help us raise more than that, we won't object! Take some time to browse the perks we've listed (there are a lot and they're all super cool, we promise!)

Should we not raise the total $7,500, we will still trudge on with production, though in a bit more debt than when we started. We're aiming to make this the best it can possibly be, and every dollar helps us get there! We're determined to see this project through the finish line.

 

Who Are We?

Sara Rose Carr (writer/director): Sara Rose is a Los Angeles based filmmaker and playwright. She has written and directed the short films BARE BONES (official selection, Angaelica Film Festival 2017), DENNIS (co-writer/co-director), NOTE TO SELF (co-writer/co-director), and GOLDEN AGE (official selection, Improbability Fest). Sara is currently a story editor at Rainier Films, a production company dedicated to the outdoors and adventure, bridging the gap between work and play. Her pilot CONSCRIPTED was a finalist for Best Original Pilot at Film Outside the Frame (2016), and is currently a part of Film Independent's Incubator Lab. She has worked as the post production coordinator on multiple shows for networks such as Paramount (formerly, Spike), Nat Geo, Nat Geo Wild, Animal Planet, and Z Living. She holds a BA in screenwriting from Loyola Marymount University.

 

Korina Tolbert (Producer): Korina Tolbert is a Los Angeles based producer, most recently know for the short film DENNIS, co-written/co-directed by Sara Rose. Korina has spent the past two years as a production coordinator, gaining experience working on multiple genre shows such as docu-follow, transformation, and crime. She works daily as an executive assistant, as well as a clearance specialist for multiple shows on networks such as Oxygen, Nat Geo Wild, Paramount (formerly, Spike), Animal Planet, and Z Living. Korina is putting her BA in Philosophy and Cognitive Science from Vassar College to good use by creating and developing projects that explore the complexity of one’s mind and how circumstance directly effects one’s actions.


Daniel Ott (Director of Photography): Daniel Ott is a filmmaker living in Los Angeles with a background in writing, directing, and cinematography. With a slew of original short films including APOSTLES (2010), WHOM VENGEANCE BELONGS (2011), NIGHT OWLS (2012), and BLOOD BLUES (2014), he balances his time between original work and collaborations with other filmmakers in a variety of departments. Daniel works in commercial and music videos at Gartner as a production coordinator, post-production coordinator, and vault manager to broaden his horizons and pay those pesky bills. His recent cinematography credits span several genres and include CROSSING WEST (2014), GRAVE MISTAKES (2016), GOLDEN AGE (2018), THE KIDNAPPING OF SKYLAR F*CKING SPEARS (2018), and NIGHT TERRORS (2018). He holds a BA in screenwriting and directing from Columbia College Chicago.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We've been fortunate enough to receive equipment through Loyola Marymount University.  However, we still have to feed the cast and crew and pick up all the other fees along the way. Look at it as, we're already more than halfway there! We just need a little bit more to help us make it through. As mentioned earlier, check out the perks we have listed, and see if anything catches your eye!

 

    Can't Contribute Financially? All Good!

    Helps us spread the word by sharing this page on social media and telling your friends and family who may be interested in supporting a project like ours! Indiegogo has some amazing share tools, so please be sure to check those out and help us get the word out. 

     

    Ready to Get Conscripted? (Kidding...kinda)

    We greatly appreciate any and all help getting us to our goal! It's a big goal, and YOU can help us reach it! We hope you can be apart of this exciting project with us.

story:
The world is coming together whether the politics acknowledge it or not. Our species is unifying and we aim to demonstrate that in a way we can all comprehend. Shepherds of Aloha: The Odyssey is a video series of two nomadic men sharing the experience of coming together through music, smiles, travel, and art.

We want to hit each continent and explore how different cultures come together... And if it’s not already happening, we’ll activate it ourselves—cameras rolling.

For Trill as a musician and for Jordan as a traveling filmmaker, The Odyssey is our chance to really push the envelope with the skills we've been developing. In whichever way, shape or form it transpires, we will shepherd the experience of individuals coming together in community, in essence, in tribe and in song.

'Aloha' is an acknowledgement of harmony and between beings. 'Aloha' is the respect and love of all (much like 'Namaste' in Hindu culture).

PRCPTION Travel's 2017 Projects

This year, Jordan and his non-profit 501(c)3 media company PRCPTION Travel, Inc have several plans around the globe. Trill will join in as we produce a collaborative album in Colombia, put on a creativity workshop in Jamaica, mentor young adults traveling in Europe, and explore villages deep in the Himalayas.

Trill has never left the country before! What better time would it be to have him join in these adventures? Let's take it a step further and activate creative community-building projects in new places!

 

THE ODYSSEY: CHRONICLES I-III

BLESSINGS & COMMUNITY

This initial crowdfunding campaign is our way of getting Shepherds of Aloha off the ground/islands. With your support we are financing the first three productions of The Odyssey: Hawai'i, the USA, and Colombia.

Shepheads everywhere have expressed their excitement to collaborate with us in different parts of the world. We’ve marked our financial goal simply as a minimum of what we would require without any other blessings:

  • Flights & Accommodation
  • Post-Production & Marketing (special effects, YouTube/Facebook ads)
  • Misc equipment (camera lens, tablet)

But included is hospitality, food, transportation, and other necessities that could easily be obtained without money, through the spirit of aloha.

If you’re able to bless us with a place to stay, a ride somewhere or a warm meal, your non-currency contribution will be gratefully received. Just send us an e-mail.

WAYS WE'LL RAISE FUNDS

  • Merchandise
    • Shephead Staffs
    • #shephead Badges
    • Stickers
    • T-shirts
    • Mugs
  • Sponsorship
    • Product placement
    • Showcasing an organization
    • Brand endorsement
  • Your financial contributions & blessings
  • Musical & Video Greetings
    • Personalized #shephead greetings to you or your loved ones
    • Shout-outs in our SHEPISODE videos
  • Workshops & Performances
    • We'll come to you and offer an inspirational creative workshop, a musical performance, or a community-building video production.

“Let’s revive the vibe to revibe the tribe!”

Your contributions and support for this project not only fuel The Odyssey, but it provides a foundation for the broadcasting of this intercultural tribal synergy. Your patronage blesses us with the opportunity to activate this movement for unification.

(Also find our Patreon project page to support the project in a more long-term fashion.)


 

Our hearts sync to a beat: music connects us and it’s high time we apply that.


#YOLOHA!!!!

And if it’s not already happening, we’ll activate it ourselves—cameras rolling.For Trill as a musician and for Jordan as a traveling filmmaker, The Odyssey is our chance to really push the envelope with the skills we've been developing. In whichever way, shape or form it transpires, we will shepherd the experience of individuals coming together in community, in essence, in tribe and in song.'Aloha' is an acknowledgement of harmony and between beings. 'Aloha' is the respect and love of all (much like 'Namaste' in Hindu culture).PRCPTION Travel's 2017 ProjectsThis year, Jordan and his non-profit 501(c)3 media company PRCPTION Travel, Inc have several plans around the globe. Trill will join in as we produce a collaborative album in Colombia, put on a creativity workshop in Jamaica, mentor young adults traveling in Europe, and explore villages deep in the Himalayas.Trill has never left the country before! What better time would it be to have him join in these adventures? Let's take it a step further and activate creative community-building projects in new places! THE ODYSSEY: CHRONICLES I-IIIBLESSINGS & COMMUNITYThis initial crowdfunding campaign is our way of getting Shepherds of Aloha off the ground/islands. With your support we are financing the first three productions of The Odyssey: Hawai'i, the USA, and Colombia.Shepheads everywhere have expressed their excitement to collaborate with us in different parts of the world. We’ve marked our financial goal simply as a minimum of what we would require without any other blessings:
Flights & Accommodation
Post-Production & Marketing (special effects, YouTube/Facebook ads)
Misc equipment (camera lens, tablet)
But included is hospitality, food, transportation, and other necessities that could easily be obtained without money, through the spirit of aloha.If you’re able to bless us with a place to stay, a ride somewhere or a warm meal, your non-currency contribution will be gratefully received. Just send us an e-mail.WAYS WE'LL RAISE FUNDS

Merchandise
Shephead Staffs
#shephead Badges
Stickers
T-shirts
Mugs



Sponsorship
Product placement
Showcasing an organization
Brand endorsement


Your financial contributions & blessings

Musical & Video Greetings
Personalized #shephead greetings to you or your loved ones
Shout-outs in our SHEPISODE videos



Workshops & PerformancesWe'll come to you and offer an inspirational creative workshop, a musical performance, or a community-building video production.


“Let’s revive the vibe to revibe the tribe!”
Your contributions and support for this project not only fuel The Odyssey, but it provides a foundation for the broadcasting of this intercultural tribal synergy. Your patronage blesses us with the opportunity to activate this movement for unification.
(Also find our Patreon project page to support the project in a more long-term fashion.) Our hearts sync to a beat: music connects us and it’s high time we apply that.
#YOLOHA!!!!

story:
Ever wonder what the life of a blue collared citizen of the Imperium 40,000 years in the future was like?

Hey everybody, Matthew here from MiniWarGaming.com.  

For the past ten years we have been making videos about miniature wargaming.  One of our favourite games, Warhammer 40k, has brought us countless hours of enjoyment (and frustration...).  Warhammer 40k has rich lore, awesome miniatures, and a fun miniature wargame.

(Above is an example of our battle reports)

However, the one thing we haven't really gotten into is making a roleplaying show.

This isn't due to lack of passion.  Dave (the other founder of MiniWarGaming) and I have played RPGs together since we were kids, from Mechwarrior to Fighting Fantasy, to Dungeons and Dragons to even home-brewed systems.  And most of the rest of our staff have either played RPGs, or are big into them right now.

This brings us to our idea to run an RPG show, the first one using the Dark Heresy 2nd Edition rules, but instead of focusing on acolytes working for an Inquisitor (that sounds WAY too important), we will be telling the story of regular blue collar workers caught in the midst of a chaos uprising. 

These poor saps (along with Dave and Josh) probably won't last more than a game or two, but we'll just keep making more!

You'll get to laugh (and maybe cry) as the MiniWarGaming crew try to get along long enough to actually work together to stay alive and deal with the everyday horrible life that is the Warhammer 40k universe.

This is a big step for MiniWarGaming, as RPG shows cost a lot more to produce, given the time and resources it takes to make them.  Compare the following requirements:

  • Battle Reports are most often filmed between an unpaid volunteer and a paid staff member, take roughly 3-5 hours to film, and an hour to edit
  • One episode of an RPG show would be filmed between five to seven paid staff members, plus a support staff member managing all of the cameras, plus a LOT more post production editing.

Not only that, but instead of filming with one camera (which we do with our battle reports), we will be filming with three or four cameras.

We'll also need to spend money on:

  • An expensive computer that has all of the requirements to directly record from multiple cameras simultaneously
  • New audio equipment to allow five to seven people to be properly recorded
  • New lighting equipment to properly light the scene

Now, thanks to our wonderful Vault members, we could definitely afford to do some of those things, which is why what we're trying to raise won't even cover all of our costs, and our stretch goals will help us to do even more with the show.

But if we really want to see this come to fruition, we need to know that this is something you want, and some funds to help us get it started.

Having said that, if we don't reach our goal, we've still set it to flexible funding as that will allow us to collect whatever is contributed and use it to make the RPG show anyways, but we'll just be limited in what we can do, and how free the show is.

In other words, we want to make this show free (with maybe some paid extras, which you can get as a Vault member or as a contributor to this campaign), but can only do so if we raise enough funds.

What You'll Get

While we want this show to be free (which it will be if we reach our goal), we really want to "entice" you to contribute to this campaign.

This is why we are focusing on perks that allow you to contribute and participate in the show.

For example, for just $20 you'll gain access to the episodes as we make them (rather than months afterwards), so that you can leave comments and suggestions on what you want to see in the next episodes.

In my past narrative campaigns I have often taken ideas from comments and incorporated them into the show.

At the higher perk levels there will be even more interaction, behind the scenes shows, swag, blu rays, and more, so check them all out to see which you like the most.

Any contribution will be greatly appreciated.

We want to make an awesomely entertaining show

...and I believe we can do it.

If you are a MiniWarGaming fan, you know that we are passionate, and you know that we can have a lot of fun.  All of that will be poured into this show.

Other Ways You Can Help

Of course we understand that some of you just can't contribute, whether from lack of funds, or the lack of ability to pay online, or just by being unable to convince your parents to do so.

If you want to see this project succeed, you can help a ton just by sharing it with others on Facebook, Twitter, your blog, email, or anywhere else.  We appreciate any effort you can give.

Happy wargaming!

-Matthew (and the MWG crew)

story:
Batman Beyond Prequel!

You've never seen a dramatic live-action Batman show.  Nor have you seen a prequel to Batman Beyond.  Now, here is your chance to not only witness a landmark in Batman history, but to also be a part of it!  Inspired by Batman: The Animated Series, Batman: Master of Fear is a web series that gives you--the fans--everything you have ever wanted from a live-action take on the character: a Batman who displays his detective and martial arts skills against a Gothic Horror backdrop.  And, we even introduce a brand new villain: Nightmare. 

With the first episode already released, we now need the funds to make episode 2.  Our plan to is to make three episodes to pitch to Warner Brothers as a TV show.  (We even have the first four seasons outlined).  Batman: Master of Fear is the future of live-action Batman, and, once again, this is your opportunity to help make it happen!

Premise

Batman's time has come, and he knows it.  Batman: Master of Fear is the tale of Batman's final mission to protect Gotham from his deadliest enemy yet--Nightmare, who will usher in a new era of criminals.  *For more info, scroll to the bottom.

 

We just need your help to fly and lodge all out-of-state actors, feed the cast and crew, pay certain crewmembers, secure certain locations, and market the episode.  We already have everything else: signed cast and crew, equipment, locations, props, makeup, and costumes.  So, our goal is only $5,000, and you have plenty of perks to choose from for your contributions.

Budget Breakdown

About Us 

Founded in 2015, Red Fist creates action-packed stories that heavily involve martial arts.  We have been relentlessly pursuing our goal to create products that balance story and action.  In the age of a saturated YouTube market, and rampant fan films, we know that a Batman web series is the perfect way for us to follow the trends in our own way.

Why it's Important to Us

We're huge fans of Batman: The Animated Series, and we wanted to do our own live-action take on the character.  We are excited to reinvent Batman (in look, fighting style, and overall characterization) and his universe (into more of a Gothic Horror feel).  On top of that, we wanted to create an original story that is not based on any previous Batman work.  That's why we also wanted to introduce a new villain to the fans.  We've been working on this show 100% for over two years because we know that it will be something the fans will love.

Impact

The two characters that we created for this show--Nightmare and Raven--have the potential to officially become DC characters.  Their personalities, skills, and motivations fit right into the Batman universe. And, the portrayals by established actors add to their legitimacy.  Nightmare even has a Lego made of him already.

Yes, it can also be a bowtie.

There have been approximately a ton of reaction videos to the first episode, Tyrone Magnus being one of the most notable.

 

Key Crew

We have all been working together on this project for the last two years.

Top left to right:  Matt Kohler--Creator/Fight Choreographer, Ian Blaylock--Writer, Justin Pogue--Costume Designer and Prop Master *Justin will also design the Batman Beyond suit*

Bottom left to right: Richie Watkins--Producer, Jesse Scimeca--Producer (Creator of Marvel Knights: Spider-Man), Nir Shor--Composer (Cover of Wolven Storm from The Witcher 3)

Other Cast Accolades

Top left to right: Wyatt Weed (Roman Sionis) directed and starred in the highly acclaimed fan-made adaptation of The Dark Knight Returns.

Tess Kielhamer (Professor Raven) starred as Lara Croft in Bat in the Sun's Super Power Beat Down.

Justin Torrence (Stuntman) starred in The Heart of Man (available on Netflix).

Bottom left to right: Jordan Scott (Stuntman) was Zac Efron's stunt double, and has performed stunts in a number of high-profile projects, including Civil War, Spider-Man: Homecoming, and The Walking Dead.

Jomahl Gildersleve (Stuntman) has performed stunts in Black Panther and Avengers: Infinity War.

Risks & Challenges

Fast-paced and hard-hitting fight scenes are inherently dangerous.  That is why we assembled a professional stunt team, led by Matt Kohler, who is a fight choreographer certified by the Society of American Fight Directors.  Together, everone will ensure the safety of all actors and stuntmen by taking extensive time to choreograph and rehearse the fight scenes, move by move.

Stretch Goals 

 

FAQ

Why Batman?  

Ever since we saw Batman: The Animated Series as kids, we have been captivated by the Caped Crusader.  Now that we’re adults, we want to contribute our version to the ever-growing Batman mythos.  Batman is considered one of the greatest martial artists in the world, but we have not yet seen that in live-action form.  Since we’re also fans of Martial Arts films, we have been waiting to see Batman truly kick ass for a very long time.  And now, we are excited to bring you a Batman that you’ve never seen before!

How were you able to make the last episode?

We crowdfunded right here on Indiegogo, in 2016.  Combined with our intake of about $3,000 and our own funds, we made the episode for just $4,000.  And those expenses were similar to those for Episode 2.  The difference is that, because there are more actors and crewmembers this time, we have to ration out our budget to fly, lodge, and feed everybody, pay certain crewmembers for their services (in addition to securing locations and marketing).

Isn’t this illegal?

Yes, next question.  No, it’s not illegal because the Fair Use clause of copyright law (specifically, the Transformative doctrine) states that any original interpretation of intellectual property is legal.  In other words, since we came up with an original story and some original characters that are set in a "copyrighted" universe, we're okay.

Will Batman’s other villains show up in this web series?

You’ll just have to see.

What happens if you exceed your goal?

Please see Stretch Goals.

What happens if you don’t reach your goal?

We will have to delay production until we raise enough money.

 

Follow us for updates!

YouTube

Facebook

Instagram

Twitter

About The Series

The 3 episodes we are currently making are a proof-of-concept for a full series, which will be 4 seasons (13 episodes each).  Like the 3 episodes, the series will follow Batman and Nightmare, two forces of nature on a collision course.  Gordon, Raven, and Black Mask will return.  We will also add villains such as Riddler, Scarecrow, and Deathstroke.

Since this show will be a prequel to Batman Beyond, all bets are off with these characters.  We are inspired by Bruce Timm and Paul Dini's most acclaimed works, including Batman: The Animated Series and, of course, Batman Beyond. 

Now, where is Terry McGinnis?  He will be front-and-center when we do our own Batman Beyond spin-off (which will also be 4 seasons).

Here is concept art for both the three episodes and the full series:

Top left to right: Self-explanatory; bottom left to right: Scarecrow, Jonathan Crane, Roman Sionis, Professor Raven.  Credit: Shannon Peterson

Nightmare.  Credit: Dominic Velando

Batman vs. Nightmare.  Credit: Dominic Velando

Final Words

We have put over 2 years,with plans to put about 10 more (seriously) into this series, in order to give you the fans the definitive live-action Batman show.  Please support us to become part of Batman's evolution!

story:
Story

Belladonna is a new concept for a television series surrounding the deceptive actions of a sly psychologist suffering from Munchausen Syndrome by Proxy. Dr. Annabelle Ricci conducts a sleep study involving patients suffering from insomnia. She administers each patient a vial of Belladonna, a known sedative intended to relax the imbiber. Slowly, each participant develops a dependency for the medication. The only source to feed their addiction is Dr. Annabelle Ricci.

Funding Goal & Rewards

We are raising $25,000 to cover our production expenses. This will go toward costs including the following:

  • Equipment rental (cameras & lenses, lighting, accessories, etc)
  • Location rental
  • Catering (to keep our cast and crew energized!)
  • Salaries (to reward our cast and crew for their hard work!)
  • Insurance, permits, and worker's compensation
  • Transportation
  • Production design
  • Wardrobe
  • Organizational costs
  • Miscellaneous

In order to thank everybody for their generosity, we have several perks lined up for our contributors! A few are outlined below, or you can check the perks page to view the list in its entirety.

  • Thank-you letter
  • Personalized thank-you video
  • Signed Belladonna series poster
  • Prop used in the making of Belladonna
  • Create your own character
  • Spend a day on set
  • Receive an end credit (ranges from Special Thanks to Executive Producer)
  • And more!

Whether we reach 100% of our goal or fall a bit short, we will push production as far as possible! We are very passionate about this story and will take any steps necessary to achieve our goal!

Please note: this series is a pilot for a well-known company. Therefore, we are unable to give away any copywritten materials such as scripts, footage, or digital copies of the work.

What You are Supporting

Belladonna seeks to bring a new concept in entertainment to the household viewer. We will leave the audience wanting more though the creation of engaging, relatable, and enamoring storylines. In addition, we will shed light on Munchausen Syndrome by Proxy by telling the story of Dr. Annabelle Ricci and the effect she has on her patients. This series will convey the dangers of Munchausen when left untreated. In addition, the arc of her patients directly correlates with the "treatment" they are receiving. 

This story is the second project of Writer / Director Rupanshi Didwania. She has a proven track record in bringing stories to life, and conveying them to the masses. Rupanshi's most recent feature-length film will be distributed to audiences worldwide in July. Alongside Rupanshi, the team behind Belladonna have the experience it takes to bring a concept to fruition and secure the necessary distribution to maximize viewership.

Challenges

Our biggest challenge is securing 3-5 additional crew members that we feel are qualified to help Belladonna achieve the highest production value possible. We will be incredibly selective with this process, and will likely appoint filmmakers with extensive experience. This is the main reason we are seeking a larger budget so we can reward our crew for the talent they bring to the production.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some do not have the financial capacity to support us in our endeavors. The team would like you to know that it is equally important for those who believe in our project to spread the word as far as possible! Your support and excitement are priceless so tell all your friends, family, coworkers, and maybe even enemies about Belladonna!

Please note: this series is a pilot for a well-known company. Therefore, we are unable to give away any copywritten materials such as scripts, footage, or digital copies of the work.

What You are Supporting
Belladonna seeks to bring a new concept in entertainment to the household viewer. We will leave the audience wanting more though the creation of engaging, relatable, and enamoring storylines. In addition, we will shed light on Munchausen Syndrome by Proxy by telling the story of Dr. Annabelle Ricci and the effect she has on her patients. This series will convey the dangers of Munchausen when left untreated. In addition, the arc of her patients directly correlates with the "treatment" they are receiving. 
This story is the second project of Writer / Director Rupanshi Didwania. She has a proven track record in bringing stories to life, and conveying them to the masses. Rupanshi's most recent feature-length film will be distributed to audiences worldwide in July. Alongside Rupanshi, the team behind Belladonna have the experience it takes to bring a concept to fruition and secure the necessary distribution to maximize viewership.

Challenges
Our biggest challenge is securing 3-5 additional crew members that we feel are qualified to help Belladonna achieve the highest production value possible. We will be incredibly selective with this process, and will likely appoint filmmakers with extensive experience. This is the main reason we are seeking a larger budget so we can reward our crew for the talent they bring to the production.

Other Ways You Can Help
We understand that some do not have the financial capacity to support us in our endeavors. The team would like you to know that it is equally important for those who believe in our project to spread the word as far as possible! Your support and excitement are priceless so tell all your friends, family, coworkers, and maybe even enemies about Belladonna!

story:
Ok, what's this all about?

Hosted by Ben (Ball) and Ben (Christensen), The Happy-Sad-Time Show is a comedic variety show made by young people for young people. We aim to explore the post-modern philosophies and existential thoughts shared by today's youth as they struggle with "apocalypse anxiety" - that feeling you get every time you read something on the news that screams: "okay, THIS is the year that The Day  After Tomorrow starring Jake Gyllenhaal was set". Currently in production on our pilot episode, our end goal is to pitch the show to networks and broadcasters (aka: someone who will give us even more money) so that we can make MORE for YOU!

 

Now, what are these kids are asking for!?

We need money to finish our pilot episode. Making use of resources at Ryerson University, we've shot roughly 40% of our content, but now we're broke! We want the pilot to include far more (expensive) content such as digital shorts, on-the-street segments, and, most expensive of all, animated sketch segments. 

 

Breakdown:

$600 - Animation(s)

$300 - Equipment Rental 

$300 - Feeding Cast and Crew

$300 - Costumes and Props

 

Who the heck are these bozos anyway?

 

BEN BALL

Ben Ball is Executive Producer. He gathers the cast, crew, equipment, scouts locations, all that fun stuff. He was walking down the street one day when a down-on-his-luck comedy writer asked him for change. It was Ben Christensen. The desperate look in his eye inspired Ben to give him a chance, bringing him on as Head Writer for his newest endeavor, The Happy-Sad-Time Show. From that day forth, they were inseparable.

 

BEN CHRISTENSEN

Ben Christensen is Head Writer. He takes the brainstorm sheet and brings it to life with his satirical tone and generally pessimistic attitude. He was walking down the street one day when a down-on-his-luck comedy producer asked him for change. It was Ben Ball. The desperate look in his eye inspired Ben to give him a chance, bringing him on as Executive Producer for his newest endeavor, The Happy-Sad-Time Show. From that day forth, they were inseparable.

 

DEVIN CALOW

Devin Calow is the Lead Video Content Editor. His laissez-faire style helps him get things done when he wants, apparently. His premium VHS editing invention provided us with all the incentive we needed to bring him on board. Devin helps us produce world-class, prestigious video with utmost luxury visuals.

 

DANIEL GORODETSKY

Daniel Gorodetsky is a producer and story editor. A hard-working comedic professional who is always up for a new challenge, he often feels that he just needs to "get through this one thing with these idiots" to find his footing in the comedic world, "leaving these short buffoons in the dust".  He apologizes on behalf of his colleagues, since he thought he could trust them in writing their own bios. That was clearly a mistake.

 

 

Check out our sweet sweet perks.

 

This Indiegogo campaign is the only way you can get access to the pilot. Unfortunately, we will not be releasing the pilot publicly upon completion because we're hoping to find someone to help us make more episodes, and they may not want that.

Daniel suggests getting the Well Fed Producer perk because he loves the idea of Ben and Ben cooking you dinner in your home.
