story:
Swords... They are everywhere in our culture, our history, and movies. From Science Fiction to medieval history, the Ultimate symbol of the warrior is the sword. The ultimate survival tool, a Blade.

Above: A collaboration Piece by the cast. 

The Forge is an original reality series about a collaborative modern day blade smiting shop, near Austin, The Live Music Capital of the World, featuring world-class blade smiths and artists working together to create iconic weapons for movies, martial artist , hunters, survivalists and collectors. Each episode, 4 of the nation’s best bladesmiths come together to put their skill and reputations to the test. They put their heart and soul into making the finest blades in the country using everything from traditional historical methods to cutting edge innovations in metallurgy and science.

Several of the main cast of The Forge happen to be champions from the hit TV series Forged in Fire: Guy Harris, James Huse and Chris Farrell as well as  fellow blade smith and contestant Larry Clements, a combative expert and  and Guinness World Record Cutter ,Brandt Noel.

These smiths have already agreed to be a part of this project  once we are set up to shoot later this year. Several known smiths in the area (and TV) are planning to drop in for  guest appearances, cameos and possibly to lend a hand. I think they just want to use our tools... we’re okay with that.  Several non forging celebrities have expressed interest to come on the show to create a blade as well. 

Each episode will follow the cast and crew as they work together create a one of a kind functional blade or weapon and, of course, these weapons will be tested.  The series will cover interesting facts on the techniques and methods the smiths use to create the blade, how the smiths do it and how these blades are intended to be used.

We also have our fingers in the pot for several block buster films projects designing and creating the swords and knives for those.

We make blades  for some serious and sometimes famous Martial Artist as well as  celebrities. Some of the high-end blades we make for collectors can go as high as $15,000.  We dont stop there though, all of the smiths have been doing commissions for customers for years. Every able bodies person can use a good blade. 

Of course the drive of the series is watching these “artists” try and work together. Each one can make a blade start to finish and each on has their own way of doing things. Each has their strengths and weaknesses. This show, filled with big personalities (and sometimes bigger tempers) along with very sharp steel has everything a great reality show needs.

In the genre of Swamp Loggers, American Chopper and Ice Road Truckers any wrong move can put you in the hospital or kill you. Even if it’s a sharp tongue.

Series projects won’t be limited to just the weapon of the episode but also whatever else the cast may be working on or get involved in. You would probably be really surprised what the cast get involved with... from Battle Bots to trebuchets, Movies to Rock’n’Roll, Cub Scouts to Special Forces, Photoshoots to Video Games and the list goes on... and on.

Swords aren’t just part of history, they defined much of history, and we will cover some of that too.

Of course there are always exciting adventure and travel opportunities to take the cast on the road every once and a while when something relevant to the show comes along: from visiting local music venues, Martial art schools, competitions, Hammer-ins, hanging out with the people who love our blades, Anything relevant to Modern Combat or Survival, MMA, even culinary opportunities can arise. (We have a full blown Cajun in the cast and a baker.) 

These smiths make everything from Swords to Chef Knives and they know how to use them too.

Several big networks and sponsors want to see a full pilot. A streaming channel already wants it.  All we have to do is get it shot... and edited...

 

What we need to make this happen:

First, we need a location to shoot.  Funds raised in this crowdfunder will be used to secure a location for a working set to film the show. The set needs to combine portions of each smith’s tools and for a camera crew to shoot.

We estimate a necessary 6 month lease to get everything setup and shoot a full episode pilot. We would prefer to secure a 12 month lease.  [These tools are HEAVY]

Everything else will be production budget to shoot and produce the pilot. If enough funds are raised we will shoot a short season to show the networks the breadth of the show... Seriously we have 52 possible episodes penciled out. We already have enough material ideas for more than 4 seasons...  

 

“Give me a blade and fire and I can make anything.” Guy Harris

 

 

Risks:

Finding a location. Not really a big risk in the eyes of some if we met our funding goal but the location is a key element.  The location needs to be secure and more important we need it for a set period of time. This workshop / set location won’t be easy to just up and move. None of the main cast have a shop or forge large enough to work out of... believe me, we have tried.

All of the test footage and trailer footage was shot at different times at each smiths shop. 

Shooting the pilot. The series will be shot near Austin, Texas where a strong film industry and support system already exists of talent for all stages of production.

Lots of movies and TV has been shot here in Austin and it has a known and growing film industry.

The only risk with shooting the pilot would be raising enough funds to cover the location AND the Production Budget. 

The resources are here. Again funding is key but we have already begun reaching out to several local production companies and Professionals in the area.

Several have actually already reached out to us.

Shooting a short series (3) or half series (6) and yes potentially a full 13 episode series.

If funding goes extremely well ... extra tools to do bigger projects...

In the event the big networks  do not  choose to pick up the series to air on cable or broadcast service, we are already talking with a company that specializes in streaming services. 

What you can get for donating to out campaign?

Check out THE PERKS

 The $30 Perk - The Forge T-shirt with The Forge logo 

The $50 Perk A special edition Tshirt with the smiths markers marks on the back

Stickers of the Forge Logo.

High Fives and Hang Tens…

What are High Fives an Hang Tens? Donations of $5 or $10 toward our campaign. 

Of course everyone who donates will receive our newsletter with updates on the progress of the show. 

 

Funding goals:

We have set our goal based on a $30k for lease. $2500/month for lease and utilities, for 12 months. $75,000 is a high goal but it will cover the lease and cost of the perks. 

Additional Funds will be used for shooting the series. We are planning to have [minimum] 3 cameras during filming and estimating each episode will take 2 weeks. Additionally an Editor will be on hand to coordinate the video  and edit it into episodes

Lighting will be built into the set location.

 

Surpassing our funding goals:

Having funds on hand for additional materials would be handy: Extra steels, handle materials, leather, polishing and grinding belts. Possibly extra equipment. 

 

Operational costs… supplies, belts!!!!, fuel for the forges, lubricant, steel… etc… lights electricity..

story:
Outline:

Hello everyone,

My name is Debrah Miceli

I’m an entertainer and I've been entertaining my fans for almost 40 years

My project has been in the works for quite sometime but been unable to release my amazing story due to life...

Now I can!

I have done a lot on my own, but with your help I will be able to help others. We will promote change, educate men and women that standing independent, speaking out and being confident is a good sign of leadership. 

Please help and share my story to the world


About:

Most everything you’ve ever known about abuse and success is a lie.

In this promotional docu-series trailer, we share only a part of what will be told.

In “My Personal (R)evolution”,

 Madusa transports us into the heart-wrenching story of an abused child who is forced to learn entrepreneurial skills to survive. She perseveres throughout her childhood and late into adolescence, with the temptation of the darker side yet never succumbed to the illicit life that surrounds her. All odds are against her, including life-threatening medical issues until one day she meets a Hollywood stunt coordinator. That one meeting would change the trajectory of her life. 

All she ever wanted was love, all she ever got was abandonment. Tragedy to triumph, this story will send you on an emotional rollercoaster ride that is raw and real. 

This is MY Personal (R)evolution...

“This is the story you’ve never heard, and nobody wants to talk about”, Madusa says in the heart-wrenching promotional trailer that shows glimpses of the unique hardships and gut-wrenching climb to the top.

This is Madusa’s life story.

Make a difference, Be the difference

BE A PART OF SOMETHING GREATER

DONATE NOW



What we need/what you get:

So here's where your money will be used:

 

If we raise $25,000

$12,000 Production, film crew, grips, lights,etc.

$4,000  Licensing, publishing, legal

$3,000 Music Production

$3,000 Physical production, Mixing, art, editing,writers, research

$3,000 Travel, extras, talent, food

 

If we raise $30,000 and beyond

We can create music videos to our beautiful soundtrack

 

If we raise $100,000 and beyond

You could help us launch one of my biggest dreams:  Madusa'sFallenAngels.org



The Impact:

First my career, I owe to you all.

You have helped me grow and become the success I gratefully am.

You have helped me live my dream by your support and I cannot express enough how much I appreciate everyone and I don't ask lightly for your hard earned money and help. I also know you have you have welcomed my career in you life and built friendships, communities around me.

There is a reason for this and it’s you. You are part of my story, one of the biggest parts!



Challenges

Oh my where do you start? There are always challenges, obstacles and walls.

I have been inspired years ago before docu/web series were even a thing  and I knew I was going to do something great in each monumental change in my life. I am so driven to make this happen thanks to your support.

The team and I have put together award winning  professionals that have cultivated many winning web series, Music professionals that are nominated for awards and upcoming hot new artists.

We will not let you down. You've seen the trailer and heard only a fraction of the music now imagine what the series will be like.



Other ways you can help:

First let’s have fun! This is a very motivating  and inspiring series.

Go to our Facebook page “My Personal Revolution” and stay connected with the community and watch for me to pop live once in a while.

Just spread the word.

Plus when you do donate, there are one of a kind merch items, and they are insane!

Find what tier works best for you. Click and donate today!

All packages will be mailed out after JAN. 2020

 

Thank you for being a part of this journey, your support and loyalty will help us make this next chapter one to never forget.

story:
Wait... a Queer COMEDY?

Yes! When was the last time you watched a good Queer comedy series? You know, one that incorporates a wide spectrum of funny people, including those who identify as Gay, Lesbian, Non-Binary, Genderqueer, and Trans? Oh, never you say? Exactly our point. Lack of representation means there is a huge void in the media for this kind of content, and THESE THEMS: The Queer Comedy Series is here to fill it (not in the sexy way. Okay, maybe in the sexy way). 

What We Need & What You Get

$25K is a lot of money, we know. But it will take that amount to create a quality show to share with the world! Your donations will cover:

  • Equipment rental - we plan on filming the series with quality equipment so you can see and hear the actors clearly
  • Production Team payments - Wow - and there will be a lot of movie making magic! From the Director of Photography to the lighting technicians, from sound engineers to the actors - These folks need to be paid for their hard work!
  • Filming locations - locations are expensive and we have quite a few to cover, including a super fun party scene (no spoilers!)
  • Craft services - food for shooting days and lots and lots of coffee
  • Post-production costs - editors, sound designers, and festival entries are in this category!
  • Condoms and dental dams. Just kidding! You can get those for free at Planned Parenthood (donate at ppaction.org/donate after you give us your money first, thanks).

Perks

Our perks are AWESOME!! Each perk has been donated by a person who is involved with the Queer community and also with this show! A big goal for the show is to uplift and showcase LGBTQ+ artists, so go ahead and treat yourself to one of our awesome perks donated by one of these rad artists!

Some fun Perks include:

  • "Ask Me My Pronoun" THESE THEMS buttons
  • Drag King one-on-one coaching session with professional King, Goldie Peacock
  • One of a kind watercolor painting OR an in-person portrait session with artist A.E.Kieren
  • Tickets to see "Friends The Musical" Off-Broadway, written by our director Tobly McSmith
  • Burlesque one-on-one class with bump-n-grind royalty Darlinda Just Darlinda
  • Blind date with cast members (no creeps, thanks)
  • And many, many more!!

The Impact

REPRESENTATION MATTERS. All of the actors in this series who are playing Queer characters are open, out, and living happy Queer lives while chasing their dreams and creating exciting art.

Not only that, but our priority when organizing the production team will be focused on hiring LGBTQ+, POC, and female film-makers. Mainstream media is vastly behind the times and we are here to send our message of Love and laughter out to the public. Everyone involved in THESE THEMS is coming from a place of uplifting each other and the Queer community!

Risks & Challenges

Creating a web series of this magnitude is a TON of work, but luckily, we have a kickass team of hard-working professional creators who have been working in their chosen fields for years and years. And with YOUR support, we will be able to fully fund this project and make it a reality.

Other Ways You Can Help

Too broke to donate? We get it. Please help us SPREAD THE LOVE! That's free, ya know.

  • Follow us on Instagram at @These_Thems
  • Follow us on Twitter at @TheseThems
  • "Like" our Facebook page at Facebook.com/TheseThems
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to shout it out, loud and proud!

Want to work with us?

Lez do it! We are still looking to round out our team, especially behind the camera. If you or someone you know is interested, please feel free to reach out at TheseThems@gmail.com.
story_txt:
Wait... a Queer COMEDY?
Yes! When was the last time you watched a good Queer comedy series? You know, one that incorporates a wide spectrum of funny people, including those who identify as Gay, Lesbian, Non-Binary, Genderqueer, and Trans? Oh, never you say? Exactly our point. Lack of representation means there is a huge void in the media for this kind of content, and THESE THEMS: The Queer Comedy Series is here to fill it (not in the sexy way. Okay, maybe in the sexy way). 

What We Need & What You Get
$25K is a lot of money, we know. But it will take that amount to create a quality show to share with the world! Your donations will cover:

Equipment rental - we plan on filming the series with quality equipment so you can see and hear the actors clearly
Production Team payments - Wow - and there will be a lot of movie making magic! From the Director of Photography to the lighting technicians, from sound engineers to the actors - These folks need to be paid for their hard work!
Filming locations - locations are expensive and we have quite a few to cover, including a super fun party scene (no spoilers!)
Craft services - food for shooting days and lots and lots of coffee
Post-production costs - editors, sound designers, and festival entries are in this category!
Condoms and dental dams. Just kidding! You can get those for free at Planned Parenthood (donate at ppaction.org/donate after you give us your money first, thanks).

Perks
Our perks are AWESOME!! Each perk has been donated by a person who is involved with the Queer community and also with this show! A big goal for the show is to uplift and showcase LGBTQ+ artists, so go ahead and treat yourself to one of our awesome perks donated by one of these rad artists!
Some fun Perks include:

"Ask Me My Pronoun" THESE THEMS buttons
Drag King one-on-one coaching session with professional King, Goldie Peacock
One of a kind watercolor painting OR an in-person portrait session with artist A.E.Kieren
Tickets to see "Friends The Musical" Off-Broadway, written by our director Tobly McSmith
Burlesque one-on-one class with bump-n-grind royalty Darlinda Just Darlinda
Blind date with cast members (no creeps, thanks)
And many, many more!!


The Impact
REPRESENTATION MATTERS. All of the actors in this series who are playing Queer characters are open, out, and living happy Queer lives while chasing their dreams and creating exciting art.
Not only that, but our priority when organizing the production team will be focused on hiring LGBTQ+, POC, and female film-makers. Mainstream media is vastly behind the times and we are here to send our message of Love and laughter out to the public. Everyone involved in THESE THEMS is coming from a place of uplifting each other and the Queer community!

Risks & Challenges
Creating a web series of this magnitude is a TON of work, but luckily, we have a kickass team of hard-working professional creators who have been working in their chosen fields for years and years. And with YOUR support, we will be able to fully fund this project and make it a reality.

Other Ways You Can Help
Too broke to donate? We get it. Please help us SPREAD THE LOVE! That's free, ya know.

Follow us on Instagram at @These_Thems
Follow us on Twitter at @TheseThems
"Like" our Facebook page at Facebook.com/TheseThems
Use the Indiegogo share tools to shout it out, loud and proud!

Want to work with us?
Lez do it! We are still looking to round out our team, especially behind the camera. If you or someone you know is interested, please feel free to reach out at TheseThems@gmail.com.

story:
After teaching full time for five years in the suburbs of Chicago, Eric Feltes started pursuing acting in the city and substitute teaching on the side. It didn't take long for Eric to realize how smart, warm, and funny kids are. Honestly . . . this stuff writes itself! 

The Substitute is loosely based on Eric's situations in the school setting. Each snack-size episode is under a minute in length. We’ve all had substitute teachers, but we rarely see the POV of the substitute. Our project champions public education and creates a diverse space that showcases kids being kids in their own environment. 

Who is your audience?

You are! If you’re a teacher or a sub, you know what it’s like to feel like you're being punked and wonder where the hidden cameras are. If you’ve ever been a student, you know what it feels like to take advantage of a substitute teacher. This project is for you!

So . . . where does the money go? 

Our plan for Season 1 is to shoot six 1-minute episodes in 1 day. We have 3 locations and about 20 students to feed. Do you know how much kids eat?  A lot. We also recognize space, sound, lighting, editing, directing, is not free! We aim to get creative with our spending, and every dollar is appreciated.

Got it. What’s the plan?

Our goal is to hire our crew, cast our actors, and find our location in time to shoot Season 1 this summer with a release date this fall, just in time for the new school year. When The Substitute takes off, we already have 8 more episodes ready to shoot for Season 2!

story:
What is "Next Move"?!

 

Hi! Sam and Julia here! We have written a super fun comedic series called "Next Move" and we need your help to get it made! After the closure of Hartley Realtors offices Madison and Harper are forced to move in with their madwoman Boss to keep the company afloat, unaware of what’s in store in this Next Move!

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • Getting a script made requires a lot of funding! We need to pay for a director, a camera crew, lighting, sound, equipment, location, and of course to pay our actors. So many artists have been out of work for months due to the pandemic and small project like this will help artists get back on their feet! Please consider donating what you can, every dollar counts to get this project off the ground! Thank you so much!
  • What you get for donating?!
    • For donating anything between $1.00-$25.00 you will receive a hand written thank you from Sam and Julia!
    • For donating anything between $26.00-$50.00 you will receive a handwritten thank you from Sam and Julia and a credit as a contributor in the credits! 
    • For donating anything between $51.00-$100.00 you will receive a handwritten thank you from Sam and Julia, a credit as a contributor in the credits, and a "Next Move" key chain!
    • For donating anything between $101.00-$500.00 you will receive you will receive a handwritten thank you from Sam and Julia, a credit as a contributor in the credits, a "Next  Move" key chain, and a "Next Move" T-shirt!
    • For donating anything over $500.00 you will receive a handwritten thank you from Sam and Julia, a credit as a PRODUCER in the credits, a "Next  Move" key chain, a "Next Move" T-shirt, AND an early screening of the first three episodes of the series before release!

story:
Summary

 

A sitcom about working at a toy store, shot on location at the iconic Toy Joy in Austin, TX, created by a dream team of local comedians, writers, actors, and artists. 

This character-driven sitcom represents some of the brightest minds in Austin comedy coming together to make you laugh, make you cry, and to pay tribute to the messiest and most joyful parts of early adult life. With our creative team and an inspiration borne straight from Austin institution Toy Joy, we're putting our all into creating something poppy, hilarious, enthralling, and meaningful.

Brief Description

Told through six episodes, each set on a major holiday, Wind-Ups follows a group of friends over the course of a calendar year as they navigate their interpersonal relationships and the ups and downs of getting older while working (and often playing) in a toy store together.

It's never too late to not grow up.

Based on show runner Adam Protextor's 4 years of working at the iconic Toy Joy in Austin, TX, Wind-Ups is a character-driven sitcom that follows 6 toy store employees as they navigate interpersonal relationships, getting older, and finding themselves in each other, told over the course of one calendar year. A few shows that have inspired us include Community, Friends from College, and 30 Rock.

We're raising money to fund production for season 1 of the show, which is broken down into 6 22-minute episodes, each centered around a major holiday. Produced by Adam Protextor and Stephanie Thoreson's production company Baby Lion, Wind-Ups is written by an all-star group of award-winning comedians: Stephanie Thoreson, Ashlee Pryor-Pitluk, Devon Coleman, Nathan Sowell, and Adam Protextor.

"This is an intensely personal story to me, and a project I've been wanting to do for 9 years. It may sound ironic, but the time I spent at Toy Joy pushed me into a new life and adulthood in Austin, both as an artist and a human being. The people I met there are still my best friends in the world, and there's a lot of story to tell there, from the silly to the heartbreaking. I truly believe that this show took so long to come to fruition because it was looking for the right people to bring it there, and I've never had more faith in a creative team than the one we've assembled for this." - Adam Protextor, show runner and director

Wind-Ups is a comedy, yes, but our goal isn't just to make you laugh. We love our characters deeply, and we want you to experience their highest highs and their lowest lows (and there will be plenty of both).

We've got an all-star cast assembled from the Austin comedy, film, and stage scenes, and we're so excited to introduce you to the award-winning, hilarious performers bringing the Wind-Ups staff to life!

We can't wait to see these folks in a toy store. Oh wait --

We're raising money to pay our extremely talented and hard-working cast and crew for the two weeks they'll be investing into filming this project, and for the rehearsals and writing sessions that come before. Artists and creators are too often asked to put in work for free or for "exposure", but we believe in paying artists a living wage for their time and work, and we've got a dream team of professionals ready to put that work in.

Our end goal for this series is to shop it for television distribution, and it's of top priority to us that we make sure the level of production quality in our presentation matches the level of talent that our actors and writers are bringing to the page and performance. When you join our project, here's what you're helping finance:

  • Crew: With 6 episodes, we're essentially shooting a two-hour feature film with a 6-person crew (running camera, lights, sound, and equipment) in 14 days.
  • Actors: From rehearsal to set, these folks are working hard for months in advance of and during filming.
  • Art Department: Comprised of former Toy Joy employees and independent Austin artists, this money goes to creating unique graphic design, costuming, and animation to capture the unique spirit of the show.
  • Production Insurance: This keeps everyone safe. A production is a village, and it's our responsibly to protect the people who join ours.
  • Craft Services: We've gotta feed everyone while they're pulling 10-12 hour days on set! Consider this taco money.

If we raise more than we use on this shoot, any extra money will be saved for post-production fees like color correction, editing, and mastering.

 

Wind-Ups is being produced by Baby Lion, an independent video studio founded by award-winning creators Adam Protextor and Stephanie Thoreson. Since forming in early 2018, we've produced promotional videos for ColdTowne Theater, Fallout Theater, and BettyFest, as well as Chlane, Glam Fam, Super Black, Clone Squad, and many more. We also created the YouTube shows RPG: Rappers Playing Games and Slumber Party Club, and the live shows Fishbowl and Slumber Party Club LIVE!

Learn more at babylionstudios.com.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this on your social networks! Email it to your veterinarian! Print a copy out and hand it to your local grocer! Seriously, anything helps, and the more people we can introduce to Austin art, the better! Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

Accents is a sitcom about six immigrant friends. Each character is from a different part of the world, but life has brought all of them together in none other than present-day America. These six friends must stick together as they deal with work, love, hate, and each other.

My name is Ignacio Arreola-Vidal, and I am the creator of Accents, the biggest project of Atlanta Cinemaniacs so far.

Atlanta Cinemaniacs is a group of passionate and creative people, dedicated to performing every step of the filmmaking process. We're throwing all of our effort and resources into Accents, and we have contacts with multiple filming services, from makeup artists to studios. But the next step is funding, and we need your help.

 

What We Need & What You Get

All of the funds we receive will be invested in producing and filming our first episode, the pilot. We've calculated that $25,000 is needed to create the respectable, good-quality pilot we need to pitch and sell our show to a promising cable or streaming network. Our campaign goal is a nickel compared to what is commonly spent per television episode in this day and age.

The following is a list of what the money will be spent on. Of course, if the goal is not met, we will be forced to prioritize the production's needs.

If goal is met:

  • Cast
  • Crew
  • Studio
  • Camera equipment
  • Sound equipment
  • Lighting equipment
  • Art department (Set/Props)
  • Wardrobe
  • Makeup/Hair
  • Editing
  • Color correction
  • Sound editing/mixing
  • Music rights
  • Transportation
  • Lodging (if filming outside of Atlanta)

If goal is not met:

  • Cast
  • Crew
  • Camera equipment
  • Lighting equipment
  • Music rights

Every dollar counts! We appreciate any help you can give and want to make sure you get something amazing in return. Check out all of our perks!

 

The Impact

Accents isn't just a random title. It pertains to something that is a part of your identity, rather than the definition of it. This television series is about people, people that have all kinds of hardships to deal with, and being an immigrant is one of them.

Representation is a big hook in film right now, and that's not lost on us. We're grateful that we've found a group of hilarious, diverse people that loves to tell stories about hilarious, diverse characters.

 

Risks & Challenges

Building a tv show from the ground up does not come without its challenges. There is always a possibility that the actors or crew or other members of the production we work with will experience creative differences, but we will make sure that everyone is on the same page. Everyone we work with is vetted to make sure they carry with them the same passion and initiative we do.

There is another possibility that our pilot may not get picked up by a network right away. We have prepared ourselves to hear "No" every step of the way, but because we wholeheartedly believe in this project, we will not stop until we are on the air.

Still have questions about our project and need answers before donating your hard-earned money? E-mail us at atlcinemaniacs1@gmail.com.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know not everyone has the option of donating money to our campaign, but we still appreciate any help you can give. This includes spreading the word! Please share our campaign on social media or tell anyone whom you think might be interested.

Into the film industry? You can also help by providing production assistance, filming locations, or any other resources you feel would be helpful towards our campaign. Please e-mail us at atlcinemaniacs@gmail.com.

Own a business? Throughout the filming we have produced for proving the concept of the show, we worked with multiple local businesses, helping create promotional videos, in return of allowing us to film at their locale. E-mail us at atlcinemaniacs@gmail.com.

story:
LABELS

Dates don’t exist anymore.

A series of female-centric short films from the frontlines of the postmodern world of “dating” & “romance.” Each episode stands alone and is about a different couple in the Bushwick-y part of Brooklyn.

​Episodes: 

  1. OPEN : on wlw/queer romance/bi-erasure/open relationships
  2. GAMEPLAY : on the rules of communication/sleeping with friends
  3. UNO : on Tinder hookups/being okay being single/me-time
  4. WHITE RABBIT : on the manic pixie hometown hookup
  5. LOSE MY NUMBER : on social media’s impact on long distance relationships and will they/won’t they pairs
  6. FLUID : on the gender spectrum, transmasculinity and gender roles
  7. PRIVILEGE : on interracial relationships, politics, and white privilege
  8. FUN : on rave culture and relationships built around drugs

Right now, we’re focusing on making the first four episodes - and we need your help.

By contributing, you’re helping us get women of different colors, sizes, shapes and persuasions on people’s screens. Plus, we’re not just putting more realistic women ON camera - we’re putting ladies to work BEHIND the camera, too!

When you contribute, you’ll be part of the change we need to see in entertainment. (Oprah will be SO proud of you.)

Making a film, even a short one, is expensive. For these four episodes we need funding for

  • Equipment
  • Insurance
  • Feeding and paying to our cast and crew

We believe in paying young artists for their work -- that is extremely important to us, because we are part of a generation that is frequently asked/required to work for free.

We want to make sure LABELS is easily accessible and shareable content. We can’t do it without you, so consider making a contribution big or small! We have some dope custom-designed, limited-edition bags you can snag for only $25. Seriously.

 

Wanna Know More About Each Episode?

You’re super nosey and we love it. Check out the breakdowns below:

EPISODE 1: OPEN

Audra and Bryony don’t want to ruin their burgeoning romance with antiquated ideas like labels and commitment. OPEN  is about young women of color struggling with love, commitment, and the meaning of a 21st century queer relationship.

And we promise that Audra or Bryony will not end up dead at the end. Because we know that it is possible to tell an interesting, realistic queer romance story without killing anyone off!

Think we’re being dramatic?  It’s a well-documented fiction trope called “Bury Your Gays” in which gay and lesbian characters are denied a happy ending (also re-appropriated as the “Too Good for This Sinful Earth” trope.)

We look forward to working against those tropes & keeping lesbians and women of color ALIVE on your screens!

EPISODE 2: GAMEPLAY

Scrabble and sangria-addicted roommates Charlie and Florence are very different kinds of young women, but they’ve both slept with their friend Louis. GAMEPLAY  is about knowing every nook & cranny of your roomie’s love life, and the insane rules of ‘textual’/app-based communication.

Catch feelings? You lose the game!

EPISODE 3: UNO

Willa never stops working. But, with her boss on vacation, she finally has an entire weekend to herself. UNO  is about learning how to hang out with yourself, recover from Tinder binges and how strange and wonderful alone-time in New York City can feel.

Maybe the happiest ending is when the girl doesn’t get the egotistical-but-has-great-hair guy? Yeah? Yeah.

EPISODE 4: WHITE RABBIT

Alice returns to her hometown after a devastating career setback. She starts hooking up with her high school old flame. When that becomes sorta serious, she decides to move back to her hometown. WHITE RABBIT  is about realizing that easy isn’t the same as happy. Manic pixie hometown hookups are never 4ever. Have a gr8 summer!

 

Wanna Give Us Million Dollars, but You’re Not a Millionaire?

That’s okay! This is a series of the people! Every little bit counts, even if it’s only a few bucks - give what you can.

Definitely like us on Facebook, share this on your social media, and send this campaign to your family, friends, acquaintances, and mortal enemies (we need all the help we can get!)

Don’t Have Any Mortal Enemies?

Congratulations.

 

Wanna Know What Else You Can Do?

You can make your voice heard! Tweet @ your favorite content creators demanding more interesting/colorful/queer women on TV.

Support content (like ours - *wink*) that represents women accurately and keeps them alive. (And when your favorite lesbian character dies, don’t let her go quietly. We sure won’t.) Let’s make TV makers and shakers accountable & demand more Bechdel Test passing content!

We hope you’ll join our badass team to make this amazing and important project a reality. Thank you so, so much for taking the time to read our Indiegogo page!

 

Are you a business owner interested in partnering with us?  Let’s chat!

 

THE CREATORS

Ridiculous People Productions

Alex Shannon is an actor, writer and producer based out of Queens. She’s a recent graduate of NYU’s Tisch School of the Arts and Atlantic Acting School. Her commitment to making content by and for badass women led her to co-found Ridiculous People Productions in 2015. The first Ridiculous People production was the feminist, satirical short Hot Girls Aren’t Funny (2016), in which Alex starred as the rebellious Priscilla Zulliani. In December 2016, she produced and acted in a timely reading of Kushner’s A Bright Room Called Day as a protest piece following the election. She was recently honored to be chosen runner-up of the Judith E. Barlow Prize, a national feminist playwriting competition. OPEN  is Alex's directorial debut.

Liv Senghor is a filmmaker, writer, and producer living in Queens. She attended NYU Tisch and majored in Film & Television. She’s lived and worked all over the world, including as a production assistant in Germany and an editor for BBC Radio 1’s renowned YouTube page. In 2015, she and her partner-in-crime, Alex Shannon, made a satirical comedy called Hot Girls Aren’t Funny, which followed three high school queen bees who were denied entry into their senior class roast by a group of sexist jocks. In her spare time, Liv practices political activism, particularly for Black women and the LGBTQ+ community. In her work, she hopes to continue to fight the system through artistic endeavors and create content that lifts marginalized communities through accurate and validating representation.

LABELSDates don’t exist anymore.A series of female-centric short films from the frontlines of the postmodern world of “dating” & “romance.” Each episode stands alone and is about a different couple in the Bushwick-y part of Brooklyn.​Episodes: 

OPEN : on wlw/queer romance/bi-erasure/open relationships

GAMEPLAY : on the rules of communication/sleeping with friends

UNO : on Tinder hookups/being okay being single/me-time

WHITE RABBIT : on the manic pixie hometown hookup

LOSE MY NUMBER : on social media’s impact on long distance relationships and will they/won’t they pairs

FLUID : on the gender spectrum, transmasculinity and gender roles

PRIVILEGE : on interracial relationships, politics, and white privilege

FUN : on rave culture and relationships built around drugs
Right now, we’re focusing on making the first four episodes - and we need your help.By contributing, you’re helping us get women of different colors, sizes, shapes and persuasions on people’s screens. Plus, we’re not just putting more realistic women ON camera - we’re putting ladies to work BEHIND the camera, too!When you contribute, you’ll be part of the change we need to see in entertainment. (Oprah will be SO proud of you.)Making a film, even a short one, is expensive. For these four episodes we need funding for
Equipment
Insurance
Feeding and paying to our cast and crew
We believe in paying young artists for their work -- that is extremely important to us, because we are part of a generation that is frequently asked/required to work for free.We want to make sure LABELS is easily accessible and shareable content. We can’t do it without you, so consider making a contribution big or small! We have some dope custom-designed, limited-edition bags you can snag for only $25. story:
Watch the TEASER

 

A mother searches for her son.

A wandering warrior seeks the "ONE".

A Nation's future lies in peril.

AESOP, a simple boy with a tale to tell.

Episodic Series - Coming this Winter

 

Amy Arburn playing Aria, Aesop's mum

 

Short Summary

I’m Julie-Anne Liechty, creator of AESOP, a new post-apocalyptic medieval series. Of course, I didn’t do this alone. The quick story is – I was inspired to write a little short film about a warrior and a boy-seer who was “touched”.

I showed the script to a couple of friends and they said, “Hey, I think there’s a bigger story in here. What if we tried to make a pilot? And then do a series?”

Pretty soon, we had a whole crew of people who caught the excitement about AESOP and the project grew and grew. Then we needed some funding . . .

Which is why we’re here.

Kylee Ferguson (Aesop's Body Double), Julie-Anne Liechty (Director/Writer), and Shane Moore (Sound) on the set of AESOP

 

The reason this project is so important to me, is not just because I like a good story, but my main hope is to create work for fellow actors, film crew and technicians. If we had a successful series filmed right here in our own back yard it would benefit all of us financially and create more industry for our community. Nothing would make me happier.

Getting a series off the ground is an ambitious endeavor. Without your help, we just won’t be able to do it. Our hope is once we have the pilot shot the quality of the story and our production of it will attract interest from industry professionals and angel investors who want to see the project reach its fullest potential.

 

Autism Awareness

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Filming is expensive. I wish it wasn’t, but do you ever sit at the end of a movie and watch the credits? They seem to go on forever, right? That’s because it takes SO MANY people to make a movie or TV series. Yes, they make it look easy, but in fact it takes arduous hours, days, even months of work.

We’re really good at stretching the budget. Heck, I made the teaser for AESOP for basically nothing – most of the $ went to the Friesian horses – they eat a lot . . . ;)

Annette Coester and her Friesian Stallion Jesse 435 Sport 

 

To shoot the pilot we’re asking for $12,000.00 to start off with. That’s to get about half of it done. You see, we’ve got four major scenes to shoot by September 11th, so we thought we’d do two separate fundraisers, so we could have access to the funds by the 9th to rent the equipment, etc. Who knows, maybe we’ll get more than $12k this time around. Wouldn’t that be nice? Then we won’t have to bug anyone again anytime soon.

 

Here’s our approximate budget for four days of shooting:

 

Lenni Uitto (Roque)

 

Here’s our perks:

(Each one includes the all the fabulous perks above it!)

  • Donate $5 and get that warm, fuzzy feeling for helping us out! (Nice!)
  • Donate $10 and get Thanked in the Credits! Plus the warm fuzzy feeling that you helped us out! (Woohoo!)
  • Donate $75 and we'll give you credit as a Producer (which you are!). This credit will also put you on the illustrious INTERNET MOVIE DATABASE! Think how fun! It could be the start of you being a movie mogul yourself! JJ Abrams move over! Plus you get all the fabulous perks above!
  • Donate $100 and get a premium ticket to the premier showing plus a cool AESOP tee-shirt! (Come hang with us at our fun AESOP party! Meet the actors! Wear cool, matching tee-shirts!) Plus you get all the fabulous perks above!
  • Donate $250 and be a featured extra on a future episode! (Your choice of having regular or special effects make-up (post-apocalyptic medieval, remember, they’ll be tons of “radiation” creatures and all that jazz . . .)) Plus you get all the fabulous perks above!
  • Donate $500 and we will help you write a short film of your own! (Who knows, maybe it will turn out like AESOP and turn into a series!) Plus you get all the fabulous perks above!
  • Donate $1,000 and have a speaking role! (Yup! If you’ve always wanted to be an actor, now is your chance!) Plus you get all the fabulous perks above!
  • Donate $2000 and we will name a new character after you! (We might fancy it up a bit, like “Hank” could become “Hankdankrius” – this is post-apocalyptic medieval after all . . . ) Plus you get all the fabulous perks above!
  • Donate $5000 and become an angel investor. Comes with a halo and wings and life time of gratitude from us ASOPERS. And pretty much anything you ask for in the way of what we can provide to make you happy and keep you connected to the project. Plus you get all the fabulous perks above!
  • Donate $10000 and be an executive producer for an episode! (That means basically you can boss everybody around and even have your pet Chihuahua play a major role* in the episode if you really want to. (*As long as it fits into the story arc . . . :0)). Plus you get all the fabulous perks above!

Lenni Uitto (Roque) and Annette Coester (The Crow)  making an impact!

 

The Impact

Again, your contribution will make all the difference. Don’t just think of it as helping a friend or a friend of a friend out – think of it as helping to grow the force of filmmaking here in Utah – in the United States – in the “outside of Hollywood” arena (not that there’s anything wrong with Hollywood, but they do seem to hog a lot of the projects, don’t they?) The more we create here, the more we contribute to and strengthen our own film community.

 

AESOP Rehearsal with Julie-Anne Liechty, Deven Skye, Amy Arburn, Jaxon Fisher and Lenni Uitto

 

Risks & Challenges

Of course filmmaking is risky. We may not get enough money to complete the project :(. (We’ll still complete it, as I said we’re wizards at spinning straw into gold, so to speak.) But it may not be quite as nice as it could be if we don’t meet our financial goals. Remember, our hope is to attract bigger investors and they certainly are less likely to look at AESOP as a viable product if the quality is shoddy.

 

Tara Norton (Art Department) and Lenni Uitto (Roque) in the horse arena

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute $ at this time – that’s OK! Instead just help us get the word out! Maybe you have a rich aunt who just doesn’t know what to do with all her extra cashola – let her know about us so she can send it our way :).

Pass this along via Facebook, Twitter, Gmail, LinkedIn, YouTube, etc!

 

On set with Amy and Julie-Anne

 

 

Photos by: Jack Foriska, Julie-Anne Liechty, Tara Norton

story:
Short Summary

The comedy shorts COCK N' BULL and COCK N' BULL 2 played film festivals around the world and received distribution from multiple streaming platforms. Throughout its release, one character, played by Pete Zias, was clearly a fan favorite. We knew we had to explore these three characters more through their bizarre throuple movie nights.
 

The original COCK N' BULL shorts

Completely improvised, COCK N' BULL and COCK N' BULL 2 had long film festival runs, including Outfest Los Angeles, Sidewalk Moving Picture Festival/SHOUT!, Reeling Chicago International Lesbian and Gay Film Festival, Pride of the Ocean Film Festival and the Mardi Gras Film Festival in Sydney, Australia. Both shorts received worldwide distribution from Seed & Spark, Dekkoo and Revry.

Shorts, independent films and web series such as ours typically do not see a financial return, which is why this campaign is so important to produce it. We do it because we love it and want to continue making audiences laugh around the world!

 

Who are we?

Nathan Adloff (Director/Writer/Producer/Actor - "Chris")

Nathan made his feature film debut with NATE & MARGARET (Co-Wrote/Produced/Directed). It sold for worldwide distribution prior to completion. It also received a commendatory review from Roger Ebert.

Nathan acted in Joe Swanberg's early films and IFC series, YOUNG AMERICAN BODIES in addition to directing a handful of award-winning short films. He also co-created and directed a TV pilot, BAD SIDES, which was a finalist in the Chicago Comedy TV Pilot Competition. His first leading role in the film, BLACKMAIL BOYS, won various film festival awards and sold for worldwide distribution. His short film COCK N' BULL was selected to screen in the 2013 Outfest Los Angeles LGBT Film Festival, which he also acted in. In 2014, his short GROWN THIS WAY won a best film award in Outfest's Fusion Lab.

In 2016, Nathan sold his second feature film, "Miles". The story centers around a high school senior who joins the girls volleyball team in hopes of winning a college scholarship after his father's untimely death. It stars Molly Shannon, Paul Reiser, Missi Pyle, Tim Boardman, Annie Golden, Yeardley Smith and Stephen Root.

 

Danny Rhodes (Writer/Producer/Actor - "Wes")

Danny is a Chicago based actor, writer, and producer. Rhodes began his acting career in the theater while earning his Bachelor's Degree in Acting  from Columbia College Chicago. After graduation Rhodes made his feature film debut with a small role in STRANGER THAN FICTION and has since landed roles in several independent films including HOHOKAM, AUDREY THE TRAINWRECK, NATE & MARGARET, ONE SMALL HITCH, BAD JOHNSON, HOUSE OF PURGATORY and WHO GETS THE DOG?.

He made his writing and producing debut with the TV series BAD SIDES, in which Rhodes also starred in the hilarious role of Marcuss, a spoiled, trust-fund baby with aspirations of being a filmmaker who makes ridiculous demands on his staff and the actors who audition for him. His other television work includes roles on the TV series DETROIT 1-8-7,  CHICAGO FIRE, and CHICAGO P.D.

Rhodes recently formed his own production company, the Chicago based Rhodesclosed Productions, with his producing partners Teresa Schaeffer and Lisa Cisneros. Rhodesclosed Productions has two films on their slate for the upcoming year... ONE NOT TAKEN, a psychological horror feature to be directed by Huck Botko and INHERITED, a horror comedy loosely based on actual events.

 

Brian Levin (Cinematographer/Editor)

"Ever since I was young, seeing movies and listening to stories was my greatest passion. The mechanics of how a story is told, how an audience will perceive a story, and how the teller delivers that story are constantly on my mind.

I am always working towards the goal of providing a creative environment to effectively deliver an exciting story to the screen. I love talking about the creation of a film project, and sharing my knowledge and philosophies with others.

I approach filmmaking with a keen sense of understanding from the smallest technical detail to the overall big picture. I enjoy understanding the minutiae of making a film as much as I enjoy overseeing the formation of the story as a whole."

 

"Why IndieGoGo if you made the first films for basically nothing??"

Good question! We upped our production value greatly on COCK N' BULL 2 and want to keep that momentum going. We are also producing six episodes, which are ultimately six short films! Here is what your contribution will go toward:

  • Food for actors and crew.
  • Renting cameras, lights and other necessary equipment.
  • Set design and props.
  • Film Festival submission fees.
  • Much, much more!

 

The Story

The first short focused on prank calls gone wrong. The second focused on the risks of awkward online hookups. In this six episode series, we focus on Chris and Wes spending more time with Logan (Pete Zias) from COCK N' BULL 2. Logan has an odd obsession with bizarre movies, cartoons and infomercials and sharing them on throuple date night. Since most of the series will be improvised, you'll have to wait and see what kind of mess they get themselves into this time!

 

Perks!

What kind of crowd funding campaign would this be if we didn't offer something in return? Check out the list on the right side of this page for our offered incentives! Name a character? Producer credit? You can have it. Take it. Yours.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Everybody has a crowdfunding campaign these days. It's tough to give funds to every project—we get it! If you can't throw us some coins, spreading the word on social media and your contacts list is a big help and much appreciated!

We can't wait to share our new six episode series COCK N' BULL: THIRD WHEEL with you! Thank you!

It also received a commendatory review from Roger Ebert.Nathan acted in Joe Swanberg's early films and IFC series, YOUNG AMERICAN BODIES in addition to directing a handful of award-winning short films. He also co-created and directed a TV pilot, BAD SIDES, which was a finalist in the Chicago Comedy TV Pilot Competition. His first leading role in the film, BLACKMAIL BOYS, won various film festival awards and sold for worldwide distribution. His short film COCK N' BULL was selected to screen in the 2013 Outfest Los Angeles LGBT Film Festival, which he also acted in. In 2014, his short GROWN THIS WAY won a best film award in Outfest's Fusion Lab.In 2016, Nathan sold his second feature film, "Miles". The story centers around a high school senior who joins the girls volleyball team in hopes of winning a college scholarship after his father's untimely death. It stars Molly Shannon, Paul Reiser, Missi Pyle, Tim Boardman, Annie Golden, Yeardley Smith and Stephen Root.
 
Danny Rhodes (Writer/Producer/Actor - "Wes")
Danny is a Chicago based actor, writer, and producer. Rhodes began his acting career in the theater while earning his Bachelor's Degree in Acting  from Columbia College Chicago. After graduation Rhodes made his feature film debut with a small role in STRANGER THAN FICTION and has since landed roles in several independent films including HOHOKAM, AUDREY THE TRAINWRECK, NATE & MARGARET, ONE SMALL HITCH, BAD JOHNSON, HOUSE OF PURGATORY and WHO GETS THE DOG?.
He made his writing and producing debut with the TV series BAD SIDES, in which Rhodes also starred in the hilarious role of Marcuss, a spoiled, trust-fund baby with aspirations of being a filmmaker who makes ridiculous demands on his staff and the actors who audition for him. His other television work includes roles on the TV series DETROIT 1-8-7,  CHICAGO FIRE, and CHICAGO P.D.
Rhodes recently formed his own production company, the Chicago based Rhodesclosed Productions, with his producing partners Teresa Schaeffer and Lisa Cisneros. Rhodesclosed Productions has two films on their slate for the upcoming year... ONE NOT TAKEN, a psychological horror feature to be directed by Huck Botko and INHERITED, a horror comedy loosely based on actual events.
 
Brian Levin (Cinematographer/Editor)
"Ever since I was young, seeing movies and listening to stories was my greatest passion. The mechanics of how a story is told, how an audience will perceive a story, and how the teller delivers that story are constantly on my mind.
I am always working towards the goal of providing a creative environment to effectively deliver an exciting story to the screen. I love talking about the creation of a film project, and sharing my knowledge and philosophies with others.
I approach filmmaking with a keen sense of understanding from the smallest technical detail to the overall big picture. I enjoy understanding the minutiae of making a film as much as I enjoy overseeing the formation of the story as a whole."
 
"Why IndieGoGo if you made the first films for basically nothing??"
Good question! We upped our production value greatly on COCK N' BULL 2 and want to keep that momentum going. We are also producing six episodes, which are ultimately six short films! Here is what your contribution will go toward:

Food for actors and crew.
Renting cameras, lights and other necessary equipment.
Set design and props.
Film Festival submission fees.
Much, much more!

 
The Story
The first short focused on prank calls gone wrong. The second focused on the risks of awkward online hookups. In this six episode series, we focus on Chris and Wes spending more time with Logan (Pete Zias) from COCK N' BULL 2. Logan has an odd obsession with bizarre movies, cartoons and infomercials and sharing them on throuple date night. Since most of the series will be improvised, you'll have to wait and see what kind of mess they get themselves into this time!
 
Perks!
What kind of crowd funding campaign would this be if we didn't offer something in return? Check out the list on the right side of this page for our offered incentives! Name a character? Producer credit? You can have it. Take it. Yours.
 
Other Ways You Can Help
Everybody has a crowdfunding campaign these days. It's tough to give funds to every project—we get it! If you can't throw us some coins, spreading the word on social media and your contacts list is a big help and much appreciated!
We can't wait to share our new six episode series COCK N' BULL: THIRD WHEEL with you! Thank you!

story:
Our Goals: 

  • To create powerful roles for women in cinema.
  • To use the Sci-fi and Horror genres as a catalyst to continue the dialogue around oppression in all it's forms.
  • To use Cosima episode one in it's completion as promotional tool to create the series in it's entirety.
  • Most importantly, to create our own opportunities as actors and filmmakers.

Our Vision: 

Imagine The OA meets Mad Max Fury Road. Our story takes place in a post-apocalyptic wasteland of desolation and destruction. Two sisters, Daya and Lily have been kidnapped by a deranged doctor who’s mission is to alter women’s bodies in ways to repopulate the world as he sees fit. Surviving the end of their world as they once knew it, they must continue to live in limbo of one world ending and a new one beginning while fighting the powers of patriarchal homogenous dictation. 

The root of Cosima is to examine the human characteristics of how and why people survive. Our goal is to put complex, female driven narrative on screen that tells a story about women depending on each other for survival and strength. To tell the tale of a meaningful and magical bond between two sisters.

* Images: Stills from the Cosima© promotional film 

The Cosima Team:

Roxanne Morrison and Premstar Santana are the creators of COSIMA©. They met in acting class several years ago where they became fast friends and developed a undeniable working chemistry as actors and creators. Vowing to work together on a project, the idea for Cosima was birthed many years ago and they have been waiting for the right moment to put it into production. They brought on award winning director Ben Gilbert and actor/writer Aaron Michael Davies who both have a love and taste for horror and science fiction genres. Ben and Aaron took the idea of Cosima and ran with it, pumping it full of adrenaline. 

Moonfaze Films:

Founded by Premstar Santana and Ben Gilbert, Moonfaze Films is a collective of artists whose lives are dedicated to telling stories via the film art form. We are rebel magic makers telling surreal truths. We are determined to unmask the masked and invoke the light in darkness. We are willing to take risks and unwilling to wait for permission to do so. 

Awards: 

SEER

OFFICIAL SELECTION - Berlin International Cinefest 2017

OFFICIAL SELECTION - LA Shorts Fest 2016

OFFICIAL SELECTION - Comic Con International Film Festival 2016

OFFICIAL SELECTION - California Women's Film Festival 2017

OFFICIAL SELECTION - Texas Cinemaina International Film Festival 2017

LUNA

OFFICIAL SELECTION - 40th North Dance Film Festival 2016

OFFICIAL SELECTION - Les Femmes Underground International Film Fest 2017

Team Bios: 

  

DIRECTOR - Ben Gilbert has directed numerous short films, all of which he has edited, color graded, and done visual effects for. He won Best Director at the City Shorts Film Festival in San Francisco for his film The Forest. Ben has also color graded and edited a variety of feature films and commercials, having worked with companies such as Petrol Advertising, Simple Films, Altarboy Productions and Last Wave Films. He is the co-founder of Moonfaze Films, a production company he started with his wife Premstar Santana. Currently Ben's film SEER, a Moonfaze Films production, is making a splash on the indie festival circuit receiving official selections from renowned festivals including LA Shorts, Berlin International Cinefest and the California Women's Film Festival.  

ACTOR/CREATOR - Premstar Santana is an award winning SAG - AFTRA actor, a filmmaker & Founder of Moonfaze Films and the Moonfaze Feminist Film Journal (formerly known as the Moonfaze Feminist Film Festival). She is also a photographer and a multidisciplinary artist. With over a decade of acting training & experience, and a background in dance & design, Premstar has created a unique body of work that speaks from the heart, and to the heart. Her goal as an artist is to be constantly creating and collaborating, bringing important stories to life in the most truthful and beautiful ways. Premstar is her given name. Most people call her Prem, which means Love in Hindi. 

ACTOR/CREATOR - Roxanne Morrison is an actor and recent graduate of UCLA, majoring in Gender Studies and minoring in Theater Arts. Along with being an actor she is an artist, social activist and producer. She has worked and performed with Parsons Nose Production Company, VCT, and Pacific Repertory Theater and UCLA.

WRITER - Aaron Michael Davies entered the industry as an actor, with a body of work ranging from shorts to features, web-series to television, and rounded out with a little Off-Broadway. He couldn't be more thrilled to be working -- off-camera -- with such a solid group of artists who take pride in each other's love of all things weird.

A HUGE THANK YOU

for being a part of the movie making magic and joining our team. We are thrilled to have you on board.

Warmly,

The Cosima Team

www.moonfazefilms.com

story:
We launched our campaign just slightly before the pandemic hit. Despite this, however, we have continued to progress forward and had our first day of filming this past week. Above are some rough cuts of footage from that shoot -- no actual color correction, or audio correction have been made. The music is just placer music. We just wanted to put something together to give you an idea of the direction we are headed and what we accomplished.

This campaign is a relaunch in hopes of getting at least a little backing to help us. Anything put into this project at this point has been directly out of our pocket. We don't have the finances to proceed forward at this point. We are asking for your help so we don't lose momentum. We are one of the few productions that has been able to proceed forward, despite things being what they are. This means we can provide some income for out of work artists, but without finances we cannot.

We have tons of information on our previously launched campaign and on Facebook and Instagram. Anything would be greatly appreciated at this point so we can continue forward on making this western series.

Thank you and Blessings!

Peter Wickliffe
Writer/Director/Actor

story:
Short Summary

I’m ready to tell you a story that you never knew you needed to hear. 

My name is Bobby Ulrich and I’m a stand-up comedian, social media content creator, and aspiring television writer/creator based in Los Angeles, California. I have been given a dream opportunity to shoot a pilot episode for a television show that I wrote while living in an influncer house with no money and no professional connections whatsoever. 

Some of you may know me from being involved with some of the biggest internet entertainment channels such as, the “Funk Bros”, “The Mob”, or the newly created “Parea” influencer house, in which I live amongst some of the internet’s most popular and talented social media influencers in the entire world. My experience living with such fun and interesting people has given me the inspiration to tell an incredibly hilarious story that comes from a unique and truly one of a kind perspective. 

With your generous support, we will be able to accomplish the following: 

  • Create a professional high quality television episode with the hopes of getting picked up by a large streaming network (Netflix, Hulu, Amazon Prime, etc.)
  • Pay our actors and production crew! (and feed them.)
  • Get proper music licensing 
  • Pre and Post-Production Costs
  • Location Costs
  • Equipment Costs
  • Wardrobe
  • Covid-Safety Precautions; testing, sanitization, gear, etc. 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal for this project is to raise at least $20,000, in order to make an enormous difference in the quality and resources available to create the most professional looking pilot possible, in order to have the best chance of getting this show picked up by a large television or streaming network. 

Although we have some good traction, television production is an expensive business, especially if you want to do it right by following union rules, paying your actors, incorporating high-quality sound design, editing, software for pre and post production and of course properly compensating all who are involved. With that being said, we can't make our goals for this pilot possible without you, so we want to give back to all who decide to donate! See below the outline of our exclusive perks:  

Number 1 Fan: $25

  • Private Link to screen final project once it’s complete

Super Supporter: $50

  • Private Link to screen final project once it’s complete
  • Personalized “Thank You” shoutout on social media

Super Star: $100

  • All that’s included with the “Super Supporter” plus:
  • Name in credits with “Special Thanks” 
  • Copy of script once released

Producer: $1000

  • All that’s included with the “Super Supporter” plus:
  • Name in credits with special  title
  • Access to the first cut of the film
  • Signed script by the cast and crew
  • Exclusive invitation to Wrap Party and Screening of the final product.
  • Invitation to be on set and potentially be in a scene!

The Impact

You will be providing my team the chance to create an extremely timely television show that is the first of its kind.

Other Ways You Can Help

There are other ways to help besides financially :)

  • Please send this page to friends and family who may be interested. 
  • Follow @bobbyu and @1dscollective 

Thank you all so much for your time and support! It means the world to me!

story:
The Crew

 

Daisy Morecroft- Producer

Hey all, I'm Daisy and I will be Producing The Ambrosia Effect. When I first read the script, I knew it was the project I wanted to sink my teeth into and end my degree with a bang! As an aspiring Producer, I hope this project will allow my skills to flourish and showcase the talent of our wonderful cast and crew. 

Rebecca White- Director

Hi! I’m Rebecca and I’m the Writer and Director of The Ambrosia Effect. I’ve always been a huge fan of the science fiction drama and after watching Black Mirror and Channel 4s Humans. I knew I wanted to create such a drama with similar moralistic and thought provoking narrative with a dynamic and talented cast. With the script written, actors lined up and a fantastic crew put together, we have the making of a great short film that we want to share with you. Any donation is welcome and we can wait to showcase The Ambrosia Effect!

Bethany Wilkins- Production Manager

My name is Bethany and I've taken on the role of Production Manager for this project, a position I have experienced numerous times at Ravensbourne.  As a huge fan of Television Drama, (my favourites being Doctor Who and Sherlock), I can say this is a really exciting project and we all can't wait to get going with it

Jack Watson- Director of Photography 

As DOP, I am really excited to be involved in this production and with this talented crew. As we are well into our pre-production stage, we are even more excited about what we can achieve with this production. We are working with professional shooting equipment and are confident that this level of professionalism will be reflected in the final edit!

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

  • We need a total of £600 from kind donators and with the additional £400 funding we receive from University, we will have a total of £1,000 for our production
  • Films are an expensive thing to make and we're looking for funding from friends and family to help cover the smaller costs that go with making a film including cast, equiptment and location hire
  • If you’ve ever made a film you’ll know how expensive everything can be... and if you’ve never made a film (we can promise you it is!)
  • If we have money spare after the project (which is unlikely), the remaining funds will be used to present our main cast with a thank you gift and a charity chosen at a later date (which will be announced) 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

Thank you for taking the time to visit and read our campaign. If you are not able to contribute to the funds, we would REALLY appreciate you sharing our Indiegogo link to make some noise about The Ambrosia Effect!

story:
THE BIG AUDITION

The Big Audition is a show about a group of Theatre Artists who set out to start a Youth Actor training organization in hopes of bettering the world.  Their plan is fool-proof, or so they think...  Obstacles come in the form of ego centric students,  fame crazed staff and counting on the Mafia for financial support.  

WHO WE ARE

  • We are a group of Actors/Directors/Writers who have been working on this television pilot for over 2 years.  Our goal is to have this project picked up by a major television distributor within one year of wrapping.
  • This campaign is meant to secure funds to be able to produce the best piece, with the best possible quality.  
  • Your contribution, no matter the size will help us achieve our goal.  We are so thankful for you even taking the time to consider helping.  Without you, this is not possible.  

What We Need 

We are aiming to raise $8,000.

  •  We hope to hire Couch Fire Films, an up and coming Chicago Production Company with incredible artists as their foundation.  We feel it is imperative to the project to film in the highest quality possible.  We will be using a Panasonic AU-EVA1 camera with output quality in 4K.
  • We hope to rent the Theatre at The Meisner Arts Center in Boca Raton Florida, an amazing space with the right feel for the show.  
  • We hope to have an all original soundtrack, designed by local Artists in the Chicagoland area.

The Impact

  • Our show will feature Actors from Denver, Chicago and Boca Raton, FL.  We want to provide a platform for all involved to take the next step in their careers as Artists.

Risks & Challenges

There are an infinite number of TV shows and movies being filmed every year, from major production companies to indie-projects.  We know we can fortify a place for ourselves in this industry.  We are confident that our project has the character to become successful, we just need the means to get our script from the page to the screen

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, we understand this!  But that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please make some noise about our project, share to your friends and family!
  • Indiegogo has provided ways to pass this information along and we would be eternally grateful if you let people know!

From the bottom of our hearts, thank you!  Asking our supporters, friends and family for financial help is not easy.  We want more than anything to have this become successful so that we can pass along the support we receive and continue helping artists achieve their goals.

story:
Short Summary

I had a close high school friend who, after being incarcerated in jail for six months, developed a completely different  outlook on life following his release from jail. Exactly three months after his release he found himself behind bars again, this time for 3 years.

Growing up, the majority of the people released from prison that I knew either found themselves returning or marked with a scarlet letter to employers, preventing them from living a comfortable life. Unfortunately, mainstream media does not do much to address the contradiction.

However, there have been many cases where people came out of prison and became successful professionals. The purpose of From Prisoner to Professional is show people faced with similar situations that there is light at the end of the tunnel and to address the preconceived notions that those who have been to prison are doomed for life.

What We Need & What You Get

The $5,500 will support the rental of a high quality camera, audio equipment, and hard drives for all 5 remaining episodes. We estimate 15 days for production with the daily average cost of equipment of $370.

Here's What You Will Get:

Level

Social Media Shoutout

Special Mention in the Credits

Sneak Peek of One Episode

Invitation to Private Screening to All Episodes

Friend < $50

X

 

 

 

Best Friend $51-$100

X

X

 

 

Honorary Producer $101-$250

X

X

X

 

Honorary Executive Producer

$251- $500

X

X

X

X

 

The Impact

Your contribution helps us to produce work to reduce the recidivism rate by providing examples of successful former prisoners to the currently incarcerated. According to the Bureau of Justice Statistics, between 2005-2010 77% of 405,000 prisoners released in 30 states were arrested within five years. 

The first episode of the series has been accepted in 6 film festivals, the 2017 Black Harvest Film Festival, 2017 Pan African Film Festival, 2017 Gary Black International Black Film Festival, 2017 American Filmatic Festival. 2018 Chicago Social Change Fest, 2018 (In) Justice for All Film Festival.  We are looking to screen all the episodes behind prison walls to directly affect those in similar situations.

Other Ways You Can Help

If  you can't support now,  don't worry, you can share with your friends and family. Anything that you can give is much appreciated!

story:
What is Stuck? 

Stuck is a web series featuring four quirky ghosts that are trapped in the apartment in which they died. With the odds stacked against them, they search for ways to make the most out of their fate and refuse to let something like "death" weaken their ambitions.

As the FeLions we’ve performed at Chicago Sketchfest, Women’s Funny Fest and written, performed, and produced 2 sketch shows in the city.  Stuck is our first major collaborative writing project. Stuck is our baby and a project we believe in. We created Stuck as a way to explore the messy parts of life and adulthood.

We plan to shoot the series this fall and your donation would make all the difference in the world for us to release our completed series as early next year.

Oh, Got it. Why do you need my support? That baby ghost around the C is cute by the way.

Thank you! We are completely self-funded and our Kickstarter goal is $5,000. It is a large price tag because it is a grand production.

We'll break it down for you!

All funds raised will go towards compensating our valuable friends and Chicago comedy communities members who have graciously agreed to help make Stuck a reality. Funds will also go toward food, lighting, camera, securing locations, props, etc.

Ok. I'll donate, but PLEASE tell me I get a sticker.

You can! Beyond receiving our undying gratitude and becoming a FeLion Guardian Angel for Life, you will earn goodies from us under Perks to the right of the page.

Now what?

You can follow us @FeLionsChicago on Instagram and Facebook to see character videos and track our progress along the say!

story:
WHAT IS DEMONOLOGIST FOR HIRE?

Demonologist For Hire is a web series set in a world where all manner of supernatural shenanigans takes place as part of everyday life. That weird noise you hear as you lie in bed at night? Probably a monster. That odd neighbour who only walks his dog at midnight? Probably a vampire. That thing you thought you saw out the corner of your eye that one time? Yup, probably an apparition. 

For the most part all these otherworldly beings keep themselves to themselves, but what happens when one of them starts being a nuisance? You go online and find yourself a Demonologist to deal with it just as you would do with a plumber.

We're a Scottish web series which means we're bringing a very different vibe to this project. We have hundreds, nay, thousands of years of folklore and history to tap into not to mention the unique locations and accents. Did I mention the accents?  

 

WHERE WILL YOUR MONEY GO?

Though we financed the first season of Demonologist For Hire ourselves the production costs associated with the second season means that we can't do it alone.  We intend to use the money raised to produce four new web series episodes of Demonologist For Hire. 

We're extremely proud of our web series, and want to it look as good as it possibly can, but that takes money. Everyone we work with is an industry professional which is amazing but adds to the money needed to produce the series.  Our budget also includes hiring locations, which are never cheap, renting professional equipment, creature make-up, special effect shots and original music.

With this money we can increase our VFX budget which means more gore, more supernatural goings on and generally just more weirdness. 

We know that donating money to any campaign is a risk, but we feel that as we're producing our second season of Demonologist For Hire we've already started our journey and we'd love you to come along with us for the ride!

If you'll take those lovely eyes of yours (don't think I haven't noticed) over to the right side of the page where you'll see the perks we're offering for various donation amounts. 

 

ABOUT US

Bryn Owen is a Scottish based writer and performer who has worked in theatre and independent film for years. He's written many feature film and television projects for such UK production outfits as the BBC that have been in various form of development and production.

Sensing an opportunity to expand into the online space he re-teamed with long time collaborator director Uisdean Murray on web series Demonologist For Hire.

IMDB

 

From the Outer Hebrides of Scotland Uisdean is an experienced Writer, Director, Editor and Cinematographer, and has been making independent films and music videos for fifteen years. His films including the award winning BBC Alba's Siubhlachan (The Traveller), and the Jemima horror Trilogy has screened at festivals worldwide including BiFan (South Korea), Fantasia, (Montreal), Action On Film (LA), Frightfest (UK), and Trieste Science + Fiction (Italy).

www.lilyislandfilms.com

 

Ronni Menzies-Stirling is an Actor based in Scotland, with 20 years experience in film, television, theatre, radio and more. A strong character actor, Ronni loves nothing more than getting his teeth into a new role. Most recently, he was the lead in Irn-Bru’s Christmas 2017 ad campaign, as well as having a featured role in Tennent’s Lager’s Hallowe’en 2017 ad, which has had several million views online.

He has been described as a “rare and unsung talent” and “an absolute chameleon of an actor”, and devotes himself to each role with passion and dedication. Ronni enjoys taking risks, and is not afraid to get his hands dirty, an approach which came in very handy during the making of Demonologist For Hire!

www.ronni.online

 

EVEN IF YOU DON'T CONTRIBUTE YOU CAN STILL HELP!

If you can't donate to Demonologist For Hire, but you're excited about the series, you can still help us! We want Demonologist For Hire to reach as wide an audience as possible, so if you can share this campaign with people you know or think would like it, that would be awesome!

Also, sharing and liking the first season videos on Youtube would be an enormous help too. Thank you so much for checking out the Indiegogo campaign for Demonologist For Hire series, we couldn't do it without you!

www.demonologistforhire.com
