story:
Short Summary

The mission CONNECTIVITY PROJECT addresses is that ever-present question: "Does what I do matter? Does it make any difference?"

Our purpose is to show that, YES, our individual choices do make a difference! CONNECTIVITY PROJECT is a series of documentary short films in which luminaries and everyday people in the worlds of science, social activism, spirituality and economics share stories about how individual choices and small actions have big impacts.

Featuring interviews and commentary by Fritjof Capra (Systems Theorist), Jon Young (Naturalist, Speaker, Author), Lois Gibbs (Love Canal activist), and many others!

This campaign is focused on post-production funds for the first three episodes of what will be an ongoing documentary series. Accompanying curriculum materials will also be developed so each episode can be used as an educational tool. With this support, we project episodes 1 - 3 will be completed in the Winter of 2018.

Connectivity Project is incubated by the Charitable Partnership Fund, a 501c3 publicly supported nonprofit organization. Any funds raised from documentary or educational materials goes directly to support the cause of raising awareness about our interconnected lives.

The three short films nearing completion are:

Episode 1) "Culture and Spirit": We explore how different cultures and faiths from around the world have a common, time-honored awareness of an interconnected way of being. More than a current issue, the notion of interconnectedness is one that spans cultures and time.

Episode 2) "Speaking Out!": An inspired high school student is influenced by the ripple effect of the actions of Lois Gibbs (grass roots activist and organizer from Love Canal in the 1970's) to advocate for clean air for her school and community in North Portland. 

Episode 3) "Pollinators": Our reliance on pollinators and, in turn, their reliance on us. This episode explores how we are a distinct part of the web of life that directly impacts the continued survival and success of pollinator species and the process itself. 

About the Filmmakers:

Producer & Co-Director Rose Madrone is passionately committed to living with sustainability and stewardship as a primary focus, aware that our daily choices actively create the world in which we live. She has been a teacher about the natural world for over 30 years -- practicing botany, herbal medicine, permaculture, and was the founder of Mountain Rose Herbs. The ripple effect of her teachings has helped facilitate an understanding that we are all indeed an essential link in this amazing web we call Life.

Co-Director Robert Consentino has over 25 years experience in motion picture/television production. He finds the challenges of visual storytelling to be the most inspiring and rewarding endeavors in the world. He is fascinated with the endless creative opportunities of being a cinematographer. His goal is to add visual and psychological depth to the story and illuminate the interior life of the characters in this upcoming film.

What We Need:

We are seeking $15,150 for post-production costs to finish the first 3 films in the series.
This covers:

  • Editing
  • Color-correction
  • Sound mixing
  • Licensing (acquiring the rights to important and historic news footage)
  • Distribution development

Some of our connectivity-inspired perks include:

  • Pollinator-friendly seed packets
  • Gift pack of greeting cards featuring photography by Producer/Co-Director Rose Madrone
  • Invite to intimate Portland screening with the filmmakers
  • Dinner with Rose & others in the connectivity community
  • Become a Creative Consultant for future episodes
  • Associate & Executive Producer credits on the film
  • And many more!

The Impact

An important part of CONNECTIVITY PROJECT's  mission is Distribution Development. We want these films in wide distribution so they can make a significant impact. This also includes the development of curriculum materials for educational purposes in schools, museums and other organizations aligned with a similar mission.

Our intention is to have a ripple effect of our own.... so that viewers will gain a better understanding and awareness about how their individual actions can make a very tangible difference. 

Risks & Challenges

Creating a documentary film series of this magnitude is a lot of work, but luckily, we have an amazing team of hard-working, professional filmmakers and activists who have been working in their chosen fields for many years. And most of the content is already done!

If we should fall short of the $15,150 goal, all of the funds raised will still be used directly toward our stated post-production costs, even if we have to cut some corners.

We'll be sure to keep our backers informed of campaign goals and progress. And with YOUR support, we will be able to finish this project and develop a distribution plan to bring it to audiences around the country, and the world!

Other Ways You Can Help

Unable to join us with a pledge at this time? Please help us spread the love and SHARE, SHARE, SHARE this campaign with your family and friends. Gaining visibility for the CONNECTIVITY PROJECT is incredibly impactful and helpful to our long term goals of distribution. 

 

 SHARE A LINK to our campaign on Facebook!

 

 "LIKE" our Facebook page at Facebook.com/ConnectivityProject

 

EMAIL YOUR NETWORK and those who you think may be interested in learning more about CONNECTIVITY PROJECT -- or who may want to be involved in future episodes! We're always looking to open new dialogue. Please include this link to our campaign.

 

USE THE INDIEGOGO SHARE TOOLS next to the "BACK IT" button at top of the page to shout from the rooftops and share with your community! The official hashtag for the project is #ConnectivityProjectFilm

 

We are relying on the passion of people like you to cheer us across the finish line, so we invite you to join Team Connectivity Project. Thank you!

story:
About Me

I'm Johnny Ray Rodriguez, I've done everything from sitcoms to soap operas, plays, musicals, CD recordings, standup comedy, dance and film. I'm a native New Yorker from the Bronx, and a major force in the entertainment industry of Puerto Rico. As a performer in San Juan, Telemundo acted as my first big arena to showcase my talents. I've starred in television shows such as: “No Te Duermas”, (Don’t Fall Asleep) “Esto No Es Un Show”, (This Is Not A Show) and “Minga Y Petraca.”

Through ‘social media’ I've expanded my “BRAND” to a wider audience and reaped the rewards by producing and starring in a new cabaret style show, (Johnny Ray es Ya Ustedes Saben Quien) and a new play, (Los Monólogos de las Verijas.) 2018 sees the success of another stage show called, (Estamos Escriquillaos).

Additionally, as a SAG member, my acting credits include, Crazy Ex-Girlfriend, Weeds, Disney’s Princess Protection Program, Journey of a Female Comic, The Hot Tamales and Locos y Contentos. Finally, I've also appeared in commercials for both Spanish and English markets

 

   

 

 

The Story

In Gardenias we view the world through the eye's of Jay Melendez who has achieved the hight of fame on his Island of Puerto Rico as a Telemundo star, who decided to plant himself in Los Angeles to take his success to the next level. When he arrived, a rude awakening was waiting as he realized that it's not that easy to transition from a Telemundo star to having a Hollywood star on the walk of fame over night. Still with a home in Puerto Rico, an aunt on the island that he helps out financially, and a new life in Los Angeles he realized that he needed more money coming in while pursuing the next level of fame, so he took a job as a Hollywood tour guide. 

 

 

 

What We Need  

Building the bridge between Puerto Rico and the United States is difficult and with this story loosely based on real experience, it will showcase the hardships one goes through to create a bond between two locations via comedy. In order to shine light on this diverse show, we need your help. We are in need of $35,000 to film our pilot for Gardenia. Filming this pilot includes: sets/location, camera equipment, costumes, lighting equipment, etc.  

 

 

Our Team

 

 

Maylen Calienes

An award winning filmmaker actor & producer. She was born in Cuba and raised in Miami, FL where her career began in writing, directing and acting for theatre. She later moved to Los Angeles, CA where she started filmmaking. Maylen has written, directed and produced several films and has worked on other multicultural projects. A movie she executive produced “Esta Es Tu Cuba” is the winner of a Student Academy Award. She is the founder of the Latino Filmmakers Network which made its debut at the 2015 Sundance Film Festival. She also formed MayCal Productions which was established in 2005. Maylen has been a big advocate of diversity in the entertainment industry for many years. She is part of the 'Diversity in Cannes' judging committee and produces the New Normal Reading Series in Hollywood that supports diverse storytellers. Maylen is proud to soon launch her new digital media company "Que Eye TV" alongside with her producing partner Johnny Ray Rodriguez which will be bilingual & focus on inclusivity and diverse talents. 

 

 

Modesto Lacen

He began working professionally as a teenager and continued his training in the Drama Department of the University of Puerto Rico, where he earned his undergraduate degree with honors, and excelled in classical theater, as well as physical theater and dance. Fluent in Spanish, English, Portuguese and French. His film credits include: Animal, alongside Oscar-nominated actor Terrence Howard; Back in the Day. Recently-concluded work in Colombia for Caracol TV is the new soap opera La Esclava Blanca, which has maintained the top spot in ratings since its debut in Colombia during January 2016. Netflix has acquired streaming rights for La Esclava. In 2018, he'll be featured in La barbería, He matado a mi marido, starring María Conchita Alonso and Tu me manques, with award-winning actor Oscar Martínez. 2018 marks his debut as writer and director when his first short film, The aroma of pig, hits the festival circuit.

 

 

T. Bankole

An award-winning producer who has produced narrative films, documentaries and television. His first feature film, “Conversation Piece”, funded by Miramax, starred Black Ice of Def Poetry on Broadway. More recently, Bankolé Executive Produced “Dominion,” a feature film starring John Malkovich, and Executive Produced a crime thriller titled “Drowning.” He is also a Co- Producer for a TV series titled “Mi Casa Mi Casa”, starring Michael Collar; and is currently in development of a few a made for TV projects, such as a series entitled Eighty 5, based off the Novel Three days as the Crow flys, and most currently Gardenias. http://www.imdb.me/tbankole

 

 

What You Get

Any contribution is a huge one, and we thank you so much for joining us on this incredible journey. To show our gratitude, this campaign includes very exciting perks such as: a personal shout out on the film's Facebook page, a private link to view the film as soon as it is released, a ticket to the film's premiere, or even an executive producer credit on the film!

 

 

 

The Impact

To showcase what a diverse platform can do. We are so passionate on being inclusive and celebrating everybody's differences. This show will tackle on social issues using comedy, create a coalition between African Americans and Latino artists, humanize Puerto Ricans, to educate mainland Americans about Puerto Ricans in hopes on creating a bond between the two, and most importantly, bring happiness to the community.

 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

In order to reach our goal for this film we will need help from as many of you as possible. In addition to donating to the campaign, sharing the link to the campaign via social media will help to spread the word about this important story.
story_txt:
About Me
I'm Johnny Ray Rodriguez, I've done everything from sitcoms to soap operas, plays, musicals, CD recordings, standup comedy, dance and film. I'm a native New Yorker from the Bronx, and a major force in the entertainment industry of Puerto Rico. As a performer in San Juan, Telemundo acted as my first big arena to showcase my talents. I've starred in television shows such as: “No Te Duermas”, (Don’t Fall Asleep) “Esto No Es Un Show”, (This Is Not A Show) and “Minga Y Petraca.”
Through ‘social media’ I've expanded my “BRAND” to a wider audience and reaped the rewards by producing and starring in a new cabaret style show, (Johnny Ray es Ya Ustedes Saben Quien) and a new play, (Los Monólogos de las Verijas.) 2018 sees the success of another stage show called, (Estamos Escriquillaos).
Additionally, as a SAG member, my acting credits include, Crazy Ex-Girlfriend, Weeds, Disney’s Princess Protection Program, Journey of a Female Comic, The Hot Tamales and Locos y Contentos. Finally, I've also appeared in commercials for both Spanish and English markets
 
    
 
 
The Story
In Gardenias we view the world through the eye's of Jay Melendez who has achieved the hight of fame on his Island of Puerto Rico as a Telemundo star, who decided to plant himself in Los Angeles to take his success to the next level. When he arrived, a rude awakening was waiting as he realized that it's not that easy to transition from a Telemundo star to having a Hollywood star on the walk of fame over night. Still with a home in Puerto Rico, an aunt on the island that he helps out financially, and a new life in Los Angeles he realized that he needed more money coming in while pursuing the next level of fame, so he took a job as a Hollywood tour guide. 
 

 

 
What We Need  
Building the bridge between Puerto Rico and the United States is difficult and with this story loosely based on real experience, it will showcase the hardships one goes through to create a bond between two locations via comedy. In order to shine light on this diverse show, we need your help. We are in need of $35,000 to film our pilot for Gardenia. Filming this pilot includes: sets/location, camera equipment, costumes, lighting equipment, etc.  
 

 
Our Team
 

 
Maylen Calienes
An award winning filmmaker actor & producer. She was born in Cuba and raised in Miami, FL where her career began in writing, directing and acting for theatre. She later moved to Los Angeles, CA where she started filmmaking. Maylen has written, directed and produced several films and has worked on other multicultural projects. A movie she executive produced “Esta Es Tu Cuba” is the winner of a Student Academy Award. She is the founder of the Latino Filmmakers Network which made its debut at the 2015 Sundance Film Festival. She also formed MayCal Productions which was established in 2005. Maylen has been a big advocate of diversity in the entertainment industry for many years. She is part of the 'Diversity in Cannes' judging committee and produces the New Normal Reading Series in Hollywood that supports diverse storytellers. Maylen is proud to soon launch her new digital media company "Que Eye TV" alongside with her producing partner Johnny Ray Rodriguez which will be bilingual & focus on inclusivity and diverse talents. 
 

 
Modesto Lacen
He began working professionally as a teenager and continued his training in the Drama Department of the University of Puerto Rico, where he earned his undergraduate degree with honors, and excelled in classical theater, as well as physical theater and dance. Fluent in Spanish, English, Portuguese and French. His film credits include: Animal, alongside Oscar-nominated actor Terrence Howard; Back in the Day. Recently-concluded work in Colombia for Caracol TV is the new soap opera La Esclava Blanca, which has maintained the top spot in ratings since its debut in Colombia during January 2016. Netflix has acquired streaming rights for La Esclava. In 2018, he'll be featured in La barbería, He matado a mi marido, starring María Conchita Alonso and Tu me manques, with award-winning actor Oscar Martínez. 2018 marks his debut as writer and director when his first short film, The aroma of pig, hits the festival circuit.
 

 
T. Bankole
An award-winning producer who has produced narrative films, documentaries and television. His first feature film, “Conversation Piece”, funded by Miramax, starred Black Ice of Def Poetry on Broadway. More recently, Bankolé Executive Produced “Dominion,” a feature film starring John Malkovich, and Executive Produced a crime thriller titled “Drowning.” He is also a Co- Producer for a TV series titled “Mi Casa Mi Casa”, starring Michael Collar; and is currently in development of a few a made for TV projects, such as a series entitled Eighty 5, based off the Novel Three days as the Crow flys, and most currently Gardenias. http://www.imdb.me/tbankole
 
 
What You Get
Any contribution is a huge one, and we thank you so much for joining us on this incredible journey. To show our gratitude, this campaign includes very exciting perks such as: a personal shout out on the film's Facebook page, a private link to view the film as soon as it is released, a ticket to the film's premiere, or even an executive producer credit on the film!
 

 
 

The Impact
To showcase what a diverse platform can do. We are so passionate on being inclusive and celebrating everybody's differences. This show will tackle on social issues using comedy, create a coalition between African Americans and Latino artists, humanize Puerto Ricans, to educate mainland Americans about Puerto Ricans in hopes on creating a bond between the two, and most importantly, bring happiness to the community.
 

 
 

Other Ways You Can Help
In order to reach our goal for this film we will need help from as many of you as possible. In addition to donating to the campaign, sharing the link to the campaign via social media will help to spread the word about this important story.

story:
About the Project and Its Creator

My name is Dylan Tyler and I am the creator, writer and director of the new T.V. series, "Hoodlums." I am a Fine & Performing Arts graduate from the Johnny Carson School of Theatre & Film. Currently, I am a freelance filmmaker in the Atlanta area trying to bring my vision to televisions across the country, as it has always been my dream to create powerful, original content.

To achieve this goal, I have spent the past two and a half years conceptualizing and writing the entire series. My next question was: How do I make this real for the person who won't spend the time reading a 60 page pilot? I decided: why read what you can watch? So, I spent what little money I had (about $1K) to bring Hoodlums to the big screen. Now, I'm asking you to help me get HALF of that ($500), so I can bring Part II to the big screen, as well.

From there, I will continue to market Hoodlums, submit it to film festivals AND I will pitch it to studio executives to bring ALL of Hoodlums (not just 5 minutes) to those television across country I was talking about earlier. Let's get this thing from YouTube to HBO or Netflix!

What We Need From You & What You Get 

Break it down for folks in more detail:

In order for me to do this, I NEED your help! Whether it's one dollar or fifty dollars, all I need from each of you is whatever you can give. To sweeten the deal, I have listed below what each money value will get you from my production:

$1: Will receive a "Special Thanks to" in the credits.

$5: A personal shout-out on "Facebook Live" during the set-up and/or break in the shooting of Part II.

$10: The ability to be an extra in Part II and receive a copy of the finished scene on a flash drive

$25: Be an on-set guest for Part II and receive a copy of the finished scene on a flash drive

$50: A "Producer" credit in the final credits; Be an on-set guest for Part II; Receive a copy of the finished scene on a flash drive

$100: An "Executive Producer" credit in the final credits; Be an on-set guest for Part II; Receive a copy of the finished scene on a flash drive

$150+: An "Executive Producer" Credit in the final credits; a Full-Access Pass to the set of Part II and Behind-the-Scenes Access (including a Meet and Greet with the Cast of Part II); Receive a copy of the finished scene on a flash drive; Receive a Movie Poster for Hoodlums

The Impact

I believe that this project is a unique story that has yet to be told. Especially in this racially- charged, highly- political climate, I believe a story about someone who is not only looking for an identity, but one that challenges racial boundaries and stereotypes, is uniquely pertinent. It also helps that this show has some sex appeal, as well.

Shows like Entourage, the Sopranos, The Wire  and Sons of Anarchy, explore not only the identity of the main character, but also establish the culture of the group around the show's main character. Hoodlums is constructed similarly; there is no true good-guy or bad-guy. This character-driven drama is meant to explore all of humanity--good and bad--to show where certain paths lead us--and how quickly they lead us there. This show is built for success because it follows that formula. The idea is to explore fictional characters in a real world--and, in most cases, the characters are based on real people.

Risks & Challenges

While money has been a hurdle, by far, the biggest challenge has been my overall lack of resources. I wrote, directed, produced, acted in and edited this show from start to its current state. While it is not perfect, it's a great launching off of point since I have had no help around me.

Due to this, I plan to finish the second part of this scene, and then sell it to someone who can take it further. I have enjoyed the past two and a half years and I look forward to working on this show as long as possible. But, at some point, you hope that someone else can come in and help do some of the heavy lifting..

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help Please, like, share and tell your friends. Even if you haven't a dime to spare, perhaps they do! And, how cool would it be to say, in a year or two, "I helped get that show on T.V."?

And that's all there is to it.

story:
A Personal Story

Hanukkah in July is the pilot episode of an original series developed by writer Adam Raber and director Ashlee Sanchez.

In this first episode, a mentally ill young man named Jamie, while venturing out to a nightclub to help a friend in need, ends up confronting his past and learning more about his place in the world.

Before we go any further, we'd like to take a moment and introduce ourselves...

Adam Raber — Writer

 

"Hey all!

Thank you so much for taking the time to check out our page for Hanukkah in July. We can’t wait to share this story with you.

My name is Adam Raber and I'm currently a junior at Saddleback College. I'm studying film with an emphasis in screenwriting and Hanukkah in July is the first television script that I’ve written. I’ve acted and co-written for short films, such as The First Five Days of Heartbreak, but this will be my first solo writing credit, which is very exciting!"

Ashlee Sanchez — Director

 

"I studied filmmaking at The Art Institute of Orange County, CA. I was inspired by film at a young age and desired to be an actress. Later, I realized my real passion was behind the camera and started assistant directing on various sets.

Since starting film school, I've been part of narratives, documentaries, as well as live events. Hanukkah in July is extremely important to me in all aspects. I'll be bringing creativity, compassion, and sensitivity to this production. I intend to inspire the audience, and nothing's going to stop me from doing that."

About Those Details

Here's where all you wonderful people reading about this campaign come in. Taking any sort of film production from beginning to end requires the hard work of an entire enthusiastic team. We want you to be part of our team.

We're looking to raise at least $10,000 to help kick off Hanukkah in July the right way. Film and tv show productions have a lot of moving parts. There are many expenses to consider, including:

  • Set design
  • Camera and lighting rentals
  • Food for the cast and crew
  • Filming permits
  • Cash for unforeseen events/emergencies
  • Entrance fees for festivals and online distribution

We intend to put every dollar we receive to good use. Here's a general breakdown on how the donations will be spent on the production:

In return for your generous donation, we have a collection of exciting perks available for all backers. We feel it's important to involve as many people as possible in this production, so some tiers include the exclusive opportunity to be a unique part of Hanukkah in July. We're excited to offer those backers the chance to, among other things, receive a drag queen makeover and be featured in the show itself.

Let's Open Up

Hanukkah in July is more than just a compelling story about realizing the worth in oneself. Too often, films and tv shows featuring mentally ill people, LGBTQ characters, or those not collectively considered "normal" hit the wrong tone. We intend to present a show that doesn't rely on the well-worn clichés that fill our screens.

The character of Jamie in Hanukkah in July isn't the picture-perfect representation of a human being. He's got flaws and rough edges. He's a person, like a family member you have, a close friend, or perhaps even yourself.

We don't intend to present a story you've seen more times than you can count. It'll not only be the first step toward a continuing series of shows, it'll be a powerful and affirming story of life being lived.

Worth the Risk

Any film or tv production is likely to be fraught with challenges, both big and small. However, anything worth doing is rarely a simple endeavor. We'll face long days, location issues, tripped circuit breakers, and much more, but we'll work through them with motivation in our hearts.

We also have the full support and participation of Studio A138, the Orange County-based production company. With their expert guidance and history of successful productions, any unforeseen complications will be squashed in no time.

Most importantly, the kind support of every single backer to this campaign is the most important key to this project's success. With your help (yes, you, the beautiful person reading these words), we'll have boundless motivation to turn Hanukkah in July into something we can all be proud of.

Thank you. Thank you. Thank you.

story:
Short Summary

Jake Iorio (Credits: Karaganda, Glee) and Krystina Bailey (Credits: Blue Bloods, My Crazy Ex) met in an acting class a couple years ago and have stayed in touch since. They both starred in a comedic short film that Jake wrote called "An Online Engagement". It went on to win Award of Recognition in the 2018 Global Accolade Film Competition. You can view the short here  https://vimeo.com/262116928

Jake has now written a web series and Krystina is set to direct two episodes along with Josh Jones, who was our director and cinematographer for "An Online Engagement." Josh will also serve as our director of photography for all five episodes. Jake Iorio is starring as Robbie, and Carla Betz (Credits: Criminal Minds, Blood Relatives) as Rachel. We are storytellers and we can't wait to bring our creativity to life. That's why we need your help. It costs money to create a quality web series and we are launching this campaign so we can make our project a reality. 

What We Need & What You Get

The funding we receive from this campaign will go towards various expenses that are required for a production of a web series. We will be paying our actors, directors, director of photography, craft services, crew, costumes, props, and fees for festival submissions. Our goal is $6,000. When you donate, each donation amount gets you a perk. The more you donate the better the perk.

The Impact

You'll be making our dream of providing entertaining storytelling a reality. As artists, we feel it is imperative to be of service to others by giving them diverse and relatable characters on screen. We hope everyone can take away our theme of finding self worth along with having a few laughs along the way. 

Risks & Challenges

There can be various challenges such as finding the right locations and scheduling conflicts with our actors and crew. However, if given the funding we need we will make sure all the elements come together so we can provide you the quality web series you deserve after making your contribution. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Share about our campaign on your social media pages and tell all your friends. And send out the positive vibes!

Live. Laugh. Love. Lets make it happen!

story:
What About LaGina and Chanel?

LaGina Hill and Chanel Carroll are the co-creators and stars of “What About Gayle?” Friends since their undergraduate days at N.Y.U.’s Tisch School of the Arts, LaGina and Chanel were looking for a project to collaborate on. After bonding over their fondness for all things O&G, LaGina came up with the idea to write a stage show, set in the 1980s, LOOSELY based on the story of how Oprah and Gayle became friends. They spent a summer co-writing the stage version of the show and mounted it at The PIT during the summer of 2017. After a successful stage run, the ladies decided to turn their hit show into a six episode first season of a webseries of the same name.

 

What About Gayle is Zany, Heartwarming and Empowering to women.

 

In this day and age, we wanted to create a series that not only made people laugh but highlighted the power that a strong friendship between two independent women had.

 

Where Your Money Is Going

By donating to What About Gayle?, you are providing a way for our incredibly talented cast and crew to get their work seen.

The first season of What About Gayle? consists of six, five to eight minute episodes. We’re hoping to shoot end of summer/early fall 2019.

Our goal is to raise $10,000. This money will go towards the following:

  • Paying our production team, consisting of: cast, director, dp, sound mixer, lighting designer and more.  
  • Equipment rental
  • location fees
  • editing
  • sound mixing
  • color correcting
  • festival submission fees
  • Crowdfunding fees

Why Does The World Need What About Gayle Now?

What About Gayle (or WAG as we affectionately call it) celebrates sisterhood, the power of female friendship and, lets be honest, how can ANYTHING involving Oprah NOT make you smile?

In all seriousness, we understand that not everyone might be able to contribute right now. So if that’s you, please help us by spreading the word on the Sosh Meeds!

Instagram: @whataboutgayle

Twitter: @whataboutgayle

Facebook: @whataboutgayle

Both LaGina Hill and Chanel Carroll hold B.F.A.s from N.Y.U.’s Tisch School of the Arts.

story:
WE'VE ALREADY DONE 1/5 OF THE WORK

The pilot episode of TRANSFERS was recently released in August of 2018. Haven't seen it? You better get on that, friend. We plan to have a 5 episode season & we need your help to fund the rest of it!

You're back? Cool.

Imagine This: The pilot episode you just watched, but better. We're talking about camera quality, lighting, locations, cast, crew, set design, the whole shabang. 

We wanted to show you an episode made with minimum funds to give an idea of how great the show has the potential of being. In addition, we have already written the rest of the season, it just needs to be filmed!

WHOMSTVE?

The pilot episode of TRANSFERS was co-written & directed by Justin Shackelford. Justin has a background in film & business from the University of Texas, specializing in creative writing, directing, & editing. TRANSFERS is his passion project & he is using this as an opportunity to grow as a director, while also acting in the show.

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal to sufficiently fund the rest of the season is $3,000. (Wow, that sure sounds like a lot). Actually, no. When compared to other productions, $3,000 is actually a very modest amount to fund an entire webseries season. Other shows & movies have extravagant budgets wayyyyy over our figure. We're not about all that. We want to get this money, & make the show while spending funds efficiently.

We can even sweeten the deal with some perks!!!

Budgeting

Alright, alright, alright, now that we've got the money, it's time to use it:

*insert a pie chart or something here*

That was a pretty impressive pie chart, no? Just in case Kelvin forgot to upload it, the breakdown goes something like this:

  • Equipment 50%
  • Food 10%
  • Post-Production 10%
  • Cast & Crew 20%
  • Locations 10%

Secure the Bag

Don't know what that means? You're on the internet & Urban Dictionary is just a Google search away.

After we raise our goal, we will allocate any excess funds towards post-production & other bells & whistles. In the third episode, Quentin has a ninja fight with another shinobi. Don't you wanna see that? Wouldn't that be cool?

Bag Secured 

Don't let the sarcastic tone of this campaign fool you, we're very grateful for all of the support we have received thus far on the webseries. Our cast & crew is comprised of dedicated members who have worked very hard to get TRANSFERS where it is today. We have been working for free & using our own funding to make this happen, but now we need your help.

story:
Isolation The Series 

Thank you for stopping by on this campaign.

My name is Steve Leeds an Actor/Writer who created Isolation The Series at the begining of lockdown. I used over 80 actors worldwide filming in a way that has never been done before. 

In the first Season of Isolation The Series, just our finale episode alone, reached OVER 145,000 views on the facebook page! 

The whole project was filmed, edited and completed on a ZERO budget but is already rated 10/10 on IMDb!

This series has already gained a massive following all over the world.

The first season starred some big names such as Matt Lucas - little Britain, Jon Campling - Harry Potter, Jess Impiazzi, Tracey Birdsall filming her scenes in California, this is just a few of the very talented Actors that were involved.


At

This is a very troubling time for our industry. My aim here, is to keep as many creative people  around the world, working.

 Just think, through this lockdown, I would almost guarantee all of you have watched a lot of films and series whilst at home am I right? That is why this series is so important  to keep as many Actors and other creatives employed.

How Does The Series Work 

In the first season of Isolation The Series I wrote each Actors side of the scripts for their scene with directions. They filmed their scene on their phones or cameras. They then sent these back to me so I could edit their scene together with their scene partner, who was filming their side of the scene somewhere else in the world. 

This is a brand new way of filming! No one got to see or know who their scene partners were, until the final edit of that episode. This is such an exciting way to film and created such a buzz.

Now imagine what we could do with a budget!

This would allow me to not only pay Actors for their time, it would allow me to pay editors, other writers, and many other creatives  to work together and build the biggest web-series out there!

 

My Aim for Isolation The Series 

 

I want this series to have it's own platform, it's own website, with weekly episodes.

After the support from the first season there is room for Isolation The Series to stand alone.

No other series has been filmed like this before! We have just created and changed the way of filming. 

 

Your Donation and what happens with it 

 

Your donation to Isolation The Series will make the BIGGEST difference.

The more we can raise, the bigger this series will be.

In this industry creative people are always expected to work for free.

The first season no one got paid including myself because we love what we do. 

Going forward I want the opportunity to give something back to an industry. I have worked as an Actor / Writer for many years and right now this industry is suffering. 

I truly believe Isolation The Series is the best way I can help keep so many creatives working. 

 I have had thousands of messages of support for the first season. Messages from Actors saying how much Isolation The Series got them through lockdown.

I want to make this bigger than ever and with your help we can do just this.  

4 actors from the first season have already been offered work in other projects including TV, Films and brand new series as a result of Isolation The Series.  Wouldn't it be great with your donation to create more opportunities. 

Why Am I asking for Donations 

I can honestly say, hand on heart, if I won the lottery tomorrow I would fund this project myself.

The buzz I had from creating the first season made me realise what is important to me and so many others.

This is a way I can give back to the industry that I have loved my entire life.  

Other Ways You Can Help

You can donate as small  or as big as you wish. Every donation will make such a difference.

Please share this campaign with everyone and then share some more, it will make such an impact to many peoples lives, by getting Isolation The Series in front of the right people!

story:
Sci-Fi fans!!! You can choose a Limited Edition Reward (costumes!) and be a part of the main decision making of our designs! 

 

WE NEED YOU!

 

PLEASE CHECK OUR REWARDS & choose your favorite!

Plus... be a part of the decision for the FINAL design of the SHOW!

Should we go with "Written Logo" (LEFT) or  "Symbol Logo" (RIGHT)???

DESIGN:

HELP US TO CHOOSE !

 

These are costumes for our "Season 1", some logos may change during filming, but don't lose the opportunity to own an incredible collector item and help us make an important decision for our Official Costumes !!!

 

-------- THIS VERSION IS THE WRITTEN LOGO --------

OR

-------- THIS VERSION IS THE SYMBOL LOGO --------

 

 

-------- THIS VERSION IS THE WRITTEN LOGO --------

-------- THIS VERSION IS THE SYMBOL LOGO --------

NEWS:

1. Watch out for the "SECRET PERKS" (what are those? Click an image or a link in this page may connect you with a secret Perk!).

2. You receive this secret Perks for free... if you refer somebody  (how refer works? Click here)

3. Here our "STRETCH GOALS CHART" ! It's going to be Epic!

(HOW STRETCH GOAL WORKS: At the end of our 60 days of fundraise we will fulfill the stretch Goal we reach! Let's go the all way to the Huge Street Bill Board!)

 

 

Choose your Costume to collect and select a PERK!

 

 

Prologue:

Year 2049, DHARSA CORP creates advanced "Human-clones-robots" almost identical to humans. They are stronger, faster and more resilient ROBOTS and are the ultimate machines.

May 2049 Robots begin to rebel against humans, acting on their own and no one can understand how. In December of the same year the "Human Clone Robots" declare war on humankind.

C10 before become a CYBORGS.

 

Unclear is the role of DHARSA CORP in this series of events.
 

”Robots are extremely envious of humans. This was one of the, if not the, first reason they declared war against them".

(Clone Robot model "JJ650", it is the most sold robot of the world. Unfortunately it's the first model rebel against humans).

 

 In September 2049, Humans were already the minority, while Robots were multiplying exponentially. They used most of the natural resources and didn't have any respect for the environment.

 

C7 (left) and C8 (right) outside in the Wasteland.

 

 The World quickly became a WASTELAND with a vigilance of Robots that looked like humans who were after the few real humans who remained.

It happened so fast and seemed to be the end... but there was still hope.

Doctor Oid inside a DHARSA CORP Bunker.

Some groups of people created "Anti-Robots Bunkers" that secured survivor shelters deep in the ground. They tried to organize and fight back.

Some of these Bunkers were discovered by the robots, some people died of starvation, some by diseases, but there were just a few who were never discovered. On the surface, with the many years passing, a new generation of uncivilized humans were roaming the wasteland.

C10 escape from a DHARSA Bunker into the Wasteland.

 

Robots captured and enslaved most of them, just for the sake of it. Forcing the savages to do barbaric things.

But once again, there was still hope...

In May 2279, an "Anti-Robot Bunker" a group of scientists finally release a Team of fighters with the power of Robots, but the brains, intuitions and feelings of humans.

It was a success and a new race was built with an exact balance between Robots and Humans called: "CYBORGS".

Before the Robots found the bunker and destroy everything, 10 Cyborgs were built by a scientist called "Doctor C". The "CYBORGS" Team was created.

"Doctor C"  starts the CYBORGS GROUP.

 

This team quickly became famously known as the last hope for human kind to survive. The Robots tried to hunt and kill the Cyborgs, but this new war was far from over.

A new chapter of our planet is being written.

Cyborgs like Angels are here to save everyone from the evil (Robots).

 

The "Skullcraker robots" can keep up a fight with the CYBORGS!

 

(The Skullcraker are the stronger "Clone Robots" around, unfortunately they resembled a very beautiful and charming girl. For human solider, it was the end).

 

 

 

 

 

Here our story begins...

"Today, Los Angeles, year 2290".

 

 

 

 

( Harry Holmes is CYBORG C10 )

 

 

 

(Kelsey Bohlen is the SKULLCRAKER)

 

 

(Hanna Palazzi is CYBORG C6)

 

 

 

(Kimo Leopldo is CYBORG C8)

 

 

( Christopher Allen McCoy is "Doctor C" )

 

"Ran Wei" is Cyborg C4

 

"Kaleb Rich-Harris" is Cyborg C2

 

"Aubrey Rinehart" is Cyborg C5

 

 

 

( Director, Producer and Creator of the CYBORGS Series: Leonardo Corbucci )

 

 

ORIGINAL MOTION PICTURE SCORE:

Music Composer "Christian Hessler"

 

Music Composer "Luciano Storti"

 

Musicians "Andrea & Marco Basili"

 

 

( ORIGINAL MUSIC CD of CYBORGS TV SHOW front)

 

Production Designer "A.J. Catalano-Torres"

(Design from "A.J. Catalano-Torres")

 

 

 

(Storyboards of the "Cyborgs dream scene")

Director "Leonardo Corbucci" during principal photography.

 

 

CYBORGS & CYBORGS TV Series

Leonardo Films & Legendary Series Inc

ALL RIGHTS RESERVED ® 2015/2017

www.legendaryseries.org

 

 

Disclaimer, Risks and Challenges

We need to film the remain 30% of the pilot (Episode 1), there is an incredible and Epic Fight scene (Between the CYBORGS & The Skullckraker) that requires Green Screen and cable technique inside a big Stage.

The second half of this production will be more costly than the first, due to; Cable  Fight Coordinators, Cable rigs, VFX, CGI, Color Grade, costumes, training, audio post-production, video editing, sound editing, and music score. All of this is still needed to make the production shine and reach its full potential.

When the project is finished, marketing will begin for future investment. This is where the public support boosts the project.

Again, without your support, we would not be able to finish this amazing project, so THANK YOU in advance.

story:
Nu, What’s the show about?

Jewishvibes is about the life of a modern orthodox Jewish high-schooler, named Mikey, who struggles with his religious values in the 21st century. Mikey has one foot in the religious world, with its many observances and "restrictions," and one foot in the modern world, which at times can feel like the polar opposite of a religious upbringing. Mikey attends a religious Jewish high-school, but believes his life would be better if he transfers to a public school, where his dream of living the "true American high-school experience" would be fulfilled. 

Jewishvibes was created by Mikey Greenblatt and developed by  Leah Gottfried (Soon By You),  Menachem Silverstein (Jimmy Kimmel Live, TBS, IFC), and Mikey Greenblatt (Magnet Theater). 

Why this?

The goal of Jewishvibes is to bring awareness and understanding of the modern orthodox Jewish community. I have faced discrimination, prejudice, and anti-semitism living in New York City, which is considered by many as an accepting and open environment. What I have come to realize is that many of these attacks did not come from a place of hate, but rather a place of  misunderstanding and misinformation. I hope this project will bring to light the Jewish experience, in a fun and educational way. I want to bring this show into the mainstream. It is my belief that all of humanity has a shared set of values and emotions, and the key to combating prejudice and discrimination is to bring them into the open. A sense of commonality with your fellow human being not only dissipates hate, but accentuates love.

Why you? 

 If you think of a meme as a short film (which Mikey Greenblatt apparently does), then this NYC based comedian and co-founder of the Instagram account @Jewishvibes, has written well over 700 comedic films about the Modern Orthodox experience #frommemetoscreen.  Jewishvibes is simply the next step in the process. Mikey has also made several short sketches, which you can find here:

 https://mikeygreenblatt.wixsite.com/mikeygreenblatt/copy-of-reel

Why now?

This is a project that has not been done before. It is an insight into another culture that I hope will humanize the modern orthodox Jewish community. The portrayal of Jews on television seems to straddle two extreme sides of the spectrum: on the one hand there are culturally Jewish shows like Seinfeld, and on the other, ultra orthodox Jewish shows, such as Netflix's Unorthodox. Yet, Judaism is not monolithic, black or white. There is complexity and nuance to our religion. 

I would not have been able to make this show a decade ago. For a show to be greenlighted, or put on the air by stations like NBC or CBS, it had to have mass appeal. Thanks to YouTube and hopefully down the line, streaming services like Netflix and Hulu, there is more room for shows like Jewishvibes.

What We Need & What You Get

Your contribution means everything for our show. When you contribute, you are not only supporting the show, you are supporting modern orthodox children who can take pride in who they are and how they are represented. All contributions will go directly towards cast, crew, gear, props, and other filming necessities. 

That said, we have lots of perks which include personal shoutouts, meme posters, extra/speaking roles in the film, executive producer credit and much more! You can find out more about these in the 'perks' tab of this campaign. 

Here's a gorgeous screenshot of our budget breakdown:

Every contribution goes directly toward producing this show. The Jewishvibes team wants to give its viewers the greatest possible product.  We also hope to use this episode in a "pitch deck" to streaming services like Netflix and Hulu.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people may not be able to contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help!

Spread the word about our campaign by copying the website link and sharing it with friends and family!

Why now?
This is a project that has not been done before. It is an insight into another culture that I hope will humanize the modern orthodox Jewish community. The portrayal of Jews on television seems to straddle two extreme sides of the spectrum: on the one hand there are culturally Jewish shows like Seinfeld, and on the other, ultra orthodox Jewish shows, such as Netflix's Unorthodox. Yet, Judaism is not monolithic, black or white. There is complexity and nuance to our religion. 
I would not have been able to make this show a decade ago. For a show to be greenlighted, or put on the air by stations like NBC or CBS, it had to have mass appeal. Thanks to YouTube and hopefully down the line, streaming services like Netflix and Hulu, there is more room for shows like Jewishvibes.
What We Need & What You Get
Your contribution means everything for our show. When you contribute, you are not only supporting the show, you are supporting modern orthodox children who can take pride in who they are and how they are represented. All contributions will go directly towards cast, crew, gear, props, and other filming necessities. 
That said, we have lots of perks which include personal shoutouts, meme posters, extra/speaking roles in the film, executive producer credit and much more! You can find out more about these in the 'perks' tab of this campaign. 
Here's a gorgeous screenshot of our budget breakdown:


Every contribution goes directly toward producing this show. The Jewishvibes team wants to give its viewers the greatest possible product.  We also hope to use this episode in a "pitch deck" to streaming services like Netflix and Hulu.
Other Ways You Can Help
Some people may not be able to contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help!
Spread the word about our campaign by copying the website link and sharing it with friends and family!

story:
The Only Way Out Is In

One Cuckoo is a web series that tells the story of Alix, a fiercely opinionated, highly imaginative, joyful and brash 30-something African-American artist in NYC and her mischievous trio of eclectic inner voices as she (and they) attempt to navigate the rocky waters of relationships, artistic pursuits, and self examination. It is a personal yet universal story that pits Alix against parts of herself that take form as: A full-grown, nebbishy jew with an insouciant, teen-ager's attitude, a flamboyant, always-right, wine swilling, British artiste, and a potty mouthed six-year-old. The series charts Alix's attempt to quiet these voices once and for all. Or at least broker a truce!

What We Need & What You Get

The team has already raised over $10,000.00 toward this project! We are poised to continue raising the necessary funds via InDemand, to bring you a gritty, beautiful, multi-ethnic, whimsical 6- webisode series depicting Alix's world and the motley crew of voices that make up her inner life. 

According to Vickie Tanner, the series creator, the series is based on our current political climate and the misconception we are divided. One Cuckoo has an all-inclusive demographic: Women in their teens, 20’s and 30’s, artists, actors, businessmen and women, everyday people struggling in relationships and life, spiritual seekers and inhabiters of hip cosmopolitan cities, large and small. The multi-ethnic cast (and crew) are very deliberate, reflecting a true New York experience, where all peoples are represented and interact on an intimate basis. One Cuckoo is a mash-up of categories (drama, comedy and fantasy) and speaks to Me Too, Times Up, Black Lives Matter and identity politics. It calls out this chaotic time in history where we believe we are all divided and offers an alternative point of view: Division doesn’t really exist until we create it.

Our Team

Actor-writer-producer Vickie Tanner manifests her own experiences through truthful and compelling characters who ground her fantastical vision of the world. Vickie is also an actor, and author of solo play, Running Into Me, which she has performed in Edinburgh, L.A. and various theatres in NYC to rave reviews. She is currently in rehearsals for a new feature film: Paris is in Harlem with writer/director Christina Kallas

Director Jess Coles brings her perspective as a queer New York native to this tale of blurred boundaries between reality and illusion, inner self and outer self, and what it means to create a vision of oneself with no prior mold to follow. Jess and Vickie’s collaboration started in John Shear’s Take Action Film Collective, where their work together on gender bending scenes spurred a lasting partnership

Lead actress, Olivia Washington is following in the footsteps of her famous father but forging her own path! She has been seen in Lee Daniel’s The Butler, Mr. Robot, a recent collaboration on a short film with director Jess Coles and many plays across the country.

Director of Photography, Katherine Castro studied architecture and photography while living in the Dominican Republic. She brings her design and photography background to work that spans narrative, music video & doc- umentaries. Her work has recently been screened in film festivals such as Indy Film Fest, Woods Hole Film Festival & Asian American International Film Festival in NYC.

Stan Meyer is a world-renown artist and Broadway set designer who gave us Beauty and the Beast and many other plays. Stan will be creating the beautiful, staggered, painted photographs you just saw in the teaser video for the entire series.

CREDITS

Creator: Vickie Tanner, Director: Jess Coles, Producers: Jess Coles and Vickie Tanner, Director of Photography: Katherine Castro, Editor: Jess Coles, Artist and illustrator: Stan Meyer, Line Producer: Amy DePaola, Assistant director/PC: Erika Santosuosso, 1st AC: Olivia Ebertz, Gaffer: Diana Eliazov, Production Sound: Jared Grove, Hair and Make-up: Tetiana Glushchenko, Production Assistant: Casey Thais, 

CAST: ALIX: Olivia Washington, SARAH: Jane West, TEEN: Hillel Meltzer,  ARTISTE: MleChester and SIX: Gemma Rathore

Music performed by Thumbscrew: Tomas Fujiwara: Drums, Michael Formanek: Double Bass, Mary Halvorson: Guitar

"Goddess Sparkle" Composed by Tomas Fujiwara, BMI. From the Album "Thumbscrew" (Cuneiform Records)    "The Cardinal and the Weathervane" Composed by Tomas Fujiwara, BMI From the Album "Convallaria" (Cuneiform Records). "Snarling Joys" Composed by Mary Halvorson, BMI From the Album "Ours" (Cuneiform Records)

www.thumbscrew.net   www.cuneiformrecords.com

Risks & Challenges

The project, after we shoot the series, may not garner interest from web series distributors. The series will be shot and edited all the same! Our plan B is to finish the entire project with a very low budget and release it on Youtube or Vimeo.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us get the word out! By sharing and reposting One Cuckoo's updates, you'll help our campaign reach its crowdfunding goal. So when you see a fundraising posts or a "Pesky Inner Voice" clip that grabs you,  repost, post haste!  Thank you!

We are also seeking in-kind donations of restaurant locations, apartments, coffee shops and rehearsal spaces. Do you know anyone who has access to one of these location types or do you own one yourself? We are all ears :)!

story:
What in the heck is Bear Apocalypse?

Corey and Brad are two best friends reunited in the wilderness after being forced out of their homes by the bears. Now that they're back together, they must face the everyday challenges of living in a world gone mad, where the bears reign supreme and humans fight for survival. 

Bear Apocalypse is a comedy web series comprised of approximately 6-8 episodes, with a run time of 8-10 minutes per episode. Before we can get there, though, we need to make an amazing Pilot episode to use as a proof of concept to bring the whole season to life.

Written and created by Brad Bergeron and Corey Schmitt, Bear Apocalypse is an ambitious concept. We're currently scheduled to film the pilot episode this September in Vancouver, BC. 
 

Whatcha need a hand with?

We are looking to raise funds to cover everything associated with the production of our pilot episode. This includes gear rentals, crew honorariums, special makeup effects, VFX, and sound mixing. A lot goes into making something look good and we appreciate any help you can offer in assisting us achieve our goals. From where we stand, your contributions will help us cover the following:

Gear / Camera Rental: $1,000

Crew Fees: $600

SPFX, Props, and Costumes: $250

Keeping the Cast and Crew Fed and Happy: $200

Post Production Sound and Coloring: $1,000

VFX: $700

 

Who are you folks? 

Corey Schmitt (writer/creator/producer/star)

Corey Schmitt is an actor and improviser based in Vancouver, BC. He has been acting in film and tv for the last 6 years. Some of his favourite credits include playing a drunk goalie who joins the baseball team for free beer in “Benchwarmers 2: Breaking Balls” , a deranged serial killer with alopecia in “The Girl in the Photographs”, and a drug dealing immature man boy murderer with a pony tail as a guest star in “The Murders”. Corey most recently won the Best Actor award at the Alternative Film Festival 2021 in Toronto for his role in "Giraffe", a film he also wrote and produced. He is very excited to be a part of “Bear Apocalypse", working with such amazing people . He is grateful to everyone who has jumped on board!

 
Brad Bergeron (writer/creator/producer/star)

Brad Bergeron graduated from the Grant MacEwan Theatre Arts Program in 2012. He then moved to Vancouver to pursue a career in film/tv. Most memorable credits include, Matthew (BH90210), Brad (Ice), Stevens (The 100), David (When Calls The Heart).

 
Nathan Houle (producer/actor)

Nathan Houle is a Windsor, Ontario native, who has worked as an actor in the film and television industry for 6 years. He can be seen in Netflix’s Lost in Space, AMC’s The Terror: Infamy, Hulu’s television comedy Woke, and most recently NBC’s Debris. Nathan holds a Bachelor of Arts (Theatre) from the University of Windsor, and is an alumni of the full time acting program at Vancouver Film School. Venturing into the world of producing, he is beyond grateful for the opportunity to work with such an amazing team.

 
Dan Nicholls (director/producer)

Born out of the prairies and driven to a love of film at a very early age, Dan Nicholls now fancies himself a director and has mined offbeat human behavior over the course of several short films to date. Most recently he directed the award-winning short film "Giraffe", which is currently making the festival rounds.  Past works as a director include four produced episodes of the web series "Mehlennials" and the black comedy short film "That's Life" (currently in post-production). Other short film credits include the relationship comedy "20 Seconds", 2015 Reykjavik International Film Festival official selection "Torture.AVI", "Worst Laid Plans", and "Green Treatment" (which he also wrote and co-starred in). Dan currently resides in the west end of Vancouver and doesn’t go outside nearly as much as he should.

 
Lola Côté (producer)

Lola Côté, born in SK, was raised to become an elite athlete. She played NCAA D1 Volleyball for the Tigers down in Memphis, TN where she garnered several awards and set records. When she wasn't busy with schoolwork or athletics, Côté was listening to music, studying her favourite movies, and admiring the comedians on SNL. Not long after she retired from playing professionally, Lola moved to BC to study at The Vancouver Film School. She is— among other things— a writer, actor, and producer with an unshakeable love for great music, film, and comedy. She was an executive producer for the award-winning short film "Giraffe", which is currently taking-off in the festival circuit.

 
Rylan Gladson (cinematographer/editor)

Rylan Gladson graduated from the University of Victoria in 2017 with a major in Writing and a minor in Film Studies. He has served as editor and cinematographer on the Out to Lunch sketch series, a number of short films, including Windfall, Wake Up, and Bottleneck (in post production) and the Mehlennials web series. He has worked with musicians such as Fintan O'Brian and So Loki on music videos. He is currently the director of videography at Beautiful Life Studios in Vancouver.

 

Contributor Perks

We're hoping you'll love our show and, more importantly, be proud to have helped us achieve our dreams of turning Bear Apocalypse into a reality. BUT, if you don't like it, at least you get some sweet sweet perks to go down in history with!

  • Digital Copy of the Pilot Episode - $20
  • Thank You in the Credits - $50
  • Signed Copy of Script - $75
  • Script 'n a Selfie Video - $150 
  • Executive Producer Credit - $500
  • Name Joe's Parents - $1000
  • Our Undying Love and Gratitude PLUS Some Damn Good Karma: $2,000
 

Thank You! 

No matter how big or small, every contribution will make the world of a difference. From all of us here at the Bear Apocalypse team, thank you. We are extremely grateful for your support. With your help we hope to make Bear Apocalypse into something you (and the rest of the world) will enjoy!

Digital Copy of the Pilot Episode - $20

Executive Producer Credit - $500

Name Joe's Parents - $1000

Our Undying Love and Gratitude PLUS Some Damn Good Karma: $2,000


 Thank You! No matter how big or small, every contribution will make the world of a difference. From all of us here at the Bear Apocalypse team, thank you. We are extremely grateful for your support. story:
The first episode was successfully funded on Kickstarter and coming soon!  

Our new goal for this campaign: 
$4,300 to create the next episode 
1st Push Goal: $9,000 3rd Episode
2nd Push Goal: $13,000 4th Episode
3rd Push Goal: $17,000 5th Episode
4th Push Goal: $21,000 6th Episode
 

After 25 years as Hollywood Superman, Chris Dennis needs your help! He is rebuilding his life after a vicious assault rendered him homeless and ruined his career. Chris has inspired millions while working on Hollywood Blvd, inspiring the national character street performer and cosplay movement. 

Be part of his true life story!

Check out all our other perks to download and own the docu-series or even be featured in it!  

Check out all our other perks to download and own the docu-series or even be featured in it! 

ABC NEWS ARTICLE

"THE KID" : Adventures of Hollywood Superman is a Cinderella story told through a series produced for worldwide web release. Chris has traversed a rough road while continuing his Hollywood Blvd role as the Man of Steel. After having his entire vintage Superman collection stolen from his home, he picked himself up and went to work, putting smiles on thousands of children's faces.

Chris' Superman Collection

Years later he was brutally assaulted and his Superman costume, his only means of income, was burned.

His story is finally being told from his point of view, with his own voice and you can be a part of it.

This series will take you to the depths of Hollywood, where you will see a completely different perspective of how one man can inspire millions, even when his own life is on a downward spiral.

Pledged $55 to own this storyboard booklet. 

 Own a piece of Superman's cape for $100

Own a piece of the Hollywood Superman's cape

  logo from Hollywood Superman's cape

We need your help to make this project a reality. 

Film Production costs money. Including: cameras, lighting, crew, insurance, food, generators, and other incidentals. Below is a chart of how the production budget will be spent. The more funds that are raised, the more episodes can be produced. Check out the Stretch Goals below.

 Only supporters such as yourself can help make this story move from concept to screen.

  

Chris & Amy Adams

Chris & Jared Leto

    

Chris & Colin Farrell

Chris & Woody Harrelson

The best part of this is that you, as supporters of this great and endearing story, can get some amazing perks.

  • Signed Photo - Chris will personally autograph an exclusive 8x10 for you.
  • Superman Patch - Indiegogo exclusive Hollywood Superman commemorative patch.
  • Cape Fabric - A section of the actual cape worn by Chris and autographed.
  • Set Visit - Visit the set of the series in Hollywood (travel not included). Have lunch with Chris and the crew and get firsthand experience of a film production.
  • Be an Extra - Not only get to visit the set (travel not included), but also become a part of the series in front of the camera.
  • Have a Part - Could be your big break. Have a speaking part. Deliver several lines in one of the episodes. Have your name on IMDB.
  • Be an Associate Producer - Have your name not only in the credits of the episode, but get an Associate Producer credit on IMDB as well. 

Hollywood Superman Commemorative Patch

  

On-Set Production

 

EXECUTIVE PRODUCER - Robert Folk has composed and conducted the musical scores for over 65 feature films. His extensive credits include Ace Ventura: When Nature Calls, Nothing To Lose, Tremors, The NeverEnding Story II: The Next Chapter, Toy Soldiers, Police Academy, Kung Pow! Enter the Fist, Boat Trip, Back in the Day, American Pie: Band Camp and Van Wilder 2 and Vivaldi. 

DIRECTOR - Vladislav Kozlov is an actor, producer, director and scriptwriter., known for DayDreams of Rudolph Valentino (2007).  While he has been in numerous TV and film roles, he is most well known for his role in the upcoming Silent Life, an American silent drama film, which he is set to write, direct and star in, as the famous main character, silent film star Rudolph Valentino.

He is a fan of classic film and filmmaking, as well as how the art and people touch others.

            Art by Christopher Dennis

 A Special Occasion VIDEO GREETING by Hollywood Superman.

If you've taken a picture with Chris as Superman on Hollywood Blvd over the past two decades post them to our Facebook Page. At the end of the campaign the picture with the most "Likes" will receive a special video hello and thank you from Hollywood Blvd via Facetime or Skype with Chris.

Thank you in advance for all of your support and well-wishes. We're looking forward to unveiling the series.
