Cape Fabric - A section of the actual cape worn by Chris and autographed.
Set Visit - Visit the set of the series in Hollywood (travel not included). Have lunch with Chris and the crew and get firsthand experience of a film production.
Be an Extra - Not only get to visit the set (travel not included), but also become a part of the series in front of the camera.
Have a Part - Could be your big break. Have a speaking part. Deliver several lines in one of the episodes. Have your name on IMDB.
Be an Associate Producer - Have your name not only in the credits of the episode, but get an Associate Producer credit on IMDB as well. 
Hollywood Superman Commemorative Patch  On-Set Production EXECUTIVE PRODUCER - Robert Folk has composed and conducted the musical scores for over 65 feature films. His extensive credits include Ace Ventura: When Nature Calls, Nothing To Lose, Tremors, The NeverEnding Story II: The Next Chapter, Toy Soldiers, Police Academy, Kung Pow! Enter the Fist, Boat Trip, Back in the Day, American Pie: Band Camp and Van Wilder 2 and Vivaldi. DIRECTOR - Vladislav Kozlov is an actor, producer, director and scriptwriter., known for DayDreams of Rudolph Valentino (2007).  While he has been in numerous TV and film roles, he is most well known for his role in the upcoming Silent Life, an American silent drama film, which he is set to write, direct and star in, as the famous main character, silent film star Rudolph Valentino.He is a fan of classic film and filmmaking, as well as how the art and people touch others.            Art by Christopher Dennis A Special Occasion VIDEO GREETING by Hollywood Superman.If you've taken a picture with Chris as Superman on Hollywood Blvd over the past two decades post them to our Facebook Page. At the end of the campaign the picture with the most "Likes" will receive a special video hello and thank you from Hollywood Blvd via Facetime or Skype with Chris.Thank you in advance for all of your support and well-wishes. We're looking forward to unveiling the series.

story:
MAKING A DIFFERENCE IN PEORIA

Overview

PEORIA is a romantic dramedy independent television series about the city of Peoria and the people that reside there. We're currently at the pilot stage, and we plan on using it to take the show to series. We've been featured in Peoria area media, most notably WMBD-TV, where we officially announced the show. The show immediately caught the attention of viewers and has been growing in popularity ever since. With all the buzz surrounding our show, and after producing a trailer and wrapping principal photography on a full-length 30 minute pilot, we are now looking to fund the post-production process in order to complete and air the pilot with plans to go to to series soon after! We have assembled a great cast and crew to make it happen. We need your help to fund the next step! Thank you!

https://www.centralillinoisproud.com/news/local...

 https://www.centralillinoisproud.com/news/local...

OFFICIAL TRAILER

 

 

Produced by River City Productions and created in 2015 by Peoria area filmmaker Michael Mcgruder, PEORIA is a lighthearted drama with comedic elements. The show is about the interesting quirks of a mid-western town, and the unique personalities that reside there as told through the perspective of a group of friends who represent different walks of life. PEORIA touches on a number of issues that are both local in nature and universal in appeal including education, health care, and environmental sustainability and regulations. It also explores the difficulties each individual faces in both their personal and professional lives, and how they navigate the conflicts thrown at them, and ultimately become better people for it!

PEORIA was created for a number of reasons, and it's very near and dear to my heart due to the local nature of it. They always say to write what you know, and what I've found is that there is a great deal of material right here in my own backyard. From an entertainment standpoint the potential is clear and we aim to produce a show that not only makes each viewer feel better by the end of the episode, but also touches on hot button issues like the current political landscape, the media industrial complex, and the socioeconomic disparities between different classes while making sure to treat them with the depth and complexity that they deserve.

From an economic standpoint, we plan on buying and shooting locally. We are confident that this will help the Peoria economy by bringing more people to both the immediate area, and to the state of Illinois due to the wide appeal of the show. We are be bringing in talent from all over the country as well as emphasizing our vast local talent. Out-of-town cast and crew members will stay here while shooting and will support our local businesses while in town. 

We are always looking to cast locally and hire crew from the area. We are providing people of all ages and backgrounds who are interested in television production the opportunity to get involved both in front of and behind the camera.

We will also be engaged with the community on a deeply personal level, and will be giving back every opportunity we get.

Born and raised in Peoria, Illinois, local filmmaker Michael Mcgruder has been in show business from a very young age. He wrote his first script at 10 years old, and produced his first play when he was 13. He has been acting, writing, directing and producing in the Peoria area for over twenty years, and plans to continue doing so throughout his career. His most recent production was play called "Once In A While", that succesfully played at the Apollo Theater in downtown Peoria in Spring of 2019. Mcgruder began marinating on his vision for "Peoria" in 2015, and began the casting process in February 2020. This is his most ambitious project yet; and he is so grateful for the cast and crew who have become involved thus far. He is looking forward to showing the world all of the local talent and beauty that comes from his hometown by naming his newest creation, "Peoria", with hopes to forever encapsulate the wealth of material provided by this wonderful city. 

Raynah Unes-Reid began her relationship with the arts at the age of four when she started her dance training. She studied ballet, tap, modern, jazz, hip hop, contemporary, and musical theater dance. She began teaching tap, ballet, and jazz when she was 15 years old. Her first introduction to film was in Jr. High when she attended the “Girls Make Movies” film camp hosted by the Southern Illinois University Carbondale media program for three summers in a row. Over the years, she has performed in multiple musical, ballets, and films, serving as dancer, actor, choreographer, director, and filmmaker. During her time at the University of Illinois at Urbana Champaign, she choreographed the Urbana Park District’s Summer productions of “Thoroughly Modern Millie” and “Suessical”, she was a judge for the Feminist Film Festival, won “Best Non-Narrative Film” in the Golden Corn Film Festival, and won the Research Oral Presentation for the College of Media Research Symposium for her paper titled, “The Ambiguous, The Invisible and The Erotic:  Discovering Sexuality in Buffy the Vampire Slayer”.  She graduated from the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign in 2019 with a Bachelor’s Degree in Media and Cinema Studies on the Dean’s List, as a James Scholar, and with Honors; and completed a minor in Human Development and Family Studies. After graduation,  she solo travelled to Italy to teach English for three months, and then travelled to Morocco and Argentina for three weeks each. Shortly after returning to the United States she heard about the call for “Peoria”, and sent in her resume and headshot expressing her love for acting and her passion for directing. She is now the series director, staff writer and she plays the role of ‘Cassie’ in “Peoria”. She is excited to show the world all of the incredible people and art that comes from the Midwest.

Braxton Angle is an American actor born on July 23rd, 1993 in St. Louis, MO. He graduated high school at MICDS in 2011, and attended Drake University to play Division I college football. He began his acting career after transferring to, and graduating Cum Laude from Miami University of Ohio in 2016. Braxton has performed on the stage and as the lead in multiple short films including 'Sleep', 'Honey and 'Stripped' as well as supporting roles in feature films like 'East Plains: Get Out' and'A New Husband for Christmas'. After serving in a supporting role on Netflix's 'Unsolved Mysteries' in 2019, he will be playing series lead, Tom Daly, in the ensemble dramedy 'Peoria' in the fall of 2020.

Oscar Mansky is a Chicago based actor, and originally from Detroit. He is a graduate of Michigan State University, but decided to stray away from an advertising degree and pursue an acting career. Some of his favorite things include his family, frenchies, country music and his two pet fish; Pinto and Mochi. He’s been in films ranging from Christian teen romances to exciting LGBTQ+ San Francisco comedies. He also hosts a podcast; "What Happenedish Podcast", with his brother Walter. Oscar Mansky plays Danny in ‘Peoria’.

Classically trained at The Theater School at DePaul University in Chicago, Chandler Smith has made the most of his early career, appearing in several theatrical productions throughout the city. Balancing his resume with classical works such as Hamlet, Richard III and the title role in Macbeth and contemporary pieces like Still and Where We’re Born. He also has experience in comedy and satire, performing at the Cornservatory in Nightmares on Lincoln Ave: Slasher High, and in the play that almost was (thanks Covid) Titus Andronikids.

Similar to his on screen counterpart, Chandler currently works as a Preschool teacher. While working with a room full of one-year-olds can be frustrating (and extremely loud), there is nothing more rewarding than seeing a child learn right before your eyes.

Chandler is looking forward to the great adventure he’ll be starting in Peoria this fall becoming a part of the community!

Megan Lipski is very excited to be a part of this fantastic TV show. She got her start in acting by doing theatre from the age of 9 years old. After studying Film Production at NIU, she began to move her acting to the screen. Besides acting, Megan has contributed her skills to the film world by working behind the camera as well. She has worked on many short films as well as many TV shows in Chicago. While stuck at home during quarantine, Megan decided to expand her creativity and turn to writing. Currently she has written two features, and an animated short. She is in the process of working on her fourth script. She would like to thank her family for all their support throughout her career and a big thank you to Michael for giving her this opportunity. She can't wait to share this amazing show with everyone! If you'd like to connect with Megan or find out more about her work, go to www.meganlipski.com.

Megan Mockensturm is an actress currently filming the roles of ‘Karen’ in ‘Peoria’ and ‘Julie’ in ‘Exit, Pursued by a Bear.’ You can see her in her most recent role ‘Riley’ in ‘Horse Camp: A Love Tail’ currently streaming on amazon prime. Her recent stage credits include ‘Maggie’ in ‘Red Herring,’ ‘Stephanie’ in ‘Time of My Life,’ and ‘Claire’ in ‘Proof.’  Megan has also been involved in modeling for 10+ years, most recently training with Coco Rocha in New York. She has been featured in Vogue Italia and on billboards for Churchill Downs. When she is not acting or modeling Megan is pursuing her career as a nurse, volunteering at local events, seeking out ways to fulfill her never-ending wanderlust, or enjoying life’s precious moments with loved ones.

Kerri Rae plays the role of Emily Taylor in Peoria. She grew up in the Peoria area and is excited to be part of a project that highlights the positive aspects of growing up and living in the Midwest; particularly Central Illinois. Kerri Rae has been highly active in the local Peoria theatre community and has performed in several productions primarily at Corn Stock Theatre and Peoria Players Theatre; productions such as Other Desert Cities (CST), Out of Sight, Out of Murder (CST), The Women (PPT), and The Foreigner (CST). She recently wandered into the world of directing and directed The Curious Savage at Corn Stock Theatre. She has also been part of a few local commercials and is now ready to tackle television!  

Joanna Mills is so excited to be creating such a wonderful and rich character as Dr. Samantha Brown on "Peoria". After graduating with a BA in Theatre Arts Performance with a minor in Dance from Saint Mary's University of Minnesota and an MFA from Academy of Art University in San Francisco, Joanna has been working in the Quad City theatre circles and doing commercials in Iowa, Illinois, and Missouri. Her most notable commercials have been for Weekend's Only, based out of St. Louis. She previously worked with Michael McGruder (writer/producer/actor) on his play "Once In A While" that premiered in Peoria in 2019. She is looking forward to working with so many talented people and getting to work on her first series. When not pursuing her love of acting, Joanna can be found relaxing at home with her incredible husband and two cats who think they can get by on cuteness alone. (So far, they are correct).

Mia Katz is the Casting Director for “Peoria” and also plays the role of “Alex”. She is a senior Theatre Performance major at Bradley University from the suburbs of Chicago. In addition to the show, Mia is a voice actor and loves to perform in plays. She is extremely grateful to be granted the opportunities she has and can not wait to see where her career takes her. You can find her on Instagram @thebluecarebear.

Kaitlyn Jackson (she/her) is an avid singer, actor, dancer, and choreographer, and is a 2020 graduate of Ithaca College's BFA Acting program. Some of her past theatre credits include Woman 2 in "Songs for a New World" (IC Master's Project), Juliana in “Hedda Gabler” (IC Mainstage), Kate Murphy in "Titanic: The Musical" (IC Graduate Recital), Player/Catherine u/s in "Pippin" (IC Mainstage), and Swing/Assistant Choreographer for "Violet" (IC Mainstage). She has also served as the Dance/Fight Choreographer for “Oklahoma!” (Norwich Theatre Company), Co-Artistic Director of IC's RockHard Dance Company and has danced with the Daniel Gwirtzman Dance Company. Outside of theatre, Kaitlyn has two albums of original music produced by Grammy Nominee, Kent Wells, and she was featured on Season 13 of American Idol. (For more, please visit Kaitlyn-Jackson.com.)

In order to ensure that we finish in as high quality a way as we shot the pilot we’ll need to do the following:

  • Pay a professional editor to put the show together in the best and most effective way. Editing a TV show is specialized skill that takes years to perfect and using a professional is always worth the investment.
  • Take the raw sound (which was expertly recorded by our great sound recordist Nick Birsa) and turn it into the polished, high quality audio you see on TV shows every day. This requires a Sound Editor to organize the sound, clean it up and add sound effects, a Composer to get the mood right for the music, a Foley Artist so that man made sounds like clothes rustling sound realistic (the audience usually only notices this when it’s missing), bringing our actors back to record ADR because even in the best of conditions dialogue will have to re-recorded and a Re-Recording Mixer to blend all these sounds together so that it sounds great whether you’re watching the show on TV or online.
  • Pay a professional colorist who will take the raw footage (shot in 4k by our amazing Director of Photography Derek Huey) and provide a consistent look that will immediately identify it as Peoria.

We want to thank everyone for your continued interest in and support for the show, this is truly a team effort, and we couldn't be doing this without you!

story:
Summary

Harbor City tells the story of 6 high school juniors--much like all of us are or have been--and the unexpected football coach that changes their world. You'll recognize a little of yourself in Charlie Fuller, an aspiring filmmaker and the small but determined varsity quarterback--Hailey, his cheerleader best friend--Damian, his troubled cousin--Lamar, a transfer student with a mysterious past--Blake, the nerdy tech wiz and camera man--and Britney, the preppy class president and ruling journalism queen.  Teenage drama rears it's head on a regular basis...and when Hailey's mom steps in as the teams football coach, things get even trickier. But our heroes face their challenges and, ultimately, become stronger.  Together. 

What makes us different?

Harbor City is a teen drama that keeps it real with characters and situations that you can relate to.  Shows such as Supernatural or Teen Wolf may be similar, but Harbor City’s story lines are filled with real issues facing teens today.  Whether it's dealing with a mental illness, choosing between parents or anything in between, Harbor City will give you somebody or something to root for and leave you hungry for the next episode.

The Team

Writer – Justin Fernandez

Justin Fernandez is a Writer/Director/Actor based out of Ventura County. After starting development on Harbor City back in February of 2014, Justin and his writing team consisting of Kendrick Surrell and Justin Benavides have allowed this concept to grow into something special and bigger than they ever imagined. After directing the proof of concept film, Justin made the decision to hand over the directing reigns to Kaneeka Patel in order to focus on bringing the character of Charlie Fuller to life.

Director – Kaneeka Patel

Kaneeka Patel is a talented filmmaker from India, who is currently studying here in the United States. With her portfolio filled with romantic and realistic character driven Drama’s, Kaneeka’s skill set perfectly fits the mold of what we’re creating on "Harbor City". After looking over her impact and involvement with the Harbor City proof of concept film, she was the clear choice to take the helm of Harbor City’s Pilot episode.

Production Manager – Melanie Wick

Melanie Wick is a filmmaker from Southern Illinois. As a Production Manager, she is on top of her game paying attention to every detail and makes sure all things are in order. She utilizes this skill set to make her a top notch 2nd AC.

Director of Photography - Chukey Man

After one look at Chukey’s Demo reel. You will immediately recognize the talent and the knack for cinematography that he has. With him leading the camera team, the visual storytelling for Harbor City will be second to none.

 

The Cast

Charlie Fuller  - Justin Fernandez

Justin Michael Fernandez was born in Downey, CA in 1994. Filmmaking has always been his passion. Acting wasn't originally in the plan for Justin until he filmed Dark Consequences in 2012 and took on the role of Dylan McGroarty. Since then, he’s made cameos and has had small roles in several films. When casting for Harbor City began, co- writer and fellow actor Kendrick Surrell thought that Justin was a perfect fit for the lead role and now is taking on the challenge of playing Charlie Fuller on "Harbor City."

Hailey Gibson – Veronica Faller

Veronica was born and raised in Traverse City, Michigan in a music-oriented family.  As a professional actor now based in Los Angeles, she has worked both on stage and in film. She graduated from the New York Film Academy in September and has done professional film work with Practical Productions, and has performed in an assortment of films and commercials.

.

Damian Butler – Steven Padilla

Steven Padilla is another actor from the Ventura county area. Steven is a life guard by trade but an actor at heart.  Steven was cast as John Riggs in the 2015 remake of Justin Fernandez's Dark Consequences. Although his resume is limited, he as proven to be a natural in front of the camera expressing a vast range of emotions and the ability to deliver lines perfectly.

Lamar Stevens – Kendrick Surrell

Kendrick Marquis Ushera-Surrell was born in Atlanta, Georgia in 1995. Kendrick has been writing since he was 5. He started writing songs and poetry. When he reached his teens he started to write scripts including several episodes for Harbor City. He also wrote A Director's Vision, a short film soon to be released.  Kendrick continues writing for "Harbor City" as well as writing scripts for student directors.

Blake Montgomery – Declan Minnis

Declan is an agreeable person who loves television and movies, running and tennis. He has a positive outlook on life and a healthy head of hair. Declan was born in Atlanta, Georgia but now calls Santa Barbara home. He is currently attending SBCC where he is studying psychology. His goal is to obtain a PHD in Clinical Psychology.

Britney Harrington – Linda Maria Grión

Guatemalan-American actor, playwright, and musician, Linda Maria Girón is a graduate of UC Berkeley where she received a BA in Theatre, Dance and Performance Studies (2017). Linda has worked on a variety of theatrical productions in the Bay Area. In addition to acting, Linda also studies playwriting under Philip Kan Gotanda and is producing a workshop for her play, "Memoria del Silencio en el País de la Eterna Primavera" (2017).

Michelle Gibson – Mary Fernandez

Mary Gil Fernandez was born in Havana, Cuba and has loved performing ever since she can remember. For the past several years, Mary has been involved in independent films,  Along with acting, which is her favorite time on set, she has been production manager, part of the sound, light and prop crew as well as script supervisor and script editor in various shorts.

 

Why We Need Help?

Lights, Cameras, Locations, Permits, Insurance, Crafty, Travel Expenses. These are just some of the costs of creating a Film/TV-Web Series.

We are trying to capture the true essence of life in high school. That means filming at a real high school, filling the halls and class rooms with students and faculty. Not to mention with football being a big aspect if this series, showing an authentic Friday night experience with our players being lead by the first female high school head football coach in the state. 

Bringing Harbor City to life is not an easy task. However, with your help we know it can be done.

 

Good Things Come When You Help.

We have a great selection of perks to choose from. They are listed on the right side of this page.  $15 gets your access to our Behind the Scenes Snapchat account. $75 is our game ball package that gives you one of the footballs used while filming autographed by Mary Fernandez, Justin Fernandez and Kendrick Surrell. $200 is our Ultimate Harbor High Fan Package. With this you get a customized Harbor High Admirals football Jersey as well as an on set autographed football. These are just a highlighted few. We also have some Early Bird Specials so check them all out soon before they're gone for good!

Also, if you like what you see, please comment and share.

Where to find us?

You can find us online here:
story_txt: SummaryHarbor City tells the story of 6 high school juniors--much like all of us are or have been--and the unexpected football coach that changes their world. You'll recognize a little of yourself in Charlie Fuller, an aspiring filmmaker and the small but determined varsity quarterback--Hailey, his cheerleader best friend--Damian, his troubled cousin--Lamar, a transfer student with a mysterious past--Blake, the nerdy tech wiz and camera man--and Britney, the preppy class president and ruling journalism queen.  Teenage drama rears it's head on a regular basis...and when Hailey's mom steps in as the teams football coach, things get even trickier. But our heroes face their challenges and, ultimately, become stronger.  Together. What makes us different?Harbor City is a teen drama that keeps it real with characters and situations that you can relate to.  Shows such as Supernatural or Teen Wolf may be similar, but Harbor City’s story lines are filled with real issues facing teens today.  Whether it's dealing with a mental illness, choosing between parents or anything in between, Harbor City will give you somebody or something to root for and leave you hungry for the next episode.The TeamWriter – Justin FernandezJustin Fernandez is a Writer/Director/Actor based out of Ventura County. After starting development on Harbor City back in February of 2014, Justin and his writing team consisting of Kendrick Surrell and Justin Benavides have allowed this concept to grow into something special and bigger than they ever imagined. After directing the proof of concept film, Justin made the decision to hand over the directing reigns to Kaneeka Patel in order to focus on bringing the character of Charlie Fuller to life.Director – Kaneeka PatelKaneeka Patel is a talented filmmaker from India, who is currently studying here in the United States. With her portfolio filled with romantic and realistic character driven Drama’s, Kaneeka’s skill set perfectly fits the mold of what we’re creating on "Harbor City". After looking over her impact and involvement with the Harbor City proof of concept film, she was the clear choice to take the helm of Harbor City’s Pilot episode.Production Manager – Melanie WickMelanie Wick is a filmmaker from Southern Illinois. As a Production Manager, she is on top of her game paying attention to every detail and makes sure all things are in order. She utilizes this skill set to make her a top notch 2nd AC.Director of Photography - Chukey ManAfter one look at Chukey’s Demo reel. You will immediately recognize the talent and the knack for cinematography that he has. With him leading the camera team, the visual storytelling for Harbor City will be second to none. The CastCharlie Fuller  - Justin FernandezJustin Michael Fernandez was born in Downey, CA in 1994. Filmmaking has always been his passion. Acting wasn't originally in the plan for Justin until he filmed Dark Consequences in 2012 and took on the role of Dylan McGroarty. Since then, he’s made cameos and has had small roles in several films. When casting for Harbor City began, co- writer and fellow actor Kendrick Surrell thought that Justin was a perfect fit for the lead role and now is taking on the challenge of playing Charlie Fuller on "Harbor City."Hailey Gibson – Veronica FallerVeronica was born and raised in Traverse City, Michigan in a music-oriented family.  As a professional actor now based in Los Angeles, she has worked both on stage and in film. She graduated from the New York Film Academy in September and has done professional film work with Practical Productions, and has performed in an assortment of films and commercials..Damian Butler – Steven PadillaSteven Padilla is another actor from the Ventura county area. story:
Thou Shall Not - a student project

 

I'm Camilo Nazar, a film student working on my senior thesis and would love and appreciate some help! We are starting this campaign to raise funds so my team and I can have the budget and opportunity to film our pilot.

The production of this first episode would allow me have a tangible way to reference the direction Thou Shall Not would take to possible future backers and distributors for the rest of the season.

 

A few things are needed to film the pilot:

  • Transportation for cast and crew
  • Meals for cast and crew during production
  • Props
  • Actors
  • Promotional photoshoot
  • Locations
  • Festival submission fees

 

The goal

The ultimate goal of making something like Thou Shall Not is to birth an online venue for content geared towards queer people, created by queer people. Allowing LGBTQ individuals from all backgrounds to share their stories is a huge passion of mine. I believe Thou Shall Not could give me the opportunity to start a series of narrative and vlog-oriented videos that make every voice in the community count.

story:
About our Project

Today eager audiences demand content that emotionally connects them with stories of adventure, action, and nostalgia. Kindness Kills offers audiences characters they can relate with, wish to be like, and reminisce about in a simpler, more colorful  time. Loss and redemption drive the arc of the story line, us vs. them.

 

Who we are...

David Medansky, a former divorce attorney, is a world-class expert at playing casino craps, a multi-international, award-winning, bestselling author, and Founder of 21-Day Jumpstart Weight Loss Program. This project, “Kindness Kills” is based on his novel, “Dark Money.”

Richard Crawford Producer, Writer, Director, Filmmaker, Author, CEO One Productions is a three-time Emmy Award-Winning producer-director. His multi-faceted career encompasses the Amusement business, filmmaking, and TV programming.

His feature film, Captain Milkshake, about the Vietnam War era, was recently featured as a special guest screening at Viennale, Rotterdam, Chicago, New York Underground, and Leeds London International Film Festivals.

Richard produced the first metaphysical television program, ONE, that aired internationally to millions and won two Emmy Awards.

What We Need & What You Get

We need your generosity to fund our project. Funds will be used for our “Show Bible” and to fund our efforts to connect with a “Showrunner” to pitch our project to Executives at HBO, Netflix, Amazon, Hulu, AMC, USA, and other channels. The funds will also be used for pre-production casting, selecting crew, location searching, legal representation, and operating capital.

Risks & Challenges

As with anything, there is no guarantee that our project will be picked up by any film or TV executives in the industry. However, with the guidance and expertise of Richard Crawford's knowledge of the film industry, we have an excellent opportunity to successfully pitch to top executives at various studios. For updates to the project go to  https://kindnesskillsproduction.com/

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand some people are unable to contribute. However, you can still help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Also, be sure to use the Indiegogo share tools.

With much gratitude, thank you so much for doing this for us.

For updates to the project go to https://kindnesskillsproduction.com/

story:
Short Summary

AESOP Episodic Series
The year is 3021. A millennia after the nuclear holocaust. Earth has reverted to a second dark age. What’s left of humanity wars among itself, threatening the extinction of mankind. Vision tells of a gifted seer, the boy Aesop who some count as daft. He must be brought to the king, his council heeded, or all will be irrevocably lost.

-----

Hi, I’m Julie-Anne Liechty, the creator of AESOP. Three years ago, we started filming the pilot for this post-apocalyptic medieval series, starring a high-functioning autistic boy in the title role. The story is about this boy who must prove himself as a great seer, despite his seeming challenges, and unite a deeply divided world that is on the brink of utter destruction, in a decimated land ruined by the foolishness of their ancestors. 

Why have we waited three years to finish it? Lack of funds and energy and I had some pretty serious health issues that had to be overcome.

But now we are back and have been filming like crazy for the last several months. We have just two scenes left to shoot (a tavern scene and a scene in a palace) and need your help to get them done. We have been doing everything on a shoestring budget and want to rent two spectacular locations for those last two scenes. So we are reaching out to you!

Become a part of the AESOP family and help this epic tale find its way to millions.

Roque (Lenni Uitto), Am'Celeena (Julie-Anne Liechty) and Nessa (Deven Sky)

 

Here is the script for the tavern scene: 

Petris Na'Varr (Chase Elwood) at his scrying table.

 

And this is the script for the palace scene: 

 

Aesop (Jaxson Fisher) and his mother Aria (Amy Arburn)

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our plan is:

Finish the pilot and the scripts for the entire first season which will include ten 45-min to 60-min episodes. Then pitch the project to a streaming company in hopes of it getting picked up and fully produced.

To finish the pilot, we need $5,500. This will cover the costs of the two locations (see below for pictures), plus get insurance to film at them and help with set dressings and more costumes because we’d like to have a lot a background actors. All of these things will boost production value which will make our project more appealing to larger production companies.

We’ve done the math – if 270 people contribute $20 each, we’ll have reached our goal!

Expenses Broken Down:

Rental of The Crooked Tavern at Evermore
Rental of the Provo Courthouse
Insurance fees
Costume and set dressing:
Indiegogo’s cut
Total

Location 1 - The Crooked Lantern Tavern at Evermore

 

Location 2 - The Historic Courthouse in Provo

 

What you’ll get: (see Perks below) Depending on the amount of your contribution, you will get the following – a personal thank you in the credits, a chance to spend time with a Friesian stallion, an exclusive copy of the finished pilot, being a featured extra in one of the scenes, and even getting a character named after you!

Bandis (Noah Kershisnik) and Roque (Lenni Uitto)

The Impact

Your support of our project will make all the difference!

The story of AESOP is about ending divisiveness, uniting humanity, overcoming what many think of as insurmountable challenges. It has the potential to touch the lives of millions, encourage and inspire them to carry on despite increasingly difficult times. And it’s highly entertaining. You will be bringing that to the world!

You will also be helping to grow the force of filmmaking here in Utah – in the United States – in the “outside of Hollywood” arena. The more we create here, the more we contribute to and strengthen the world’s film community.

Aesop (Jaxson Fisher), Roque (Lenni Uitto), Scrap (Lorenzo Silva), Beauty (Sam Huntsman), Bandis (Stunt double and horse wrangler Jared Gray). Horses: Odin, Arthur, Bane and Rowdy

Risks & Challenges

Risks: Filmmaking is risky. What if we fall flat on our face? Get turned down by Netflix and everyone else? What if we don’t meet our funding goal? All we can do is try. We believe in this story and in this project and we believe others will fall in love with it too. And if we don’t meet our funding goals, we’ll still finish the pilot as we are wizards at spinning straw into gold.

Challenges: Our biggest challenge with AESOP is connecting to production companies that have the capital to get the series fully produced. We have a few possible leads but are looking for guidance and assistance with that aspect of the production. We are open to any other possibilities.

The Necromancer Lord Gear Na'Varr (Robert Scott Smith)

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute financially at this time there are other ways you can help us.

Spread the word! Send this out to everyone on your email list. Put this link on your IG, FB, Twitter accounts. Blast it on TikTok.

Let us know if you have any connections/leads with Netflix, Disney+, Hulu, etc. Maybe you know someone who knows someone we could get this in front of.

If you live in the area and have access to costumes, set dressings or fabric let us know. We could use all of those.

Thank you!

Thank you!

story:
Hey there!

Ruthy Froch (NYU/Tisch Drama) and Stephanie Spector (CU Boulder) came together to create (im)mature because we were sick of the same old, unrealistic television portrayals of young people in New York City.  We want to portray the real lives of diverse young people in the big apple, in the way that shows before us have missed the mark.   We are committed to telling the real stories of diverse young people struggling to find themselves, which we hope will resonate both with our peers while also appealing to audiences of every age.  

We are operating on a shoestring budget but there are some expenses that are unavoidable.  We need help funding production costs such as equipment rentals, location fees, and (a little) compensation for our artists. Your help would be an enormous gift to our project and to creating this story, which we believe will be just as important to our peers as it is to us.

What you can do and what you can get* (hint: *prezzies!)

A Closer Look:

  • To be a bit more specific, we are looking to raise 7,000 dollars to produce and film our first seven episodes of (im)mature which would culminate in the completion of our first season. (YAY!) So to break it down thats 7,000 dollars, 7 episodes, 1,000 dollars per episode.
  • Your help, if we are lucky enough to have it, would help us pay for equipment fees and rentals, location fees, helping to keep (im)mature series on its feet and alive, and most importantly paying our fantastic crew and artists who are contributing to and helping to create this story.
  • We have several exciting perks in return for your generous contribution, including a day on set, a night out with the cast, and a storyline or character you want to tell included on the show!
  • We are committed to creating this project, regardless of whether we reach our goal. If we do not reach our goal, we will have to make do with what we get--that would mean: our sound quality would be significantly lower making outdoor shots & crowded indoor shots, we would not be able to compensate our artists, we would have to lower our quality of equipment rentals, and have difficulty finding a quality cinematographer who would have to spend ample amounts of time for little to no compensation. HOWEVER, with your help we can reach our goal and create a series with as high quality and low budget as possible!

Wait, why should I care?

We believe there is a disparity in the way life in your 20's in New York City is portrayed and what it is like to actually live that life:

  • It is important for people to see themselves reflected in the art and media they consume.  When people see their stories, struggles and successes being portrayed on TV, they feel validated in their experiences and know that they are not alone.  
  • Being female writers, creators, producers, comedians, we are committed to involving as many female filmmakers as possible in the production of (im)mature. AND with the help of our other series regulars Sergio King and Tyler Jimenez we are working to create diverse characters and stories.
  • Although, Ruthy minored in producing at NYU/Tisch and has produced several theatrical ventures and has created and edited some of her own film content, this her first venture in creating something on this scale. We understand the risk in donating in our project, considering this is a new experience for both of us, which is why we added Cici Sutter to our producing and creative team. She is currently studying film at NYU and has extensive experience in ventures just like ours! We assure you that we have done our research and are equally inspired and committed to see this project to it's fullest potential.

Help me I'm poor, what else can I do?

Just because you don't have the funds (believe me we've all been there) doesn't mean you can't contribute!

Here are some ways you can help a sistah out:

  • SPREAD THE WORD! Just because you can't donate doesn't mean you don't know anyone who may want to contribute. Use the Indiegogo tools and share our campaign. It takes a village, ya know?
  • Give us a like, follow, retweet, share on ALL of the social media!
  • MOST IMPORTANTLY: don't forget to keep an eye out and watch our show! Subscribe, share it with your friends, let us know what you think, share your (im)mature story with us!

To be a bit more specific, we are looking to raise 7,000 dollars to produce and film our first seven episodes of (im)mature which would culminate in the completion of our first season. (YAY!) So to break it down thats 7,000 dollars, 7 episodes, 1,000 dollars per episode.
Your help, if we are lucky enough to have it, would help us pay for equipment fees and rentals, location fees, helping to keep (im)mature series on its feet and alive, and most importantly paying our fantastic crew and artists who are contributing to and helping to create this story.
We have several exciting perks in return for your generous contribution, including a day on set, a night out with the cast, and a storyline or character you want to tell included on the show!
We are committed to creating this project, regardless of whether we reach our goal. If we do not reach our goal, we will have to make do with what we get--that would mean: our sound quality would be significantly lower making outdoor shots & crowded indoor shots, we would not be able to compensate our artists, we would have to lower our quality of equipment rentals, and have difficulty finding a quality cinematographer who would have to spend ample amounts of time for little to no compensation. HOWEVER, with your help we can reach our goal and create a series with as high quality and low budget as possible!


Wait, why should I care?
We believe there is a disparity in the way life in your 20's in New York City is portrayed and what it is like to actually live that life:

It is important for people to see themselves reflected in the art and media they consume.  When people see their stories, struggles and successes being portrayed on TV, they feel validated in their experiences and know that they are not alone.  
Being female writers, creators, producers, comedians, we are committed to involving as many female filmmakers as possible in the production of (im)mature. AND with the help of our other series regulars Sergio King and Tyler Jimenez we are working to create diverse characters and stories.
Although, Ruthy minored in producing at NYU/Tisch and has produced several theatrical ventures and has created and edited some of her own film content, this her first venture in creating something on this scale. We understand the risk in donating in our project, considering this is a new experience for both of us, which is why we added Cici Sutter to our producing and creative team. She is currently studying film at NYU and has extensive experience in ventures just like ours! We assure you that we have done our research and are equally inspired and committed to see this project to it's fullest potential.

Help me I'm poor, what else can I do?

Just because you don't have the funds (believe me we've all been there) doesn't mean you can't contribute!
Here are some ways you can help a sistah out:

SPREAD THE WORD! Just because you can't donate doesn't mean you don't know anyone who may want to contribute. Use the Indiegogo tools and share our campaign. It takes a village, ya know?
Give us a like, follow, retweet, share on ALL of the social media!
MOST IMPORTANTLY: don't forget to keep an eye out and watch our show! Subscribe, share it with your friends, let us know what you think, share your (im)mature story with us!

story:
Hook-Ups is a show that explores modern dating practices. In a culture obsessed with online dating, swiping left, Netflix and chill and casual hook-ups, how does one find love? While most shows about dating feature young, white twenty-somethings, Hook-ups, showcases people from all backgrounds.

Hook-Ups is a five-episode comedic series with standalone episodes. However, a character from the previous episode introduces us to a character in the next episode. 

 

Episode Overview

Episode 1

Sheila, a divorced 50-year old woman goes on her first date since the divorce. This time, with a woman

Episode 2

A casual hook-up after the club brings drama to Reese life after she discovers that she may have slept with her new beau’s brother.

Episode 3

Brianna is an overweight, confident chocolate woman on a date with the outspoken Tyson. Will his big mouth ruin their date before it even begins?

Episode 4

Jonah, a trans-man and the woman he’s dating have sex for the first time.

Episode 5

Rashad, a gay man is determined to find love and a relationship, but will his cute date foil his plan to stop casual hook-ups.

 

Hook-Ups features a few familiar faces. Episode one features prominent lesbian actress, Milon V Parker. She was the co-star in my first film, Kismet. 

 

Director: Arnetta Randall

I am graduate of the University of Illinois with a degree in creative writing. I've written, directed and produced two short films. My first film, Kismet has been accepted to multiple film festivals. Kismet has also been featured in multiple publications including Afropunk, Loud magazine and Curve magazine.

Hook-Ups features a few familiar faces. Episode one features prominent lesbian actress, Milon V Parker. She was the co-star in my first film, Kismet. 

 

Hook-Ups Timeline

Production for Hook-Ups is completed in February. 

Post-Production for Hook-Ups is completed by April 2018. 

Hook-Ups is slated to be released late May 2018. 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Every share to social media goes a long way. The more people that see this campaign, the more likely, I'll reach my goal. 

 

Thank you for being apart of Hook-Ups!

story:
Hi there, we hope you like our idea. Following on from our award nominated sketch show The Age of Enlightenment, we're keen to bring a fresh new comedy show that will get everyone laughing - whether you're a football enthusiast or not. We made great progress with the sketch show, opening doors and getting people talking about us. Now we need to demonstrate that we can make a traditional hit sitcom, consisting of core characters in familiar settings. This project is an introduction to how we can bring those sort of characters into the world.

Now to introduce ourselves. We're Ben, Daryll and Kyle and we write, perform and produce comedy. We've come from different backgrounds, but we all share one unique passion for the genre. Here's a bit about us individually:

Bios

Ben Kent has loads of experience in making people laugh. He has written and directed a number of award winning short films, music videos and adverts, specialising in comedy. He has also won an Academy Award for his work in VFX. After the success of his short horror comedy Love Bug (which played at over 50 festivals and was picked up for worldwide distribution), Ben has recently gone on to write and direct his first feature film, F.U.B.A.R., starring, amongst others, comedy legend Mark Heap.

Kyle Eaton has written and performed in several comedy troupes that have toured all over the UK, including two appearances at the Edinburgh Fringe Festival. Funny or Die commissioned two sketches for him, which comedy legend Matt Lucas directed resulting in hundreds of thousands of views across various online platforms. He worked with Ben on their award nominated online sketch show 'The Age of Enlightenment', which they created together. The show reached hundreds of thousands of viewers, picking up frequent coverage on Funny or Die, features in The Huffington Post and The British Comedy Guide and gathered many fans from the UK and US. He was also one of TV Gold's Christmas Cracker Joke of the Year award winners in 2017. 

Daryll James is a writer and performer who has worked on many film and TV treatments, submitting concepts to various institutions including Writers Room and Blaps, he likes to seize every opportunity. He formed a company with Kyle at college, and together they have made TV tasters, performed live shows up and down the country including two stints at the Edinburgh Fringe and devised plays and workshops. They are close friends and the warmth they have for eachother off screen is very much evident on screen as well.

What does this mean to us?

Everything - this campaign is so very important to all three of us, as we so want to follow up our work to date with the best possible show we can. We genuinely feel Off the Ball is ripe for TV, and we just need to get commissioners' attention with it. By creating the best looking, best sounding and best written web series we can we don't see any reason why we can't continue the upward trend set with our past projects and grow it further.

What We Need & What You Get

So we're looking to raise £2500. This amount will allow us to shoot nine web episodes - three stories for each character.

This money will pay for the hire of camera, light and sound equipment. It will cover the expenses of all the cast and crew. It will help us secure the best locations, giving our characters a world to live in.

If we can't raise the full amount, every penny will go towards helping us realise our collective dream of making the best new comedy web series we can.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't in a position to help us out financially, that's fine. But if you like the idea then please help to get the word out and make some noise about Off the Ball. Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Short Summary

Last One Out: The Blackout Files is an action/adventure series that will be shot in a style similar to 80's action films.  It will follow a team of federal agents as they take on cases that have been abandoned by other agencies due to repeated failures to apprehend the high level offenders.

This campaign is for funding to make and release the pilot episode.  More info to come.

Thank you!

This campaign is for funding to make and release the pilot episode.  More info to come.Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

A dying man, woman too insignificant to change anything (or so she thought, of course) and only 107 years between them. A time travel and 'forbidden' romance after, a question appears - if a painter can indeed save the man she loves, what will be the price they'll have to pay?

​

This heartwarming romantic comedy mini-series will invite you on the journey not only through time but into a storm of emotions that the main character, Emma Luthain, a shy and low-esteemed painter from 1910 goes through after being suddenly transported into present time, with no way of knowing what became of her friend and her ill daughter. 

'Rescued' by Shawn Truid, eager to help her get back to her time, she is continuously shocked by the changes that happened through the century, while definitely being relieved that it was Shawn who found her after the jump to 2017. All would be nice and rosy, they'd fall in love with each other and forget all about the time travel... Well, they do fall in love with each other, but there's no chance for a 'happily ever after' - Shawn is dying for an untreatable genetical illness. Emma seems to be hopeless, as her only skill - painting - cannot save him. Or could it?

 

About Me & The Production Preparation

For the last 7 years I was learning how to make movies, and apart from a heap of screenplays that I deemed not worthy of production, I made these three short films:

 

And of course, I spent big part of that time on preparing 'Skipping Tomorrows', as there's a lot of work to get a mini-series ready for production. I came as far as my own work can take me, but to get great people on my team costs, as does the wardrobe, props, securing the locations and bringing the actors from outside the Yukon. It doesn't come as a surprise to me and I saved up as much as I could ($2,500) but it still leaves me with $3,500 to gather.

In the film world it is really little, but still, I cannot make this episode without that. If you are such an amazing person that you will support this campaign, you help us bring the production closer to reality and you will help us convince private investors (that we'll be turning to after this campaign) 'yes, there are people who want to watch this series'.

And most of all, when you will help us make this first episode of 'Skipping Tomorrows', you bring us so much closer to producing the whole series as well! After watching our awesome pilot episode, who wouldn't want to help us make the rest? But for now all we have is a bunch of papers (very important for the production, but just papers nonetheless) and a promise that we'll do all in our power to make this series the best it can be. 

So, what say you? Will you join us on our adventure?

What We Need & What You Get

The first episode has many extra needs some of the latter won't - there will be other characters beside the main trio, all of them dressed for the Edwardian era, and we will need to rent three locations.

The total budget equals $6,085, I'm able to cover $2,560, the remaining $3,525 I hope to receive from this campaign, private investors, a broadcasting license and maybe a rebate from the airlines. Here is a basic breakdown of the budget:

Cast: $1,240

Crew: $700 

Locations: $635

Food: $490

Transportation (travel costs for Laura and Delana): &1,600

Wardrobe: $1,420 

 

Now, let's get to the perks:

You'll get the pleasure and privilege of watching this episode as soon as it's finished already for $1 pledge, and we'll keep you updated on how it's going along the way.

If you really like the hair band Minnie will be wearing in this episode, we can add it to your movie for $3 (1 for the episode access, 1 for shipment & 1 for the bow - if you want more of the headbands, add $1 each and let us know) Each bow is 6cm (2 1/3") x 3cm (1 1/3").

Another little something we made for you is this small (1.5cm - 1/2") flower pendant for $4 (including shipment and episode access), you can choose between silver and golden frame.

And more detailed cameo pendant (size 2.5cm - 1") for $6, including shipping and episode access.

 

For some of the extras I prepared handmade ribbon flowers, and if you'd like one, you can have it for $5, plus $5 for shipping. The first one pledging chooses which flower they want. Flower size is approx. 7cm (3")

 

For $7 you'll get the access to the whole series.

You love to play jigsaw puzzles? Let us send you one for $25 to remind you that you can be victorious today.

You can also get this exceptional cameo with ostrich plumes pin for $25 + shipment. The cameo size is 6cm (2 1/3") x 4 (1 1/2") and 20cm (8") feathers.

Do you want a special video about your hobby or family? I can make it for you for $250 (includes pre-production, shooting and editing)

 

Did we forget anything? Let us know if you'd like something else!

Risks & Challenges

It is challenging to take on a project more difficult and complicated than the previous one, but what is life without a challenge every now and then?

I prepared as much as I could during the pre-production, so there will be no setbacks due to negligence, but there are still risks no one can eradicate simply by preparation: someone from the crew or cast could get sick for example, causing delay, a need to reschedule and a budget increase. Or we may not be able to acquire matching funds in time, which would force us to postpone shooting.

Other Ways You Can Help

Right now your friends may be sitting in their homes, scrolling their social media, thinking 'Oh how I'd love to help someone make a romantic time-travel mini-series about a shy painter'. Maybe not exactly, but who knows? Click one of the share buttons (or all of them, why not?) at the top of this page and save their day!

story:
As COVID-19 spread, a group of filmmakers and storytellers from 22 countries did what filmmakers do.  They grabbed their cameras to capture the lives and stories around them.  Stories of suffering, isolation, struggle and coping.  And also stories of kindness and moments of unexpected joy.  

SANATIONE: A Time For Healing

 

ABOUT THE CREATORS  

I’m Evelyn Seubert, the co-creator of SANATIONE.  My life’s dream was to work with young people in the visual arts, specifically film and video.  And that’s what I’ve been doing for the last 21 years.  In 2006, I co-founded the International Youth Media Summit (IYMS) whose goal is to bring young international filmmakers together to bring positive change to the world through collaborative media projects. Every year IYMS hosts our annual Summit in a different country.  We were scheduled to meet in Croatia in July 2020, but the pandemic forced the Summit online. By then our SANATIONE filmmakers were already working across borders.  Co-creator Anne Drecktrah had organized folks with cellphones in the U.S. and co-creator Sapan Hamal and I organized filmmakers in other countries.  

THE SERIES

SANATIONE is a web series of 15-minute videos that are inspired by the drastic impact of Covid-19.  We have recruited over 30 filmmakers from 22 countries, including Bangladesh, Croatia, Egypt, Ghana, India, Iran, Israel, Italy, Lebanon, Myanmar, Nigeria, Pakistan, Peru, Sweden and the USA. Our team firmly believes we can have a positive impact from such a negative event.  That is who we are. 

SANATIONE will revolve around the main themes that have emerged during the pandemic:

Helping Hands: medical workers, health care professionals, food suppliers and refugee advocates.

Fighting for Change: worldwide protests demanding an end to injustice.

Mother Nature: climate change, food sources, indigenous wisdom, paths to healing.

Generations: the impact on youth, the elderly, education and jobs.

Healing through the Arts: music, dance, theater and the visual arts.

We know that the pandemic will evolve; vaccines will eventually be distributed. This is a fluid situation and SANATIONE will evolve along with it. The filmmakers themselves are often at the center of our stories. One of our filmmakers in Lebanon, Rola, filmed both the protests against the government and the pandemic that surrounded her. Farhad spent six weeks in the COVID ward of an Iranian hospital to get the story of Atefeh, a nurse battling the disease.  As we get all of our filmmakers ramped up, the Webisodes will be released on a regular basis. 

What we need…

All contributions will move us forward to our goal of making short videos that will give us worldwide perspectives on how people are coping with the pandemic.  We are also using this moment to reveal the possibilities – asking young people, elders, scientists and experts how we can heal the world and ourselves. 

Everyone has been working hard this year, filming end editing episodes to release on the SANATIONE website.  So far, we are all volunteers because we believe in this endeavor so much.  However, funds will help us not only pay our young filmmakers and editors, they will help us pay for the production expenses. We think that maybe, just maybe, the episodes will affect individual lives by offering them hope and the encouragement to engage.

We want to raise $15,000 towards our budget.  This is partial funding but will go a long way in making our project come alive.  We are keeping our budget tight and virtually everyone will be working for very little.  This speaks to our entire team’s dedication to SANATIONE.

What you get…

A passion project like ours, one that aims to contribute to the good of mankind, is forgoing merchandise.  We have a website, a Facebook page and the shows themselves in which to include your name, your photo, your personal dedication and credits, all depending upon the level of your contribution.  WE WANT TO MAKE YOU FRONT AND CENTER!  Every dollar helps.  SANATIONE began with a contribution from UNESCO that got us off our feet and moving.  Let the race continue!

Below is a link to the IYMS website which will give you an opportunity to see other projects from IYMS and the episodes as they roll out.  Let’s give these incredible, dedicated and good-hearted young people a chance.  Please tell them that you believe in what they are doing.  We adore them so much.  They are some of the world’s most precious citizens.

https://iyms.org

Episode 1: Defenders

 

Episode 2: I Can't Breathe - Part 1

 

Episode 3: What's Going On

 

FYI:

This is a low-risk project.  Episodes are now being shot or are finished and posted.

If you can’t contribute to the campaign, please watch our episodes and spread the word as much as you can.  We all know the power of Social Media and Indiegogo has some great sharing tools.

OUR SINCERE THANKS!

I’m Evelyn Seubert, the co-creator of SANATIONE.  My life’s dream was to work with young people in the visual arts, specifically film and video.  And that’s what I’ve been doing for the last 21 years.  In 2006, I co-founded the International Youth Media Summit (IYMS) whose goal is to bring young international filmmakers together to bring positive change to the world through collaborative media projects. Every year IYMS hosts our annual Summit in a different country.  We were scheduled to meet in Croatia in July 2020, but the pandemic forced the Summit online. By then our SANATIONE filmmakers were already working across borders.  Co-creator Anne Drecktrah had organized folks with cellphones in the U.S. and co-creator Sapan Hamal and I organized filmmakers in other countries.  
THE SERIES
SANATIONE is a web series of 15-minute videos that are inspired by the drastic impact of Covid-19.  We have recruited over 30 filmmakers from 22 countries, including Bangladesh, Croatia, Egypt, Ghana, India, Iran, Israel, Italy, Lebanon, Myanmar, Nigeria, Pakistan, Peru, Sweden and the USA. Our team firmly believes we can have a positive impact from such a negative event.  That is who we are. 

SANATIONE will revolve around the main themes that have emerged during the pandemic:
Helping Hands: medical workers, health care professionals, food suppliers and refugee advocates.Fighting for Change: worldwide protests demanding an end to injustice.Mother Nature: climate change, food sources, indigenous wisdom, paths to healing.Generations: the impact on youth, the elderly, education and jobs.Healing through the Arts: music, dance, theater and the visual arts.We know that the pandemic will evolve; vaccines will eventually be distributed. This is a fluid situation and SANATIONE will evolve along with it. The filmmakers themselves are often at the center of our stories. One of our filmmakers in Lebanon, Rola, filmed both the protests against the government and the pandemic that surrounded her. Farhad spent six weeks in the COVID ward of an Iranian hospital to get the story of Atefeh, a nurse battling the disease.  As we get all of our filmmakers ramped up, the Webisodes will be released on a regular basis. What we need…All contributions will move us forward to our goal of making short videos that will give us worldwide perspectives on how people are coping with the pandemic.  We are also using this moment to reveal the possibilities – asking young people, elders, scientists and experts how we can heal the world and ourselves. Everyone has been working hard this year, filming end editing episodes to release on the SANATIONE website.  So far, we are all volunteers because we believe in this endeavor so much.  However, funds will help us not only pay our young filmmakers and editors, they will help us pay for the production expenses. We think that maybe, just maybe, the episodes will affect individual lives by offering them hope and the encouragement to engage.We want to raise $15,000 towards our budget.  This is partial funding but will go a long way in making our project come alive.  We are keeping our budget tight and virtually everyone will be working for very little.  This speaks to our entire team’s dedication to SANATIONE.What you get…A passion project like ours, one that aims to contribute to the good of mankind, is forgoing merchandise.  We have a website, a Facebook page and the shows themselves in which to include your name, your photo, your personal dedication and credits, all depending upon the level of your contribution.  WE WANT TO MAKE YOU FRONT AND CENTER!  Every dollar helps.  SANATIONE began with a contribution from UNESCO that got us off our feet and moving.  Let the race continue!Below is a link to the IYMS website which will give you an opportunity to see other projects from IYMS and the episodes as they roll out.  Let’s give these incredible, dedicated and good-hearted young people a chance.  Please tell them that you believe in what they are doing.  We adore them so much.  They are some of the world’s most precious citizens.https://iyms.orgEpisode 1: Defenders Episode 2: I Can't Breathe - Part 1 Episode 3: What's Going On FYI:This is a low-risk project.  Episodes are now being shot or are finished and posted.If you can’t contribute to the campaign, please watch our episodes and spread the word as much as you can.  We all know the power of Social Media and Indiegogo has some great sharing tools.OUR SINCERE THANKS!

story:
THE POINT is the brainchild of Fred Kuhr, an actor and journalist, who wanted to put a new spin on the talk-show format by bringing together a diverse group of gay and straight men. After bringing the pop-culture obsessed Tito Faustino on board, they went on an exhaustive search to find just the right guys to make their vision a reality. The show premiered in its weekly format in October 2016. 

But producing a weekly web series ain't cheap, most notably because we rent our equipment. It would be cheaper for us in the long run if we owned our own cameras, but that's a big outlay of cash. And that's where you come in!

If you enjoy our show - and want us to continue building bridges between gay and straight men - please help us by contributing. Every little bit helps. You can also check out our website at ThePointGuys.net. And please, share the work that we do on your social media!

THE POINT, brining gay and straight men together to see what happens!

story:
CAMPAIGN REMAINS LIVE:

With a commitment from WBRA Blue Ridge PBS to air Penny P's Backyard, and to be the representing station for a nationally syndicated broadcast, we are keeping our campaign live.  Primarily, the money will go to grant writing and the writing of the first 13 episodes in the series.  Please donate and help us keep this momentum.  

 

Penny P's Backyard: The Core Story

Penny P’s Backyard is a new family show being developed that looks at the intersections of Science, Nature, and American Folk Art/Culture.   Main character Penny P, age 10 and her three friends Ramp (10), Nelly (10) and Sadie 9), aka the core four, belong to an after school film club.   

Through Penny P’s short films, documentaries, and animations the primary narrative themes of the wonderment that exists at the intersection of Science, Nature and American Folk Art, of all shades, will be portrayed.  All the while, subtly introducing the language and practice of DIY film making to a generation of media and tech-savvy youth. 

An example of an intersection between American Folk Art and Science would be in a conversation with a Geologist about how the Appalachian Mountains were formed, topics like heat, pressure, and the bending and folding of the earth would be explored to describe the processes and end result of plate tectonics.  

A folk artist that would use near-identical terminology, in the world of folk art, are potters and blacksmiths. Who uses heat and pressure to bend or fold earthen materials, into their creations.

Other concepts may include, but are not limited to; Basketweavers and the varying types of bird nests, light refraction/the color spectrum and glass blowing, canning/smoking for food preservation and microbiology, tree rings/wood grains and Luthiers, The Fibonacci/Pi sequence in nature, the geometry of quilts, the physics of mobiles, the mathematics of fiddle music.   And more!

Every episode, the core four are given a video or animation project assignment from film club mentor Vanover. This assignment, driven by Penny’s love of natural science and folk art/culture, spurs on a production adventure in search of the projects subject matter in and around Penny P’s Backyard.  Thus opening a world of interconnections between Science, Nature, and American Folk Art.   Like the small mountain college town, she calls home,

And the adjacent university where her mother works as Dean of Natural Sciences and the Environment.

 

Also,  all the mountain top hideaways and bends around curvy country roads brimming with folklife her Daddy, a local woodworker, and musician, always seems to know his way to.

And in doing so, puts the core four in contact with a host of unique characters, while learning age-appropriate themes of teamwork, respect for self, others, place and the environment, sense of community, life skills and humor.

Main character Penny P  sees the world around her as a continuous stream of interconnections. Her father's world of folk art culture mixes with her mother's world of science and technology to help shape how she sees the world around her. She is the director of all the videos and animations she and her crew of friends put together. Which, in end, tells a mystical story of their backyard.  

Sadie is the lighting guru of the production team. She also is the resident comic relief. She has an inquisitive mind and is always up for whatever production adventure Penny P. leads her on. Sadie has a love of all things electric. She is a skilled dumpster diver, and she knows all the good spots on the local university campus to find the various wires, metal, LEDs and electrical components she needs to make all the lights she uses to help Penny P create her video projects. 

Nelly is the cinematographer of the crew. She sees the world as pieces to the whole. And at times is a big help to Penny P as she helps see the connections between folk art and science. She's an encyclopedia of old movies and TV and because of this, she (we the creators) slide homages to famous shots and visuals from classic movies and TV shows from history and pepper them throughout Penny Ps videos. Penny P trusts Nelly to get the best shot possible. She has access to numerous camera toys as her father is a photography faculty on campus. She also collects all things made of glass and loves folk art made with glass as it's medium. 

Ramp is the audio engineer of the crew and b/c of this he experiences his world with a focus on how the world around him sounds. Along with Sadie, he dumpster dives at the choice spots on the local University campus. And he finds everything he needs to create the noises he needs for a library of foley sound effects. As well as bits and pieces of electronics he works into his audio gear.

Penny P's Backyard is designed to open a family's viewpoint of what the interconnections between Science, Folk Art, and Nature is.  It will challenge them to look at the Art of Science.  Or the Science of Art.  Or how Science and Art are influenced and inspired by Nature.  Set in the mountains of Southwestern Virginia, the show is designed to challenge the preconceived notions of what Appalachia (its people/culture) is.  And will represent a true positive portrayal of its people, art, and culture.  Not what the national media portrays, but an honest and heartfelt vision of all that is beautiful about Appalachia.  Towards that effort, this show will be a visual love letter to the mountains, people and places of Southwestern Virginia.

The interconnections between Science, Nature and American Folk Art are often simple but, at times, can be mystical.  This show is designed to visually portray how these connections are made and to celebrate the Art, Science, and/or Nature within each interconnection.  It is designed to inspire a transdisciplinary view of the world that kids and families can draw inspiration from in their daily lives and in their own backyards.

 

Chris Valluzzo is a video producer, documentary filmmaker and TV Producer who focuses on Appalachian folk culture.  He is the owner of the documentary and television production company Bliss Bus Media.  His films and shows have screened at festivals, limited theater runs, are available on Amazon and a show "Song of the Mountains" he Directed and Produced in 2014-2016, aired nationally on PBS.  He came up with the idea of Penny P's Backyard in Dec 2015.  And while it took a while to develop the full idea, Valluzzo began filming the proof of concept for the show in the late summer of 2016 and finishing the spring of 2018.  

Green Filmmaking and Sustainability

Thanks to a generous partnership with Solar Connexion, a leading solar voltaic solutions company in the region,Penny P's Backyard will be the first show in Television history to be produced using 100% renewable energy.   

All lights, sound, camera, drone, communication, catering, and flashlights will be battery powered and charged 100% by the Sun.   We are also instituting a massive sustainability effort for this television production on the front end, from the start.  Some items include, but are certainly not limited to, recycling of sets with materials donated to Habitat for Humanity, costumes sourced and donated back to YMCA and Goodwill.   All traditional paper materials like scripts, shot logs, storyboards, etc will be in digital form.  All lights used on set will be new LED film production lights cutting down on the single biggest source of pollution associated with the industry, energy consumption. Catering will include compostable forks, knives, and plates will be composted.  Food served onset will be grown and prepared locally, using the power of the Sun.  The compost created from our show production will be donated to a local community garden that raises vegetables for those in need and without easy access to fresh vegetables.  In a roundabout, distant, sustainable way, this show will actually help feed people.  What other show can say that?  But only with YOUR help!

Why Are We Raising Money?

You will be a part of a historic first.  Challenging the industry's notions of what it is to be making Films and TV in a sustainable way.  The time to act is now.  It can be done, so we're going to do it.  With your help! You will be part of a TV show that is fresh in concept.  That is new in vision.  Both behind the cameras and in front.  We are staking a claim with this show, that it be produced in the place it's about.  No alternative locations.  We are the underdogs.  Won't you join the community?

This isn't an indie film, it's indie television and it's a new model.  That is our challenge in the project.  Being from the outside, trying to break through to the inside, with something that the inside has never seen before. From the show concept to how we produce it. We have a remarkable show and a sustainable plan to produce it.  Please join the movement.

This campaign does a few things. First, it pays for the proof of concept (POC) which has already been shot.  Gaffers, Grips, Line Producers, Director of Photography, Director, Writers, Sound Engineer, Drone Operators, Actors,  Animators, etc will all be paid for their work on the POC with a large portion of this campaign.  These folks worked for free based on the shared belief in this project.  To honor that commitment and vision, they will be paid first as part of this campaign.  

 

The other items this will pay for are post-production, sound design, and graphics for the POC.  It also pays for the writing team to complete the Pilot Episode script.  It also pays for the First Season Outline.   These three things get packaged together and submitted to Amazon, Hulu, Netflix, PBS, Disney, etc.  As well as independent production companies with established relations with larger studios.  Some rewards for this campaign rely on us getting to pilot.  We believe that between the fresh concept of the show, and the historic sustainable first, one of the groups listed will want this show in their portfolio.   But we need your help.

How You Can Help!

Please share this campaign with lovers of art.  Share it with practitioners of science and technology.  With those who love to inspire children to critically look at the world around them.  Share it with your friends who grew up in a place like Penny P's Backyard.  Share it with those who care about the earth.  Who acknowledge that all great efforts have to start somewhere.  Only this "somewhere" is a humble, quiet place, ready to do big things.  Share it with your friends and family.  And most importantly.  Please give to our effort to bring a new television show that is fresh in concept, produced in a sustainable way, and tells the story of an often forgotten and misunderstood part of the country, to the world.  It's YOU who will help us do it!

 

Thank You, from the cast and crew of Penny P's Backyard.

story:
Redefining Racial Profiling

Young people of color lack the appropriate representation of positive role models that are not celebrities, athletes, etc. Profiles in Color (PIC) combats that issue by showcasing successful people of color, highlighting their personal backgrounds and sharing strategies on how they became professionally successful.

The series kicked off with a 5-episode Season One highlighting professionals in the Chicago area.  We featured a family-man consultant, successful barber and social entrepreneur, first-generation college student marketing manager, Nigerian-born tech-savvy author and product developer and a blogging finance manager. You can find all videos on camitha.com.

The first season has generated great buzz (more than 2,000 views) and the team is eager to start production on the next two seasons and feature even more stories.

What We Need & What You Get

Thank you for everyone that submitted feedback. We heard you and are making some changes to the next two seasons to make this series even better:

  • Different Locations - We will be filming on the West Coast in LA and San Francisco areas  
  • More Perspectives - We will highlight more women and add additional minority groups
  • Better Production - We will improve the video and audio quality

We need your help to raise the $8,000 necessary to make this come to fruition.

Sponsorship Levels

We will be delighted with any donation amount, but we have developed several sponsorship levels below along with perks for each.

  • Credits ($25) - Name shown in the credits at the end of each video
  • Sneak Peek ($50) - Advance access to all videos before release to public plus “Credits” perks
  • Behind the Scenes ($200) - One-on-one chat with favorite guest plus all “Sneak Peek” and “Credits” perks

Note: Perks only apply to Season 2 and 3

The Team

The team behind PIC is passionate about spreading positive messaging within the black community.

  • Tony Rice II, Executive Director
  • Candace Ramsey, Co-Producer
  • Kareem Edwards, Co-Producer
  • Nkem Nwankwo, Co-Producer
