story:
InDemand Stretch Goal #3: Theme Song!!!

We are so excited to share some big news! Our fans' generosity has brought our campaign into InDemand on Indiegogo, this means we can continue to crowdfund for even more amazing content!

Our first treat for you? The Theme Song! 

Our cast and crew have begun initial recording for our Theme Song Video!

"Damsels Roll the Dice" will feature the voices of several cast members, and Producer Extraordinaire Linsay Rousseau. When finished, the goal will be to provide our fans not only with a fabulous video to tide you over until Episode 2...you'll also be able to purchase the song on iTunes!

As you can see, we've been able to keep costs down by recording with a mobile studio, but we still need to compensate our fabulous audio engineer, composer, and editor! This stretch goal will help us finish the video quickly, so that we can give you all the Damsels content your heart desires! Help us roll a Natural 20 on our Performance Check, and we'll make sure you share in the loot. New perks will be added soon to keep up with InDemand goals, so keep an eye on our social media accounts to see what new swag we've got in store! 

We can't begin to tell you how grateful we are to all our donors. You've been incredible, and we can't continue on this journey without you. Please continue to share the campaign, we can't wait to share the next part of the adventure with you and all our new friends!

 

STRETCH GOAL #2!!!

We cannot believe how generous our wonderful supporters have been! We are over the moon to announce that our Wig Restyles have been completely covered! There's still 21 days left of our Indiegogo, so we're moving on to the next Stretch Goal...

Food!

We plan to have a full day on set, and film-making is hungry work! Help us keep our cast and crew happy and well-fed by covering craft services. Every dollar donated will go toward making sure we have delicious and healthy meals for our whole adventuring party! As our favorite Wizard once said..."Snacks are better than people."

STRETCH GOALS!!

We are so grateful to have achieved our first goal! We can now cover pre-production, including Crew, Equipment, and Studio Rental!

Our first stretch goal will now cover expenses that will occur during the making of Episode 2:

Wig Restyles.

Help us ensure each Princess is perfectly coiffed by contributing to our very first stretch goal! All the same perks still apply, so if you haven't had the chance to pick one, go right ahead! We hope to add a few new perks very soon!

Once Upon a Time...

There was a nerdy actress in Los Angeles who realized that her group of friends consisted almost exclusively of professional RPG players and professional princesses. How can you resist a mashup like that?

And here's the good news: We've completed the pilot and have scripts for 6 more episodes, a full season of Royal RPG (that's role-playing game) antics! And, thanks to the generous donors of the first campaign, we were able to release the pilot, and make some headway for Episode 2! 

Here's where you come in, kind stranger/new best friend. We have everything ready to go, but filming a web series takes resources and we need all the help we can get!

All fundraising will go straight to offsetting the costs of production: Renting equipment, locations, paying our hardworking cast and crew, feeding, clothing, and wigging the princesses, dressing the set, etc. This project has been a labor of love by everyone involved, and we just need a little boost to share the next episode with you! 

We've Got Gadgets and Gizmos Aplenty...

A shiny RED Camera! Professionally styled, custom wigs! Handmade props and costume pieces!

~We just need some help from our Fairy Godmothers to pay for them~

We were fortunate enough to be able to film the pilot ourselves, and our donors have been able to completely cover the crew expenses for the next episode, but we would love to be able to cover our equipment expenses and pay our actors as well! This show means the world to us, and that means we want to make it the best that it can be. We want our princesses to shine!

With that in mind, each episode technically costs about $10,000 to make. That covers everything from the highest quality equipment and wigs, to competitive compensation for the cast and crew. Right now, we're just asking for help to cover initial pre-production and some shooting expenses, which, after the previous campaign, will come to around $5000. We're already pretty close!

Here's a breakdown of the expected budget for each episode: 

A Dream is a wish your heart makes...

And we have the power to make those dreams a reality!

At its heart, "Damsels, Dice, and Everything Nice" is about a group of girls getting together to tell their own stories. It has never been a better time to shine a light on a diverse, female ensemble taking charge of their own lives.  It's finally the moment for these princesses to rescue themselves...with a little help from their friends, some magic, and most importantly you!

 

All we need is Faith, Trust, and a little Pixie Dust...

To those who have already contributed, thank you. We would never have been able to release the pilot or gain this much attention without you! We are blown away by how wonderful everyone has been! (Your perks are on the way soon!)

For all our newcomers, donations are delightful and you'll get some super fun perks as a backer for the series, but we understand if you're a little short on gold right now. 

If you can't give us the power of your dollars, please give us the power of your voice (If you haven't already sold it to a sea witch)!

We reside in all the Realms of Social Media, so you can share, like, comment, and subscribe to your heart's content. You can even send links to your friends, coworkers, animal companions, or any bards that you may come across. We also have a website with the pilot, behind the scenes images, and lots of tidbits about our cast and crew.

If you find yourself becoming Curiouser and Curiouser, we invite you to journey down the rabbit hole with us. Roll initiative, the adventure begins soon...

"It's kind of fun to do the impossible"-Walt Disney
story_txt: InDemand Stretch Goal #3: Theme Song!!!We are so excited to share some big news! Our fans' generosity has brought our campaign into InDemand on Indiegogo, this means we can continue to crowdfund for even more amazing content!Our first treat for you? The Theme Song! Our cast and crew have begun initial recording for our Theme Song Video!"Damsels Roll the Dice" will feature the voices of several cast members, and Producer Extraordinaire Linsay Rousseau. When finished, the goal will be to provide our fans not only with a fabulous video to tide you over until Episode 2...you'll also be able to purchase the song on iTunes!As you can see, we've been able to keep costs down by recording with a mobile studio, but we still need to compensate our fabulous audio engineer, composer, and editor! This stretch goal will help us finish the video quickly, so that we can give you all the Damsels content your heart desires! Help us roll a Natural 20 on our Performance Check, and we'll make sure you share in the loot. New perks will be added soon to keep up with InDemand goals, so keep an eye on our social media accounts to see what new swag we've got in store! We can't begin to tell you how grateful we are to all our donors. You've been incredible, and we can't continue on this journey without you. Please continue to share the campaign, we can't wait to share the next part of the adventure with you and all our new friends! STRETCH GOAL #2!!!We cannot believe how generous our wonderful supporters have been! We are over the moon to announce that our Wig Restyles have been completely covered! There's still 21 days left of our Indiegogo, so we're moving on to the next Stretch Goal...Food!We plan to have a full day on set, and film-making is hungry work! Help us keep our cast and crew happy and well-fed by covering craft services. Every dollar donated will go toward making sure we have delicious and healthy meals for our whole adventuring party! As our favorite Wizard once said..."Snacks are better than people."STRETCH GOALS!!We are so grateful to have achieved our first goal! story:
OFFICIAL WEBSITE - IMDB - INSTAGRAM - FACEBOOK - TWITTER

 


ABOUT THE SERIES

RECKLESS JULIETS is an original, multi-award-winning, critically acclaimed, web series with a darkly comedic---and sometimes devastating---take on the secret lives of four, headstrong teenage girls. A cross between Heathers and The Virgin Suicides, the series follows the lifelong friends Carmody (Britni Raine), Wynn (Lelia Yvetta), Chloe (Sadie Eve), and Shasta (Natasha Stricklin) as they navigate their way through high school, womanhood, and hectic home lives.

We aren't like any web series that you've seen before. The large cast of characters are interesting and three dimensional. The storylines touch on mental heath, body image, suicide awareness, LGBTQIA representation, and most importantly, the complex nature of female friendship. 

The first seven episodes are online for your viewing pleasure, but we need help to make the rest of our first season a reality. That's where, you, the fans come in. If you haven't seen any episodes yet, don't worry, they're all listed below for your convenience. You can also learn more about our incredibly talented cast and crew, see behind the scenes photos from set, and find out about the perks that you receive when you donate!

All donations go towards helping us shoot episodes eight through ten (the finale), and two shorter episodes. The money will go help pay actors, crew members, catering, location fees, permits, equipment rentals, wardrobe, production design, festival submission, marketing, and post-production. 

Have a question? Shoot us an email at recklessjuliettv@gmail.com 

FULL EPISODES/MINISODES

Watch the full episodes and minisodes below:

Episode 1 (Pilot) - Starring Britni Raine, Alison Kohlhardt, and Melody Bernhoft
Episode 2 ("Grey Area") - Starring Lelia Yvetta, John Paul Sales, Britni Raine, Samantha Hodges, Braxton Baker, and Alison Kohlhardt

Episode 3 ("The Vow") - Starring Sadie Eve, Natasha Stricklin, Gavin Magnus, and Roxanna Kaye

Episode 4 ("Homemade") - Starring Natasha Stricklin, Britni Raine, Julian Von Nagel, Samantha Hodges, Braxton Baker, and John Paul Sales

Episode 5 ("Fathers & Daughters") - Starring Lelia Yvetta and Will Hawkes

Episode 6 ("Last Night Was Crazy") - Starring Britni Raine, Lelia Yvetta, Sadie Eve, Natasha Stricklin, Sierra Pond, Benjamin Bergstrom, Julian Von Nagel, Will Hawkes, and Adrian Rivero

Episode 7 ("Camelot") - Starring Britni Raine, Alison Kohlhardt, Melody Bernhoft, Laney Malone, Holly Gagnier, David Pevsner, and Andi Rexha

Minisode #1 ("Forget Paris") - Starring Lelia Yvetta

Minisode #2 ("Dick-Face") - Starring Britni Raine and Karson Kern
Minisode #3 ("Hurricane Hadley") - Starring Sadie Eve, Mia Topalian, and Anatoliy Ogay

 

UPCOMING EPISODES (that donations will fund) Full scripts are available upon request for any donation over $500 / email: recklessjuliettv@gmail.com

Episode 8 ("All About Evie")  Shasta's younger sister is bullied by neighborhood girls, and we meet two very different, but equally important, female influences in her life. Meanwhile, drama erupts between Phillip and an employee. 
Running Time: 20 minutes

Episode 9 ("Crush") - Chloe and Jaron, the much older object of her affection, butt heads when Chloe finally decides to make her move. Hadley's job hunt hits a snag thanks to a bitter cashier, and her new friends, Diamond and Salvador, make themselves comfortable at the Bennett house. Julia worries about her daughter's education.  
Running Time: 20 minutes
Cast--

Episode 10 ("Happy B-Day Bitch") - The Season One Finale. A viral video leaves Carmody's future in question. Tracy finds a psychiatrist to replace Dr. Malcolm. Chloe tries to get closer to Jaron as he finishes the first chapter of his new book. After overhearing a phone call between her parents, Wynn's drinking causes her to make a mistake that she can't take back. Shasta is caught in the middle of Carmody and Fiona's feud. Julia finds out that Diamond has been living in Hadley's room. Despite the chaos going on with her friends, Margot throws an epic birthday bash.  
Running Time: 30 minutes
Cast--

Erin Goulet ... Party Goer
 

Minisode #4 ("With Friends Like These")  Fiona's clique try and convince her not to pursue a relationship with Shasta again. 
Running Time: 10 minutes
Cast--

Sierra Pond ... Fiona Gaynor
Natasha Stricklin ... Shasta Morgan
Jessica Harthcock ... Amanda Turner
AlexAnn Hopkins ... Hunter Myerson
Marwa Garawi ... Amirah Bitar
(2 Roles not cast)

Minisode #5 ("Swimming")  Carmody invites Fisher over when her parents leave her home alone for the weekend. 
Running Time: 10 minutes
Cast--

Britni Raine ... Carmody Shaw
Julian Von Nagel ... Fisher Sturack

REVIEWS & RECOGNITION

'Caustically funny. Watching "Reckless Juliets" is like hanging out with the cool kids in high school who were always making bowls (for smoking, not eating) in art class and driving into the city on weekends for underground punk shows. It's a series about teen girls, but it's no "Teen Girl Squad." All of the characters feel fully-formed and getting to know them over the course of 6 episodes is highly enjoyable.' - WomanInRevolt.com

'In “Reckless Juliets,” one of the web series offerings, four teenage girls have their friendship tested by unexpected tragedy. Creator Skyler Barrett walks a fine line between dark comedy and compelling drama, which helps set this coming of age story apart from the young adult fare that wades into melodrama or emotional manipulation..."

'Created by Skyler Barrett, the show has a dark comedic edge that prevents the show from getting too self-serious without ever doing a disservice to its characters. As its name suggests, “Reckless Juliets” isn’t afraid of the volatility of teenage emotion...' - Women & Hollywood

'The first season episodes of Reckless Juliets that have already arrived on YouTube are of top-notch quality. While it is a show about high school students, it is decidedly mature, both in terms of the way it portrays its characters and the skillful manner in which its slow-burning scenes are shot.'​ - Tubefilter

Interview with Follow Magazine

FILM FESTIVALS

WINNER First Glance Film Festival Philadelphia 2017 (Best Ensemble Cast in a Web Series)
WINNER First Glance Film Festival Philadelphia 2017 (Best Actress in a Web Series - Britni Raine
WINNER First Glance Film Festival Philadelphia 2017 (Best Director Web Series - Skyler Barrett)
WINNER Female Filmmakers Fuse Film Festival 2017 (Best Web Series)
WINNER Female Filmmakers Fuse Film Festival 2017 (Audience Award)
WINNER SoCal CIFF 2017 (Best Web Series) | Best Actor Nominee (Alison Kohlhardt)
WINNER Los Angeles Film Awards (Best Web Series - Honorable Mention - August 2017)
WINNER Best Shorts Competition (Best Web Series - Award of Merit)
WINNER Direct Monthly Online Film Festival (Best Web Series - April 2017)
WINNER Festigious International Film Competition (Best Web Series)
WINNER International Independent Film Awards (Platinum Winner)
WINNER WAW Web Series & Short Film Competition (Best Web Series Drama, Best Director in a Web Series Drama, Best Cinematography in a Web Series, Best Supporting Actress in a Web Series Drama - Sadie Eve)
OFFICIAL SELECTION Bucharest Shortcut Cinefest 2017
OFFICIAL SELECTION Baltimore New Media Web Fest 2017
OFFICIAL SELECTION NYC Web Fest 2017
OFFICIAL SELECTION First Glance Film Festival Philadelphia 2017 (Best Web Series)
OFFICIAL SELECTION Hollywood Comedy Shorts Film Festival 2017
OFFICIAL SELECTION Web Series Festival Global 2017
OFFICIAL SELECTION Women's Film & Script Showcase 2017
OFFICIAL SELECTION Miami Independent Film Festival 2017
OFFICIAL SELECTION California Indie Film Festival 2017
OFFICIAL SELECTION International Online Web Fest 2016

Despite the chaos going on with her friends, Margot throws an epic birthday bash.  Running Time: 30 minutesCast--      Britni Raine               Lelia Yvetta                  Samantha Hodges  Sierra Amirah Bitar(2 Roles not cast)Minisode #5 ("Swimming")  Carmody invites Fisher over when her parents leave her home alone for the weekend. Running Time: 10 minutesCast--Britni Raine ... Carmody ShawJulian Von Nagel ... Fisher SturackREVIEWS & RECOGNITION'Caustically funny. Watching "Reckless Juliets" is like hanging out with the cool kids in high school who were always making bowls (for smoking, not eating) in art class and driving into the city on weekends for underground punk shows. It's a series about teen girls, but it's no "Teen Girl Squad." All of the characters feel fully-formed and getting to know them over the course of 6 episodes is highly enjoyable.' - WomanInRevolt.com'In “Reckless Juliets,” one of the web series offerings, four teenage girls have their friendship tested by unexpected tragedy. Creator Skyler Barrett walks a fine line between dark comedy and compelling drama, which helps set this coming of age story apart from the young adult fare that wades into melodrama or emotional manipulation..."'Created by Skyler Barrett, the show has a dark comedic edge that prevents the show from getting too self-serious without ever doing a disservice to its characters. As its name suggests, “Reckless Juliets” isn’t afraid of the volatility of teenage emotion...' - Women & Hollywood'The first season episodes of Reckless Juliets that have already arrived on YouTube are of top-notch quality. While it is a show about high school students, it is decidedly mature, both in terms of the way it portrays its characters and the skillful manner in which its slow-burning scenes are shot.'​ - TubefilterInterview with Follow MagazineFILM FESTIVALSWINNER First Glance Film Festival Philadelphia 2017 (Best Ensemble Cast in a Web Series)WINNER First Glance Film Festival Philadelphia 2017 (Best Actress in a Web Series - Britni RaineWINNER First Glance Film Festival Philadelphia 2017 (Best Director Web Series - Skyler Barrett)WINNER Female Filmmakers Fuse Film Festival 2017 (Best Web Series)WINNER Female Filmmakers Fuse Film Festival 2017 (Audience Award)WINNER SoCal CIFF 2017 (Best Web Series) | Best Actor Nominee (Alison Kohlhardt)WINNER Los Angeles Film Awards (Best Web Series - Honorable Mention - August 2017)WINNER Best Shorts Competition (Best Web Series - Award of Merit)WINNER Direct Monthly Online Film Festival (Best Web Series - April 2017)WINNER Festigious International Film Competition (Best Web Series)WINNER International Independent Film Awards (Platinum Winner)WINNER WAW Web Series & Short Film Competition (Best Web Series Drama, Best Director in a Web Series Drama, Best Cinematography in a Web Series, Best Supporting Actress in a Web Series Drama - Sadie Eve)OFFICIAL SELECTION Bucharest Shortcut Cinefest 2017OFFICIAL SELECTION Baltimore New Media Web Fest 2017OFFICIAL SELECTION NYC Web Fest 2017OFFICIAL SELECTION First Glance Film Festival Philadelphia 2017 (Best Web Series)OFFICIAL SELECTION Hollywood Comedy Shorts Film Festival 2017OFFICIAL SELECTION Web Series Festival Global 2017OFFICIAL SELECTION Women's Film & Script Showcase 2017OFFICIAL SELECTION Miami Independent Film Festival 2017OFFICIAL SELECTION California Indie Film Festival 2017OFFICIAL SELECTION International Online Web Fest 2016​

story:
CREATION OF MINORITIES

"Minorities" was created by Bloh Williams and Al-Jerometta Chede who were inspired by the Awkward Black Girl series. Bloh and Al-Jerometta have dug deep into their embarrassing memories as teenagers dealing with similar issues the protagonist is in order to bring us this entertaining project.

CREATIVE TEAM

Al-Jerometta Chede (Co-creator, Writer, Director, Producer)

Bloh Williams (Co-creator, Writer, Producer)

Audferyna Howard (Writer, Producer)

Andre Winn (Director of Photography)

Blenda Lau (Composer)

 

LEAD CHARACTERS

Beatrice “Bea” Kawah (JENABAH KOROMA)

Beatrice “Bea” Kawah is a 15 year old, socially awkward extrovert living in the big city of L.A. We follow Bea as she grows up as the only daughter of a care free father and a strict mother. With her father often gone and on the road Bea turns to her best friend “Isa” to escape her mother’s traditional west African grip. Although Bea is clever and outgoing, she stumbles through life while trying to fit in with the other American youth yet still obeying her traditional Liberian upbringing.

Isabella “Isa” Garcia-Lopez (MARISSA SAENZ)

Isabella “Isa” Garcia-Lopez is a spunky, slightly tomboyish 15 year old Mexican-American. Los Angeles grown, she along with her best friend Bea try to fit in with their American friends without defying their traditional home life. Unlike Bea, Isa has a older brother who experienced life as a teenager under their strict parents and he teaches Isa the ropes. She is the best wing-woman one could ask for.
 

What We Need & What You Get

We need our help to sponsor production of the remaining episodes of season 1. At a cost of $3,000/episode and a total of 5 remaining episodes, we will need to raise a total of $15,000. WE CAN DO IT!!

 WE’ve already funded production of the first episode and other fun informational videos about the cast - find all of the produced videos on our Youtube channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC4LbnIPZeJRoTwnaI21lp7Q

Your contribution will go towards paying the cast and crew, transportation, food, equipment and location rentals, editing, wardrobe, etc.

Please donate whatever amount you can - anything will go a long way. We have cool rewards listed on the right to show our appreciation for your kind donation!!

The Impact

We are first time filmmakers  and we believe we believe that "Minorities"  will be an amazing web series that will bring understanding to the difficulties of balancing cultural differences in America. It is a show with heart and characters that anyone can relate to.

Other Ways You Can Help

You would be of tremendous help if you WATCH the pilot, LIKE it, SHARE it, and SUBSCRIBE to our youtube channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC4LbnIPZeJRoTwnaI21lp7Q 

And please also share this campaign with everyone you know using the Indiegogo share tools!!

story:
We are Stained Glass Media, a group of all-female Ryerson University students.

Winterbourne is our fourth-year capstone project that allows us to put the skills and theory that we have accumulated over the past three years into practice. We wrote the scripts, we found the locations, we envisioned this project. 

And we cannot wait to make it happen but we need your help to do so.

Winterbourne is a 10-episode horror anthology web series, inspired by Robert W. Chambers' The King in Yellow.  Set in a supernatural town, we'll follow a different Winterbourne resident in each episode as something unsettling occurs.  

The series will be released starting in early January 2018 with weekly episodes. In addition to these 10 webisodes, Winterbourne will also include three short VR mini-episodes that fully immerse the viewer into the eerie world of Winterbourne.  The stories of Winterbourne will also continue on a blog run by a mysterious character, known only as "The Archivist", who documents the lives of the residents and various surreal occurrences within the town.

All-female teams are a rarity and all-female teams specializing in horror are even more rare. This project will be exciting and challenging but we are more than ready to take it on.

By supporting Winterbourne , you will help women in film work in a genre where they are scarce.  Our project gives women the opportunity to take the lead. 

Together we are Stained Glass Media.  We are group of nine passionate women dedicated to creating high-quality content that is accessible to everyone.  We value diversity both on and off screen and work hard to make sure that we represent that in our work.  

All the members of Stained Glass Media are fourth year Media Production students at Ryerson University’s RTA School of Media.  Together we are a creative, determined, and passionate team. Each of us brings a unique set of skills to the table, and we are excited to be using them to create Winterbourne.  Despite all the behind-the-scenes laughter, we all have a dedication to making Winterbourne as dark and unsettling as possible and plan to get #SPOOKCREW trending.

Top, Right to Left: Priya Duguay (Producer), Michal Heuston (Showrunner & Director), Ayah Zeineddine (Creative Lead & Writer)
Middle: Katherine Oliveira (Technical Producer), Brittany Nguyen (Director of Photography), Sabrina Bertsch (Production Coordinator & Co-Producer)
Bottom: Cindy Long (Post Production Supervisor), Schaefer (Marketing Lead), Leah V. Smith (Head Writer)

$7500 is just a portion of our budget.  In addition to our personal contributions and this campaign, we will also be holding local fundraisers. You can see where this money will go below:

By far our largest expense is covering our actors. This includes transporting them to our locations, feeding them and housing them if needed. It is important to us that our actors are treated well as they dedicate their time and energy into our production.

Location permits, props, marketing and even running this campaign add to our costs but they are necessary to complete this project.

In order to thank you for your support, we have created perks that are both representative of our project but also enticing to you!

Receive a hand-drawn caricature portraits from our director Michal Heuston.

Get Your Picture Drawn ($20 Perk)//Get Your Picture Drawn 3.0 ($150 Perk)

Or you can show your #spookcrew support with a Winterbourne button or personalized postcard. 

If you're interested in learning how to make your own videos, consider our intro courses for After Effects, Premiere, Lightroom or Protools. 

If you're in Toronto or willing to travel, we would love to have you come to our launch party and get an exclusive viewing of all ten episodes of Winterbourne! 

We want Winterbourne to serve as an inspiration to women in film. No matter the genre or subject matter, women can make it happen in a male-dominated industry.

Horror films are often subject to several tropes but we want to do more than that. With a diverse cast that's reflective of actual society, we will avoid killing off the expected and give not-so-predictable storylines. 

What if we don't meet our goal? What if something goes wrong?

We have a contingency plan if we are unable to reach our goal or if something goes awry during production. This would include cutting episodes, moving to less ideal locations and reducing actor roles. However, we believe that the budget we set allows for us to produce the highest quality project we are capable of making.

This project is a huge undertaking, and we could not do it without you!  Any contribution you can make, whether it's $1 or $100, will bring us closer to our goal! 

As students ourselves, we understand that not everyone is in the position to be able to contribute. Please consider sharing our campaign, following our social media (Instagram, Twitter and Facebook), and watching our webseries when it's released.

story:
Custom Gilmore Girls Cutting Board

I promised Gilmore Girls fans who couldn't make the Gilmore Girls Fan Festival the opportunity to win their very own custom made Gilmore Girls cutting board. So here it is folks!

Hand-made from locally sourced, Californian walnut and hard maple. This cutting board measures 14.5" x 7" and is engraved with  the infamous Gilmore Girls quote;

"Oy With The Poodles Already"

Ticket Prices $10 for 3. $20 for 10. $50 for 50. $100 for 200. 

Make sure to write your full name. Free shipping to lower 48 U.S states

story:
kindlyTV is a digital content/television network dedicated to short-form, family-friendly entertainment. We aim to inspire and entertain through relatable and heartwarming storytelling. Creativity, ethics and integrity are at the core of our mission. These beliefs guide our business strategies, our productions, and our relationship with our audience. 

Created by former Miss Asia USA Ashley Park, kindlyTV is currently seeking funds to produce a slate of inspirational Hallmark-style short films to be released in 2021. Just imagine a feel-good Christmas movie that you can watch entirely on your lunch break or while the kids are taking a nap! By pledging to this campaign, you are green-lighting the kind of entertainment that enriches and uplifts. 

In a competitive media landscape, it's imperative that we maintain high production values and creative standards. That means good technology, talented actors and an experienced crew. Your funds will secure these resources, ensuring that we make something we can all be proud of. 

Due to the complex nature of the entertainment industry, this project will be written and directed by an Emmy Award-winning team. Experience and expertise in all aspects of production will ensure that kindlyTV delivers content that is on-budget and suitable for prescheduled release dates.

story:
I started this project over three years ago while in Graduate school at UCLA's School of Theatre, Film and Television. Never did I imagine that we would be creating this pilot so soon after first writing it. I call it my baby because of the time and energy that has gone into building it into what it is and seeing it go out into the world to hopefully make a difference. It is as much a part of me as my right arm and I'm thrilled to have the opportunity to share it with all of you. 

High school is a turning point in all our lives that we can honestly say was the highlight and blight of our maturing. It is the time in our lives when we begin to get a taste of the responsibilities that will be coming our way in college, our careers and our journey through life. Some refuse it, some go with the flow and some embrace it wholeheartedly. It is also during this time that we begin to question our families at home and realize they may not be who we think they are. We question them, stop trusting them and turn to our friends. We turn to those that we feel like we have more in common with and who understand what we are going through. Our friends become our families. Within those make-shift families everyone has a role they take on or an attribute they possess that no one else has within the family. Soon the strength that one friend has protects the friend who does not have that strength and another protects another and so on. Each has a different power that they wield that keeps the darkness at bay and allows the light to shine bright. Salem High is that story; the story of five friends that possess incredible powers to protect each other and their entire world.

The enthusiasm of our cast and crew for this project is awe-inspiring. We plan to bring to life everything that we are dreaming of and everything you can imagine it can be. In order to make it the best that we can, we need your help. Locations, costumes, props, energy, talent etc. all come with a price. We're asking that you help us make this a journey we and all of you will never forget and help us evolve into something more.

In exchange for your kindness and generosity we have gifts to give.

Donations up to $49 will receive a special gift from us to you as a thank you!

Donations of $50 to $99 will receive an exclusive Salem High School Athletic Dept. T-Shirt! Donations of $100 to $199 will receive an exclusive Salem High School Athletic Dept. Hoodie!

A donation of $200 to $349 will be able to visit set for a day and witness the magic of Salem High.

A donation of $350 to $499 will have a walk-on role in an episode of Salem High.

A donation of $500 to $999 will receive an Associate Producer Credit.

A donation of $1000 and over will receive a Producer Credit. All of these will be in addition to our special gift to you!

This is the beginning of something big and we want you to be a part of it's inception.

Thank you so much!

We are the Witches of Salem High!

story:
The Short of It:

I'm Lacey the head of Ink Stain Productions and showrunner for Twisted City. You may know me from my previous webseries Maggie Hale's Corner, which was based on the novel North and South. For Twisted City, I'm joined by an amazing team of talented young women around the world who've developed and written the story with me, and we can't wait to bring it to life! 

To do that, we need your help. Maggie Hale's Corner was produced with a borrowed camera and basically no budget. For Twisted, we'd like to up the production quality and make the story the best it can be!

Having our own quality camera will make all the difference in the over all product, and anything extra will help us truly make the series come to life. 

The Long of it: 

We're hoping to raise enough money to invest in a DSLR camera, a simple lighting kit, mics and sound equipment. A bonus would being able to cover the cost of memory cards, better editing software, and an extra hard drive for storage. Our goal covers all that, plus perks and Indiegogo fees. 

And speaking of perks, we have some great ones for you including scripts and postcards from both Maggie Hale's Corner and Twisted City, plus the chance to help this series become reality. Be sure to check out all the perks details!

 

 

Where Your Money Goes

If we don't hit our goal, all the funds left after fulfilling perks and paying fees will still go to equipment and production costs, starting with a camera and working down our list. 

If we exceed our goal, we can invest in even better equipment and have budget for things like costumes, props, and snacks. Plus we have some fun bonus content stretch goals for you guys:

Stretch Goals:

  • $1500- We'll do a bonus crossover with another webseries
  • $2000-We'll film a bonus episode inspired by another Charles Dickens story
  • $2500- We'll film some original scenes from the novel 

 

 

 

What It's All About

Our Story:

In our genderbent update on Oliver Twist, join orphan Olive who leaves behind her horrible job in Mudfog for the urban capital of Washington D.C. Once in D.C. Olive makes both friends and enemies, and ends up entangled in crime, manipulation, and mystery. 

Our Vision:

Oliver Twist, while beloved, is a story that undoubtedly was a product of it's time and Dickens' own prejudices. We're endeavoring to counter some of those prejudices, bring not often represented spirituality to the series, and touch on the complicated relationships of friends, lovers, and family. 

Our Team:

The creative team behind this show has a varied and unique background. Several of us worked on Maggie Hale's Corner, as well as other projects including Janny's Diary, Charlotte's Web Series, The Femmes Fatale, Any Other Rosie, Pod17, and more. We've been working hard to create this new story. 

Risks:

As with any film project, there's always a chance things can go wrong: cast or crew might bow out, equipment might break, locations might become unavailable. Any of those things might delay the project for a while. 

How Else to Help:

Even if you don't have the means to contribute financially, you can still help!

Talk up Twisted City using #TwistedCity, share our campaign on ALL your social media or even in real life, so more people have a chance to be involved in making Twisted City happen! Indiegogo even has some handy buttons over on the side to make it super easy.

story:
So Here's the Deal

Thanks to my recent partnership with KPBS, the network has agreed to promote, distribute and partially fund  the first season of "Jordan Loves," a new web-series that highlights the quirky, unique and downright odd features that set San Diego apart.

...but here’s where I need your help more than ever.  

The fact is, every project that appears on Public Television is funded in part by financial contributions by viewers like you, and this project is no exception.  With your help, I hope to raise enough to make “Jordan Loves” not just a reality, but a success.

 

After studying film in San Diego, where I was born and raised, I’ve spent the last few years working as a writer on various media projects.  I also write, produce and appear in my own award winning web series “Jordan Hates,” in which I generally comment on the things that people dislike most.

After years of arduous struggle and unwavering modesty, KPBS is now giving me the opportunity to produce “Jordan Loves” a larger-scale, San Diego-based series exploring the unseen corners and unknown features of America’s Finest City.  Through a series of vignettes, viewers will discover aspects of a city they only thought they knew.  

As an indie filmmaker, your generous contribution would allow my team and I to create, produce, and air content that is entirely our own, distributed on a major platform aimed at supporting independent filmmaking.  

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise $4,000 for production costs, craft services, props, actors (yes we want to pay our actors too), pickup days, and additional post-production needs.

All perks are aggregated

  • $5 Contribution - Thank You Credit.  Every dollar counts, and we’re grateful for it!
  • $10 Contribution - “Jordan Loves” Sticker and Thank You Credit.  Add to your Jordan Hates Collection with a NEW Jordan Loves Logo Sticker.
  • $25 Contribution - (For Locals) - “Extra” role as a zombie in a “Night of the Living Dead” recreation, plus Jordan Loves Sticker and thank you credit.
  • $25 Contribution - Jordan Loves/Hates tote bag
  • $60 Contribution - Jordan Loves/Jordan Hates T-shirt, Jordan Loves/Hates tote bag, Jordan Loves Sticker, and thank you credit
  • $150 Contribution - DVD of of Season 1 of Jordan Loves, plus all (unlimited) perks below included
  • $250 Contribution - Guided tour of San Diego led by Jordan Jacobo himself, filled with fun, little-known factoids of San Diego spot.- Plus Jordan Loves Tote, Jordan Loves T-shirt, Jordan Loves Sticker, and a special Thank You Credit.
  • $500 Contribution - Co- Producer Credit, plus all (unlimited) perks below included
  • $1,000 Contribution - Executive Producer Credit, Personal Shout out during one of our episodes, plus all (unlimited) perks below included.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  •  If you just can't contribute $$ right now, you can still help us spread the word about our Campaign! Share our Crowd fund video and Indiegogo link to your Social Media pages!

Video Link:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pys11q22TH0

Campaign Link:  https://igg.me/at/jordanloves

Facebook Page:  https://www.facebook.com/JordanHates/

Share Share Share!

story:
Who We Are...

Mandated is a web series created and developed by four women. Over three years ago, Jessica Grant, Chelsea Krause, Lauren Lawson, and Kelsey Maples began meeting to discuss creating a series to showcase themselves as actors and to help bring complex women to film. With the help of director and producer Jesse R. Tendler, their incredible crew, a super talented cast, and a collection of generous supporters, the creators have been able to bring this vision to life.

Principal photography for Mandated wrapped last summer. Now the team is in the home stretch of post-production, working to get this project finished and out to an audience. We are currently deep into the process of editing our thirteen-episode season, and hoping to begin our run of the festival circuit this summer.

But before we can release the series, we are in need of help from supporters like you! Only with your assistance can we make sure our project gets finished at a level that makes it worthy of being shared with an audience!

 

What We Need...

We'll break it down as clearly as possible for you so you can see where it all goes.

We're looking to raise around $11,000. 

  • About $5,500 is going to our editor so that he can finish piecing together our shots. He's incredible and is not only doing our video editing but our sound editing as well!
  • About $500 is going to our incredible colorist who is making our shot coloring and tone both consistent and vivid, helping our cast look better than ever! ;)
  • Another $2,000 is going towards festival submissions; this allows us to get Mandated out to a wider audience and gives us the opportunity to put it in front of industry folks, sales agents, and distributors!
  • And the rest? We hope to continue to pitch Mandated to even bigger markets such as Amazon, Hulu, and Netflix to name a few. The rest of the money raised will be to ensure we have our bases covered in order to create packets, marketing materials and other related materials to pitch our series. However, every penny raised goes towards post-production and festivals first!

 

Rewarding Our Supporters...

  • We'll do weekly shoutouts on our Facebook page for anyone who makes a contribution of $10 or more!
  • For $25, you can get an individual shoutout with a silly animal video included.
  • $50 gets you a first look at our pilot episode BEFORE it is released to the general public.
  • $100 lands you a 4" by 6" art print inspired by the series.
  • $200 enters you into a raffle for a free dance class in NYC (transportation not provided).
  • $250 earns you a personalized audio mix.
  • $300 gets you a Patron of the Arts Credit in our credit reel and on our website.
  • $500 or more lands you an Associate Producer credit and IMDb entry (that's the Internet Movie Database, where all major studio and network projects are listed)! 
  • and $1500 bumps you up to Executive Producer status!

Check out a full list of perks on the right side of the page!

 

Our Impact

We, as women, are dedicated to making the world more inclusive for us and others. Our cast and crew are not only diverse but our series also has actors as young as eight to beyond seventy. Our entire AD team, all but one of our production assistants, and many others on both our production and post-production teams are women.

Not to mention our incredibly talented cast! Our actors boast a slew of impressive credits, including television's Orange is the New Black, Billions, Homeland, Assassins, and House of Cards, and Law & Order, as well as Broadway credits from Ruthless to Matilda.

 

Our Challenges

We've built this series from the ground up. We were just four girls with a dream, and it was only with the talent, ideas, and support of friends and family that we've been able to make it as far as we have. We won't pretend otherwise!

Creating a series is not only financially taxing, but also something that takes a lot of mental and physical perseverance as well. We worked for months creating, writing, and consulting with others to develop our story. Principal photography involved twelve very long, 14+hr days over the course of three weekends to get everything shot and recorded. And now we are continuously working on editing, scoring, coloring, and finding platforms to showcase our hard work and talent.

It has not been easy. It's been an incredible risk for many of us. We've given up jobs, worked over holidays and breaks, and invested a huge amount of time, effort, and money into the project. We know it's worth it. We hope you'll agree. We're lead by passion and a drive to not simply get things done, but get them done right.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We fully understand that not every contribution involves donating money. Trust us, we live in New York City... But don't worry, you can still help out!

  • Tell your friends! We're always open to making new friends and fans!
  • Share our IndieGoGo page, so that even if you can't contribute, someone else maybe can!
  • Like us on social media! That way you can get regular updates about us and our series!

...What are you waiting for?? Let's finish this!! :)

story:
Blunt Trauma is a joint effort...

Hello, we're Amanda Chayne Pierson and Alex Dudley! 

"Blunt Trauma was loosely inspired by two of my friends and what I hope their adventures would look like if they decided to solve crimes. I sprinkle in my own absurd humor and irrational tendencies. This leads the series down some weird paths like murder and cat paintings, and even more fun like messing around with noir conventions. It’s easy to be distracted by the humor and all the weed, but the heart of the show is about friendship, being at a crossroads in your life and trying to find purpose." - Amanda "Murder She Wrote" Pierson

Blunts, Traumas, Cats & More!

We're hoping to raise $3500 for equipment rentals, feeding our cast & crew, emotional support, diamond studded boom mics, and other vital necessities on set. 

For our MFA, we will only be producing the first episode of our web series with the hope of continuing on in the future. 

Episode 1: Crime & Cannabis: After smoking a crazy experimental strain of weed, best friends BILLS and KRAMER wake up covered in blood, with no memory of the night before. Suspecting that they may have killed Kramer's ex, NATALIE, they seek help from their finicky dealer, OLD GREG. Though Old Greg illuminates some details from the night before, Bills and Kramer realize that, in order to truly rehash the night and retrace their steps, they'll need to smoke the very strain that got them into this mess. 

Check out our concept trailer:

 
Check out some of our perks to see if anything tickles your fancy...
...Sorry that was weird, blame Old Greg.
 

Meet the Team

Amanda Chayne Pierson: Creator/Co-Writer/Co-Executive Producer/Capricorn

Alex Dudley: Co-Writer/Co-Executive Producer/Sleepyhead

Kylie Chi: Director/Russian Bootlegger

Mauricio Jauregui: Director of Photography/ Wizard

Chikodili Agwuna: Producer/Beautiful Soul (according to Jessie McCartney)

Other Ways You Can Help!

https://www.facebook.com/BluntTraumaTV

https://www.instagram.com/blunttraumatv/

story:
Logline

Miss Jordan just wants to put on the best production of the Three Sisters that Ubly, Michigan has ever seen. But when only four people audition, Miss Jordan has to redefine the meaning of “best” and learn lessons she never thought possible. Taking place in the run-up to the pandemic, this ensemble comedy will make you laugh till you pee, just like Tyler.

How Your Contributions Matter

Become a member of our little Ubly High School Drama Club!

Our team is composed of a diverse set of incredibly talented individuals from across the country. Unfortunately, it takes a little bit more than just talent to get a series off the ground! With your contributions we will be able to fund key elements in production allowing us to provide high-quality entertainment for all!

  • Paying our cast and crew for their time on set
  • Meals to feed our cast and crew when we are on set
  • Costume and production design
  • Hair and makeup
  • Equipment rentals and insurance
  • Necessary PPE to follow all COVID-19 Guidelines and to protect our cast and crew
  • Post production costs and festival submissions

Why Your Contributions Matter

By contributing, you help to stimulate a small part of the Artistic Economy, while supporting the creation of new art! The arts make up a $730 billion industry that employs nearly 5 million arts workers. It is our goal to pay every individual on set for their work on this project. 

  • Help stimulate the Artistic Economy!
  • Contribute to the creation of new art from a collective of emerging artists!
  • Join in the launch of Sam and Jenna's Production Company with our debut project!

Risks & Challenges We Face

Funding a film is always hard. However, the creation of new art is not always about turning a profit, but rather about letting artistic voices breathe. To top it all of, we are attempting to produce this webseries in an ambitious time frame at the height of a global pandemic! 

  • Invest in the future of young, emerging artists' careers from our directors, producers, actors, director of photography, and crew.
  • We will be researching all laws and regulations concerning production and COVID-19 in order to safely protect our cast and crew in the production of this web series. *** It is our hope that we are able to produce this web series at a time when a fair percentage, if not all, of our cast and crew, has been vaccinated (assuming vaccine rollout runs smoothly in each state).
  • In budgeting this web series, we have accounted for a wide variety of scenarios in each department and in our contingency to ensure a quality final product at any budget. 

    What's Next For Us?

    We are currently in the pre-production phase for this web series! We are hard at work producing and finalizing casting decisions and soon we will be finalizing the script! It is our hope that we will be able to begin production for Miss Jordan's Spring 2020 Production by the end of June 2021 in Los Angeles, CA. We will regularly update you about the process over on our Instagram @samandjennaproduce, and we will keep you in the loop for our future projects!

    Other Ways You Can Contribute

    Sometimes people can't contribute to these causes, and we get that! Here's a quick final reminder that these crowdfunding campaigns aren't funded by the random-generous-mega-donors, but rather by a collection of small donations from a diverse coalition of people who believe in the project or cause! If you are unable to help, here are some other ways that make a huge impact!

    • Share this campaign! Getting the word out to as many people who could be even remotely interested is a key way to fund this project!
    • Follow Sam and Jenna's Production Company on social media @samandjennaproduce
    • Support the web series when it comes out! Seeing that the web series is viewed and loved is a real confidence boost and will help our production company in future projects!

Equipment rentals and insurance
Necessary PPE to follow all COVID-19 Guidelines and to protect our cast and crew
Post production costs and festival submissions



Why Your Contributions Matter
By contributing, you help to stimulate a small part of the Artistic Economy, while supporting the creation of new art! The arts make up a $730 billion industry that employs nearly 5 million arts workers. It is our goal to pay every individual on set for their work on this project. 

Help stimulate the Artistic Economy!
Contribute to the creation of new art from a collective of emerging artists!
Join in the launch of Sam and Jenna's Production Company with our debut project!


Risks & Challenges We Face
Funding a film is always hard. However, the creation of new art is not always about turning a profit, but rather about letting artistic voices breathe. To top it all of, we are attempting to produce this webseries in an ambitious time frame at the height of a global pandemic! 

Invest in the future of young, emerging artists' careers from our directors, producers, actors, director of photography, and crew.
We will be researching all laws and regulations concerning production and COVID-19 in order to safely protect our cast and crew in the production of this web series. *** It is our hope that we are able to produce this web series at a time when a fair percentage, if not all, of our cast and crew, has been vaccinated (assuming vaccine rollout runs smoothly in each state).
In budgeting this web series, we have accounted for a wide variety of scenarios in each department and in our contingency to ensure a quality final product at any budget. 

What's Next For Us?We are currently in the pre-production phase for this web series! We are hard at work producing and finalizing casting decisions and soon we will be finalizing the script! It is our hope that we will be able to begin production for Miss Jordan's Spring 2020 Production by the end of June 2021 in Los Angeles, CA. We will regularly update you about the process over on our Instagram @samandjennaproduce, and we will keep you in the loop for our future projects!Other Ways You Can ContributeSometimes people can't contribute to these causes, and we get that! Here's a quick final reminder that these crowdfunding campaigns aren't funded by the random-generous-mega-donors, but rather by a collection of small donations from a diverse coalition of people who believe in the project or cause! If you are unable to help, here are some other ways that make a huge impact!
Share this campaign! Getting the word out to as many people who could be even remotely interested is a key way to fund this project!
Follow Sam and Jenna's Production Company on social media @samandjennaproduce
Support the web series when it comes out! Seeing that the web series is viewed and loved is a real confidence boost and will help our production company in future projects!

story:
CORONA HOUSE

Seeking fame and fortune, aging reality television star “The Lobo” journeys Down Under to start filming his new reality show “Top Blokes”. But, having never read the news, he is shocked to discover that he will be forced into quarantine for 14 days as soon as he disembarks. Luckily, his reality heavyweight producer, David De McMichaels, has a plan to capitalize on this unfortunate turn of events, rekindle “The Lobo’s” career, and lead to ratings gold. 

Welcome to CORONA HOUSE! 

What seems like a “man in a box” routine quickly spirals out of control when the buildings dark secrets start to reveal themselves. 

Will “The Lobo” survive 14 days of quarantine in CORONA HOUSE? Will he make peace the buildings sordid past? Will he be able to maintain a .08 average or above? How will he manage his daily routine around MGW (Masks, Gloves Wipes) during a global pandemic?

Tune into CORONA HOUSE, coming to you this April, in a limited 14 day event series.

What We Need

We are actually quarantined in Australia and we want to do something creative with the limited resources at our disposal (thank god I packed a camera or two) to keep from losing our minds. Join in the madness and help us feed and drink ourselves into comedy gold!

Episodes will begin streaming daily and run for a total of 14 days. We will create a special Facebook group where we can all survive together and hopefully entertain you whilst answering all of your questions and concerns. 

PLEASE USE A CURRENT REGULARLY CHECKED EMAIL FOR YOUR PURCHASE AND/OR HAVE AN ACTIVE FACEBOOK PROFILE. Otherwise we can't contact you about perks.

story:
Fantasm is a drama thriller series about an OnlyFans cam girl who accidentally meets the wife of her most twisted viewer. The two women develop an unlikely online friendship, but soon the cam girl begins to realize her new friend's life, and her own, might be in danger.

Sound like something you might want to stream?

Good news! We're the Fantasm team and we're gearing up to shoot our series pilot this spring/summer. Once we wrap post-production, we'll be using our finished pilot to pitch the series to buyers; our goal being to bring you the full Fantasm series by 2022 (see "Our Plan" below). We've assembled a fantastic cast and crew and are so excited to get to work; but first, we need your help.

Your contributions will enable us to cover the bulk of production and post-production costs for our pilot, such as PPE for Covid safety, meals, costumes, props, set design elements, shooting permits, sound mixing, and special effects. We value your contributions highly, which is we are offering cool perks like free tickets to our Virtual Premiere Party and Tarot Card Readings!

If you're interested in Fantasm but can't financially contribute at this time, you can still help us by getting the word out; just use Indiegogo's social media share tools, follow us on Instagram @fantasmseries, or tell a friend about our campaign.

Fantasm is our passion project and we can't wait to make it and share it with all of you. Join us in bringing it to life!

CAST



CREW

Manon Gage (director, executive producer, writer)
David Corenswet (director, executive producer, director of photography)
Julia Best Warner (executive producer)
Medina Senghore (executive producer)
Scout James (producer, designer)
Margot Gage (producer)
Gwendolyn Wang (sound)​

Special Thanks to Anna Hughes, Anna Kerrigan, Mike Klasek, Yoko Okumura, Erin Penamon & Zac Towner.

We are currently in pre-production. Production is slated to start in the spring/summer. We aim to finish post-production by the fall, at which point we will screen the finished pilot at our Virtual Premiere Party (see perks).

Next, we will prepare to pitch the series to buyers, with an eye on streaming platforms. If we don't successfully sell our series in 2021, our plan is to enter our pilot into TV festivals like SeriesFest and Catalyst Content Festival, as well as the episodic categories of festivals like Sundance, TIFF, SXSW, and Tribeca, to help it pick up the necessary steam to catch a different buyer's eye or help us finance, shoot, and release the entire Fantasm series ourselves.

story:
Our campaign has now ended, but thanks to Indiegogo InDemand, you can still support us! A new set of InDemand perks are available!

We're NyxRising Industries, a group of nerdy YouTubers coming up on 60,000 subscribers on our channel where we produce fan content for video games, films, books, and the like. We've become absolutely obsessed with tabletop games over the past year, and after multiple requests to bring our passion to the screen, we're finally tackling it with a brand new Dungeons & Dragons show Life of the Party!

Click on a perk image to the right to see the full list of rewards you get at that level!

This Indiegogo campaign has ended, but perks will still be available for the next six months thank to Indiegogo's InDemand feature. As we are over 100% funded, you can find our stretch goals detailed below. Thank you so, so much for all your support so far!


I'm Nyx, founder of our Youtube channel NyxRising, and one of the players. I'm joined by Bee, Sasha, Chase, Isa, Cat, and of course our wonderful Dungeon Master, JD. With a long history of acting, performing and improv, we love to get deep into the roleplay of tabletop games and get completely lost in the fantasy.

  • This campaign means so much to us - we know what we're capable of achieving, but to do our absolute best, we'd like to purchase new equipment, build a great set, and have the opportunity to share our creativity with the world! We're still planning on filming and sharing Life of the Party with the rest of the world no matter what, but we know how much more we could achieve with your backing on this exciting project.
     
  • This campaign is going to be a story to remember, set in an incredible, diverse original fantasy world with endless possibilities. Our party - terribly balanced but full of enthusiasm, and equally full of dark and shocking secrets - are all played by LGBT players and we like to think we bring our own chaotic and courageous energy to every game. This story is too rich and deep to keep all to ourselves, and so we invite you to tag along for the journey and become part of the Party community, where everyone is welcome!

Join us - make a contribution, big or small, and lose yourself in our world.
 

Here's What We Need

  • Equipment upgrades will allow us to improve our quality. We have just enough camera and audio equipment to pull this off, but we can provide a far more exciting viewing experience with better quality audio from lapel microphones and a sound mixer, interactive maps, streaming equipment, plus we're desperately in need of a few camera lenses to ensure all the footage looks top quality, more tripods, cables, and other dull production bits and bobs to get the ball rolling. We're estimating the cost of equipment to be around £600, but at £800 we'd have everything we needed for a long term endeavor. 
     
  • Artist compensation - high quality art of our characters, NPCs, and the world we're playing in will add another dimension to the show with beautiful visuals to accompany what we're doing and saying. Great talent requires good compensation, and this art will become available for backers as part of some of our rewards, then later for viewers. 
     
  • Terrain, miniatures, maps - custom made terrain boards and monsters will make for a very exciting show to watch and play, and the more we explore in the vast world of our game, the more we'll need!
     
  • Set design to remember! With a production set designer on our team of players, we're definitely on track already, but we need materials and props to bring our videos to life. Some of your contributions will be used to make a high production value set that can last the length of the series.
     
  • Rewards - a small amount of the funding will be used to create physical rewards such as art prints, stickers and pins, but we estimate less than £100 for this and will keep costs as low as possible. We're offering free shipping on all physical rewards smaller than a large package, too.

Risks & Challenges

All projects come with risks & challenges. We know this all too well, but we're confident about Life of the Party. We have most of what we need already, and we're determined to make this work no matter what. There's always a risk of equipment failure, or lost footage, but if it happens we'll work around it. There's always another way. Plus, the series is already well underway! With that in mind, I'm happy to declare this campaign as very low-risk!
 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand as well as anyone that money is a tough and touchy subject. Not everyone can afford to support creators, not even if they really want to, but not to worry! There are other ways to support our channel and this new project, which are extremely helpful to us:

  • Make some noise about Life of the Party! The more people you spread the word to, the better chance we have of getting the project fully funded, and most importantly, the more people can discover the show to watch it!
     
  • Subscribe to our Youtube channel NyxRising Industries! We will be posting the show here, as well as running livestreams about it and uploading bonus content.
     
  • Support us on our social channels by searching for NyxRising on Twitter, Instagram, Facebook and Tumblr.
     
  • You can use the Indiegogo share tool to spread the word about our campaign to your social media friends and followers!

Make some noise about Life of the Party! The more people you spread the word to, the better chance we have of getting the project fully funded, and most importantly, the more people can discover the show to watch it! 

Subscribe to our Youtube channel NyxRising Industries! We will be posting the show here, as well as running livestreams about it and uploading bonus content. 

Support us on our social channels by searching for NyxRising on Twitter, Instagram, Facebook and Tumblr. 
You can use the Indiegogo share tool to spread the word about our campaign to your social media friends and followers!

story:
The Pitch: We’re making a new show for right now.

Hello family, friends, and theater fans. We’re a team of four theater artists in Portland, Maine using this pandemic pause to create a new web series called “Hausfrau.” It’s based on a one-woman comedy about the sublime ridiculousness that is being a stay-at-home parent. While theaters are closed, we want to stay open to our creativity and new ideas, so, we’re putting our artistic energy and expertise into transforming a hilarious solo show for the stage into a new form made expressly for your enjoyment online. Embracing the DIY scrappy-style of an early 2000s mommy vlog, this newest version of the Hausfrau, sharing her misadventure mama stories and hand-drawn cartoons, will keep you laughing this fall. And with your generous-at-any-level contributions, we will complete a 6-episode season that everyone - hausfraus, hausdaddies, anyone who helps raise kids, or anyone who has ever met a kid - will be able to enjoy for free on YouTube.

Meet the Team

Bess Welden - actor/writer. Bess makes theater as a performer, playwright, producer, and educator. She’s written/co-written twenty original performance works including plays, librettos, and podcast/audio scripts with a long-time focus on solo shows. https://www.besswelden.com/

Hannah Cordes - director. Hannah is a director, educator, actor, and the Education Director at Portland Stage. Hannah facilitates workshops throughout New England, working with students, teachers, and artists to use theatre as a tool for self-discovery; literacy; community-building and collaboration; exploration of difficult or controversial topics; and creative expression. As the daughter of a single mother, Hannah was immediately pumped to help bring Hausfrau’s stories to life and delighted by the humor and honesty of this project. http://hannahcordes.weebly.com/

Todd Brian Backus - script consultant/video editor. Todd is the Literary Manager at Portland Stage Company in Maine. He’s also a new works dramaturg, and, perhaps most importantly, very online. He’s a co-producer with Dungeons + Drama Nerds (dungeonsanddramanerds.com), a podcast about tabletop role-playing games and theatre, and can be found just about everywhere on the internet @tbbackus. You can also check out his work at toddbrianbackus.com. 

Leo Hilton - director of photography/all around tech guy. Leo is a theatrical electrician and lighting technician, most recently at Asolo Repertory Theater in Sarasota, FL. He’s also a lighting designer and amateur photographer. 

With cartoon contributions from the original Hausfrau herself, Nicole Chaison (https://www.penguinrandomhouse.com/books/25802/the-passion-of-the-hausfrau-by-nicole-chaison/)

What We Need & What You Get

When Portland Stage initially shut down public performances last spring, they had Todd reach out to a number of Affiliate Artists to see what sort of nimble, digital projects could be made. After some brainstorming between Todd and Bess it seemed clear just filming The Passion of the Hausfrau wouldn’t cut it, and instead we adapted the monologue play into the modern monologue, the vlog! Through a grant earlier this summer, Portland Stage gave us some seed money to dream up the series and begin creating a pilot. Thank you Portland Stage! (https://www.portlandstage.org/)

Now, our goal is to raise $3300 to fully fund a 6-episode season. We’ve determined it takes $500 to create each episode and compensate all artists involved. We also need an additional $300 to pay modest royalties to the original play production team, including Annette Jolles (co-writer/director), Nicole Chaison (co-writer/illustrator), and Hans Indigo Spencer (original music/sound design), whose creative fingerprints are showing up all over this new version of the material.

We also want to offer a stretch-goal: with each additional $500 over target we raise, we’ll be able to create a bonus episode. If we raise enough above-and-beyond, we might even consider creating a full second season in spring 2021. There are so many Hausfrau stories to tell.

But we need your support to make it happen. When you contribute at any level, you’ll know you’re:

  • supporting theater artists creatively and financially at a time when our industry has essentially shut down
  • helping make the web series available at no cost to everyone and anyone in the whole wide world

Check out our contribution levels and perks and choose what fits best for you. We’re genuinely thrilled to have your support and excited to let the world know that you’ve helped bring this unique project to fruition.

We believe we all need art in our lives. We believe we all could use a good laugh right now, too. We believe “Hausfrau” as a web series will help us have both. We’re excited and confident that our collective 50+ years of theater-making experience will bring the Hausfrau to new life in a binge-watch worthy way. Two of our creative team members Bess (Big Mouth Thunder Thighs, Madeleines, Legbala is a River) and Todd (PowerOut NYC) both have established records of successfully crowdfunding to produce new work. With your financial support and trust, we’ve totally got this.

If for any reason we don’t make our $3300 goal, we will use your contributions to create as many episodes as we can. So no matter what, you’ll get some Hausfrau humor and heart one way or another this fall.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you’re simply not in a position to contribute monetarily, we completely understand. We know so many people are struggling in so many ways right now. But! There are other ways to support us for free. Sharing our campaign on your social media feeds and talking it up with your friends and family helps us out a lot. And once the season launches, we hope you’ll be among our regular viewers. If you love what we’ve made, we hope you’ll invite everyone you know to enjoy it, too.

And once the season launches, we hope you’ll be among our regular viewers. If you love what we’ve made, we hope you’ll invite everyone you know to enjoy it, too.

story:
Short Summary

In The Other Belles, we delve into the lives of four young women pursuing careers in fields traditionally dominated by men. The Other Belles will challenge cultural norms through the lens of an ensemble sitcom. Funny and meaningful, this binge-worthy series will invest viewers with relatable characters and relevant storylines.  We are currently working toward a goal of securing quality, local talent with name recognition in order to attract networks to this worthy project. Our previous pilot, "The Hutchins" starred veteran actor Michael H. Cole, building and strengthening our resumé, and demonstrating our commitment to excellent talent on each and every project.

This series is going to be, at once, revolutionary and familiar — new ideas and strong characters in a recognizable, universal sitcom format. Think “The Big Bang Theory” meets “Family Matters.”

 

Who We Are

We are a group of people striving to bring great film opportunity to all. We know all too well that show business is a challenging field, but we endeavor to always pursue our dreams and work toward making them a reality.


Producer: Sam Wilson

Sam Wilson is an actor, writer, and producer. He successfully funded and shot a mini pilot for the upcoming sitcom Podcasters, for which he also serves as head writer and producer. He has served on the cast and crew of a number of indie projects in the Atlanta area. 

http://www.imdb.com/name/nm7043374/?ref_=tt_cl_t6 

Producer: Mista Martel
Mista Martel is an actor and producer.   Stage productions he has been a part of include "A Midsummer Night's Dream" and "Twelve Angry Men."   However, his passion for show business has led him to direct and produce projects such as "The Campaign Game", "Nowhere USA" starring Roz Ryan, "The Hutchins" starring Michael H. Cole and a short filmed called "Deleted."  He attends Troy University majoring in Human Resource Management. 

http://www.imdb.com/name/nm4194518

Writer: Steve Holbert

When no stress eating under deadline, Steve enjoys baking, ghost hunting, and drag queens. His feature screenplays have been finalists at the Fear Awards, iHorror Awards, Horror Film & Screenplay Festival, and North Carolina Film Festival, semi-finalists at Los Angeles CineFest and Austin Revolution Film Festival, selected at Hollywood Boulevard Film Festival, made the second round of Austin Film Festival, and won Best Horror at Los Angeles Film & Script Festival. Steve’s TV pilot and spec scripts have been semi-finalists at Austin Revolution Film Festival and made the second round of Austin Film Festival. His plays have also been nominated for two Metro-Atlanta Theatre Awards. Steve’s currently under feature and pilot commissions for indie companies in New York and Metro-Atlanta. He’s a current MFA Candidate in TV Writing at NYU’s Tisch School of the Arts and holds two B.A.’s from Georgia College & State University. He donates to neither.

What We Need & What You Get

We are turning to you, the Indiegogo community, for help raising $5,000. These funds will cover the costs of producing and marketing the pilot for The Other Belles.

As a thank-you, we have put together some unique, limited-edition rewards for contributors of the campaign. These rewards are just our way of saying “thank you” to the people who believe in our project at this early stage of development.

The Impact

We believe that showing strong women characters taking on non-traditional jobs would be extremely beneficial to all young people. We want to encourage them to follow their hearts and to see beyond the restrictions that society has set in place for so long. In addition to sending an important message, our goal is to entertain through this very funny show.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge for us would be our small to mid-size budget and scope of distribution like with any independent project.  We have herded together some of most super-creative and passionate people we can imagine to create this project.  We have created a very tight and ambitious production schedule.  If we don't get the funds we request  what we'll do what we can to cut back on costs. Whatever other challenges come our way, we will, however, be in constant contact with our backers so you know our progress every step along the way. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Beyond making a monetary contribution, you can help us by sharing this campaign with all your friends and family. Go ahead and post the campaign URL on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and any other social media platforms you use along with a brief message explaining why you believe

The Other Belles is a worthwhile project.

We appreciate all contributions, monetary and non-monetary.
Thank you for your time and support. It means the world to us.

story:
What's Our Pilot About?

Pilot logline: When two early twenties women start working for a business to help men build confidence, they begin to teach themselves to practice what they preach as they navigate newly adult lives that they were less than prepared for.

Teagan and Violetta. Jacks of all trades. Masters of none.

The Ladies

Teagan (Tierney Malloy)

Known for being optimistic, fun and curious! Teagan is always open to finding new opportunities and experiencing new things, which subsequently led the girls to their new workplace. Her sympathy for others can be her Achilles heel. She often finds herself in strange situations due to her curiosity and trust. Teagan moved to LA after breaking off her recent engagement to one of New York’s “Who to Watch” actors. She made the move with her college roommate and best friend, Violetta.

Violetta (Arielle Diaz)

Although she can be perceived as serious and hard, Violetta is the life of the party! After years of an in-depth, heartbreaking relationship, she became bulletproof – at the expense of her chance at love. Violetta moved to LA to start over, and to give herself a fresh chance at life and love.  Inside she’s just a hopeless romantic who wants a man who will treat her right. Simple enough, right? Besides, anyone can experience the real Violetta… that is, if you can get her to let her guard down.

Why A Short Series?

The only thing that separates talent from talent is opportunity.  We have decided to move forward from hopes and dreams to pursue reality! This series concept is an idea we have been thinking on for the past two years. We chose to create a short series loosely based on our own experiences that we’ve had since moving to Los Angeles. Our hopes, successes, our failures, the men… it’s all (kind of) real! We’ll let you decide which parts are the truth :) Our goal is to shine positive light on the push and pull between females and males, and to specifically empower the image of independent women who are still people, facing challenges and real life experiences.

We’ve talked to multiple writers and producers about different ways we could make the vision in our minds come to fruition, and we’ve decided to write and produce the whole thing on our own! We’re very excited! 

Where Are Your Funds Going?

We are asking for $3,500 to create the pilot of this series, specifically for:

Camera

Sound

Lighting

Locations

Editing

Additional Actors (minus Tierney and Arielle)

Catering

Any extra money made during this campaign will be used to make the remainder of the season. You will all see the finished product!

Hit TV Shows That Started On The Internet:

Broad City

Workaholics

Insecure

Drunk History

+ more

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spread the word about our campaign, and about our series!
  • Keep your eyes out for further updates!

story:
Our Project

This series will follow the lives of women who are pushing the boundaries within their counter-culture professions. Each episode centers around one woman and her unique talent. From the first female to perform a backflip on a pogo stick, to one of the top competitive eaters in the world, these are the women who deserve to be recognized.

For our pilot episode, we are following freerunner and parkour athlete, Sydney Olson. We are 90% complete with her episode, however we have one more major event to cover: Sydney’s final competition of the year at Red Bull Art of Motion.

Over the past year we’ve followed her as she’s trained and prepared for the event, pushing herself through injury and fear.

Now she has placed 1st in the women’s qualifier for the Red Bull Art of Motion, and we need to be there to capture the climax in this story!

 

Our Story

We are a team of filmmakers who have been friends for several years. When the RadLasses concept was created by our directors, Casey Nimmer and Karen Du, the rest of us were eager to be a part of it and make it happen! Up until this point we’ve created the pilot using only personal financing, each of us working separate day jobs and then coming together on nights and weekends to film for the series.

 

What We Need

To do this story justice we want to send two people, our directors Casey and Karen, to Santorini Greece for the Red Bull Art of Motion competition finals, which take place on October 7th, 2017. This means flights, hotels, meals, ground transportation, and additional equipment rentals.

 

Being on site to capture real time preparation, interviews, training, and reactions of the event will give this story a well rounded third act.

 

Stretch Goal

If we are lucky enough to reach our funding goal, anything earned beyond that would be put toward bringing another person. With an added body on the ground to help with logistics, coordination and b-roll, this will allow for more time and energy to be devoted to the quality of the interactions and the footage that we can obtain.

 

Series Intention

This series is not just about opening eyes to out of-the-box professions, but also putting a spotlight on how women are excelling beyond all that has been done before.

We are passionate about bringing the stories of real women to the forefront of media. Our plan after completing the pilot is to use it to find funding and distribution for the rest of the season and the series beyond. But that is only possible if we are able to complete the pilot!

 

One Last Favor…

We simply couldn't do this without YOU. After you've checked us out and contributed, please share our campaign with your friends!

 

For more information, check us out across the web

instagram.com/radlasses

facebook.com/radlasses

twitter.com/radlasses

radlasses.com
